Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with Excellent staff and facilities !”
Reviews.Author: Ria S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Arc de Triomphe for 4 nights. This was our first trip to Paris and our flight arrived early in the monirng. As we were travelling with a baby, we decided to go directly to the hotel. The hotel was fully booked and our room was not available immediately. However, the receptionist informed us that we had been upgraded to the Executive floor which had access to the Executive Lounge where we had breakfast. A couple of hours later, we were informed that no rooms were available on the Executive floor so they temporarily moved us to the normal floor. The view and the room was good and we slept in for a while before they moved us to the Executive Room which was not as nice as the Regular room but atleast we had access to the Lounge. Overall the hotel was great, the service - fantastic, the staff - polite and amenities - top of the line. We were celebrating my brother's 30th birthday and the hotel arranged complimentary champagne in our room along with a birthday cake. The hotel really treats their guests well. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Paris, although a wee bit expensive it is totaly worth it. It is a 4 star hotel with a 5 star treatment and facilities !!

Reviews.Title: “Last minute special in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ClaireQPortsmouth
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the 6 nations Rugby and booked very last minute. The hotel is in a great location and very close to the Metro. Great for all major locations and also you can hire the Veli bikes nearby if you are wanting to cycle around. The hotel staff were very friendly, the spa was excellent - an amazing huge steam room with ceiling lights. The rooms were comfortable and perfectly adequate and very clean. I would stay again - this hotel was good value, but we did benefit from out of season last minute rates.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Asta S
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights in february 2012. The hotel was very nice and I was very satisfied with my room. Had some problems but the staff was very helpful and solved things fast. My room was very clean all the time. Breakfast and roomservice expensive, but it is a Hilton hotel so I didn't mind. What i DID mind was that the food I ordered on roomservice was not the standard I would expect for the money. One evening I ordered a steak, and it was a very thin slice of meat. The service was excellent though. Another thing was the terrible cost for WiFi. 22€ for 24 hours. WiFi ought to be included in the price of the room in a modern hotel. I recommend using the velib-bikes on your stay in Paris. You find them close to the hotel. A new way to see Paris.

Reviews.Title: “18-24 March 2012”
Reviews.Author: EugeneCooper
Reviews.Content: The service and staff at this hotel are amazing! The room was clean, heard no street noise or noise from other rooms. The food in the restaurant is amazing. If your Hilton rewards status doesn't get you on the Executive Floor pay the extra expense. The Executive Lounge has the best food of any Hilton property I have visited to date, thus the recommentation for the extra expense. The concierge staff did a great job arranging local dinner reservations, tours and transportation. This hotel shoud be a model for other hilton properties.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: abp_Chicago
Reviews.Content: My review will read like so many others...this Hilton was a fantastic experience! I took my Mom to Paris for her 70th birthday (her first trip to Paris) and she was 'blown over' by the service and care at this hotel. We were upgraded to a suite (awesome to have 2 bathrooms) and had executive level access. The team in the executive lounge were extraordinary. When I mentioned it was my Mom's birthday I think it kicked off the perks. 3 times we were sent champagne and chocolates..they would ask her about her day and her experiences... she told me she felt like a 'rock star.' The rooms really are nice and kept quite clean by a staff with excellent attention to details. Is it super modern decor? No, but the art deco look fits with the hotel and Paris. I think my Mom's only complaint was the distance. It may be a 10 minute walk for some, but for her it was about 15 minutes to the Arc (she is 70, after all!). Also, there aren't a ton of options in that direct neighborhood for food, drinks, etc, so plan accordingly. Otherwise, enjoy your trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTraveler967
Reviews.Content: We stayed here, in an executive room with lounge access in the Summer of 2011. The service was outstanding, the room very nicely appointed, and the executive lounge was worth every penny. There is a nice breakfast buffet in the morning, finger sandwiches at lunch, and enough food in the evening to consider skipping dinner. My wife and I especially enjoyed sipping champagne in the evening after a long day of touring the city. You can sit on the balcony and enjoy the view or stay inside. There is a very nice selection of French wines, beer, and liquor available. The concierge will take great care of you. The hotel is close to the Metro and you can easily walk a couple blocks to the Champs Elysee. I plan to stay here on my next trip to Paris. We loved every minute!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: QueenMeerkat
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated about 10 minute walk from the L'arc de triomphe.... we easily walked to the arch, down the Champs elysee, over towards the sienne, round to the place de la concorde, and back to the hotel in about an hour!!!!! The hotel reception is lovely, but what made it better was the service! The staff - reception, concierge, guest services, hotel cleaners, waiters, waitresses, bell boys.... were all so pleasant and helpful. It really made staying at a lovelhy hotel very easy!!!!!! Rooms are sumptously decorated....and free bottles of drinking water!!!!! All round.... would defintely reccomend. I stayed with business, but you could easily stay as family, couple, friends or solo!

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: sue f
Reviews.Content: It was difficult finding a hotel room for my husband and I as well as our ten and twelve year old. The Hilton accommodated our needs of a double room but didn't dazzle us with the actual hotel. The decor is dated and tired. Since it is a large hotel there were several days we found ourselves entering or exiting the hotel through a sea of tour groups with all their luggage. The 8th is a beautiful neighborhood to take a walk one afternoon but not for a home base. If you prefer a neighborhood with cheese shops, bakeries, and restaurants all within walking distance from your hotel try another location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: M C
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel I have stayed there for 4 Nights on business, 4 stars but it should be 5 for the excellent staffs and the services. Rooms,Beds and everything else was totaly speechless.. Great personell from Check in to Chamber maids.

Reviews.Title: “Class Class Class! Hilton at it's best”
Reviews.Author: coopervanning
Reviews.Content: From the moment you pull up till you drive away this Hotel has class. And in the right spot we walked from our room to the Arc de Triomphe in ten minutes. Rooms were spotless and Staff on the ball. This perfect spot is a great place to start your tour of Paris. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “A decent Hilton in Paris, France”
Reviews.Author: Deb C
Reviews.Content: OK. Upon arrival customer service is a top ten. Like a good first date, a very good impression. Beyond the first impression, customer service declined. Not only did they place us in a room where the AC didn't work, but there was a major wet spot (either from previous flooding or whatever) in the front of the bathroom door that never went away. The use of the executive lounge was a plus, BUT the guy who worked at the desk up there gave mediocre customer service accompanied with major mis-communication with the folks at the front desk/concierge. We asked him how/where to purchase the Museum Pass. He told us we could down stairs. When we went down stairs they said, "oh, we don't sell the Museum pass....." and the red headed woman at customer service/concierge was rude and acted as though we were disturbing her. Rather than her helping us, she quickly rushed us off. Hilton, this is sh*tty customer service. Also, Hilton you should be sure your rooms are prepared for customers. I was glad to find that the light bulb over the bath was fixed, but why did they ignore the massive wet spot on the rug? Why do half the job to ensure proper customer service?!? To top if off, when we were leaving, the gal at customer service nicely greeted us....um, she greeted us four days prior with the same speech. While it was a nice speech the first time around, her second time around it seemed like a prepared speech, words with less meaning. And since we where there to receive the same prepared speech twice, we can truly note that the speech and actions of customer service do not balance. Also, the fact that she greeted us while we were actually LEAVING was odd. It would have been better had she asked us about our stay, even after we pointed out to her that we were leaving and she already greeted us four days prior. Don't recall her name, Virginia perhaps. Overall, the executive lounge was a plus and the location was decent. Room conditions were mediocre especially for a room that was on the executive 6th floor. Customer service along with rooms could use a face lift.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Sunny_D673
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hilton Arc de Triomphe for 4 nights in March 2012. We booked via lastminute.com as a secret hotel and paid around a third of the rack rate. (~Â£430 for 4 nights). Staff were all very friendly and said Bonjour/Bonsoir on passing in the corridor (we saw the staff very little as we were Room Only and out sightseeing from 9am til about 9pm everyday). The room itself was a good size - bed extremely comfortable - the bathroom was AMAZING, all green marble, big bath and shower, free toiletries and towels changed every day. The hotel does not really have any views of the Arc de Triomphe (maybe the top floor does ?), its a fair 6/7 minute walk to the AdT but come on its close enough! The hotel is in a very safe area - lots of other 4*/5* hotels and various embassies and business headquarters, Parc Monceau nearby is lovely and a great place to grab a pastry for breakfast before getting the metro at Monceau. Few gripes: - the hotel on lastminute.com was listed as room only with a patio - we did not have a patio with room 139 - reading some other reviews it seems that guests were given a few little 'extra' perks when they had special occasions, upon booking I told the hotel we had a birthday on one of the days we stayed there however there was no extra treatment - maybe its because we booked it at a large discount to the standard rate...who knows !? I'm sure people booking directly with Hilton would have received some of these 'extras'..... - NO FREE WIFI !! For a 4* hotel this was very surprising, Wifi was available but ridiculously expensive (I think maybe â‚¬8.50 for 60 mins or over â‚¬20 for 24 hours access) - Breakfast was â‚¬25 per person each day, as we were Room Only we were considering getting breakfast at the hotel, however â‚¬50 a day for 2 people to eat breakfast was extreme to say the least - swerve breakfast at the hotel and grab a Pain au Chocolat/Coissant from Pacr Monceau instead All in all a very pleasant experience and good value - would happily stay there again (if its discounted!) Travelled as a young couple - March 2012

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: MaNa99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the second half of our honeymoon in Paris at the Hilton Arc de Triomphe. We cannot complain at all. I informed the guest relations staff of our honeymoon trip ahead of time, and were greeted with an upgrade to the executive floor (maybe because of gold status) and complimentary champagne, a bouquet of flowers, and a piece of cake. It was the perfect surprise for my wife. Virginnie from guest relations walked us up to our room and gave us a tour of the executive lounge and provided local maps. We found the lounge staff to be very friendly and the concierge staff at the reception desk to be quite helpful with restaurant tips. I used points for the entire stay, so I cannot comment on the price, but we were very pleased. Overall, this was a great location and we will definitely stay here on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Martin Sherriff
Reviews.Content: On our first ever trip to Paris we stayed for two nights last week and felt most welcome from the moment we checked in. Our room was upgraded to one with an outside balcony with views over the city including the Eiffel Tower. The accommodation was very comfortable and most staff were from France and all were very polite and helpful at all times. The Executive rooms had complimentary access to the lounge where drinks and snacks were available throughout the day including a very good breakfast. The bar was very nice and the restaurant (see separate review) was excellent. We will make this our first choice when we return in future.

Reviews.Title: “Great people, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: CopaSis
Reviews.Content: Our flight from the US was in early, but the Hilton staff had a room ready for us early. The size of the room was WAY over expectation. The room was clean. The turn down service was nice. The bell boys were fun. The concierges were exceptional and friendly. The bartenders at The Purple Bar during the evening made you feel welcome and were more than happy to help you explore their wines and chat with you. The breakfast buffet was good......I highly recommend the croissants and cafe. I would love to thank them all for breaking my husband's perception of " Parisiens are rude" feeling. He can't wait to return. The location is pretty good,but dining at night is limited in the area....so expect a cab ride or an expensive dinner at the hotel. There is a cafe next door to the left, which is ok. (No English spoken here at all) Walk around the block to the right & right again.....great cafe with red awning (can't remember name). Good food,prices, & service. Husband is a diamond member of Hilton and is trying to plan our next trip in the fall.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: BeautifulWorld08
Reviews.Content: The hotel is so well managed and the rooms are beautiful. Rooms are much larger than typical European-size rooms. Wonderful chocolate truffles from La Maison Du Chocolate were left on pillows each day, extremely clean, great breakfast. I needed to Fed Ex a business package while staying and I was promptly helped. The neighborhood of the hotel is a good one. Very near the Arc de Triomphe and right off the Champs-ElysÃ©es. I received a very competitive rate for the dates that I travelled. All in all I felt it was the best Paris experience possible while traveling with two young children, though combining business and family time.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: _Cyberus_
Reviews.Content: I brought my girlfriend here for her birthday on 3 March 2012. The hotel is clean, the decor is amazing, the staff are polite, friendly and helpful without exception, the room was of ample size and the bath and separate shower were a nice touch. We received a complimentary bottle of champagne and my girlfriend received a book about Paris because it was her birthday. This was one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had. I cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but too many details are wrong”
Reviews.Author: MarkCWales
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel, well located, near lots of corporate headquarters. The retro design theme makes it look good (not stunning but interesting a coherent look). Maybe the design focus has got in the way of attending to practical details. Just look at a few good things about the hotel to see how they could be better. Th gym / healthclub is actually very good by hotel standards: an advanced Technogym KInesis cable machine, six machines, three treadmills and four other pieces of cardio equipment. There is a decent selection of freeweights too. However, getting into it is very frustrating. My room key wouldn't open the door -- this is a frequent problem apparently. They gave me a second key just for the gym but it de-activates itself every day. You have to add 15 minutes to every workout to allow for a side trip u[stairs to reception. The rooms are pleasing with some genuinely nice retro style furniture but only one spare electric outlet in the whole room. Clearly, the design ethos doesn't permit a much-needed extension cable. The decision about curtains in the rooms is truly bizarre: most of the rooms overlook a courtyard and so face another room which is about 15 metres away. Despite this, there are only net curtains. I'm not very prudish but I was concerned to see a gentleman across the courtyard, sitting at the desk next to the window in his underwear and a little over-stimulated by whatever was on his screen. He wasn't an exhibitionist: he was sitting behind the net curtains but clearly visible with the lights on The temperature control in the rooms is also apparently part of the decor: whether you turn it to maximum or minimum, the temperature stay s at 22 degrees C -- a little chilly for the man looking at the computer in his underwear. The internet is fast although very expensive if you're not gold or diamond. One evening, though, I had to call the i-Bahn service centre to get logged on as the re-direction page had crashed. It was sorted out but it took another 15 minutes. Most of the service was ok but there were no cups or mugs in my room when I arrived (the kettle and tea and coffee supplies were where they should have been). It took an hour to deliver them. Would I go back? Probably, if I had a meeting in the area: the staff were friendly and helpful and the place has a nice atmosphere. Would I go out of my way to stay there? No, I'd pick somewhere with less style but fewer hassles.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Russell J
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel as a weekend trip for me and my girlfriend via the Hilton Honors scheme, so it was free. Upon arriving I found I had been upgraded, which gave us access to the Executive lounge. After a quite confusing trip to the hotel (never been to Paris before, so trying to get my head around the trains leaving CDG) We arrived quite late, and it was quite difficult to find in the dark. Luckily we happened to bump into another lost couple heading for the same hotel, so we followed them, The Hotel was exceptional. Lots of Marble, and fresh flowers everywhere. Whilst I would say the hotel is very well designed, it does have a tinge of being a bit dated. But this I feel is more to do with the art Deco design. So not a minus point. The staff were excellent, smiles from everyone, and always on form with customer service. My Room was also exceptional. I was in an exec room. Large Bed seperate shower and bath. I also had a dressing area with green marble sink, which looked very posh ;). Next day we woke and had an explore. The hotel is located about 10-15 min walk from Arc de Triomphe. Its based in an excellent location, you can get anywhere from the Arc de Triomphe roundabout (incl arc de triomphe museum ;) ) We used the red tour buses which - although expensive (Euro26 for two days) is cheaper than others, and still takes in all the main sights, whilst maintaining the hop on /off facicilty. We bought these tickets on the bus at the arc de triomphe, we were also given headsets to listen to the tour commentary. The Exec lounge provided excellent snacks and drinks, excellent wine, and also breakfast. All in all an excellent hotel stay, and one of the better Hiltons Ive stayed in in europe. Well done Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Steve M
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a pleasant weekend in the Hilton Arc de Triomphe with my wife and three children (under 12). The hotel staff are vey pleasant, the property is well run, and the rooms are large and clean for Paris. You even get the feeling of space when you park in the underground carpark, with excellent access. The location of the hotel is prime for Paris, in a quiet area of the 8th arrondissement surrounded by law, notary and insurance offices and a few minutes walk from Parc Monceau and Courcelles Metro. Nowhere, I am aware of, in Paris is close to all of the main sights, of course, so we walked a lot during our stay and used the metro and RER when the kids needed a break. It is pleasant to return to the hospitality and relaxed atmosphere of the Executive Lounge after a hard day's sightseeing and shopping.....just don't forget to leave it again to experience the Parisian nightlife ! We booked a twin bathroom King Deluxe Suite and even though we had to remind the front desk about at extra bed they mobilized housekeeping who prepared everything in minutes. Breakfast for 5 is more suitable downstairs than in the Executive lounge, and again space prevails. Breakfast staff were easy going, welcoming and efficient. Small touches like a take away coffee when requested were no problem. The concierge was very good in recommending places and has tickets (at the right price) for trips and les bateaux mouches, which saves queuing. The gym facility which I used (briefly) is very well kitted out, although we did not avail of the spa and jacuzzi. I was here with family, but if I had been working I would have been frustrated that the internet is expensive, whereas in most European capitals there is an abundance of free wifi hotels. Not having stayed with Hilton before, but as a regular booker for small business groups, this I would perceive as the only downside to this property. Come on Hilton, keep up with the competition in this modern age !!

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Arc de Triomphe - Most Excellent”
Reviews.Author: EworksMA
Reviews.Content: We decided to take a European site seeing vacation this year in February - Paris and Amsterdam. I'd been saving my Hilton points because I'd heard great things about this hotel and we were not disappointed. The rooms are spacious with a large bathroom/shower and ours had a balcony. We were able to take advantage of the executive lounge for breakfast and again at the end of the day. Very good selection of food and nice wines. I travel weekly in the states on business and have to say I liked everything about the Hilton Arc de Triomphe including: The staff - super nice and helpful in planning our sight seeing tour. The location - 15 minute walk to the Arc de Triumph and even closer to the metro. We purchased a 2 day metro pass for everyone and used it extensively. The subway felt safe and was a very convenient way to get around to all of the sights in Paris. The rooms - very clean, modern, and the same size as you would expect in the US. My only annoyance was that wireless internet didn't work well. I think it had more to do with me as the front desk offered to send someone up to help but decided to just let it go. A few tips: Buy the museum pass (unless your kids are 17 or under - they get in for free). Get a metro pass. A taxi cost us 60 Euro (for 4 of us) from CDG. The bus or train would have cost about as much and been less convenient. Get your Eiffel Tower tickets on line. In case you don't know, it's lit up at night and "sparkles" on the hour after dark (really a sight to see). If you want to eat dinner at the top, you need to make reservations way (months) in advance and I hear it's super expensive. The comments from other guests was that the food was ok but the scenery spectacular. Walk (hike the stairs to the top of Notre Dame). The gargoyles are great and there are spectacular views of Paris. We didn't do it (ran out of time) but many people told us the boat tour is very nice. So in summary - really great and would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: john k
Reviews.Content: Will go there again as soon as possible. We've liked everything. The front office is one of the best i've seen in Paris. The hotel is very well located, can't find better in Paris. Rooms are huge, clean, fresh and well designed. Everything is done to have a wonderful stay in this hotel. Furnitures are also awesome ! Front office staff helped us finding a nice place to eat. Thanks to everybody for this stay in your hotel. Paris was much more friendly with a hotel like this.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you'd expect from Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Natalie593
Reviews.Content: We booked a superior room online, but were upgraded to a deluxe room on arrival (not sure why really). The room was very large, especially for Paris, and was beautifully decorated and furnished. The bathroom had a separate shower and bath and was also spacious and lovely. The staff were courteous and friendly and helpfully reconfirmed a restaurant reservation for us without any fuss. It was everything you would expect from an international brand like Hilton. The only negative is that it is not really close to any of the surrounding metro stations - Courcelles is probably the closest. We had a great weekend in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Service | Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brenda D
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here once before (2010 volcano delay) and had such a lovely stay that I made a five night stay for my visit in February 2012. I had access to the executive lounge which is the best lounge I've ever experience. The hotel and lounge offer a relaxing atmosphere after a long day walking and touring around Paris. If you've eaten throughout your walk, the Hilton Arc de Triomphe lounge offers small treats to hold you over until the next day. They offer a great selection of beverages both alcoholic and non-alcoholic. The room are spacious for Europe and offer modern conveniences. I highly recommend staying at this Hilton location -- it is close to several Metro stops making it an easy base for your Paris tour.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Katie S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Arc de Triomphe for one night going from London to Normandy. We've been to Paris before and always stayed at the Hilton Paris - which Hilton sold between our last visit and this one! That hotel was spectacular, right next to the Eiffel Tower and with amazing staff, so we had high expectations for this hotel! The hotel itself is in a great location - the nearest Metro station is a short walk away, but you are also within walking distance of the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysees. The one downside with the location was that there weren't any great restaurants in the immediate area, but there's certainly no shortage of other amazing restaurants in Paris! The hotel itself is beautiful! We were on the Club Level and the rooms were clean and spacious. The rooms did have internet access (we are Hilton Honors members and were given free access) but we struggled to get it to work, and eventually gave up. Our room had a lovely little balcony, which was fairly useless in February but would be great in the summer to sit out with a glass of wine! The staff were all friendly and helpful, and all spoke perfect English! The Club Lounge seemed a good size, but it was often crowded and some guests had to stand to eat. Breakfast was a typical continental breakfast with some hot items like eggs and bacon. We also stopped in in the evening, where they offered wines, liquors and champagne, as well as vegetables, cheese plates, etc. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel, it suited us just fine and we'll be back to stay there if we're in Paris again!

Reviews.Title: “Gross dirty room too tired to bother!!”
Reviews.Author: Truthtel
Reviews.Content: So we had one night in Paris thank god. Our room was dirty the sink was clogged and toilet had poo marks gross!! We were so tired was not worth saying a word. We plan to come back for 4 days won't stay there. I'm a clean person keep your dirty hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice building let down by its staff and location”
Reviews.Author: ozjug
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay here at the last minute, and booked online directly with Hilton, paying quite a high price. Arrived around 3 hours later, and the hotel had no record of the booking even though I had received the email confining the booking. Checkin ended up taking a long time, and I suspect my HHonors elite status wasn't honoured in the "replacement" booking. The building is tastefully decorated and rooms were comfortable, adequate size, had comfortable beds and well-appointed bathroom. Breakfast was of adequate quality but poor value and really ought to be better food too, given it's Paris. Again the real let down was the staff: very slow, arrogant, brought the wrong food to the table - twice (someone else's order) and forgot to ever bring some of ours. Staff entered the room on two separate occassions without knocking / ringing the doorbell, which was surprising. The other big letdown was the location. Based on the name of the hotel I assumed we would be close to the Arc de Triomphe - perhaps with a view. In fact, the hotel is a fair walk away and in the cold Parisian winter the location was quite disappointing (again particularly because of the price).

Reviews.Title: “Paris 2011”
Reviews.Author: RevJack-HM08
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel very much. The room we had was very spacious, bright and quite. In the executive lounge we were well provided for by the staff. The hotel is very central and convenient to transport. The concierge were very helpfull in arranging activities and helping us with suggestions of places to see. One of the highlights was having diner on the river Seine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel,good location”
Reviews.Author: avk_n
Reviews.Content: I had very good week in this hotel in October last year during my business trip. The hotel has a very good location. It's just 7 minutes from metro station, approximately 10 minutes from Champs elysees. Room was clear, service and breacfest was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you can get a deal”
Reviews.Author: SydneyAussieGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at this hotel and booked as a top secret deal through lastminute. We were offered the chance to upgrade to an exective room but for an extra 60 euros we didnt feel it was worth it. The standard room was already amazing and we were only there briefly for one night. We didn't have breakfast. the staff were very polite and helped us to weigh our bags (before heading off to the airport). If you can get a deal I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: rmcolin
Reviews.Content: I stayed for just one night at the hotel. I cannot explain why such an expensive hotel won't offer free wifi (it's eur 9/ hour!!!). Oher than that, the location is awesome, the level of service is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hilton Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: kjtripper
Reviews.Content: We picked the Hilton Arc de Triumph based on the reviews on T/A. This was our fifth trip to Paris and the best mostly because of the Hilton Arc de Triumph. The front desk crew were pleasant and quick at getting us into our room even though it was 2 hours before check in time. Our room was large and comfy. No problems with heating, or cooling, and the bed was very good. The conceirge staff was the best we have ever encountered, and we have stayed at a few five star hotels. Oliver, the head concierge was fun to talk with, and steered us to one of the best meals we have had in Paris. Kristan and Manuel were always ready to help when Oliver was not available. We never had to wait long to speak to a concierge staff person unlike many hotels we have stayed at in the past. The hotels location is close to so many great places like the Jacquemart-AndrÃ© Museum, and the Nissim de Camondo Museum. Make time to see both if you can as they are worth it. Park Monceau is a 2 minute walk and is a nice place for a stroll or picinic. Don't miss the Boulagerie Marcel Prodhomme just 2 blocks away on Rue de Lisbonne. The croissants were the best we had on this trip, and their sandwiches are great too. Don't be turned off by the line that forms around lunchtime as it moves quickly. It's closed on Sat/Sunday. Next time in Paris we hope to come back and continue to to explore the area around the hotel, and re-visit some of the same places we discovered on this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant stay in a fashionable part of paris”
Reviews.Author: fonzpac
Reviews.Content: A refined luxury hotel near Arche de Triomphe - courteous and helpful staff - especially in the Executive Lounge. Very helpful staff from time of arrival until we left 2 days later. A good example of what Hilton offers when they get it right.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: Andy99
Reviews.Content: A weekend away booked as a Eurostar package from London. First impressions were good, hotel located in a nice residential area a short walk from the Metro and the Arc de Triomphe was comfortably reached in a 15 -20 minute walk. At check in we opted to accept the offer of an upgrade to access to the executive floor lounge for breakfast and snacks/drinks in the evening. Unfortunately, by upgrading this meant my wife was not allowed access to the spa facilities without an additional payment (it would have been complimentary on our original rate). When raised with the front desk staff the 'best' they could do was a 15 euro additional charge per session or offer a deal next time we stayed. I would recommend that you review, and clarify completely, the actual facilities offered if you decide to upgrade at the last minute. Rather than wasting further time arguing our point, which we felt was a fair one (considering all my wife wanted was a 20-30 minute session in the sauna), we decided to get on with our break and think very carefully about staying at this hotel again. The actual room was OK for a large city, not the largest, but serviceable. There was an iron, board and kettle in the room - this doesn't show on the hotel website and may not be available in all rooms. The room faced the courtyard, it was very quiet. The hotel was full on Saturday evening, despite this it remained very peaceful and we were not disturbed by noise from the corridors. Executive lounge staff were helpful and polite, a separate check in was available. I did get busy at times. The food was OK for a short stay. Breakfast was good for the cold selection, hot food was limited in choice and the same each day. Evening snacks, OK but very similar each evening would get tiresome for a long stay. The complimentary drinks selection was reasonable. Given the time over I think the 300 euro we spent for access over three days would have been more wisely spent in local a local cafe and a bar or two if on a holiday break. On business, the convenience would probably make it worthwhile - wifi is not free though. I travel relatively frequently on business and like to give a fair opinion of my stays in hotels. Therefore, on the whole, this is a nice hotel. A little more attention to meeting the customers expectations rather than trying to rack up a little more revenue would have left us with a better impression.

Reviews.Title: “Great 2 night break in Central Location”
Reviews.Author: LizzyW
Reviews.Content: We returned to the Hilton Arc de Triomphe last week for two nights. The hotel is very comfortable, large spacious lobby and the staff were warm and welcoming. We had breakfast in Saffran each morning whcih was a great start to the day and well worth it. there was a selection of bacon, sausage, eggs, hash browns etc and a delightful selection of fresh fruit, french pastries, porridge and many fruit juices. The only slight negative to our experience was returning after a day at museums to find our room door was not not closed properly. Anyone could have just pushed it and removed laptops, cameras etc so I would say there was a lapse in security by the maid! Luckily nothing was taken but it woudl have been very difficult to prove if it had. I would return here though as I assume that this error was just an unfortunate blip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hilton”
Reviews.Author: seagrovetraveler
Reviews.Content: We are still here and loving it. Arrived after a long international flight from Florida we were greeted warmly by the staff, given a key to the executive lounge, and sat down to a hot cup of tea and wonderful desserts. After a short wait, we checked into a large, well decorated room with a very comfortable bed and a cute balcony. It is has been bitterly cold in Paris but we haven't cared since we had our warm, home away from home to return to after long days spent exploring the museums and wandering the streets. Great fitness facility! The executive lounge is definitely a plus... to anyone who isn't a Hilton Honors member, you must join immediately. Thank you Hilton Arc de Triomphe for a memorable trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very "Parissien"”
Reviews.Author: foomsie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a 1 night business visit, mostly due to lack of availability in other more affordable hotels. This is a very nice, top-end business hotel. As a diamond I was upgraded to the executive floor with Eiffel tower view. The executive lounge, at the 6th floor, offers drinks and horse d'ouvres, which for me are adequate so that I do not require dinner afterwards ;-) With the free drinks, internet and food, this is a reasonable deal. I will stay here again..

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: silversurfer900
Reviews.Content: We stayed here christmas 2011, fantastic location and fantastic hotel

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sar4you
Reviews.Content: overall we ha d a great stay, loved the spa, it was empty every day, great big steam room! We stayed in a deluxe room, nice size, good bathroom, seperate bath and shower, great location 5 min walk from all the hot spots.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris”
Reviews.Author: MichaelandAnne
Reviews.Content: We stayed in in August/September 2009. An easy cab ride from the airport (CDG) and a reasonable price. It is very well positioned for most site seeing. Walk to the Arc and Champs. You can also walk easily to the Tower - this is a lovely walk. Close to cafes, shops, and post office. We had use of the lounge which was surperb. Staff excellent. As we sat with supper or breakfast - on the balcony - we felt as if we had gone back 200 years. You could almost here the shouts of the people and sounds of Les Mis. A beautiful building with efficient lifts and lobby. Staff were wonderful and even accepted our poor attempts at the language. Rooms were a good size and ours had a balcony with a view to the Eiffel Tower. It was the sort of place you enjoyed returning to at the end of a long day tripping about, Some lovely spots in the near vicinity to research and explore. Well worth a look and stay. Check out deals on the net.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic visit in Paris”
Reviews.Author: French S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Arc de Triomphe during our visit to Paris. Good location on the right bank. We stayed on the executive level which was outstanding. We had our breakfast each morining there and snacks and drinks throughout the day. Our room was spacious and very comfortable. The staff was very helpful in meeting all our requests.

Reviews.Title: “Made to feel welcome”
Reviews.Author: RoyalBridie
Reviews.Content: I booked The Hilton Arc De Triomphe as a 40th Birthday Surprise for my partner having previously stayed here a few years ago. Guest relations manager Virginie Kmita greeted me upon arrival and said she wanted to ensure our stay was enjoyable. She organised a room upgrade for us which given the occassion was very much appreciated. The room was modern, clean, smelled nice and there were plenty toiletries which were re-stocked daily. There was a turndown service nightly & guest relations organised a nice surprise for our return on the 1st evening which ensured we had a very memorable stay. We couldnt fault the Hilton for making every effort to look after us. In terms of the Hotel itself it is less than 5 minutes walk from Courcelles Metro Station or less than 10 minutes walk to the Arc De Triomphe & Charles De Gaulle Etoile Metro Station. We were staying on a room only basis so cannot comment on the breakfasts but if you are in Paris I would always recommend you go to a Bistro/Cafe and endulge in the cafe culture. The Hotel Bar did seem a bit over priced at 20 euros for a cocktail and 14 euros for a Gin & Tonic so not somewhere you may be keen to stay all evening but this said at the end of an evening in Paris you may be tempted to sit down and relax before heading upstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Executive room in an art deco hotel”
Reviews.Author: IOMGEOFF
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated approximately 15-20 minute walk to the Champs-Elysees.The hotel is a modern version of a 1930 art deco hotel which we found to be be very pleasant and pleasing on the eye. We were booked into the executive rooms and had a room on the 5th floor which overlooked an internal courtyard (no traffic noise). The room was of a good size with 2 double beds. House keeping excellent with fresh bedding daily and nightly turn down service. Downside points to the room: poor lighting around closet area, no mirror in bedroom, bathroom on the small size and I would had liked a separate shower. Executive lounge: is a large and smart area with a small separate TV room. It is very comfortable and well laid out. We found all the amenities to be to our satisfaction with very friendly and helpful staff. We found the lounge to be quite busy, and that some used it as an office carrying out meetings especially at breakfast time. Spa: expensive, but you do get free admission to the other amenities. To note: We found the room to be well sound proofed. I would return to this hotel if visiting Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION IS THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: Julio B
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel during our visit to Paris. The hotel is expensive, however, it has several amenities that make it worth it. Parking is underground, you do not have to worry about finding parking, the rooms are amazing, the staff is excellent, the restaurants in the hotel are very good, close to many places, just walk out and you will find the typical Parisinian places: reaturants, cafes, Arc de Triumphe, this is a pay more and be closer to everything selection.

Reviews.Title: “Location Good, Service lacking”
Reviews.Author: gotbagswilltravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in June 2011,never got around to review. Nice hotel, quiet street, couple of miles from Champs Elysee. Good restaurants nearby. I-net fees are steep, concierge service not helpful. Told me I could get tickets for Versailles by going to their computer and ordering them. Didn't tell me about the $30 US, for computer fee to do that. We got the tickets outside Notre Dame the next day at an info booth. Restaurant is really expensive. Can't sit in the lovely courtyard no seats.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: georgehu
Reviews.Content: Checked in to this beautiful hotel in the middle of the day. hotel surrounds a nice courtyard and has an art-deco theme. It's true the that rooms facing the courtyard are more quiet than the ones facing the street, but I didn't find the street-facing rooms too bad. Originally we had booked a room with one kind bed, but the room was barely big enough for the bed, and we had also requested a crib. So, we requested a larger room, and they gave us a room with two double beds. It was still small, but that's Europe for you. however, it was comfortable. It faced the street, but we found that charming. The hotel has a wonderful concierge staff that will assist you with anything. It's also located about 10 minutes walk from Metro stations, and a 15 minute walk from the Champs-Elysees. Previous reviewers are right--the hotel is surrounded by charming patisseries and boulangeries, so there is no need to buy breakfast at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Location Just OK, and overpriced for the simple things”
Reviews.Author: kfloCalifornia
Reviews.Content: It's comforting to walk into a Hilton after you're tired from traveling 20 hours to get there. I was disappointed I could not get upgraded to the concierge floor upon arrival. Check in receptionist seemed a little snooty about it, even though I offered to pay for it and they seemed to have plenty of availability in the hotel. Rooms are small, but very comfortable, niced sized king bed and functional, clean bathroom. Breakfast buffet was fantastic (as long as price included in your room). Cost of drinks in the bar were outrageous. Not much shopping close by to hotel to stock up for snacks. And no great restaurants that I found to quickly walk down the street for a nice meal. Nice to have a health club in the hotel, but appeared to be filled with locals who didn't really want to share the equipment with hotel guests. Other than check in receptionist, hotel staff friendly and very service-oriented. Wifi was free for me, but did have issues with conncection. Hotel was farther from the Arc de Triomphe than I expected. I would prefer to stay somewhere closer to center. But it is certainly a comfortable place to stay if you can get a good rate or cash in your points.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Kathya100
Reviews.Content: A weekend break and our first trip to Paris. From check in to check out everything was perfect. All staff were more than helpful and very friendly. Room was very comfortable and clean. Stayed on executive floor with full (all day) access to the lounge which was amazing. The area and location was excellent and was central for all our needs. This hotel made our stay in Paris "Just Perfect"

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: JetsetManager
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a couple of nights in the Hilton Arc de Triomphe in Paris. Quila, the guest relations manager, was excellent. Our rooms were ready early and after an international flight that was awesome. The rooms were great. The hotel concierge was also very helpful. They also had a very cool pop-up Bubble Bar which added to the experience. I spend many nights in hotels every year and consider myself a discriminating traveler. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific executive lounge, nice rooms, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Inluvwithjapan
Reviews.Content: Somewhat typical of upscale Hiltons in nice cities...rooms were nice, staff was pleasant and helpful, restaurants were terrific and overall service was top drawer. The location was ideal to most everything we wanted to visit.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Hotel perfect location with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: MarkGemBell
Reviews.Content: We went here for a short break for my wifes 30th and it was perfect. The rooms were lovely and clean and they had a Bubble Bar in the garden which was a great extra. The location is perfect for all sights in Paris everything is very accessable. There is also a great Park on the doorsteps for a romantic stroll. The service was very good and I would highly recommend to anyone looking for a comfortable stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Executive Lounge”
Reviews.Author: kymadden1956
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Hilton Arc de Triomphe because it was centrally located and we were able to get a free room for our family of four. We stayed Dec. 19th thru Dec. 22nd. My husband is a Diamond Hilton honors member so we were able to get a Double Double room and also have access to the Executive Lounge. The room was a bit small, but very clean and well appointed as was the hotel lobby, restaurant and Executive lounge. We were very impressed by the Executive lounge roominess and its breakfast foods, snacks and drinks all day, including spirits, wine and beer. The fresh breads were great, along with the chocolate candies at 9:00 pm every night. We enjoyed the free Wifi also in the lounge, but would have liked to have the wifi access in our room also. But we made the best of it every night, by unwinding in the lounge after a hectic day of touring. The hotel is within blocks of Champs Elysee and Arc de Triomphe which made it easy to walk around. Also since we were there before the holidays we enjoyed all the Christmas markets and Christmas lights everywhere. I would also like to commend the excellent service we received from all the hotel employees, especially the Concierge, Executive lounge and front desk employees. All were very helpful, especially since we don't speak much French, but we tried. They all spoke English, which made the stay just wonderful. I would recommend staying at the Hilton Arc de Triomphe.

Reviews.Title: “My regular place in Paris”
Reviews.Author: hiflya
Reviews.Content: I've had 7 stays at this property since it opened. As a Diamond, you are given access to the lounge which is a nice place to get a free drink before heading out in the evening. I've had every type of room they have on site and though some can be somewhat small, I've had no issues with any of them. Just down a side street very near the hotel, check out the MusÃ©e Nissim de Camondo. Patterned after le Petit Trianon at Versailles, this private home was built in the early 1900s for Comte Moise de Camondo, to set off his prestigious collection of 18th century French furniture and art objects.

Reviews.Title: “An American Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: phuocsandiego
Reviews.Content: I'm a Hilton Diamond member and over the past 3 months I've stayed at this property over 25 days. I've stayed here previously a few times as well so I can say that I have some experience with this hotel over the last few years as well as many other hotels for comparison sake. The Hilton Arc de Triomphe is not fancy or pretentious which fits me just fine. It's clean, the amenities are great and the staff wonderfully helpful, as many others have noted. If you're an American in Paris for business or on vacation and would prefer some of the comforts of home, then this hotel is for you. Some reviewers have mentioned that the toilet is in the bathroom... that's very American. Having a toilet in a separate closet is a very European thing and you have to decide what you prefer. I'm of the former camp. If you're an elite member and can qualify for the executive lounge or have a room that allows you access, then breakfast is included and it's a nice variety. However, the same hot entrees of scrambled eggs, hash browns and bacon gets old after a bit. In the evenings there's refreshments (wines, champagne, beer, soft drinks and assorted appetizers & snacks) and that's always welcome before heading out to dinner. The location is pretty convenient. Close enough to the Champs Elysees but just off enough that it's not loud and crazy all the time. The hotel however, is not without its fault. Some like the art deco look. I hate it. Ok, hate may be too strong a word but to me it's not "timeless" as others have described. It looks dated to me and some of the elements of the design makes the hotel look a lot older, dark & uninviting. Although it's very well maintained, I prefer something more modern, bright & cheerful. Elegant chic if I may call it that. I've seen that enough at other high end hotels that I know my preference. Other gripes include no wireless internet in the rooms which is a huge pain since most of us are on iPhones/iPads or on a notebook that we'd rather use in our beds rather than tied to the desk. Internet is included for elite Hilton members so at least that's a plus but having to go to the lounge or the lobby when I want to use my iPhone/iPad is a chore. Others have pointed out the sewer smell in the lifts & lift lobbies. This has not gone away and have not been solved permanently by the building engineers. I've smelled it in all of my recent visits for at least a few days and it's nasty. The past few days have been pretty decent though. I don't know why it's so hard to resolve that one. I also don't like the inconsistencies from room to room. For example, some rooms have a separate shower & tub (my preference) and other rooms just have a tub with a piece of glass at one end where you can take a shower with water going all over (very French & I hate this type of rooms). I wish there was a way to make all the rooms similar. Americans would be driven crazy by the latter rooms while French guests would be more than fine with the former so I don't know why Hilton won't just make it consistent and give each room separate tubs & showers. Also, many rooms do not have a 110v outlet in the bathroom for shavers & toothbrush chargers. You'll have to be careful there since many of those items are not dual voltage and you'll have permanent damage using just a plug converter... best to get a 220v charger for those items if you come to Europe a lot. Given these gripes though, the Hilton Arc de Triomphe is still a very good hotel and my default when visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Would not consider staying anywhere else in Paris”
Reviews.Author: nongagkram
Reviews.Content: Staff is always very accomodation for early flight arrivals. The hotel is very quiet yet set in a great location in central Paris. Walk anywhere. I Have stayed here on 6 occasions and usually get a room upgrade. The Purple Bar a great stop at the end of the day

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to the Hhonors program”
Reviews.Author: Vincent_D_BE
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay. Thanks to my Hhonors Diamond status I received a great upgrade to a Junior Suite. Nice large executive lounge and the staff was very helpful . I booked already my next stay in March. So looking forward to be back in Paris. Regards Vincent

Reviews.Title: “Nice but a great default”
Reviews.Author: Monpetit
Reviews.Content: Location is good : calm, not far from Champ Elysees, and Boulevard Hausmann... Lobby, corridor, and rooms are very cosy in a art deco style which is perfect. Our room(superior with garden view) was perfect, tub and shower, and a lavabo... But why the toilets are in the batrhroom ???? For a **** hotel at this price(325 $, internet rate ), it's just off the line... Nice staff, good spa.

Reviews.Title: “All expectations met, Maybe the best Hilton”
Reviews.Author: DoesNotGetOutMuch
Reviews.Content: We checked in for 4 days in the first week of January 2012. Arriving on the Eurostar at Gare Du Nord, we had problems finding the La Chapelle station on the Metro 5 but once we did the transit to Courcelles was easy. After coming up the steps from Courcelles its an even walking of 300 metres to the Hilton along rue de Courcelles (Boulevarde de Courcelles). We looked at departing via Metro/RER through Gare du Nord to CDG airport but opted for a taxi at 45 euro for ease and because we had one large suitcase. The hotel is also an easy walk to George V Metro (lines 1 and 2) on the Champ and Miromesnil Metro (12,13,14) along Blvd Haussman depending on where we were headed. Shopping or people watching on Ave Montagne, Champ, Printemps and G Lafayette are all within 10-15 minutes walk. We generally ate at moderately priced Bistros between the hotel and the Champ but Blvd Corcelles deserves exploration. Check in was smooth, friendly. We had a an Executive King room, which was large by Paris standards, obviously with a King sized bed. Our view was not great - office block adjacent. The Executive lounge is outstanding here on level 6. There is an outside terrace that provides a place to view the local skyline. There are very good sequential buffets here throughout the day including a hot breakfast with egg and bacon and an evening drinks with hors service from 6-9pm. Nice pre-dinner option. The best resource is, however, the staff - overall positive and proactive, non-presumptious and industrious. We also found the rest of the staff in the Hotel very good. Originally, we want a small hotel ... now we are spoilt for never.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Simone029
Reviews.Content: Great hotel at fantastic location. Beautiful room, clean, spacious and modern. Staff very friendly and go out of their way to help you. Bed very comfortable. Not many options for food close by was a downside, and a problem with sewerage smell in hotel lifts and corridors. Had a fantastic Christmas brunch Buffett at the restaurant. Would recommend to others and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Executive Lounge is Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Ravine W
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a beautiful lobby, good service and a wonderful executive longue. The location was very good for walking or metro.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful And Comfortable Hotel With Great Service And Style”
Reviews.Author: n1w9106
Reviews.Content: May 2011. My wife and I traveled to Paris following a stay in Versailles. Getting to the Arc de Triomphe from the Gare St. Lazare station was a short taxi ride. I am a Hilton Diamond and had saught a paid upgrade to a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower on the executive floor but it was not available. To make up for this, the hotel gave us, at no extra charge, a georgous two room suite with a courtyard view! The bedroom had a very comfortable king bed, a sitting area, desk, 40 inch big screen TV and a full bath with separate tub and shower. The main room had a couch, table, chairs, desk, a 40 inch big screen TV and another full bath. We loved the executive lounge on the top floor of the hotel. The staff was super courtious and helpful and the food and drink (including full bar selection) was fantastic. The lounge had 5 services thoughout the day so there was always something good to eat or drink. From the hotel it was easy to walk to the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysees. Nearby restaurants were delightful and travel to the Louvre, Eiffel Tower and many other sights were all close. As a Diamond member for over three years now, I would easily rate this hotel as one of the best Hilton properties I have been to. I used Hhonors points for this stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: LadyoftheLake1
Reviews.Content: Nice Hilton located relatively close to arc de triomphe and within easy walking distance to champs Ã©lysÃ©es. Have on your walking shoes to make it to Eiffel and Louvre on foot. Takes at least 30 minutes to walk to Eiffel from hotel and longer to Notre Dame and Louvre. Rooms are tiny. Door in bathroom oddly placed. Executive Lounge for diamond members superb!!!! Staff very nice and helpful. Only complaint - tiny room - even on executive floor with upgrade!

Reviews.Title: “Happy to have stayed”
Reviews.Author: Gail K
Reviews.Content: The lobby and those attending the desk were helpful and friendly. It was clean and comfortable. The room was clean and the beds were also comfortable. The room size was pretty big for European standards. We had a view of the Eiffel Tower but there was some construction happening which marred the otherwise wonderful view. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fourtravels
Reviews.Content: The people at this hotel made our experience very special. We stayed for 3 nights in December in a suite. Our check-in was smooth and the sweet Italian young lady spoke perfect English. Even though I was responsible for the mixed-up with our reservations, the hotel manager went above and beyond to help straighten out the situation for us and made it a very pleasant stay for us. The hotel is a short walk to the Champs Elysees. We would definitely come back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “''Great Hotel''”
Reviews.Author: Steve360791
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hilton Arc dr Triomphe for one night on December 2nd. The service we received from the moment we arrived was superb. From check in to breakfast the next morning, everything was fantastic. It is very well placed as a base to see Paris. Would highly recommend to anyone........

Reviews.Title: “Rewarding experience!”
Reviews.Author: VMB2010
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights 29th December 2011 to 3 January 2012 with the specific purpose to welcome the New Year in Paris! My wary was that I knew the former Hilton Tour Eiffel and knew nothing on Hilton Arc de Triomphe, a former Waldorf., as the maps say. The surprise was on the good side. I was given a room with view on a inner garden, but I wanted a room with a street view to see "les toits de Paris". Next day this was possible to my satisfaction. The Executive lounge on 6th floor is on the normal Hilton standard and the only minus was for me the absence of sausages (!?) at breakfast, but I took it as a personal taste. The service on both HHonours desk and Executive lounge was excellent. A special notice for a lady from the Concierge who was most helpful arranging a show at Le Lapin Agile, cancelling it on my request and rebooking. Even more, she sent a notice in the room as a reminder. The New Year party in the the Salon Normandie was also very good: a true French dinner, live music (a little bit to loud and with no French songs) and a lot of French champagne! Seeing Paris was easy as the location is minutes away walking distance from Avenue Champs Elysees. For sure, I will come back to this hotel when I will visit Paris again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for first visit to Paris”
Reviews.Author: jojostew
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I just returned from Paris. We spent five days over the New Year holiday. We used trip advisor extensively for the trip and were very pleased with so many reviews. Therefore, I have rushed to add a review about the hotel we stayed at. We tried to decide between Marriott and Hilton, since we had enough hotel points for either. This hotel was perfect. The staff is so friendly and helpful from the doorman to the concierge (especially Manuel). We made sure to contact the concierge and tell them to keep our room since we were arriving at 6:00am and reserved the room for the night before. They upgraded us to a beautiful, large suite and off to sleep we went. We used the Executive Lounge often and you cannot see the Eiffel Tower from the loungeâ€¦some rooms may have a view of the tower. The staff is so helpful with were to go and any items you may need from the hotel. After a wonderful day of visiting sites and enjoying delicious dinners we would go to the Purple Bar for an after dinner drink. Just loved the bar staff, especially Maxime, even though I couldnâ€™t pronounce his name or merci very well with my southern accent, he was charming as ever. This truly was a beautiful, perfect vacation and the wonderful hotel had a lot to do with making it so. I have included many pictures of our fabulous stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mum4k9
Reviews.Content: I think this trip makes the 6th stay at the Hilton AdT and once again they did not disappoint! We were here for 8 nights and have zero complaints. The staff was fabulous and the food was great. As others have said, the location is really convenient as a jumping off point to see the city. My only complaint was some of the other guestsâ€¦.we saw some really bad behavior in the Executive Loungeâ€¦way to keep it classy fellow Americans! Weâ€™re already looking forward to our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “New Year @ The Hilton”
Reviews.Author: LondonMac1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our two children aged 9 and 12 stayed at The Hilton Arc De Triomphe from 27th December through to 1st Jan. We enjoyed a wonderful 5 nights in Paris and The Hilton did not disappoint. All the staff we encountered during our stay were friendly and helpful and our room was comfortable and spacious with all we needed - the view of the Eiffel Tower from our room was great but the view of the building site next door not so! There are 2 metro stations very close by, a lovely park on the doorstep and the Arc De Triomphe a short stroll away. An ideal location to explore Paris from. We enjoyed lots of drinks in the hotels Purple Bar, both the decor and atmosphere in there were good - a bit on the pricey side but worth it. All the public areas of the hotel were very grand and just what you would expect from a Hilton hotel - loved the art deco style. We attended the New Years Eve gala dinner at the hotel - which was the highlight of our stay, all the staff were incredibly friendly, helpful and attentive, the food first class and the general atmosphere wonderful - a great way to see in the new year!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: exotic_chick
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hilton Arc de Triomphe a handful of times now. My first few times staying there, I had issues during check-in (one time they couldn't find my reservation, another time they didn't have my room ready until 4:00 pm even though I'd booked the hotel for the previous night so I could check in immediately upon arrival, etc.). Fortunately, I had a much better experience my last time there. As usual, since my plane gets in at 8:30 am, I booked the room for the previous night. This time, checkin went very smoothly and I got into my room promptly. I also was upgraded to a suite, which was very nice. The location of this hotel is really great, and the Concierge staff is truly helpful with a smile. I'd stay there again and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A triomphe!!!”
Reviews.Author: enriquedemarchena
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Arc de Triomphe makes sense to its name not only because its location but because it is a great hotel for its value. A triomphe in french, a success!! A friendly lobby, excellent staff at the reception but specially the concierge is very attentive, ready to serve and be helpful with reservations to restaurants and concerts. The Bubble bar is very trendy. Rooms are very nice again for its value. All of what you need to be comfortable for american standards is there. Only problem is that our room in the fourth floor faces a building always busy, therefore, curtains has to be mainly closed. A great value is breakfast that I highly recommend to make sure to book with your room. A full buffet allows you to have a healthy breakfast before hitting the streets, and certainly save you some euro s as you can have a light lunch if you want. Remember how expensive is Paris. In conclusion, the hotel allows our family(8 of us) to have a very pleasant stay. We definitely recommend it !!

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but pleasant”
Reviews.Author: d r
Reviews.Content: I stayed couple of times 2010-11 at the HIlton AdT, and must say I'm pretty happy with it, and would probably go back. It is pricey indeed, but if you know Hiltons you know what you pay for: good beds and linens, good noise isolation, usual Hilton breakfast and HH lounge. Last time I was there I was a bit disappointed being in an average room: still it was perfect! The concierge(s) has been fantastic and a great great help, front desk staff maybe a bit less efficient... And, I personally LOVE the deco!

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL PARFAIT POUR UN WEEK END A PARIS”
Reviews.Author: ericfoulon
Reviews.Content: hotel tres bien situÃ© pour la visite de Paris;prÃ¨s des champs ElyssÃ©es.Ne louper pas le petit dejeuner .Conciergerie trÃ©s efficace.Chaque fois que je suis a Paris , je choisis cet hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: georgiagirl120
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here in December 2011. Our room was very nice and the staff were so friendly and helpful. With Honors Points we had access to the Executive Lounge which was great for breakfast and snacks. The staff there were also very friendly and helpful. The hotel is located a few blocks from the Arc de Triomphe and a few blocks from the Courcelles metro stop. The area around it is a mix of residential, commercial and embassies. Plenty of cafes and restaurants, and a pharmacy just a short walk from the hotel. My only complaint about the hotel would be that each evening, the hallways had a sewage smell. This odor seemed to be gone each morning and did not permeate the rooms, lobby or lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service (with a small exception)”
Reviews.Author: mikeshw
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with my family mid-December 2011. The concierge was 1st class, right from the minute we got off the taxi before check in and up to the point we checked out and boarded the taxi. I don't think I had ever experienced this level of service at any 5-stars so far (except maybe for the Ritz Carlton). The hotel is a little far from Champs Elysee, especially for getting to the Paris L'Open Bus Tours, and within a 10 minute walk to the Charles De Gaulle metro stop at the Arc D'Triomphe. Food wise at the Executive Lounge was ok, although they do not vary the menu at all. Housekeeping was slightly off, some days we got complimentary water and refills of shampoos and shower gels and other days none. Overall I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: jasmine210westie
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, location a bit far from center but within walking distance of the Champs Elysee. Was a nice experience overall, and the rooms were more spacious than expected. The hotel concierge was semi-knowledgable, though they gave m the wrong information about the tour buses. Wasted a day for me. I also booked a trip to Monet's house, and realized that from other hotels, they charged less. This is because the concierge gets a cut. Overall, safe location, mediocre stay. They seemed to be busy with a lot of conventions and groups from India at the time of my visit. Bakeries nearby. Great food outside of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: janineb01
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I have just been to Paris to the Christmas Market and decided to spend one night at this hotel! WhAt an amazing surprise when we got there they had upgraded us to a junior suite (my husband has diamond status) and they just couldn't do enough for us what amazing staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel if you want to stay in a big busy hotel.”
Reviews.Author: relaxingaussies
Reviews.Content: Excellent from check-in to check-out. Staff were friendly, knowledgable & very efficient. Room clean with modern bathroom & toiletries. Club benefits worth the extra money although overcrowded during our stay. Other guests seemed to go to the Club floor at 6pm and eat & drink everything in sight & stay till closing at 11pm. Very hard to get a seat from 6pm till 11pm. So we tried the Restaurant for breakfast. It was excellent with very attentive staff. Concierge very helpful. Hotel name a bit misleading as it's a 10-15 minute walk to the Arc de Triomphe. Overall excellent if you want to stay at a big busy hotel in a big city. After our visit to the Hilton we rented a private apartment & had a wonderful experience living & getting to know the locals in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great rooms and service to match”
Reviews.Author: mbryant73
Reviews.Content: Often I find Hilton hotels very basic and the same but this hotel really exceeded my expectations for a Hilton. The building is in an art-deco style with similar spacious rooms complete with Peter Thomas Roth bath products. We had a meeting at the hotel as well and the staff was nothing but helfpful and inviting as soon as you would walk through the door. The food for lunch was fantastic! Only one small drawback...do not serve powdered eggs for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing birthday weekend”
Reviews.Author: SamChang
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband celebrated our birthday weekend in Paris. We've stay in Hilton arc the triompe, we had the best Hilton experience. 5 star service, room is very clean and the staffs are very friendly accommodating. Location is near to champs elysees where you can find restaurants and go shopping. Near to local cafes and metro station. Best Paris experience!

Reviews.Title: “An American in Paris”
Reviews.Author: oncfari
Reviews.Content: Getting around in Paris as a first-time American tourist can be challenging, especially if you don't speak the language. This Hilton has an incredibly convenient location, near the Arc, of course, but also a short walk to the Champs d'Elysees, and a 10-minute cab ride to the Eiffel Tower and many other Paris attractions including museums, art galleries. And, of course, there's great French cuisine around every corner. But the coup de grace of this hotel is that it is every bit as proud of its American heritage as it's Paris location, making it easy to get directions, advice on attractions and the impeccable level of service that one might expect from a $350/night (+/-) venue that is offset to a degree by an ultra-convenient location, top-notch rooms and exemplary service all around!

Reviews.Title: “Another fine stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Louise40
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel especially the exec floor. Local park is excellent for jogging.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: love2travelTelAviv
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights in a Deluxe Plus room. Lobby, patio and breakfast area are WOW !. The room spacious, very clean, big LCD, coffee/tea facilities, a bath and a separate shower. Super comfortable bed/pillow/dovet. The staff was the friendliest and the most attentive I have encountered: truely willing to fulfill your requests, and always with a smile. The closest Metro station is a 5-minute walk, and the Arc de Triomphe a 10-minute walk. Something to consider. If you don't mind the walk and you prefer a quiet residential location, it is perfect. Breakfast good but rather standard. Also I would have expected, booking a deluxe room, complementary mineral water and a turn-down service, which were not provided. But over all we were happy with our choice and will stay at the Hilton Arc the Triomphe in our next visit to breathtaking PARIS.

Reviews.Title: “NIce size room for family of 4”
Reviews.Author: 914Familyof4
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel mainly because we could get a room with two double beds. My wife and I have children and found that many other hotels wouldn't accomdate more than three people in a room. The room price included breakfast for all four of us. The room is a decent size for a family of for and very clean. The hotel staff was very helpful and they had a room ready for us when we arrived at about 9am after an overnight flight. The concierge assisted in finding kid-frindly activites and directions around town. The hotel was centrally located, not far from a metro station--no problem for the kids to walk to it many times.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: dsllprice
Reviews.Content: The exterior is not overly impressive, but the interiors are nicely done - both public and guestroom spaces. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Location is excellent. As a first-timer to Paris, I wanted to have easy access to good food, good shopping and of course the most popular tourist traps. I could walk to the Eiffel Tower, the Louvre and the Arc de Triomphe or catch the metro for places farther out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good area, we would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravelfamily4
Reviews.Content: Good hotel with nice hilton standards. we enjoy the executive floor rooms and the lounge. The hop on hop off buss is just a few blocks away and cab rides anywhere in paris are only about $10 from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Service not so great”
Reviews.Author: Izzy_11777
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is located 10 minutes walk from Champs Elysees and offers a nice and cosy accomodation. Nothing more than this. The quality of service is not at the level of a hotel of such class and is not worth that money. I would find my stuff just thrown into a corner, whereas I am expecting it to be neatly folded, or at least to have it put on a shelf and not thrown together with everything else. The towel which I put on the green marble floor in front of the sink, was put back on the handrail, with the clean ones. The bellboys were pretty rude in the way they expected their tip for luggage handling, so they did not get any... Internet, being expensive at 22 EUR/per day, was so slow, that websites could not open, and I spent half of the night trying to connect to my mail. Spa has crazy working hours from 10:00 to 20:00 so if you are on business, it means that you will not get much relaxation.... Overall, not so great impressions, probably because of high expectations from the hotels of this kind.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: RoseTraveller
Reviews.Content: This Hilton hotel is at just a 5 minute walk to Arc du Triomphe, in a calm residential neighborhood. Lovely location, great place to stay in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Best of HH”
Reviews.Author: 621VladC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on an HH award. We were given a generous update, Hilton Honors benefits at this hotel are excellent. Very nice spacious rooms. Excellent service. The location is one of the best in Paris within walking distance of all the places that make Paris a great city. The hotel including the lobby, the rooms, the lounge look like recently updated and in excellent shape. A great place to spend quality vacation time. One of the best Hilton hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: paulmar
Reviews.Content: From stepping out of the taxi on arrival to departure every member of staff could not have been more welcoming and helpful at this superb hotel. Having stayed in several London Hilton properties this was a cut above. Our double double executive (608) adjacent to the lounge was spacious clean and comfortable - Oh and quiet too. What else does one need? A few things were a little tired like the curtains and mirrors/lighting could be a lot better but they did their job and nothing deterred from our enjoyment. The staff certainly make this hotel what it is and in particular those in the executive lounge who always had time for help and advice and those lovely lively concierge boys always smiling and running around for taxis. Location was ideal for us to visit the Salle Playel theatre (5mins) and felt very safe plus Champs Elysees only 10 minutes away and what a superb atmosphere at the excellent Christmas market. This hotel like the rest of Paris is expensive but the snacks and refreshments in the lounge do help make the euros go a little further! Would not hesitate in returning to this property.

Reviews.Title: “No wifi or web access”
Reviews.Author: JMarques023
Reviews.Content: It is incredible how such an expensive hotel has no wi-fi in the rooms. And additionally the 1st night I stayed there, there wasn't also Internet accs via the cable, and the help desk is a external entity that isn't in the hotel and that can't do nothing for you. Terrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Treatment with a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaSweetpea
Reviews.Content: Once again, we were very impressed by this hotel. We stayed at the Hilton Arc de Triomphe on our honeymoon in 2009 and returned in November 2011.
