From the moment we arrived, the service was great. Aurelie checked us in efficiently and gave us a great room. We were upgraded to a balcony room with a view of the Eiffel Tower that was wonderful. We highly recommend the executive level rooms. The executive lounge is amazing -- always stocked with snacks/meals and drinks (wine, beer and liquor as well as various coffee options). In addition, the location is excellent and the rooms are very clean. Edouard Lapasset, Guest Relations, deserves acknowledgment for the special champagne and flowers delivered to our room. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “spacious rooms in Paris”
Reviews.Author: DDandC
Reviews.Content: When travelling with our teenager daughter to Paris, we always choose this hotel because its rooms are spacious enough to accomodate three people easily. Otherwise, we would prefer a smaller hotel, with more character.

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to return,”
Reviews.Author: OH4sure
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this hotel and cannot wait to make this my homemade for another trip to Paris. The staff were all so kind to me durning my 7-night stay. The concierge level was amazing and I loved the lounge for coffee and pastries while planning my walking tour of the day. The hotel location is terrific for sightseeing and was always a welcome sight when returning from another jaunt out and about in the city. You will enjoy your stay at the Hilton Arc de Triopmhe.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience at the Hilton Arc de Triomphe”
Reviews.Author: suze_shoes
Reviews.Content: This was a combination wedding anniversary get-a-way and business trip. Spending at least half our lives in hotel rooms on business travel, we look for a property with outstanding service, amenities and quality. Happy to say that this Hilton delivers on all counts. From a business standpoint, it certainly accommodates the needs of the business traveler and offers spacious meeting rooms and an easy to navigate floor plan. Check in is pleasant and efficient. The public spaces are filled with lovely fresh flower arrangements. Look up at the ceiling in the lobby and marvel at the artwork! Our room was on the executive floor--well worth the extra cost as it gives access to a lounge offering food and beverage and a dedicated concierge. The lounge may be crowded at times, but the staff handles it effortlessly. Sleeping rooms are well appointed with marble and wood, cushy beds, robes and slippers, and Peter Thomas Roth amenities. Temperature controls are responsive and comfortable. The front desk concierge staff is simply superb--effortlessly handling our requests for dinner reservations and a private car to the airport. The restaurant Le Safran provided a delicious meal after a day of travel. This was fine dining and the wait staff is highly professional and accommodating. The Purple Bar is just fun! Enjoy a glass of champagne and a snack here. The room just draws you in and makes you want to sit and sip for hours. The location is several blocks from Arc de Triomphe, but this is good--its really quite frenetic in that area and the quiet of this neighborhood is so appreciated. Just a few blocks away begins the famous shopping street: rue du Faubourg Saint-HonorÃ©. Take that right into the Place Vendome area and then up a few blocks to Galleries de Lafayette and Printemps...recommend a cab back to the Hilton. Unless you hate to walk (then why are you in Paris?), this is hands down one of the best places to stay in Paris. We will recommend highly to our clients for upcoming meetings/conferences also. Our thanks to the hardworking team for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “A good, solid quality Hilton”
Reviews.Author: GPeto
Reviews.Content: In relation to the ever fluctuating quality in the Hilton chain this hotel is at the top end of the list. The name suggests its at the Arc de Triumph but in fact its about a good 10 minute walk away from it. (Its like calling Hahn aiport in germany Frankfurt) The lobby looks very nice indeed and the hotel building is also very pretty. In preparation for Christmas they decorated the courtyard in the most spectacular way I have ever seen. They used artificial snow and amazing lights. The breakfast is good. The internet is fast. Rooms are spacious especially for Paris. Most of the employees were very helpful which is super knowing that french generally are not the most friendliest. The prices are high. Very high. If you get a room for 280EUR then u should feel lucky. The only thing I didnt like is the smell in the rooms. They use somekind of perfume and its not one i liked so the only way of getting rid of the smell was not letting houskeeping service my room for 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Two Stays at Paris/Arc de Triomphe”
Reviews.Author: quequedub
Reviews.Content: Second stay at the Paris Hilton Arc de Triumph, both equally good. I arrived early afternoon; front desk welcomed me to the city and to the hotel and directed me to the lounge: "you can check-in there and relax. They can get you a better room." Lounge staff were welcoming and worked on getting us a room. There was some issue with the safe in the room to which we were assigned but they worked to resolve it while we had refreshments and unwound after traveling. It wasn't a big deal at all and they were very apologetic. The room itself was spacious enough by Paris standards. It was certainly not palatial but the hotel rooms in Paris are typically small, so I wasn't surprised. Everything was clean, up-to-date, and well-appointed. The bathroom was comfortable, though not large at all. This hotel's location is a good fifteen-minute walk to the nearest subway station and, even then, multiple connections always seemed necessary to get where we wanted to go. That said, the walk is pleasant enough and it's not an issue, but this is something to consider if you like the subway directly outside your door. The location to sights of interest along the western part of Paris's center is excellent, though Isle da la Cite (with Nortre Dame, etc), and The Louvre are a good 40-to-60-minute walk. There are restaurants in the immediate area but I wouldn't call the number plentiful. Still, we didn't starve. The only real negatives I can offer is the water pressure in the bathroom (or, as my traveling companion asked "What water pressure? There isn't any!"). It took twice as long to shower because the trickle of water didn't really offer a robust rinsing capability. There was no hotel-wide wireless, so it was possible to use the internet in the Executive Lounge but nowhere else. But, these are small considerations for me. All in all, a good spot to stay. The staff were all wonderful and represent the hotel quite well and offer Stateside Hilton employees a customer-service goal to strive towards. The location, while not perfect, is quite good. And, the rooms offer more space than I expect in Paris. I recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: Traveller257
Reviews.Content: We spent our silver anniversary at this hotel ( and not at George V as everyone suggested) and I have no regrets. From the start we were made to feel very welcome; we were upgraded at nocost to an executive room, presented with champagne and cake and truly made to feel very special. The hotel is fairly central and the staff is willing and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, OK value”
Reviews.Author: mwall722
Reviews.Content: I rarely stay at big name hotels, but I was visiting with friends who chose this place. The hotel was quite fancy, with comfortable rooms including a new flat screen TV, however I was not impressed with the expensive wifi and lack of amenities, although it looks like I may have overlooked a very nice whirlpool, in which case my review would probably have been 5 stars. Location was good, close to the Arc de Triomphe, and within walking distance of all the good sites.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: cardtraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a luxurious hotel just blocks from the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysees. Walk to Boulevard Haussman shopping, the Rue du Fauborg St Honore and dining choices. Excellent breakfast with a wide range of items. Immaculate housekeeping. Caring, accommodating and detail oriented staff from the desk clerks to the concierges and doormen. As a frequent business traveler, this is as good as it gets.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel on the slide”
Reviews.Author: Neilthr
Reviews.Content: Normally I would be giving glowing reports of this hotel. After all it's our favourite hotel to stay at in Paris. It's close to all the attractions we like within walking distances. However on this occasions I was less than pleased with our accommodation and service. On this stay we had pre arranged plans as it was my wife's birthday so our normal room with in either a suit of balcony executive room was not needed. I decided for a normal executive double. This was a dig mistake as we were given a room directly next to the kitchen of the Exec Lounge. I thought that it was an error having a waste food cart left outside my room but this soon became a regular occurance. Added to the noise of the kitchen I was forced to complain. The manager was very apologetic and did offer a replacement room the next day. Another thing we noticed was that the standards we have grown to expect in executive lounge have fallen considerably. What use to be a nice choice of items to select from has reduced to a few meat morsels. Also we found the lounge now closed at 2100hrs instead of 2300hrs. I can only guess this is due to the recession. On our next visit to Paris I will be looking for another hotel as I honestly can't see why I'm paying for a service that is gradually getting worse.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Batroun
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and another couple stayed here for a few days before heading to Provence. We found the location excellent. Near the Arc, perhaps a 10 minute stroll. The hotel had all the amenities and services you would want. Perhaps the only negative was the expense of breakfast. Rather than complain, we considered it an incentive to go out and find a good local breakfast cafe. Having said that, it was an excellent use of Hilton points!

Reviews.Title: “OK but expensive”
Reviews.Author: CorkHibs
Reviews.Content: Plush art deco hotel. Stayed here for a conference. Everything is as you would expect for a grand Hilton but if travelling for pleasure at this cost I would stay in a smaller boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful slice of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveler884
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights and it was charming. Although I had a room that looked out into the interior courtyard and not out to the city...it was charming and cozy. Like all European rooms, you are not going to have tons of room, but the service was excellent, the breakfast was yummy and it was close by to everything. Nothing like a midnight stroll to the Champs. Very romantic.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, posh, expensive!”
Reviews.Author: mrizzo1881
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hilton near the Arc de Triomphe in June 2011. I booked using HHonors points and received an upgrade to a Deluxe King upon check-in. The room was inward facing to a lovely courtyard with lots of greenery! It was a spacious, luxurious room with nice bathrobes and slippers! The hotel has a nice location right near a metro stop and is about 10 minutes walk to teh Arc de Triomphe and the shopping there. However at night the options for restaurants / bars are lacking and is it much better to take a short metro trip to either Montmatre or teh Latin Quater. Montmatre can also be walked to in 30-45 minutes I found! The breakfast is superb with lots of options including freshly made omlettes and even sushi! The bar is also very nice and serves delicious cocktails although expensive at around 15 - 20 euros!

Reviews.Title: “wonderfully big and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Bianca S
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the opulant setting and wonderfull staff, esp Serge you attractive man ... I promised a review ,, here it is you are truly professional and dedicated ... best hotel in Paris? maybe!

Reviews.Title: “Pay a lot for the room and pay some more”
Reviews.Author: Lexrex99
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 1 week ending on Nov 4. The hotel is nice and really well located. The value proposition was destroyed for me by their excessive charge for wifi. I paid 300 euro per night I expect wifi to be included. Instead the hotel charged 8.50 euro per hour for Internet access. Ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Back for the second time”
Reviews.Author: mimainn
Reviews.Content: After two or three years we were back to this hotel, for 3 nights end of October. This hotel is to me a kind of mixture between a high-end luxury (like MO or 4S) hotel and a 'normal' Hilton. The design is truly splendid and the staff very good, especially at the reception / congernie. A small disappointment was that the lounge did not serve Nicolas Feulatte any more but some normal sparkling wine - maybe the champagne has been exploitet too much :-) A bit strange that two times employees entered our room (565) without knocking. They apologized (one time the lady said she was looking for a lost item) but nevertheless should have been more discreet. Alltogether I felt very well there and had a relaxing stay without any problems which is far from guaranteed in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent time and location”
Reviews.Author: michaeledwards7
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice - comfortable rooms, excellent view and friendly and helpful staff. We would definitely stay there again. It is located well - within walking distance of many of the wonderful sites in the city and a short cab ride to virutally anywhere in the city. We had a fantasic time and would recommend it to others. This is a little late for a review as we traveled in July of 2010, but I am sure that nothing has changed.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely celebratory stay!”
Reviews.Author: jill1472
Reviews.Content: We came to stay for 4 nights at the hotel (27-31 Oct 2011) to celebrate my wife's birthday. I am an Hilton Honours card holder and we had booked an Executive Room with American Breakfast and dinner in Le Safran each day at â‚¬550 per night - their mini-break tariff, I believe. Because we were there to have a celebration we were told on arrival that we had been upgraded and we did indeed have a lovely room with a balcony. We had also booked a table in Le Safran Restaurant for 7 on the Saturday night when our family from England flew in to join us for a celebratory dinner after first enjoying some champagne in The Purple Bar where we occupied one of their cozy booths . We had a lovely evening and were well looked after for both our pre-dinner drinks in the bar and during our meal in Le Safran. For-going our normal mini-break menu dinners that we two were entitled to we all ate from the al la carte menu and had a truly delicious meal. We visited the Executive lounge most days for a pre dinner drink, and/or to use the internet but unfortunately due to building works in the kitchen the lounge did not open until 11.00 each day we were there. It is a very welcoming lounge and obviously many Executive Room occupants use it to provide their daily meals using the lovely snacks it serves throughout the day. The staff are a true plus for this hotel as they are magnificent, nothing is too much trouble and every single member of staff you come across in and around the hotel greets you most pleasantly - we cannot speak too highly of them. Only one small minus - we were told that the two vouchers for the set menu mini-break dinners we did not use on the night of our celebrations were not deductable from our very large 4-day restaurant bill but could be use on another visit!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable , but additional services very expensive.”
Reviews.Author: iheani i
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Hilton arc the triomphe from 20/10/11 - 26/10/11 . The facility is really nice and very comfortable . The staff are very helpful and friendly as to be expected at any Hilton . We stayed in a double double executive room on the 5th floor. Executive rooms give you free breakfast and free evening drinks in the executive lounge which is very nice . The gym was well equiped and never really busy . The location of this hotel is great , its a 5 minute walk from the arc de triomphe and champs elysees. Now for the down side . Internet isnt free in this hotel , it costs 22 euros for 24 hours , and if you access it in your room then your restricted to using it in your room only . Also the bar and restaurant are very expensive. Over all we really liked it . Although we think the internet should be free or at least alot cheaper .

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: BabeOnTour
Reviews.Content: I would say that its is very hard to find quite hotel around the champs elysees. It would say it is not far from the champs elysees as it is few blocks away. I would rather walk for few blocks to get a comfortable and quite night sleep in a hotel rather than a very near hotel but no quite night for sleeping in the centre. It is about 5 minutes walk (in fact we enjoy walking as we are curious about the surrounding of the arc de thriomphe or the champs elysees shoping (LV). Anyway, if u tired of walking back to the Hilton hotel, u may take a cab back there which is about 5 earo. So u may stay and dine at the champs elysees and then take a cab back there if u are tire, or else jz walk back which not far at all. There is a metro/RER at the champs elysees i.e. George V (LV) there which it would take u everywhere fore example the disney land or the valee outlet. It is very convenient as long as u understand about the RER. No problem for dining or shopping at all. Recommend to dine at the Leon where u can enjoy the tradition Belgium (Brussel) mussel & fresh brewed bee at champs elysees. It is just around the LV retails, go find it out. The hotel is grant and located at the quite area where u can have a good night sleep. The minor drawback is that there is lack of suis around the bathroom for my hair dryer or clipper. The suis are located at the study desk which is not near the bathroom/ mirror where I can set my hair. Other than that, everything is prefect. I would back to this hotel the next time I travel Paris. I saw other hotel which I did plan to stay before Hilton (same rate or more expensive but slightly nearer to the champs) but luckily I finally booked this hotel which I have no regret. Keep it up ur good work Hilton. I hope it will remaind as good as it is when I return.

Reviews.Title: “Style and Substance”
Reviews.Author: SSAASSHHAA
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable and centrally located hotel. The highlight of this hotel is the the awesomely done styling which brings Art-Deco (and a bit of Secession) to the modern era. The hotel certainly looks the part. Also the staff was extremely helpful and attentive. They earn very high marks. Especially the concierge service that assisted us with dinner reservations every night. The only real complaint is that there is no WiFi in the rooms. There is only a LAN connection offered for 26Euro/day(!). If your devices are only Wireless - then this will be a problem. They actually do offer WiFi in the Lobby - but for 26 Euro/Day! Why somebody would pay 26 Euros for a day of WiFi access in the Lobby is beyond me. Not even an hourly option. I travel a lot on business and I'm used to getting reamed by the better hotels on WiFi - but I thought this was excessive. If you're already behind the times in the rooms - At least offer some free WiFi in the Lobby. This hotel is way too nice to have a remedial issue like this. Once again - big props to the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Spendy, Not-So-Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mandelmart
Reviews.Content: The property is very nice, particularly by Parisian hotel standards, and the staff we encountered were all fantastic. Catherine in guest services made us feel particularly special and welcome. The Executive Lounge was nice respite. I must say, however, that if we had been paying for the room instead of using honors points, we probably would not do it again. While it's more true in Europe than anywhere else that you get what you pay for, we can get by in Paris by paying a lot less. The only other issue is the location. The hotel is in the middle of the 8th Arrondisement, and while there is a metro stop two blocks away, the 8th is just not really convenient to the hot spots of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, just as expected from a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Dagwoods_daughter
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable hotel, everything you would expect from a top-class Hilton. Great location within easy walking distance of the Arc de Triomphe. Will definitely stay there again if visiting Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “There are better choices”
Reviews.Author: MowAlex
Reviews.Content: The hotel is too big and this makes up for most of its problems. Particular issues which I had found unsettling: 1) Line before elevators. There are simply not enough of them to accommodate everyone. No stairs as alternative. 2) Lousy room service. An ironing board stood for 3 days next to the window after we had used it, waiting to be stored back to the closet 3) Unpractical timing for SPA which makes it unusable. Opens too late, closes too early. 4) Fitness room lacks attention. No towels at times and as well as no TV remote. Try to spent 1 hour there with french cartoons at their loudest. I ended up pulling the plug. 5) Slow service at breakfast area at peak times 6) Same for reception 7) Ordered a taxi to CDG at concierge service. It never was ordered, we had to pick up one ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice.....only 1 BIG drawback.”
Reviews.Author: R&G-Opine
Reviews.Content: Excellent room. Terrific Service. Very good location.....BEWARE OF THE BAR! Room: We don't usually care much about room size, but it was very big by Europe Standards. Our particular room had a shower and a bath which was very nice. Bed was very hard, which we find to be typical in Europe. Service: Top notch and very "english speaking friendly". We tried our French, but as soon as it became obvious that we were incapable of communicating in the native language, they launched into excellent English. Really... really good service. Location: Very good. A safe, and quiet neighborhood. We came back late each night and still felt completely safe. A good walk from the main sites, but that's what you are in Paris for...the walks through great areas. Why only 4 stars? I'm still mad about the 13 Euro Beer in the bar. For those of you doing the math that's $18 U.S ...for 1 beer. I asked for a draft beer. Bartender said "large or small?" I of course said large which got me a .5 L (half liter) beer....then the bill came for the 1 beer ...13 EUROS!!!! $18!!!!!!! for a BEER!!!!!! Unacceptable. I could hear Germany laughing hundreds of miles away. In all seriousness, this 1 "gotcha" had me so mad, It practically ruined my opinion of the hotel entirely. Now that time has elapsed, I can say, "Great Hotel, just don't buy a beer at the bar."

Reviews.Title: “Feh, not fantastic, not horrid either”
Reviews.Author: Erik Z
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean, rather small. No bedbugs. Staff was pleasant and helpful. However, 4 of the 5 days I stayed there, there was the smell of raw sewage in the lobby, the other day was a very overpowering chemical odor. Not conducive to eating a meal or grabbing a drink in the bar really. Internet connection scheme was a rather annoying. Pay for a 24/hr access period. For a main line hotel, I would expect that to be covered in the room charge. Especially for business travelers. Wireless was only available in the lobby area, and was a pay for use service as well. Poor form.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with style - very crowded Lounge though”
Reviews.Author: Mikko H
Reviews.Content: Spent two last nights of our honeymoon here. We had booked a Suite with Great Getaway rate. Room was of very nice, decorated with Art Deco style. We had access to Lounge, which was very crowded whole weekend. Lounge servings were good but not fanstastic. Coffee machine was broken for two days. Hotel is 5 min walk to Courcelles metro station and 10 min walk to Arc de Triomphe. Parc Monceau nearby is worth visiting. This was the worst price/quality we had at our honeymoon. However, hotel was very nice and staying at Suite was luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: zorro26
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend beginning of October at this hotel. We liked the nice large and very clean rooms, great service, excellent lounge at the executive floor (even so crowded due to bad weather) and the great location. You are in walking distance to the Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysees. There is a nice little cafe across the street..and we had here the best home made bloc de foie gras. Overall I recommend this property and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, service could be improved”
Reviews.Author: acostin76
Reviews.Content: Pros: The hotel is nice with large rooms for Paris standards. The rooms are modern, with comfortable beds and decent size bathrooms. The bar downstairs is fun and the breakfast at the Executive Lounge was great with a great selection of food. Location is good as well - at about 5 minutes walk from the Champ Elysees. Cons: The service was a bit subpar. The check in lasted for more than 5 minutes and I am a Diamond member and I had a prepaid room. Also, the room was quite cold and the thermostat was not working - I called the reception to send somebody but nobody came. In the morning, the hotel was not able to call taxis and the wait for a cab was almost 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK in Paris”
Reviews.Author: AliDog
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Paris at the end of September and stayed here. The room was clean. The bathroom was clean. Nothing too special here. The breakfast in the morning was something ridiculous like 45 Euros. Really? It really is a turn off when a hotel pulls this. There is a great cafe directly across the street that we ate at instead. There was a horrible stench in the lobby. Every time you would walk through the doors, it would smack you in the face -- like sewage backup. We heard other guests commenting on it too. It was a very strong smell. The concierge was friendly and helpful. I recommend going to JaJa and also Chez Janou for dinner! The concierge recommended (for my husbands birthday) The Berkeley restaurant one night and it is quite possibly one of the worst dinners/dining experiences I have ever had. We let the concierge know when she inquired about it. A perfect opportunity for a customer WOW experience, may have been a coupon (or something similar) for a free glass of champagne (at least) in the hotel bar as an apology and to make up for a birthday dinner in Paris (once in a lifetime) that was horrible. One downfall was that my Clinique facial wash was in the shower and when the cleaning lady cleaned our shower, she threw out my bottle of face wash. It did resemble the freebie tubes of shower gel that the hotel offers - so I can see how a mistake could have been made. I called down to the front desk to report it. She said she would get back to me...and I never received a return phone call or a resolve. Kind of a sour way to end my stay there (and not pleasant to have another 8 days in France without my facewash). . The walls were paper thin. I was kept up one night by the neighbors. Not fun when battling jetlag. Our bed in our room was so comfortable. We wanted to bring it home with us! The hotel bathrooms in the basement (below the lobby) were gorgeous!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious experience, awesome location”
Reviews.Author: Pepromene
Reviews.Content: Really beautiful art deco -style hotel with a grand entrance and spacious, tastefully decorated rooms and very nice bathrooms incl. both bath and shower. Very well located with a 10 minutes easy distance to Arc de Triomphe; near Boulevard Hausmann.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location, small room, wireless sketchy.....busy busy busy”
Reviews.Author: Matthew S
Reviews.Content: Good location for us as we stayed here for 4 days on our points. This is a very busy hotel....about a mile from the Arc. Staff was great, but we got there and were immediately chastised about stealing someone's spot in the honors line as he was attending to something, but not in line. ANYHOW...after this it was better....staff was great, but I can see how they would be a little chippy having to deal with customers with the likes of this gentleman who obviously was talking WAY down to women. We also had to wait for a room and when we went to our first room it was overpowered by the smell of an odor killer because I think someone had smoked in the room......we changed rooms and somehow it didnt seem a surprise. ANYHOW....it was again smoother after this as you have to work out the kinks. Great executive lounge...love the espresso machines. Oh...and the wireless was very sketchy....hit and miss, but worked in the lounge well. If we could have avoided the first hours problems I probably would give 4 1/2 stars. I think everyone did their best....we were amenable and on vacation.....the staff was great.....it was points, not cash......it was Paris......life was and is good.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay on points...”
Reviews.Author: idontlikechina
Reviews.Content: I kept saying that I was sure glad we were staying here on points, as 450 Euro a night they were asking for a basic room here would not have been worth it in my opinion, even though the hotel was very nice, but that's me. Fortunately we were given an upgraded room to an executive floor, overlooking the courtyard. Room was pretty nice and cofortable. They could use outlets on or up near the the night stands though. Nice size flat screen and although they had a few English channels, always could use more, heck, it's a Hilton! Because of HHonors status, received executive lounge access and choice of breakfast in lounge or in restaurant. We did use the lounge for drinks and snacks each nite and the lounge was really nice, OK selection of snacks, wine, liquor, and a few types of beers and juices and stuff. The breakfast in the restaurant was one of the best breakfast buffets I ever endulged in at a hotel. Not sure what it would cost if you had to pay, but it had everything you would ever want for breakfast regardless of where you come from and the quality of the food was outstanding! It was the best part of our hotel stay, escept for the fact that we stayed for free! As others have said, the walk to the Arc de Triomphe is 10-15 minutes, but not too bad, but also not a lot to see between there and the hotel either. And watch out for those idiots pretending to find a gold ring in front of you...my god, we were hit on with that scam at least six times in the two nights we were there and a couple of them happened near the hotel. I am glad I read about that before so we were prepared to immedaitely tell them to get lost. Do they really rake in that much doing that? Overall we had a pleasant stay to wrap up our trip before heading back to the US. If ever in Paris again, I'd probably try to find a hotel closer to the action, but it it is definitely nice having a familiar hotel chain to call home too, assuming I am not paying 500 Euros a night for just a room... It's a nice hotel and if you can swing the cost, stay for free, or get your company to cough up the cost, stay there for a nice Hilton experience "near" the action in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our purposes”
Reviews.Author: abbalish
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 nights at this hotel, which we paid for using Hilton points. The room was more than adequate - we were on the 3rd floor overlooking the courtyard, with a window that actually opened. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom had a separate bath and shower. Typical Hilton toiletries. There was a nice flat-screen TV with plenty of English-speaking channels. We were given access to the executive lounge, which was fabulous - great full breakfast and access to snacks and drinks all day. We also bugged the lounge staff with questions almost every day, and all of them were very helpful - especially Isabelle, who even lent us her own guidebook to use while we were in the area. Concierge was very good as well, from walking us outside and pointing us to the nearest ATM to helping me with my terrible French pronunciations. The location of the hotel is good but not great. It's a solid 10-15 minute walk to the Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysees, which was fine for us but I could see being an issue in worse weather. It's also about a 45-minute walk to the Eiffel Tower and the same to the Louvre, maybe a bit longer. There are a handful of restaurants and cafes that are quite close to the hotel but they seemed to close early, but there were plenty more places a bit further away. We did visit the hotel bar and it was lovely but it seemed a bit overpriced, even for Paris. Honestly, there are certainly hotels with more local flavor but we trust the Hilton brand and since we don't speak French it was really nice to have somewhere we could feel comfortable asking questions, etc. We would definitely return in the future but would probably only pay using points - it would be quite expensive otherwise!

Reviews.Title: “sightseeing trip”
Reviews.Author: Rosaline55
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful, clean and well maintained. Did have to ask for forgotten towels and milk and the dishes were not always washed. Did expect better service for the price. The breakfast was good but the tea and coffee were not very hot and we had to ask for hotter. The beds are very comfortable and the rooms are spacious . We had to wait an hour for our room as there was a mix up with the booking and we were being charged for breakfast when we had paid for bed and breakfast when we booked it. The staff at reception were very nice as was the girl who seated us for breakfast. Did enjoy our stay .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: EstherAlice
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable hotel in a great location. Housekeeping service was slow (had to call several times to remind them of our towel request) but staff were pleasant. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Arc de Triomphe”
Reviews.Author: Galway2006
Reviews.Content: I am a Diamond member with more than 400,000 points in the first 6 months of 2011. I have stayed at many Hilton properties. This one is OK. The room service is terrible. You will likely have to call several times to have your room made up properly (e.g. forgtten towels, coffee, collection of used glasses, etc). The hotel is VERY smelly. Horrendously so. At least on the 3rd floor - there is a sewage smell that is incredibly bad. The bellmen are relatively useless. You need to prod them for assistance. There is no reason to assist. As for the front desk and the executive lounge - the staff in both areas are great. Very accomodating. But that is about it. This is not worth the price. I have been to 41 countries and know the cost of good service. This is not one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Now that's service!”
Reviews.Author: a b
Reviews.Content: I had a horrible stay in NYC at an unmentionable hotel (read my reviews), this hotel reminded me of what professional service is! Used my Hilton Points (although they downgraded me to silver after 5 years of loyal stays!), I was quite impress with the professional demeanors of their staff. From housekeeping to their front desk professionals! Thank you! You ended my long business journey with a positive end!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: norzee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for an anniversary trip with my wife. Used mostly hilton points, and I am diamond, so had access to the executive lounge floor. Staff at hotel made you feel welcome from the first minute there. Tried to check in early, but room not quite ready so they asked us to go up to relax after the long flight in the executive lounge. The service they provide all day long there is excellent, and very convenient for an early breakfast or for snacks after a long day of touring. Wireless internet was free for diamond members in lounge and other public areas, not available in room (was available for a fee). Concierge always very helpful with suggestions for day. Hotel 2 blocks from Metro stop, so it was very convenient to get anywhere in the city relatively quickly. A few kilometer taxi ride took us to the $15 bus service that services Beauvais airport (we were on our way to another city). Hotel is expensive, and maybe there are others in the city that are better value, but I found this Hilton to exceed our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: barryfd
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Paris after staying a total of 11 nights (2 separate visits) at this great Hotel. We had an upgraded room on our first stay with access to the executive lounge. Service and attitude of the entire staff was exceptional, Food/drinks at the Executive lounge was good & great to have after walking around Paris all day, Breakfeast Buffet was great as well. The only thing we cannot comment on is the dinner offered at the hotel as we went to local restaurants.ALthough my French is limited I think every employee at this Hotel spoke english. Nice, relatively quiet location,nice park nearby, easy walk to the Arc de Triomphe & metro.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel name is a bit of a stretch ...”
Reviews.Author: Boeing767
Reviews.Content: The property was fine, clean, relatively friendly and with a decent location. HOWEVER, calling it Arc de Triomphe is a stretch, since the Arc itself is about a ten block walk. Other than that, my only complaint was room size; the hotel is expensive (EVEN for Paris @ 404 Euro/night), and for that we got a magnificent view (Eiffel Tower), and a room about the size of a typical walk-in closet. There was a foyer and a diminutive bathroom. The Executive lounge has a full breakfast daily, and that's a definite plus. The neighborhood feels safe, and walking around ... even at night ... was easy. Be advised that unlike many Hiltons in Europe, this one has NO 110 volt outlets, so bring your adaptor. The taxi from CDG was 40 Euro, and took about 20 minutes. I MIGHT return ... but only on points. Just my 2c.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: easytraveler49
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 8 days in Paris at this property. The location is very convenient to many sites on the right side of the Seine: the Arc, Place de la Concorde, Grand and Petite Palais and Champs Elysee. We had executive lounge access and throughout the week we tried the breakfast, afternon tea and then cocktails. All were satisfying with a good variety of choices available, but the scrambled eggs at breakfast are best avoided. Our room was lovely and not as small as I might have expected, but it wasn't a room for just relaxing in. One of us had to sit on the bed and one in the only easy chair in the room, so we did spend more hotel time in the lounge. Be prepared for a very firm mattress.We experienced some functional difficulties with the room, but it only took one call and everything was straightened out and done with a smile.Several staff members asked how this property compared to others we have visited throughout the world and were sincerely interested in ways to improve. Do be careful about placing calls from the phone in the room; one 3 minute local Paris call to confirm a tour cost us more than 4 euro! We absolutely loved the champagne and Creme de Cassis fixings for Kirs during happy hour. We enjoyed spending the warm evenings out on the balcony in the lounge. Overall a great experience with some topnotch service. Don't miss Parc Monceau which is only a block away. It is such a beautiful park with some interesting sculpture; the chicken sculpture is a hoot!

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, but luxurious stay in the centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: barve
Reviews.Content: This Hilton property is located within 10 mins walk of the Arc de Triomphe and as you can imagine the surrounding area is really nice, though a big quiet. The hotel is expensive, really expensive, but I guess given the city and the location this cannot be helped. For Paris, the room size was quite big and almost comparable to rooms in similar hotels in Asia. The room overlooked an inner courtyard and was very quiet. I was staying in an executive room and therefore had access to the Executive Lounge, with breakfast in the morning and food & drinks all day long. The lounge has a small terrace which was a perfect place to sit for breakfast, given the cool morning weather in Paris. Breakfast was better than the evening fare which was limited to a soup, some snacks, salad, cheese and crackers. Would I stay here again - yes, but only on a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: PeanutInSeattle
Reviews.Content: I recently took my family to Paris and stayed at the Arc de Triomphe. We upgraded to the family size room because of the kids. The hotel was very accommodating, and we had a fabulous time. It's within walking distance of the Champs Elysees and the Arc, of course. We took a tour bus which was recommended by the concierge at the hotel. The yellow bus. You can get a one, two or three day pass. The three day pass includes the boat on the Seine, which is a wonderful experience. I would stay here again. Room service was fast, and there are two supermarkets within a few blocks of the hotel and small food shops too. Restaurants nearby are also quite nice. Bakeries are the best! Paris is wonderful if you are staying at the right location. The hotel had no pool, but there is no time to swim, even for the kids!

Reviews.Title: “Deserves its good rating”
Reviews.Author: LINDTY
Reviews.Content: This Hilton is very well run, and the staff are excellent. Customer manager Quila must be congratulated on her excellent service, not often seen in a European hotel. As a gold honors member we were upgraded to an exec room, with exec lounge access. Our room was large and well equipped. We only eat breakfast in the hotel, which is excellent and with a good choice. There are a few good restaurants, just a short walk away. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Let's just go to Paris for a week”
Reviews.Author: AmherstNY1
Reviews.Content: The art deco design runs throughout this lovely hotel. The service was always beyond friendly and helpful. Our room was well appointed, everything worked as it should. The executive lounge provided a nice respite after a long day of walking in Paris as well as offering a comfortable breakfast each morning. The staff in the lounge were especially helpful and friendly and the expresso was to die for, a full full cup, not the 1/2 oz portion in the US. The hotel is in a quiet area of Paris, about a 5 minute walk to the metro, 10 minutes to the Champs-Elysees. The Purple bar was great to relax in after dinner, the waiter remembered our after dinner drinks each night. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Can walk to main attractions”
Reviews.Author: Philadelphia_PAMissy
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel. The restaurant was good. The hotel was clean. Almost every place you could want to go was within walking distance. The metro stop is close for those places that are further away. We will stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “a fabulous afternoon”
Reviews.Author: Mermoz78
Reviews.Content: We decided to spend an afternoon my daughter and I with a lunch in the Andalusian patio followed by a spa moment at Hilton Ar c de Triomphe. We had a real relaxing time and we have planned to come again!

Reviews.Title: “Our Anniversary/My Birthday Trip to Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Barb K
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and the people are very friendly and helpful. The room was really nice and comfortable. My husband had requested an upgrade when making the reservation and they did not upgrade us to the Executive Level even though we have Diamond Level Status. Did love the Retro feel of the hotel and we received a nice surprise of a mini bottle of champagne and delicious dessert compliments of the hotel for our Anniversary!! It was convenient to a lot of places and close to the Metro (great way to get around the city).

Reviews.Title: “Loads of French Charm and Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: SeattleDowntown
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights on vacation and loved the hotel. This is a Hilton with loads of French charm including this wonderful light show that projects in the inner courtyard on summer nights. Room was immaculate and the service excellent. I ordered room service on several occasions and the food was outstanding as was the delivery time. I paid extra for one of the top floor rooms with a private balcony and it was well worth the money with a wonderful view of the Eiffel Tower and Paris roofscape.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but Where Being a Hilton Diamond Member Means Little”
Reviews.Author: MonGourmet
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed one week using Hilton points. I always stay at Hiltons worldwide and got used to Hilton going above and beyond for a Diamond member. Here we got an average room, no view, not even a welcome note from the manager. We had access to the Excecutive Floor which is very nice, good breakfast. Concierge by the lobby was excellent and always nice and helpful. However getting taxi service from the hotel front door during peak hours is nearly impossible. We highly recomment La Valois, a neighborhood bistro two blocks away. Roasted chicken and Mille-feuilles are excellent. Metro (Courcelles) is 5 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - one of the better ones in Paris”
Reviews.Author: 666-HIM-666
Reviews.Content: I've stayed a number of times in Paris and always been disappointed by small boxy rooms. This hotel I stayed for 4 nights and was very impressed by the room especially with the size! - they've taken time and money to make it look nice, marble bathroom etc. Food from the room service was fantastic! Easily fits a 6ft 2 person in the shower and it's separate from the bath tub. Has a good array of amenities, TV's are new lots of channels (sky sports, bbc etc). It's a safe area and is around 10-15 euros taxi from the Eurostar terminal. Cons (why it didn't get 5*): No wifi - as a business traveler I brought my own long cable so I wasn't tethered to my desk by a 1ft cable. There was an odd smell of sewage when walking into the lobby which lasted all the way to the lifts..kind of odd. Lastly, the location despite being called "Arc de Triomphe" is a walk away from the bustling / touristy area.. that's not a bad thing if you like walking mind.. Although my room nice I don't believe I got a complementary room upgrade being a Hilton gold member simply because my coworker who is not a member got the same style / same floor. Overall, I 100% would stay here again.. if they get it of the feces smell that'd be nice though!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: morris7180
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay here was very comfortable. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We had no problems with communication of English from the front desk staff or concierge. We are honors members so qualified for the free breakfasts each morning. It was a huge spread and something for everyone, however, we were not impressed with the service we recieved any morning we had breakfast in the hotel. Our room was comfortable and beautiful and we had a view of the Eiffel Tower from our side. The hotel is approx. 3 blocks to the metro station and very close to the Arc De Triomphe. We had no trouble getting around Paris to see the sites on our weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could give it an Excellent Rating”
Reviews.Author: Hugh C
Reviews.Content: Stayed here September 14th though 19th 2010. This was the second stop on our month long tour of Europe! The hotel is quite large by Paris standards with large rooms and well appointed marble bathrooms. Our room was an executive room on the top floor with a window overlooking the Eiffel Tower. Overall I found the staff at check in to be quite friendly and helpful. We arrived late in the evening after taking the Eurostar from London and the hotel was quite full but check in was still quick and service with a smile. The gentleman who checked us had some excellent recommendations about what to see during our short trip. Unfortunately our great first impression of the hotel quickly changed when we went upstairs to our room on the second floor. As soon as we got off the elevator there was a desk with a security guard who asked to see inside my moms bag. We let him have a look and went on to our room. Over the next few days we were tortured by the security guard daily. One day we got in the elevator (lift) and we were chased down by the guard and asked to get out of it that it was reserved. He said we could take the stairs! Out came and entire group from there rooms and got in the elevators! I was furious. This happened daily over and over and got worse. One night mom went out looking for the ice machine and he escorted her back to her room and said to not walk down the hallway. I went down to the front desk to talk to someone and told Latifa what was going on. She informed me that the security did not work for the Hilton but rather was private and was for the group on our floor. I was happy that they didn't work for hilton but was a little sad that Hilton allowed this group to have full control of the floor I was on. If they were so important they should have reserved the entire hotel for themselves or at least the entire floor. The evening before we checked I was walking into the hotel and Latifa seen me and called me over to the front desk. She said the assistant manager manager would like to talk to me. He was very polite and apologetic. He explained that I wasn't the only person in the hotel that was having problems and he wanted to let me know that the next time I was in Paris that I would be staying at the Hilton and he would be taking care of the room. He took my contact information and promised to email me after I arrived home. He did not ever email me and sadly after me emailing the hotel and management on several occasions to schedule my trip back, I have never heard back from the Hilton Arc De Triomphe. I wanted to give the hotel a 5 star rating but since I loved the hotel and thought the staff was great but since they didn't ever follow up with having me back as they promised I am a bit disappointed. The hotel itself is fabulous which is why its saddens me that I can not give it an excellent rating

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Friendly, Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: ournames
Reviews.Content: Just spent a wonderful few days in this hotel. Cannot rate the hotel or the staff highly enough. Friendly and welcoming from the time of arrival to departure, nothing is too much trouble, they are always ready to have a friendly chat or help in any way possible. We stayed on the 7th floor with access to the executive lounge and benefitted from the food and drinks available thrioughout the day. Will certainly be returning. Excellent !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for shopping”
Reviews.Author: Canterqueen
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hilton Arc De Triomphe in Paris and it was a short walk to the Champs Elysees. The staff was very polite and helpful, the room clean and quiet. I am a Hilton Diamond member and it was an award stay. We were given no perks, no executive floor, not even a newspaper. Full breakfast was not included and was 33 euro per person. Overall it was an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “STAFF, ROOMS, SERVICE, ALL A1!”
Reviews.Author: Funlovinfella
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very plush and only ten minutes stroll from the Champs Elysees. lovely room, spotlessly clean. A bit pricey but it's Paris! Great view of the Eiffel Tower from our balcony! Executive lounge is very nice! Breakfast was really good! Staff are brilliant! I left my car key in my room and after a phone call and a mad dash by taxi from the station, the concierge was waiting for me with key in hand! He saved the day! 6 Euro taxi ride to Eiffel Tower. 10 minute walk to the Paris tour bus stop. Ideal! Very safe and quiet area! The staff are the main attraction, each and every one of them were friendly and very eager tp please! Fantastic weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Not value for money.”
Reviews.Author: RMJK
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed here for 3 nights and i got the hotel through a corporate rate that was lower than their rack rate. To be honest, we were expecting a lot more a 'Hilton' and were a bit dis-appointed that it didnt meet our expectations. To begin with the positives: - the reception and concierge are very polite and helpful. - the hotel is on a quite street, away from the noise and activity. - the room, while small, is functional and has all the basic amenities that one could ask for. - the bathrooms are small but clean. The dis-appintements were as follows: - the hotel is not very close to the acivities as it makes it sound. Champs is about 12-15 mins walk and the Arc is also the same distance. The metro is about 7 mins walk away. - the hotel has absolutely no neighbourhood. we had a room overlooking a construction site and very depressing and cold. - there are hardly any cafes or restaurants around, so the place is very lonely at night. - the lobby was always full of people, with lot of activity and the hotel somehow lost its charm because of that. - the floors have numerous rooms and we got one that was at one end of the floor. The walk from the lift to the hotel by itself was 3 mins! and the walls of the corridor looked outdated and tired. - the hotel exterior too needs a make-over as it is very tired-looking. - the hotel has NO wi-fi in the rooms. The only wifi available is in the lobby. - we needed to contact the front desk for some info and it took us 25 mins to finally reach someone on the phone. No one seemed to pick up the phone. Overall, we didnt get a 'Hilton' feel in this hotel. Next time, we are planning to stay in another hotel that is possibly between Champs, the grand palace and the louvre.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected garden of beauty in busy Paris”
Reviews.Author: asnerek
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to so many top sights in Paris, but the best part is it's proximity to the parc Monceau, rue de Levis with its wonderful market stalls and restaurants. The inner courtyard garden and restaurant at the hotel is just wonderful after a long day of sightseeing. The decoration is lovely and the rooms well equipped as one would expect from a Hilton. We enjoyed all our meals and the service was excellent. Stay here, you will not regret it!

Reviews.Title: “What more could you ask for?!”
Reviews.Author: Lucy9252009
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay (3 years in a row) at this hotel and we can't wait to go back again! If you are looking for impeccable, friendly service - this is the place to go. From the moment you check in you feel welcome and that the staff really wants you to enjoy your stay. Every single staff member goes above and beyond what is required, whether it is the concierge desk, the maids or the doormen! We have stayed on the 7th floor - last time we overlooked the interior courtyard and this time we were in the opposite side with a balcony and overlooked the outside courtyard. Some people have complained the room is too small or lacking imagination in the decor. The room is very comfortable with adequate space for relaxing or working at the desk. the decor is art deco and very attune with being in Paris. Everything is in excellent condition! We celebrated our anniversary while we were there and the hotel had champagne, fresh flowers and a delectable treat waiting or us upon our arrival. Being a Hilton Diamond member we had access to the Executive Lounge. We have traveled extensively and this lounge is first class. Again the service can't be beat - whether you want directions, recommendations or just want to chit chat about your day, the staff in the Executive Lounge is there for you. The lounge never closes between 7am and 11pm - they change their offerings on a daily schedule and it is almost transparent to you. The lounge is spacious and comfortable and we sent many hours just relaxing there. the only complaint we have is that on previous visits there were no children allowed in the 7th floor lounge; instead they used a family lounge. This time there were several children there and unfortunately they were often running around and noisy with no supervision from their obviously oblivious parents. But that is our only complaint. Although the offerings in the lounge are not meant to feed you like a restaurant at every setting, there is always something for everyone and drinks of all kinds are always available. We love the location because it offers you a quiet retreat from the hustle and bustle of the rest of Paris. But you are close enough to walk to many things and you are a mere 5 to 10 minute walk from the Courcelles Metro #2 line that will take you anywhere you want to go! We feel you couldn't ask for more from a hotel!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: Croxford64
Reviews.Content: I paid for two nights with points so the cost was fine, but supposedly the published rate was anywhere from 500 to 100 euros a night. For that price, definately not worth it. If you can get it a decent rate, go for it. Otherwise I would look for more reasonable alternatives. One very large positive is that the room can handle 2 adults and 2 children up to the age of 18, which is not always the case in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Great business and family hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rbs7562
Reviews.Content: We are a Hilton Honors member and the club there was incredible. The concierge arranged tours, restaurant reservations and the staff provided us with everything we needed. Quiet neighborhood, full service, first class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel Near Arc de Triomphe”
Reviews.Author: FigPow
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Hilton Arc de Triomphe for two nights in late August 2011. We travelled to the hotel via metro after travelling to Paris on the Eurostar from London. The hotel is situated a 5 minute walk from the metro Courcelles or a 15 minute walk to the metro Charles-de-Galle Etoile. Whether you decide to get to thehotel on the metro or by taxi, it is easy to find. The hotel lobby is beautifully decorated with a large, comfortable seating area which many guests used espcially in the evening to socialise with one another. The hotel staff were very pleasant and helpful. Our room was on the 4th floor with a view of the centre courtyard which was nicely maintained. Again the decor in our room was very nice and it was very clean. Overall I would say that the Hilton Arc de Triomphe is an extremely nice hotel, conveniently situated within a 15 minute walk to the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs de Elysee.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with Hotel”
Reviews.Author: llfoster
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for only 1 night at the end of August. Despite the fact that our stay was short, I was very pleasantly surprised by the service we received. Prior to our visit, I had emailed the hotel a couple of times with questions. Each time the hotel's response was quite prompt and very helpful. The Executive Club was wonderful - a nice selection of good food/snacks (hot and cold) and at cocktail time there were 3-4 bottles of champagne on ice. The executive lounge had a nice balcony overlooking a quiet side street. The room and bathroom were clean and elegant looking. The location requires a tad of a walk to various sites. The only downside to our stay was that the carpeting in the hallway was being ripped up in the AM and made quite a bit of noise/unable to sleep - guess we just were unlucky as to our room assignment! The concierge was helpful with a dinner recommendation that was delightful.

Reviews.Title: “This was AWESOME!!”
Reviews.Author: Ian_Boss
Reviews.Content: It was great. and even better, because my dad is a hilton honors member, so we had access to the executive lounge! you should get the executive lounge!

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jillstravel
Reviews.Content: Good location and super hotel!!! We could walk to many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Clean and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: marena1993
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel for it's location and the staff. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the staff were extremely helpful. Don't stay here if you want a view, it is in a quiet little area right near Park Monceau (which we loved) and a few blocks from a metro station so you can hop right on and get to where you need to be. The bar is very pricey for drinks but the staff can recommend local bars that are quaint and fun for a drink or a small bite late at night. Would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel but quite expesive”
Reviews.Author: Teddy-Chris
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights with family at Hilton Arc De Thriomphe. It is a really nice hotel. It could even be a 5* hotel. The facilities ar great, the staff is very helpful and the rooms are very comfortable. The only downside is that the prices at the hotel. brekfast (if not included), room service and spa facilities are expensive compared to hotels in London or other European countries. There is nothing for children to do in the hotel or anywhere near. So do not be looking at a kids club or something like that. There is however a parc near by ( Park Monceau) for pic nics if the weather is good. Overall if you are not on a budget this hotel is really nice and I highly recommend it !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Paris for Christmas and New Year”
Reviews.Author: JMA814
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on Hilton points and because of diamond membership we got the Exec Lounge access. The lounge had a great selection of food and champagne and wines. It was a great place to start the day with a good breakfast and a nice end to the day with a glass of wine. The room was bigger than the usual European hotel rooms and even bigger than most American hotel rooms. The staff was wonderful. The location was great. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “As advertised”
Reviews.Author: Domer130
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights here as part of our 20th anniversary. We found the staff welcoming, helpful and courteous. Location is a bit off but within walkable distance to two metro stations and these connect to all the major attractions including shopping areas. Overall, enjoyed the hospitality at this Hilton. Thank you to Pierre and others at the front desk for making our stay memorable.

Reviews.Title: “It could not have been better!”
Reviews.Author: 2HappyTravelers2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed 9 nights at the Arc Hilton in late August for our third trip to Paris in five years. And, when we say it could not have been better, it's not an exaggeration. The check-in was so friendly and helpful - from changing money, getting us maps and giving us advice to the little extras they gave us throughout the days. Because of our Hilton status we got a king room with a balcony and executive lounge access - which was wonderful. We were surprised and delighted with flowers and other small gifts delivered to our room. What made it really special though, was the attention given to us by the staff, at the front desk, in guest relations, concierge and in the lounge. Two standouts in staffing were Isobel and Lila and especially the housekeeping staff who cleaned the room each day to perfection. We had read all the other reviews before we went... And, it is truly located less than a 10 minute walk to the Arc, subway and a most beautiful park - Parc Monceau. Please believe us - mature travelers - who have been to many great hotels, you will be pleased. We highly recommend it and will gladly go back to this hotel. on't be disappointed. Guest Relations Manager Quila Hingrai deserves special applause for a well-run hotel and exceptional service and staff!

Reviews.Title: “close to champs elysees and that is all its value”
Reviews.Author: msaylan
Reviews.Content: I do not think that the money you spent is worth to money you spent for being close to Champs Elysees. Not anything particular to be in Hliton.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms and good service”
Reviews.Author: DrDrinu
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hilton hotel during a conference. Beautiful rooms with nice marble bathroom. Good service with a very good breakfast. Sadly no views and dull part of Paris away from the hustle and bustle of the rest of Paris, on the other hand just a 5 minute walk to arc de triomphe. My room 166 unfortunately seemed to have a service room just above and could hear footsteps and banging all through the day and evening.

Reviews.Title: “Period hotel, more charm than most Hiltons, but overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: ehbien
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on points, but going rate was around 425 euro for an executive room. The room was your typical smallish Parisien hotel. It was spotless and fresh linens ironed with lavender- very nice. The bath was marble with period sink and shower, but shower was spacious. Nice robes and slippers waiting for us. The beds were hard, as seems typical in Paris, but not as bad as Le Meridien Montparnasse of a few years ago. We only stayed two nights and were on our way to Bordeaux, so we did not dine in hotel. The area was okay, but not my first choice in Paris. Ten minutes to Champs Ã‰lysÃ©es and arc. But the surrounding area was mostly consulates, business like, not your charming 6eme or 5eme area. But it was free so we thought we'd give it a try. The service was fabulous. I speak French and had no problems. Hubby does a great pantomime routine with some Spanglish that caused some chuckles, but the staff was very gracious. I would say not stay in this area if this is your first visit to Paris- you'd be dissappointed in the area. While certainly very safe, it's not your stereotypical idea of Paris. There were a few local food stores, a few cafes, but other than Parc Monceau and proximity to the Arc, it was forgettable. The Champs Ã©lysÃ©es is close but not a draw for me. It had a charming original looking

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: hulahunny
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because we were using Hilton Honors points and the options available for Hilton in Paris are very limited. We used to stay at the Hilton Eiffel Park Hotel, however, that is no longer a Hilton property. We were very disappointed to be at a different hotel, but felt comfortable at this property based on the reviews. We arrived at the hotel prior to check in, yet they had our rooms ready and available for us. Since we had two teenagers with us needed two rooms. We were given adjoining rooms, one with a king bed and one with two double beds. The rooms were decorated in the very chic look of the art deco period. The rooms were pretty small and since we were not upgraded due to our Diamond status because of the adjoining rooms, I don't know if rooms on higher floors are more spacious. There was ample closet space and storage space despite the small room size. One thing we noticed was that there were inconsistencies in the rooms. For example, one room had a tea pot and service the other did not. One room had a safe, the other did not. I am sure that both rooms can be independently rented without having to have adjoining guests, so it seemed odd that the items were hit or miss. We had executive lounge access, however, during our stay, the lounge was closed for remodeling so there was a family lounge that we could use. This was actually a good idea and something I have never seen before. In this lounge, there were video games and a large play area for families traveling with kids. I would guess this is handy when adults traveling alone are in the lounge and don't want to be distracted by rambunctious children. The downside is that the lounge was filled to capacity each morning so we opted to eat in the restaurant. Good choice. The restaurant has an excellent morning buffet. My daughter loved the crepes with chocolate sauce pain au chocolate. This made it easier to get her up in the morning knowing that there was a sumptuous breakfast waiting for her. The hotel front desk staff was very helpful and friendly. The hotel is located within two blocks of a Metro Station and is about a ten to fifteen minute walk to the Arc de Triomphe where you can pick up the Metro or RER. There are a few markets close by to get drinks or snacks if you don't have lounge access as well. Although we were disappointed that the other Hilton had closed, we were very happy with this property and will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel for a romantic break.”
Reviews.Author: MomDawn
Reviews.Content: The staff were our first contact and the guy who dealt with us was excellent. Our room had no view but was very comfortable. Quite rooms, comfortable bed and good fascilities.Well placed to walk down to the Arc De Triomphe and stroll along the Champs Elysee. The concierge got us tickets for the Musee De Orcy but the queues were too long for the Louvre. On the way down were lots of little cafes to get a breakfast omlette and a good cup of coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel - Exceptional Experience”
Reviews.Author: webgrease
Reviews.Content: I always use this site to research hotels and restaruants in advance, however I've never actually left a review. Based on the experiences of our last trip, I decided it was time to give back. We planned an elopment in Paris and based on the reviews of this site decided to stay at this hotel. It's a difficult thing to gauge - trying to decipher completely opposing reviews and decided which is correct. We took a leap of faith and decided to book for 5 nights (using points). And it's a great thing we did! I contacted the hotel in advance to get clarification on some of the issues in previous reviews I had seen, which were all addressed. I am Gold with Hilton, and while that doesn't gaurantee room upgrades or access to the exeutive lounge based on the large number of Diamonds in the world, we did in fact get a room upgrade and access to the lounge. The room was absolutely fantastic! It was the last room at the end of the hall on the front side of the hotel, top floor, and according to the diagram on the backside of the door, it was 1.5 times the size of other rooms. In addition, it had a HUGE balcony that was larger than the width of our room, complete with a 4 seat table and chairs! The room was spotless and quite large. Firm king bed, a couch, coffee table and two chairs, and a desk. Shortly after we arrived, a large flower arrangement was delivered to our room from the hotel to congratulate us for our wedding/honeymoon! It was such a thoughtful gesture. Then after we went out to explore the first day, we came back to a bottle of champagne and a beautiful dessert in the room! This place really knows how to make you feel special! The location of this place is PERFECT! We were within easy walking distance to at least 6 metro stations, and it was an easy walk to Champs Elysees the Arc de Triomphe. In regards to other reviews talking about walking distance... I am a 30-something, lazy, somewhat overweight American and I walked back to the hotel from Notre Dame (check a map). So anyone between 12 - 60+ years old that have no physical impediments should have no problem walking at the very least to the nearby metro stations. The executive lounge was being renovated so it was temporarily relocated to the first floor. This was probably better as the room was huge! We definitely used the lounge daily. Would I stay here again in the future? Absolutely - wouldn't think twice about it.

Reviews.Title: “Well run Hilton”
Reviews.Author: LiamBuckley
Reviews.Content: This is a well run Hilton and as long as you know what to expect from Hilton (in cities typically business hotels) then you will not be disappointed. Prior to writing this review I read some other reviews and one in particular struck me as down to expectations. The reviewer referenced "executive" and "deluxe" and I have to agree with him that those words are banded around all to easily. I think the best description of this hotel would be efficient and well run with business visitors front and foremost. The hotel has 463 rooms so any ideas of exclusivity or luxury should be done away with. Demand for services is high and in my opinion the hotel does well in handling the volume of guests that it handles. The foyer and and public rooms are very nicely decorated - oppulent comes to mind. The rooms are what you would expect from a Hilton - reasonably appointed with all the necessary fixtures, fittings and well managed by a competent housekeeping staff including a full turndown service. If you are looking for a romantic 5 star place - this is not it. If it a decent well run hotel in a good location you need this is a candidate. During our stay the concierge lounge was being refurbished and was located in a conference room on the ground floor. A previous reviewer referred to it as a cafeteria, I think that is a little harsh. It is open from 7-11 and seated about 50 people, we had breakfast there every morning and considering the volume of people using it I think they did an exceptional job in keeping it stocked. Hot items available, freshly squeezed orange juice, smoked salmon, range of pastries, etc etc. I think it was very well done - the room was not the greatest but it was fine. Lunch, afternoon cakes and evening snacks are also available. If you are paying for all this I can understand that this would not be to expectations - but as a Hilton property anyone that is a Gold or Diamond member has access to this room - Paris is #1 city destination in the world and, like me, a lot of Hilton regulars use their points to go to Paris so demand for this kind of service is going to be high. We ate one evening in the restaurant and it was excellent - despite a mix up on the order the food was excellent as was the friendly service - do not over look this if you want a relaxing dinner. The concierge recommended 2 restaurants for us - both were excellent. Always taxis available and help with bags etc. All in all a well run hilton, big but abale to cope with the high demand.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: ItalianTravelerLargo
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Hilton Arc de Triomphe in Paris went above and beyond to make our stay extra special. All staff were very friendly, spoke English and were very helpful in assisting us with all questions and transportation arrangements. The services received in the Executive Lounge were the best we have ever received in any Hilton chain.....and we stay at Hiltons quite frequently. The breakfast served is much more than the normal Continental breakfast. Snacks, including hot food are available most of the day. Alcohol is included in the evenings. The metro is two blocks away as well as a grocery store where you can purchase items for a picnic at Parc de Monceau, which is very close to the hotel. The metro is very easy to navigate. This hotel is centrally located to get to all tourist attractions, but far enough away to get a real feel of Paris neighborhoods. Thank you Hilton Arc de Triomphe for making our first trip to Paris very special. We will definitely stay again when we come back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A very very expensive dissapointment”
Reviews.Author: RoyScat
Reviews.Content: After re-reading the reviews I had to check that we'd stayed at the same hotel... Long story short ... we should have celebrated our 25th Wedding Anniversary in the Maldives...first grandchild due week of anniversary, arrives early, book trip to Paris. Read all reviews and get a great deal though Expedia for a DeLuxe Executive plus room, decided to splash the cash as it was our Silver Wedding. Included was Breakfast, access to the Executive Lounge on the 6th floor with views of Paris and the room had a balcony, maybe with a view of the tower. I'd e-mailed to hotel hoping for a room with a view of the tower given our 25th, told may not be possible as rooms are at a premium, no problem, worth trying. On arrival we learnt that the 6th floor executive lounge was being refurbished and now on the ground floor, the executive lounge turned out to be a large conference room with a large tv, two armchairs and a sofa in one corner and a lot of tables set out in rows. I equated it with an upmarket staff canteen. There were a lot of families staying there using these facilities which made it appear more like a all inclusive holiday hotel. Instead of the views of Paris we got a view of the net curtains onto the corrider. On the second day of our stay the lounge was closed for the afternoon while they relocated the lounge to a conference room a third of the size of the previous one. We used the lounge a total of three times during our 5 day stay, choosing to take our breakfast in the lovely restaurant. I was at least expecting our DeLuxe Executive bedroom to blow us away, to say we were underwhelmed would be a understatement. The room had nothing that we had had before in rooms costing a third of what we had paid for this, the bed was very large and comfortable but in order to access the "balcony" required moving the table and chair !, making sure not to clatter into the standard lamp at the side. On accessing the Balcony we were struck by the views which this afforded us, around 50 metres across the garden courtyard stood an office block, we could see them working and if not having the curtain drawn they could see into our room. I have a problem with what the hotels definition of the word balcony is. The "balcony " was no more than 5 x 4 feet square, there was no furniture on the balcony, probably due to the fact that there was no room to put it, with my wife and myself stood there there was no more room. I would describe the area more of a large ledge, from which given the problems we had getting here and the subsequent disappointment was tempted to jump !!!. So all in all we were really disappointed with what in our world was an extraordinary amount of money for, I clearly have a different definition of the words "Executive ", "DeLuxe" and "Balcony", when booking a DeLuxe Exective room I expect something extraordinary, not something ordinary which is what we recieved. To top it all, given that I had told the hotel the we were celebrating our Silver Wedding on the 16th, I obviously naively expected, maybe a bunch of flowers, chocolates or at least a half bottle of their cheapest plonk, what we got was nothing, given our experience so far I should not have been surprised. The best things about the hotel are the public areas, which are very sumptuous and elegant. The breakfast was brilliant, the choice was extraordinary. I had a word with one of the concierges for recommendations for a nice Bistro in which to spend our Anniversary evening.
