He recommended Andre Allard in the St Germain district and made the booking for us, we had a fabulous evening there for which I have left a review. The hotel is in a quiet area, around ten minutes walk from the Arc, the Parc Monceau nearby is a very nice place to take a stroll in the evening. I am not in the habit of leaving negative reviews as a look at my previous reviews will attest, I did e-mail the hotel with my concerns a few days ago, giving them time to reply before posting this review, up to now I've heard nothing from them, perhaps I will now ?.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: mak195
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel. The service was prompt and friendly. The hotel and rooms are beautifully decorated in an art deco style similar to old cruise liners. The location is perfect for the Etoile and within easy walking distance of most sights. Would return to this hotel when visiting Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Solid & Safe Choice”
Reviews.Author: mjc0896
Reviews.Content: Used points for a very nice double overlooking the street and as a Gold member thoroughly enjoyed the free breakfast in the morning and snacks/beverages throughout the day. Stephan at check in was very nice and helpful and the staff as a whole was extremely friendly- no complaints anywhere. Worth buying Louvre tickets at the concierge vs waiting in line at the musuem. Used L'Open tour bus to get around to major sites and rest of the time took a taxi to Eiffel (6 Euros) or Sacre Coeur (12 Euros) and didn't even bother with the metro. Recommend the show at Moulin Rouge and the guided tour to Versailles-both booked thru concierge. Took a Seine cruise which was great and overall thought Paris was a great city to explore. Bought a couple of Louis Vuitton purses at their store nearby and after comparing to US cost was still a savings even with exchange rate and getting the VAT refund

Reviews.Title: “Guest loyality recognition”
Reviews.Author: Zurich
Reviews.Content: There are many things I really liked about this hotel. Location - a central location in Paris might be next to Notre Dame. This hotel is not in the geopgraphical centre, but it is in a very nice neighborhood, clean, quiet. Rooms - we had a King Deluxe Plus overlooking the patio. A beuatifully furnished and well equipped room (and bathroom). Overlooking the patio allowed us to have windows open all night (for me a prerequisite for a good night's sleep) Breakfast - well organised, good choices. Public transport - one metro stop ("Courcelles") within 5' walking distance or even less, bus stop in same direction and distance, metro hub "Etoile" (Arc de Triomphe) 10' of pleasant(!) walking, alternative metro stop between 5-10' walking (did not use it), air port shuttles (operated by Air France) behind Arc de Triomphe) Having said that, my issue is the way my loyalty with Hilton (Gold status) has or has not been recognised. These expectations are based on Hiltons' own regulation and they always depend on the hotel managers' discretion. This is all well known to me. I received what I had booked and have been happy with it: a King Deluxe Plus, breakfast included. At check-in I was told I was upgraded to a King Deluxe Plus and breakfast is complimentary. In the room, a greeting and a small chocolate gift was deposited. The daily news-paper, promised at check-in, was not delivered at all. Since Executive Rooms were unavailable, and no alternative room upgrade was at hand, since breakfast was already included in the rate, I really wondered what would be the perk for Gold members. I tried to find out the other day at reception and received a rather blunt answer. The receptionist told that she had to reassure with guest relations first. I suggested a bottle of wine or champagne. Indeed, at night we found 1/2 bottle of champagne and a (decent) chocolate gift. I simply do not understand how this property acts below standards they are obliged to follow. I wrote this down at the guest comment card. At check-out I spoke to a different receptionist who agreed that this should not happen. He said he would follow up with this. Yet, I did not receive any reply from management. Other reviewers had successfully acknowledged their Gold or Diamond status. Maybe I simply had some bad luck here. Not a big issue, to some fellow travelers this might look like nagging. For me, this is like a promise (Hilton Guest Loyalty Program) not kept.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, loved the lounge”
Reviews.Author: ReginaH
Reviews.Content: Used points to stay here with my husband and adult son. Booked a double double executive. Room and bath size fine by European standards. Room was ready when we got there. Lounge was in conference room on first floor and was wonderful, open all day, great breakfast and snacks. Free liquor. So nice to go to after walking around Paris all day. Short walk to Arc. Very quiet neighborhood. Staff were very nice, no problems at all. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jhbunny
Reviews.Content: Wonderful service and beatiful rooms. We got upgraded to a suite and the rooms was wonderfully furnished. Bathrooms were marble. The hotel had a great breakfast and a wonderful lounge with free snacks and drinks. The hotel is a few subway stops from the major atttractions, but walking distance to the arc and the main shopping district. We loved staying here.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Hiltons we ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: NemuriCat
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, helpful staff, great room. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: 3away
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel and it is by far one of the best Hilton's on the continent in Europe that we have stayed at so far. Staff are friendly and very helpful, they presented our 8 year old daughter with a welcome gift to make her feel special and it had all of the facilities that you would expect of a hotel of this standard. Their buffet breakfast is out of this world with so much choice! Rooms are spacious and very clean. All in all it made for a relaxing stay. The executive lounge if you choose that option has a good selection of snacks and drinks to enjoy and is located on one of the higher floors. The hotel is located near a nice park with swings if you are travelling with children (it is through a gated area that houses old mansions and a school on the opposite side of the street and only about 2 mins walk from the hotel). It is about a 10 min walk to the Arc de Triomphe and all that the Champs Elysee has to offer. In the other direction you have Galleries Lafeyette and lots of little cafe's to explore. We highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Would Return”
Reviews.Author: charli3601
Reviews.Content: Got here a bit before the room was ready so we waited in the lounge. Stayed here using points and got a nice room, but it was not an upgrade. Room was small but fine for two people and bathroom was very nice with separate tub and shower. I did not personally find the bed comfortable. The location is in a quiet area but we walked everywhere and it was always an enjoyable, albeit longer, walk. Had free breakfast due to Hilton status and it was a very good breakfast with good service. Concierge lounge did not allow you to take any food or beverages from the lounge back to the room and this rule was strictly enforced with staff confronting guests in the elevator. Just an odd rule to begin with in my opinion. Overall, I'd try another location that is a bit closer to everything next time but would certainly consider returning in the future nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “BIG BIG Disappointment!!!”
Reviews.Author: AlexdeB_11
Reviews.Content: Our Paris trip was in part spoiled because of this Hotel. We arrived with children after a very long flight and none of our rooms where ready, and had to wait a few hours even though we had requested rooms by 3:00 pm. Next day we over slept because of jet lag and went down for breakfast 15 minutes before closure, even though we where with 4 children ages 1 to 6 they didn't want to serve us. The other days the service was very obnoxious, making remarks everytime you asked for something. But the worst part was the smell, the lobby and elevators had a horrible sewer smell. The only thing that this hotel has is location , but I will never come back nor recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel”
Reviews.Author: Neilthr
Reviews.Content: This is our 7th stay at this hotel and find it ideal for everything we need. The hotel is very well maintained and the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. We tend to stay on the executive floor and the lounge is a treat. It's well worth the little extra as it gives you a cozy place to sit and relax away from your room. The food and drinks provided are always good quality. The hotel itself is situated close Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Ã‰lysÃ©es that makes getting around extremely. I have booked another stay here and looking forward to..

Reviews.Title: “Expectations were higher for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: B P
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights using points [50k a night]. Since we were three adults, got a Double Double room which as far as I could tell was the same size as a normal room only with two doubles. Room was pretty good, bathroom nice with marble or granite features but nothing too grand for what I expected, just your average hilton but at 50k points a night :-( Some things to note which did not sit well for us... 1. Our room was awesome to have a direct view of the Eiffel Tower in the distance, however below it was a construction site where workers commenced operations very early in the morning. Jack-hammering was not in tune with my sleeping. I don't remember seeing on the hotels website that these works were going on [although I could have missed it]. 2. We reported that our TV would loose its reception on average ever 10 mins [some times every 2 mins] for 3-4 secs at a time, making it a real pain in the *** to watch TV broadcasts. They sent an Engineer to look at it and he said would contact an external provider or something but never heard back and it was never fixed. I again advised the checkout person at reception and he just laughed when i told him our TV never got fixed [I am not joking he laughed]! 3. Being a room of three adults, I would have expected three of everything [ie towels, drinking mugs, slippers etc]. On each day we had to prompt them to bring the extra items, I was getting sick of having to call them, and having to call different departments sometimes, as one person should have taken care of it all. That is what I would expect for a five star hotel. 4. Wi-fi was not available in the hotel despite the brochure saying it was. Other internet was at a fee in the room [direct cable connection]. I wish the large hotel chains would stop trying to squeeze every $ out of its guests and charge for nearly every service. Internet should be free and unlimited for all hotel guests. Our previous hotel in Roma had it for free even in the rooms so that was great!! 5. Dark stains on the carpet made the room feel a bit dirty, however the beds were crisp and clean. and 6. Upon checkout, we were hit with a parking bill of something like 30 Euros [can't remember exact amount]. We never hired a car in Paris so laughed at this. I wonder if they throw on random charges with the hope some may stick with the customer accepting the charge. They also forced us to sign that this charge was not related to us. I fail to see why we should sign anything when it was the Hotels fault and seemingly a random charge. Room service was expensive and so was breakfast so we never tried any of the hotels food, which is a shame as the hilton food is usually pretty good. It really does upset me when alot of $$$ [or points] are spent on 5 star hotels just to get you in the door, and then you are greeted with very expensive room service charges. But that is how it seems to be in most places, I wish they would subsidise the food to an extent [ok I will stop dreaming ^_^]. Overall, a very average stay at such an expensive hotel, other hilton stays have been much better. I will be moving away from the hilton hotels, i find they are not worth the money anymore!

Reviews.Title: “Very Gracious and Acommodating”
Reviews.Author: 54famly
Reviews.Content: We are on week 3 of a European adventure that culminates with 5 nights at the Hilton - Arc du Triomph - in Paris. After checking in on 8/14 and 2 nights into our experience, it has been stellar. The staff, accomodations and amenities have been outstanding. We are Hilton Honors Gold Members and recieved access to the Executive Lounge. We were told that the normal lounge on the 6th floor is being remodeled, so they have set up a temporary space on the ground floor. While it may not be as luxurious and relaxing as other venues in the Hilton portfolio, it is nice, adequate and the attention by staff certainly offsets any shortconings of the venue. The snacks and refreshments are nice and, as stated, the staff is very attentive. After 14 days travelling, we sense the respect and admiration from the Hiilton organization. We are loyal Hilton customers and they certainly reciprocate and show their appreciation. The rooms are art deco style and nicely appointed. We were upgraded to a 2-room suite which gives us plenty of room to stretch out and relax. This is a very nice culmination to our adventure. Thank you Hilton and the Hlton staff!

Reviews.Title: “A great disappointment in many respects”
Reviews.Author: tandys_trainer
Reviews.Content: We came here as part of an Adventures by Disney tour (which was wonderful, by the way). We'd just come from the London Chancery Court, and I did a gushing review of that place--elegant, spacious, gracious. The Hilton Arc de Triomphe was none of those things. The rooms were cramped--even the bathrooms were crowded with just one person in them. Showering required acrobatic feats, and the only way to stand under the small trickle of warm water was to have the faucet jammed into your calf. The lamp cord was wrapped onto the corner of the bed, and the lamp actually fell onto me in the middle of the night. The phone rang at 3 in the morning by accident. The printer in the business office wasn't working, making the printing out of boarding passes a real problem. The front desk staff were snotty and arrogant about any guest complaints. They really projected the attitude, "we have your money already, we don't care." The food (breakfasts ) were good (they would have been terribly overpriced, but were included in our package). The towels and robes were nice. The lobby and restaurant are decorated in lovely fashion. As others have mentioned, the hotel is INCREDIBLY STINGY about internet service. Even if you are silver elite Hilton, you get not even ONE free hour of internet connection. That will cost you 9 euro---about what you would pay in the US for 24 hours. This, after you've paid about $500 a night for a room 1/2 the size of what you might get at a Holiday inn in the states. I'll be writing a letter of complaint about this facility to Hilton and to Disney---it was a real let down and source of frustration to what was otherwise a magical trip. This facility just isn't up to the usual Hilton standards (e.g., Boston Logan Airport, Philadelphia at U Penn, Washington DC). I have never been to Paris before, but I cannot imagine that it would be impossible to find a more gracious and spacious facility, especially for the money we spent..

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience - highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Alexander Z
Reviews.Content: We planned to spend the last night of the year in the hotel and it was amazing. The hotel had an option for a special Dinner with life music and a very special dinner. Food was excellent. Hotel overall is in a very modern style, you can see that it is one of the first class hotels of Paris and amazingly well maintained. Staff is excellent. If you want to invest money for a special occasion I can highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: juliemarie08
Reviews.Content: We are part of the Hilton Honors Program and stayed here using points. We LOVED this hotel and the staff could not have been more professional. This is the bar to which all hotels should strive. We had access to the Executive Lounge and at all times it was beautifully stocked. The concierge made great dinner recommendations and reservations and we were never disappointed. Our room was well appointed and quiet large by european standards. We would definitely return. Thank you Hilton for such a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great location”
Reviews.Author: SSfamily
Reviews.Content: A small Hilton with a great location near the Arc. It is Art Deco decor and very nice not to mention expensive. Not far from the Metro. Great breakfast but then agauin being in Paris the food is always great. I think I gained 10 pounds!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with wonderful service in a great location”
Reviews.Author: missgrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our two children (9 and 11) during a European vacation. The hotel is everything you would expect from a luxury property. The rooms were spacious and well-appointed. The concierge staff was extremely helpful and patient, taking plenty of time to guide us to interesting sites and good restaurants, and making reservations when necessary - they became trusted advisors! The location is near Paris' "embassy row" and there are plenty of dining options as well as a few nearby Metro stops. I have heard that this is not the best location to stay in for touring the city but we liked it and walked to many sites - Arc de Triomphe, of course, and even the Eiffel Tower. The walks were amazing! Our only regret was not having more time in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: monde_trek
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with the family, two adults, two kids. We stayed in one room and had breakfast included. I found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel was good. An easy walk to the Arc de triomph and Champs Elysees. I found the hotel clean and comfortable. The buffet breakfast was very good and fuelled us up for the day ahead. WiFi - There is WiFi in the hotel but it is very overpriced. I still can't belive they charge for this service when so many hotels offer free WiFi!! . Across the road from the hotel is a small restaurant/bar called "La Parthanon". This bar has a free WiFi service. You get 20 minutes free which was enough to check some emails and make a Skype call. You can sometimes pick the WiFi signal up from the bar of the Hilton if your lucky. About 5-10 mins walk from the hotel is a street called Rue De Berri. This street proved to be very useful. It has a pharmacy, coin operated Laundrette, nice Italian restaurant called Il Conti and a great Boulangerie (Cake shop) which sold fantastic chocolate eclairs etc. Traveller Tips: In Paris taxis charge extra if you sit in the front seat, have four people and want to take luggage. We were a group of 4 and some taxi drivers refused to take us. We found many of the taxi drivers to be very rude and arrogant. Even the hotel staff had arguments with them when they tried to get us a taxi for 4 people. Gypsies: I am sure most peple are aware now of the Gypsies that congregate in the tourist areas. They will ask you to sign a petition and pretend they are deaf. Do not sign anything as they will either try and pick your pocket while your distracted or once you sign hassle you for a donation. Have nothing to do with them, be firm and tell them to get lost!!

Reviews.Title: “VERY LOVELY PROPERTY FOR BUSINESS AND PLEASURE”
Reviews.Author: atlantatvlr
Reviews.Content: we were celebrating our wedding anniversary and informed the hotel prior to arrival... when we arrived, they did everything they could to make our stay special, from check in, to our room - balcony, king, executive level....the employees are AMAZING... and one is nicer than the next. We were so impressed with the executive level - it was worth booking on this level. The hotel website does not do the hotel justice... it is elegant, well maintained, beautiful gardens, great location , easy to use the metro from here... all in all we couldn't have asked for more!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms, variable service, crowded lounge.”
Reviews.Author: Vnyrdr
Reviews.Content: Second visit to this property; was impressed that they 'remembered' which room we were in last time and that we liked he view, so they put us in the room next door, which had the same Eiffel Tower view. Rooms are very nicely decorated in an art deco style, and very large by Paris standards, with two double beds plus a large sitting area. The executive lounge has a very nice balcony, but gets very crowded (standing room only) and the hot appetizers are often gone within 20 - 30 minutes, replaced by something silly like tiny squares of toast... Drinks are free-flowing, but on a very strict schedule (noon - 3 and 6 - 9); don't even think of asking for a glass of wine at 5:45! Concierges are generally excellent, but restaurant recommendations are iffy; sometimes it seems like the valets fill in for them (in which case you can actually find out about the better inexpensive restaurants). All in all a very good but not fabulous stay.

Reviews.Title: “We loved every bit of it”
Reviews.Author: u775kelly
Reviews.Content: This is a 7 star hotel in my book. Everyone was extremely helpful and being a hilton member we had access to the Family Executive lounge. We were minutes walk from the Champs Elysees and you could see the Eiffle tour from your room. Equisite all the way.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rhanna1
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel in paris Very clean and sevice is excellent.,the staff speaks english very good and are very nice. They have a concierge service that is very helpfull. There is a taxi line in front of the hotel, so you never wait to take the taxi. Taxi in paris is better and cheaper than the metro for a family of four. We had a very big room with two double beds. We where greated with a bottle of champage and deserts in our room even if we booked with hotwire.com ( we paid only 120 euro). This is a great, clean and modern hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms but let down by awful service”
Reviews.Author: BizTraveller000
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for business. The rooms are very nice - art deco design and good bathroom. The size of the rooms is much better than the average Paris hotel room. Breakfast quality is also good. My complaint is that after checking in at the end of a long day (10pm) I asked for 2 foam pillows, as I am allergic to feather. After a wait of 90 minutes and several phone calls to ask if the pillow were on their way, I was told that there were NO FOAM PILLOWS AVAILABLE IN THE HOTEL. At several hundred euros a night and for a hotel of this standard, I found this hard to understand and was very disappointed. I had a very bad night's sleep given that I could not sleep on the feather ones. I was absolutely stunned that the hotel said they could not provide an alternative and that there was 'nothing they could do'.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at center of Paris”
Reviews.Author: PrashantArya
Reviews.Content: Just a 15 minute walk from Arc de Triomphe this hotel has great rooms, excellent lobby and courteous staff. I booked it through my Hilton points for one night and idea was to be as near to central attractions as possible. Rooms were well furnished and TV had a great choice of channels across the board. A mini bar, coffee maker, comfortable beds, great ambience and ample space awaits you. Charles-de-Gaulle Etoile is nearest metro station on Line 1 and from there you can reach out to most of the monuments including concorde, louvre, notre dam and Eiffle tower within 10-15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Consider that using Hilton Points is still spending EARNED money”
Reviews.Author: G8RED
Reviews.Content: I decided to try to save some money on our 3 week Europe trip and use some of my Hilton points. It is a Category 7 and we got some sort of point deal on a 4 night stay so I believe the total points used was around 170k. Even though I tried to save money, I still view using points as money because I could have been using another credit card that gives me money vs Hilton points. When we were being checked in, I asked about a possible upgrade or at least an executive/family type upgrade. The gentlemen took out a piece of paper and told me we could be upgraded to a Junior Suite on the executive level for ONLY a three hundred euro per night additional charge (wow - what a bargain). We went to our regular room and I must say were completely underwhelmed. I have stayed at Category 4 Hilton properties that had nicer rooms and views. The point is if they are going to take Category 7 level points out of the account (which is supposed to include Waldorf Astoria type properties) then the room given in the transaction should be at least better then what you would get at a Holiday Inn. My wife ended up going back to the front desk and we negotiated for the same type room but on the seventh floor which gave us access to the executive level and family rooms for one hundred euros per night more. The food selections are extremely limited. They do not give you free internet access and we had to pay nine euro's per hour extra for that. If you convert the euros to US then we spent over one hundred and fifty per night....and if you count the 170k points at - at least three hundred more per night in value....this hotel is NOT worth the cost/points. The bathrooms and bath tub were really small too and we saw several minor maintenance issues with our room and the hotel. I have to say that overall the staff was professional, we had an experience with a female concierge which was very friendly/fun but If we had to do it again we would of chosen a lower star but higher rated hotel that included breakfast and internet at a price that rivaled our "upgrade costs" and was in an area closer to the action. My take home from our entire three week stay in Europe is to make finding a hotel that includes breakfast and internet a top priority because the costs in Europe are so high.

Reviews.Title: “Terribly overpriced, poor service, construction.”
Reviews.Author: diannebarnard
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Hilton Arc De Triomphe for two days in July of 2011 following a one week stay at a lovely apartment through VRBO. I chose the Hilton brand for its reputation. I was disappointed in this Hilton. I spent 100,000 Hilton HOnors points to secure two nights. I was put in a double room which overlooked immediately a construction site. Large moving equipment began moving rocks very loudly at 6 am on both days providing very little sleep. The room price was expensive but only included the room. There was no wifi and limited french channels on TV. I called the front desk and they told me it was 35 euros to add the TV daily and 22 euros to add internet. The room menu was labeled "ORIENTAL menu" and listed a continental breakfast available for 26 euros a piece. And a continental breakfast meant juice, coffee, and a danish or croissant of some sort. We were tourists so we spent very little time in our room but if we wanted to watch a TV show in a language we could understand, check our email or eat just a continental breakfast, it would have cost us (or anybody) way over an additional $100 a day! There were no anti-slip pads or mats available in the slippery bathtub and my daughter slipped and hit her head and flew home with a terrible headache. When I called down for a taxi to take us to the airport, I was informed that the taxi charges would start immediately at the time of the call so I went out on the street and got my own cab and loaded my own luggage after checking out. There was no ATM in the hotel but one about a block and 1/2 away. I talked with other Paris hotel visitors at the airport on the way home and all of them had the basic amenities of TV and wifi. I did contact guest relations and did receive an email from a representative of the Paris Hilton but she was unwilling to make any adjustments for our poor experience. She said that if I contacted her for my next trip, she would try to make it unforgettable. I am sorry to say that my first experience was unforgettable. I was told frequently prior to my daughter and my trip to paris to expect rude and unfriendly people, and I am happy to report that I found the entire French experience charming and lovely with the exception of this American based Hilton Hotel. I even had to pay 5 euros to print off my plane etickets. And it's a bit of a walk to the Arc de Triomphe as well. The beds were very hard with minimal pillows and just a big heavy throw, no blankets which made me really doubt if they could effectively wash between each customer. I would highly recommend staying clear of this hotel and staying at a local charming French hotel or another name brand.

Reviews.Title: “Staying here changed my impression of Paris”
Reviews.Author: llesniew
Reviews.Content: After years of staying in small independant hotels in Paris where I felt that my custom was unappreciated - I decided to spend a few extra dollars and stay at the Hilton this trip. The service was textbook Hilton which was a vast improvement over any other hotel experience I've had in Paris. The location is a little odd, but once you get the lay of the land you realize that you are not as remote as it seems - about a 10 minute walk to the Arc, and 2-3 minutes from a Metro stop.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive Hotel but Good”
Reviews.Author: _Mundo_Traveler_11
Reviews.Content: The location is in a nice residential neighborhood and fairly quiet. The hotel is well kept and we had a good experience with concierge recommending delicious restaurants. Note: This is not right next to the Arc de Triomphe - it is a decent walk away. The Executive Lounge amenities in terms of food and beverage offering is much better than most Hiltons but as other travellers have noted the Executive Lounge staff can be snooty and rude to guests. I did see that. Expect to wait at check-in even if you arrive at the designated check-in time. Not sure why they have a problem with this because other guests have reported that as well. Nice breakfast in the morning, which I get for free as Diamond Hhonors. However, if you have to pay for it, get ready to speand a lot of $$$!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: dan_from_the_UK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights during February 2011. Our rate included access to the executive lounge, this was excellent with such a good selection of food and drinks. It was very nice to be able to have a pre dinner drink of champagne in the lounge. My room itself was an executive room, but not on the executive floor. It was spacious and immaculate, the bathroom, whilst having an odd design was brilliant. Having windows that open is a real plus as it did get rather stuffy. The lobby itself is beautiful and really quite grand. Had breakfast in the restaurant, this was superb, the quality of food was excellent and such a variety of hot and cold options. The greeter was lovely and remembered our names from the previous day, I certainly did not except this in a hotel of this size. The only issue is the paper mats and mugs that Hilton insist on using, it looks terrible and detracts from what should be an elegant dining experience. Overall, a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “First time to Paris”
Reviews.Author: Idbuythatforadollar
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving to the Hilton by cab from the train station I was warmly greeted at the front desk. I used Hilton Honors points for the first night of my three night (2 room) stay, and received two lovely adjacent rooms with garden views. My family and I then made the short walk to the Arc. The next morning we were moving into "executive " level rooms, one deluxe king room and one deluxe king suite. We were told to leave our bags packed in the rooms and they would be transferred to our new digs. Upon returning from that days sightseeing we were excited to see our executive level rooms. They were disappointing. The rooms were on separate floors and both were of lesser quality than the ones we had stayed in the night before. Hotel rooms can be funny, really its about expectations. We expected more from our upgraded (VERY expensive) executive level rooms. Had we never seen the previous nights offerings I'm sure we would have been happy enough. But we had, and the hotel should know better. We traded our garden view for a street view of nondescript buildings (under construction). The suite was under-whelming (I don't think I even got a "wow" from my 12 year old daughter). I would advise this hotel's designers to swing by the Hilton Orlando next time they're in the US for some ideas. To make things even a little more sour, our bags were not in our rooms as promised. No one seemed to know where they had spent the day, but we got them about an hour later. I read many positive TA reviews regarding the executive level lounge. The "free" sodas, water and beer are nice, but the food offerings are minuscule (some literally). And the lounge has NO free WIFI. I expected more and was disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: TamsinPlush
Reviews.Content: This was a very disappointing hotel. Check in service: bad. 4 people available, but no one helped with bags Room: bad. These are all petty annoyances that I don't expect for a four star hotel at the $$$$ I was paying. Spacious (for France) but really dumb, annoying issues. 1) TV remote: trying to get a channel took about 10 pushes, then the TV would occasionally decide to turn itself on. Kettle: stuck to a tray positioned tantalizingly out of reach of the electrical sockets, so to boil water I had to transport the tray and all it's stuff across the room. Not a big deal but stupid. Magnifying mirror in the bathroom: sadly I am at the age where I need this. But, it's no good when it's not movable, has no light and is stuck inaccessibly to the wall in a dark bathroom. Shower: annoyingly, this couldn't be fixed to spray outwards, so I had to stand on the plug hole close to the wall. Internet: you have to pay. By the hour or by the day. Other, lower rated hotels give this service for free! Dinner recommendations: we asked. we won't again. We were sent to a pretty mediocre cafe/bar when we asked for a nice restaurant. Very disappointing. We didn't want the fare you find at every cafe/restaurant in Paris on every street corner. It used to be that you'd find interesting independent establishments easily in Paris: either they have gone out of business or they aren't open to tourists! All in all the hotel tainted our stay in this beautiful city. I would not recommend anyone to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Hazzles78
Reviews.Content: Room and bathroom was a very good sized. Nice free standing shower. Felt it was overpriced though, the art deco interior was quite tired. Mattress was saggy and the bed linen not very good quality. Central location but if I'm in Paris on vacation I prefer to stay somewhere more atmospheric in the Latin Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and fabulous service”
Reviews.Author: MoniqueAL
Reviews.Content: Thank you Hilton Arc de Triomphe for making our 10th anniversary trip spectacular! The room as great-- spacious and clean. While the bed was a little hard for our preference, we appauld your staff for getting a comfortable bed topper on the bed immediately! Staff was freindly and helpful. Great location. We appreciated the extras provided by the executive lounge, as well as the treats left in our room (champagne, cookies, candies, water) throughout our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience overall”
Reviews.Author: traveler193
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Honors member and have stayed at this hotel on several occasions. This report is for my last stay in July 2011. The good: 1. Executive lounge is very good. Good selection of food and drinks throughout the day. 2. Interior rooms are quiet. Bathrooms are nice. Bed was comfortable. 3. Staff is very courteous and helpful. Check in and check out were fast and efficient. Concierges are knowledgeable, patient and helpful. 4. Hotel is decorated in Art Deco style, which is done very nicely. 5. Room service was fast (quoted 30 minutes and delivered in 25) and food was very good. The bad: 1. Waited for room. I arrived at 2:30 pm and my room wasn't ready. They sent me to the executive lounge on the 6th floor to wait and it wasn't until after 4:00 pm that the room was finally ready. 2. Room needs new carpet. My room was nice overall, but the carpet was stained in several places and ripped along a seam, and needs to be replaced. 3. Elevators are slow and seem cheap and industrial (not hotel elevator standard). Expect to have to wait for the elevators at peak times. The ugly: Nothing. Other notes. I'm not a fan of the location. It is a 10-15 minute walk to the Champs Elysee and the George V metro station (Metro line 1). There is a closer metro station (Courcelles) but it is on an inconvenient metro line, usually requiring transfers. There are few restaurant/bar choices near the hotel. If you are a jogger/runner, you can run to the Eiffel Tower from the hotel or do loops in Parc Monceau. Overall this is a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good value and location”
Reviews.Author: mikeyhand
Reviews.Content: I used HHonors points for my stay but when booking, the price was comparable to other hotels in area. I am a Gold VIP, so free internet and i was upgraded to Executive Floor, 7th, and had a nice little balcony. (Some other reviewer said he didn't get any Gold benefits, that's a lie). Taxi to/from is about 55-60 Euro. No pool is a bummer but Paris kept us busy enough, we forgot there wasn't one. The breakfast in the restaurant gave more selection than exec lounge, as it usually does, and all in all, breakfast was good. Not the best, but definitely good. Great location. A 5 minute walk away, on Rue de Berri there is a nice laundromat, only 10 Euro for a large wash load. Also, across from that laundromat is a nice small market, like a Quickchek in USA with decent prices on snacks/water. Exec lounge gave us free snacks and drinks, so we only got minimal stuff there. So close to Champs Elysee and attractions. We took a taxi to Notre Dame, that's it. We walked everywhere else. Great staff, concierge was helpful and smart. Would stay again without a second thought. Rooms are somewhat small but for Europe standards, i think normal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: vacation061
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton for 4 nights and what plesant surprise it was. We had booked the executive room and did not know that the executive lounge priviliges came with it. The lounge started in the morning and closed at 11pm at night. They had light snacks, drinks, coffee etc.that was a welcoming sight after a tiring day sightseeing. The location of the hotel was great, close to Arc de Rriomphe, somewhat close to Champs Elyeese and close to the subway station. The staff at the hotel were all helpful, we were given umbrellas when it rained. Our room had a view of the Eiffel Tower which when light up was amazing. Would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Paris, lived up to its expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Upperclass hotel with superfriendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: SenJAntwerpen
Reviews.Content: We booked our room with a HH voucher but got the service of a paying guest. As Diamond HH member we were upgraded to a very nice rpom on the 7th floor and got exec lounge acces. This hotel is really an upper class hotel woth high standards.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: londongirl20
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous, clean hotel decorated in the Art Noveau style - large spacious rooms for a family of three - grand lobby. Great staff - room service was prompt, courteous and spoke English. Good upscale neighborhood with cafe across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific lounge but small rooms for a high price !”
Reviews.Author: liveyourlifegood
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 times before also in Club level but with less people. Now I went with four people so took a double double club room. The description told that it can accommodate up to 4 persons. We checked in downstairs very smoothly and got our key to our room. Our room was not at all on the club floor and was very very small. 2 Double beds but not in double size, just to small for 2 adults. The Executive lounge on the other way was superb ! The quality and choice is fantastic ! The evening snacks are always busy but it is worth waiting a bit. Everything needs to be filled by quickly and they manage to do it. The only thing I miss is free WiFi in the lounge ! This normally need to be in a lounge from a 5 star hotel in the Hilton chain. The price is also way to high even for Paris ! Metro around the corner just like the Champs Elysees Overall great stay !

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: lucylex
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our two last evenings of our honeymoon and upgraded to an executive plus room. We were disappointed at our room and asked for a change which the staff were happy to accommodate. Following a stay in the very romantic La Belle Juliette, this was a very different experience. We had stayed in this hotel a few times before so we knew that it was more of a corporate feel but we were unsure where the extra money we spent on the upgrade went. Having said that it was very clean and the staff were helpful enough. The concierge especially was very friendly and helpful and always had a smile on his face. The location was good if you want easy access to the main tourist sights, although many sights are still a bit of a walk for anyone who may have mobility problems. The breakfast were really busy and quite hectic but then it is a big hotel with lots of guests. I would recommend this hotel if you were using Hilton points for a discounted rate but it is highly over priced for people who are paying the full rate. For people visiting for leisure purposes I would recommend a boutique hotel which would give you more for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel OK, if you pay, not so if you are using Hilton Points”
Reviews.Author: chadz52
Reviews.Content: Overall the staff was good. Maid service twice per day, business center helpful, as well as conceigre. My biggest negative is the fact that as a Hilton Honors Gold Club member we were denied use of the Executive Lounge because we were using our points to stay here (50,000 per night). I don't know why Hilton treats their points users as second class guests. We were told that the executive level is only for those that pay. So if you choose to pay at this hotel you should be ok. Two blocks from a Metro station and many good restrauants in the area. Any future trips to Paris I think we would stay in a different location closer to Paris Center. Sunday Brunch is 89 Euro per person ($130)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kutecris
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton from May 13 to May 16 2011. This was my first time in France so I was a bit nervous. I took the train from the airport to the hotel, which after following a map, was quite easy. When I arrived I was greeted very pleasantly by the doormen and also by the receptionist. I was afraid because of the language barrier and by what I've heard about the French being rude but I must say everyone was friendly everywhere I went and the language was not a problem because almost everyone spoke English. The room I was given was spacious, clean, and modern. The hotel was close to the train station and walking distance from most sites but make sure you wear your sneakers!! The first day I wore my flip flops and my feet were so sore when I got back to the room. The Arc de Triomphe, the Champs Elysee, the Louvre, and several other sites were close by. I did hop the train to the Eiffel Tower because that was a bit further away. I ate in the hotel restaurant one evening. It was OK. The menu wasn't very exciting but I decided to give it a try. It was expensive and the food was just blah! I ate out most of the time. There is a nice park right up the street with a lake where you can go walking or jogging. It reminded me of Central Park with all the joggers going by. My only regret was that I could never make it back in time to visit the spa. They seem to close very early (about 6 or 7pm) and by the time I got back from sightseeing all day it was closed. My sister is a Hilton employee so they gave me an all access pass to the spa which I didn't get to use : ( The hotel was very expensive even with the family discount but it was definitely worth the money and I would stay there again when I return, which I plan on doing soon.

Reviews.Title: “Rated 3 Stars for the hotel and the staff 4 stars 6/27/11 to 6/29/11 Good location”
Reviews.Author: TripperLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Good location for the Arc de Tromphe, the Effiel Tower, the Seine River Cruise and Champs Elysees and only 2 1/2 blocks from a convenience store where you can buy drinks (soda, alcohol etc) at 1/5 price from the restaurants. Plenty of outside eating places. Hotel needs some remodeling. The room was small compared to American rooms. A little musty, carpet was old, the shower head would not hang and the grout was missing from a tile in the shower. Had a security safe in the room as well as a small refrigerator but with very little space for your own drinks. Got free bottles of water and welcoming candy for Hilton Honors as well as the newspaper. Coffee maker inside the room. My girls got a nice welcoming present - pink Hilton Hats! Hotel staff very customer oriented. Stephen at the check in counter was excellent. The business center could use more computers especially with English keyboards. The concerige could have provide better more detail instructions as the Paris streets can be confusing. Asked the Concerige to book a Taxi for us to CDG airport but got a private driver. I don't know if this was intended because the Taxis were having a strike or not. I know the Taxis were still running though. The drive from the Hilton to CDG cost us $100 Euros vs the Taxi from Orly to the Hilton was only $45 Euros. The Concerige may have done us a favor by private driver or did we get taken??? The room rate was supposed to be about $800/night but lucky for us that we got the room from my sister's Hilton points. I don't know how these rooms compare to other Paris Hotels but I'm used to more luxury for this price and the American Hiltons. I must say the staff is very good overall. The hotel may have some physicial limitations as this is a high rent district.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Paris surprise”
Reviews.Author: savebythesea
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a pleasure to arrive inside the Hilton and be greeted with efficient, pleasant staff. From the outside in the cab, it doesn't look special. Inside is a haven and retreat. The hotel is filled with Americans, which I considered a plus, being so far from familiar sights and sounds. The hotel staff was eager to have us enjoy Paris. The Concierge sought us out to ask how dinner was at a nearby Bistro that he booked for us. Very clean, very large rooms. My visitors advised that the hotel room was bigger than their apartments in Paris. Go Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, amazing concierge service”
Reviews.Author: KGBLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with descent amenities. Was disappointed that I was not upgraded given my Diamond Status, but that's not really a knock on the hotel. The conceirge desk was AMAZING!!! Oliver in particular made our visit in Paris so enjoyable. He arranged for reservations at many spots, told us where to go, and truly made us feel welcome. He made this hotel worth staying at. The rooms were clean, but on the small side (probably normal for Europe). Access to the Executive Lounge was very beneficial as well.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 15th Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: shellygirl
Reviews.Content: I don't quite know where to begin. Our stay was fabulous from beginning to end. We let the general manager know in advance that it was our 15th anniversary. When we arrived, a guest services representative let us know wthat they had upgraded us to an Eiffel Tower view room with balcony. We are Hilton Diamond menbers, so we do often get upgrades to executive floor rooms, but this was beyond the usual upgrade. There are probably fewer than 10 rooms in the hotel that have the balcony and Eiffel Tower view, so this kindness was much appreciated. After we got to our room, we went out for a walk and loved the neighborhood. It was pretty quiet with lots of locals around. We had lunch at a nearby cafe (can't remember the name), and when we came back to the room, there was a lovely bouquet of flowers, a bottle of champagne, and deserts waiting for us. So nice! We went out on our balcony and ate the deserts and drank the champagne while looking at the Eiffel Tower. Every morning, we went to the executive lounge to have breakfast, which was plenty to fill us up. Each day they had eggs (great eggs, must have had tons of cream in them), bacon, potatoes, fruit, croissant (including chocolate ones), juices, great coffee and more. When we headed out for our days' adventures, it was a quick walk to two metro stations (Courselles, Monceau) and a bus stop even closer. To get to the Monceau metro, you walk through Monceau Park, which is very nice and has many people out walking, jogging, riding the carousel or just sitting on benches. It was nice that the hotel provided 2 complimentary bottles of water in the room every day, so we could pack them in to drink while out walking. One day we went out when it was raining, and the doormen had umbrellas for people to borrow for the day. When we came back at the end of the day, the room was always nicely cleaned and resupplied with towels and toiletries. Then we'd head back to the executive lounge for food and wine. Each night they had a great soup, two hot appetizers, breads, etc. They also had wine, champagne, and even liquor if you went to the back side of the wall to find it. We met several people again and again in the lounge and really enjoyed talking with them about our days' adventures. We usually didn't even go out for dinner after that, as we were exhausted from our day, and we had had plenty to eat and drink. We did go our for our anniversary dinner, though, to the Ciel de Paris. The concierge was great, making a reservation for us there. Ciel de Paris is on the 56th floor of an office building in Montparnasse and was very enjoyable. See my review on that too. When we got near the end of our stay, we got a request from guest services to give them feedback. I gave them a call and provided a general overview of our stay. I was suprised that they didn't just accept the good review but rather probed several points to see if there was anything they could do better. We would definitely stay here again. We have great memories of our trip, and it was great being treated so well by the entire staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, room and central location”
Reviews.Author: Jeffmasters
Reviews.Content: I and my family spend a week in June 2011 in this hotel (5st Floor - Double Executive Room). The service and hotel facility was very good in relation with the hotel standing. Same about the hotel personnel very competent and reliable. The hotel is near the metro number 2 and Arc de Triomphe so no problem to visit the city. I advise this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: cbergin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is what you expect for an upscale Hilton. Nice comfortable rooms, good location in easy walking distance to Arc De Triomphe and Champs Elysees. Staff was helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel : good location, spacious rooms, great bar.”
Reviews.Author: B-Belgian
Reviews.Content: If you want to see the Arc de Triomphe / Champs Elysees area of Paris this is a great place to be. Top end hotel but worth the money. Would stay there again next time that I am in this part of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: MelissaBradley
Reviews.Content: Back from Europe! We stayed in Paris for a few days on our whirlwind tour and we were very pleased with our accommodations at the Paris Hilton. Funny, the "Paris Hilton". hee hee. Anyhoo. For the record we are Hilton Honors members, but booked this through American Express and they knew in advance we would be brining our small children with us. First of all you should know the location of this hotel is fabulous! A few blocks from the Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysees, then right down to the Louvre and other museums. A short ride or walk to the Eiffel Tower. So we stayed in a 2 bedroom family room. You open a door with your hotel key card to a hall and then there are doors to the right and left. One was set up with a king bed the other with two double beds and a crib. They also had treats for the kids and adults waiting for us when we arrived. Each room had a modern bathroom and the soap and shampoo were Crabtree and Evelyn. The bath sheets were very soft too. Everything was very well done in the modern art deco theme and squeeky clean. The beds were comfortable as well as the lines and pillows. I am picky so trust me on this. The maids were wonderful with general housekeeping and turndown and they always gave us plenty of towels. Love that. The whole hotel is done in a Art Deco motif. Personally, I'm not a huge fan of art deco; but it seems as if "the city of lights" is. It was everywhere you turned in Paris. The rooms and hall ways had lots of replicas of Erte artwork. I didn't like the lobby, but that is probably because it was small and art deco. The fresh flowers however were lovely and so beautiful I had to touch them to confirm they were real. They were. The staff was all top notch. Accolades to the concierge. He went out of his way literally to help you. He would walk out of the hotel with you to point to where to go, and make sure you knew where to turn. Everyone spoke excellent english; which sadly was not the case when we stayed in London later on this visit. The main restaurant we ate at only once and it seemed way over priced; luckily the concierge recommended tons of great places to eat and we had a wonderful time. One bummer of course is that you get smoke blown in your face from every direction from all the Europeans who smoke like chimney stacks. They even will blow second hand cigarette smoke right into a baby's face. Crazy people. Nice enough, but don't they get it? I didn't run into any snobby people in Paris despite the stereotype; everyone was super friendly and helpful and lovely; minus of course the smoke. What else? Hmmmm. Oh yes, the photos of this hotel online on the Hilton website are horrible. They need a professional photographer to redo them. I was so pleased when we pulled up and it didn't look like it did in the photos. Note to Paris Hilton... get new photos taken ASAP! Oh yeah; the bellman was always out in front of the hotel opening the doors for everyone. I mention this because unfortunately this is not the case all the time at all hotels. I feel like I am forgetting an important favorable detail. I wish you could go back and revise these reviews but you can't so maybe you'll get there and be surprised by some detail I can't recall at the moment. Oh well.. Bon voyage!

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad”
Reviews.Author: TMcMullen524
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our family for two nights here on vacation. We found the hotel nice and convenient for exploring the city. As far as handling HHonors Gold status, the hotel was very poor. I booked two rooms, and they were not able to provide an upgrade to the executive floor, which was OK. But, they were also NOT able to provide access to Executive Floor lounge nor provide breakfast otherwise or any other benefit. When pressed, our check-in agent actually told me they did not have an executive floor lounge. This was unacceptable. They also could not provide me adjacent rooms (required when traveling with small children), and finally switched me to rooms a few doors away. Ridiculous. Again, the hotel is nice and convenient, but the guest reception and handling is terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible value for the price.”
Reviews.Author: kmanvan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for several days. I've stayed in far better hotels around the world including Manhattan, San Francisco, Dubai, etc... for less than half the price we paid here. Generic american hotel feel, generic cheap hotel food, lousy gym, basic rooms. Would never come here again.

Reviews.Title: “No french ambience”
Reviews.Author: SurreyConnie
Reviews.Content: Very busy and popular hotel with American tourists. If you want a true French experience don't stay here. Executive lounge very busy and very noisy not relaxing. Water served at breakfast for tea was tepid and had to wait 20 minutes for 2 poached eggs despite being fairly empty. Most of the guests in the executive lounge ! Inappropriate music in the lifts and in the lounge. On a plus point extremely helpful and friendly receptionists and doormen. Quite a distance from the main tourist attractions and taxis are expensive. Spa treatments very over-priced

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, excellent service, near Metro”
Reviews.Author: RPI-hockey-fan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights, upgraded to Executive King Room. Wonderful room, large room, expecially for Europe, very quiet hotet. The executive lounge is small but very nice, adequate breakfast with eggs, bacon, a variety of rolls, the ever-excellent French breads, fruits, etc. Evening snacks but open bar with wine and beer to end the day. The hotel is about a block from a Metro station so easy to get anywhere in the city. About 3-4 blocks from the Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysees. Too far to walk to other Paris attractions but easy to take the Metro everywhere. Small market is nearby about a block away. Many nearby restaurants (it's Paris!) The hotel staff is excellent, very helpful with everything from getting a cab, to giving us directions to local attractions or even helping arrange a day trip to Normandy. The TV had about 6 or 7 English channels (mostly news channels). A quiet oasis from which to explore Paris. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Base for a Short Trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: ABC_1956
Reviews.Content: This is a good example of the Hilton brand in operation in a city centre location. Rooms are comfortable, the location is good with the metro enabling easy access to more distant locations. The restaurant is more than adequate, but few will eat in. There are fine restaurants a 10 minute walk (or 5 minute cab ride) away. The bar is lively at lunch times and serves good snacks. If you want the peace of mind of knowing exactly what you will get from a large well run hotel, this is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnotherHoustonian
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very, very busy. Many tour groups stay here. However, the property is magnificent. The service is excellent.....if you don't mind waiting in line to talk to someone. The lobby is gorgeous and the rooms are exceedingly well appointed. I was suprised that the rooms were so large in a downtown hotel. The bathrobes were posh, etc. The fitness center was excellent. Plenty of equipment. I took a quick peek into the spa and it looked divine. I understand the previous comments about the location. The location is in a financial district of sorts with lots of embassies. I really liked it because the location felt less touristry. The metro station is a block and a half away so we could quickly and easily get to the touristry areas but at night when we wanted dinner and relaxation, we weren't in the crowds (and in the middle of all of the Paris pickpockets!) I felt much safer in the blocks surrounding our hotel than I did in the more touristry areas. There are reasonable and wonderful restaurants within an easy ten minute walk. You may be the only American in the restaurant, which is kind of a fun thing! We actually walked from the Louvre back to our hotel. The walk isn't for the faint of heart and is definitely a hike, but is one I will always remember. There were so many neat things to see along the way. Breakfast here is breathtakingly pricey. There is a cheaper option directly across the street, and another one to the right and down the hill. However, I would suggest trying it once. It is a fabulous. It's a buffet. I'm not normally big on buffets, but for this I made an exception. If you are unsure, ask if you can go look. When you look make sure you check out the assortment of breads in the back, the crepes (easy to miss!) and the cheeses. Skip lunch one day and call this brunch. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: Pchhabra20
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel, clean, large rooms, a spa, and the staff were so incredibly friendly. I'm going to repeat what others have said, I didn't love the location. It was my first trip to Paris an I really did feel that we were out of the way. After a long day of sightseeing we would come back to the hotel and would be just to exhausted to take the Metro anywhere again and there wasn't much nearby. Champs Elysees is within walking distance but the restaurants there are just so pricey. The neighborhood directly around the Hilton doesn't have nearly as much to offer compared to the other wonderful neighborhoods in Paris. On my next trip I would book either near Rue Cler (so adorable and so close to the Eiffel Tower) or the Latin Quarter (lots to do).

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Service!”
Reviews.Author: momoftwo30
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! Perfect location. Easy walk to the Arc De Triomphe and 2 different metro stations. With 2 kids, we stayed on the Executive level and were treated so very well. Will stay here again in a heart beat. They even gave the kids welcome gifts.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel, excellent location, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: LazyPoint
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 night in early May. Was greeted by the concierge, room ready with fruit and chocolates waiting. Excellent help at the front desk providing info/instructions for our trip to Versailles. (PS anything you read about Parisians not being helpful was disproved in this trip..especially when the woman in the Metro information booth came out of her booth to help us purchase tkts). Hilton Art De Triomphe also had a great breakfast...so much so that we generally skipped lunch. Absolutely great

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as our first time here 2 years ago”
Reviews.Author: tpry
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here two years ago. so we returned this summer We love the art deco design, the nice rooms, decent location and proximity to the metro. Although for most most destinations, one does need to transfer to a second line it was very simple, imo. My only negative comment is about the cost of the internet. It was even cheaper for the same IBAHN service at our friend's hotel and she was at the Intercontinental Paris Le Grand. In addition my email was accessible but I could not send any emails. This is an IBAHN issue I believe as it happened at our hotel in Amsterdam as well. FYI all Mc Donald's in Paris announced they have free internet now. Even just stopping in for a drink there can make it well worth your while with rates so high.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location. We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Elliebouja
Reviews.Content: The hotel is within a very safe and quiet neighbourhood. It is near metro station Courcelles. It is within walking distance to Arc de Triomphe and Les Champs-Ã‰lysÃ©es. The check in process depends on whether you bump into a tour group. We waited for about 15 minutes. They appologised for the delay. As we went there for a special occasion, we were greeted by the manager who also gave us her name card in case of any special needs or complaints. When we arrive at 12, our room was not ready. We were offered to leave our luggage. We also obtained a very useful map from the counter so we started off sight-seeing straigh away. When we found our way to our double room. It smells lovely! The room was enormous and so was the bed! The toiletry set was from Crabtree & Evelyn. After we came back from our afternoon trip, we found surprise presents upon return: berry cheesecake, champagne and flowers. We only stated that we wanted a room with a good view because we have a personal special occassion but we did not expect present from the team! And there was a greeting card from them too! We can see Eiffel Tower from our room. It looks small in the day time but was beautiful at night. At the back of the hotel, there was some construction going on. But thanks to the good quality windows, we can't hear anything in the room until we opened the window. We are hoping that it will not be a high-rise building in the future because we do want to return to this hotel in the future! Yes room service was great. The quality of the food was fabulous, better and cheaper than many restaurants in central Paris. If we have known earlier, we would have ordered dinner every night. I chatted with a colleague after the trip. She also happened to stay in the same hotel when her car broke down in Paris. She and her partner decided to stay in Paris at the last minute. The team at Hilton Arc de triomphe helped to find a car mechanic to fix the car and helped to translate the problems to him. We were all very impressed. We were a little disappointed that there was no tea or coffee set. But then we realised that this is a common practice in France.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a nice quiet location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: buellwinkle2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a full week and it was great. The room was very nice, spacious, quiet, clean. It was decorated in an art deco motif. The bathroom was pretty large with seperate shower and bathtub and sink areas. The room was quiet and overlooked their courtyard garden. The TV was a large flat screen TV. Very little English language programming on TV, about 8 channels, but mostly news. The buffet breakfast was one of the best we've had and very complete, something for everyone here. The wait staff was very attentive bringing coffee and juices. While called the Arc De Triomphe hotel, the actual Arc De Triomphe was a healthy 10+ minute walk away. From there you can catch the Metro lines 1 and 6 which covered most of what we needed to get too. The closest Metro station was the 13 at 2 blocs away and was convenient for getting us to Versailles. Enroute along Ave. Washington is a few good restaurants, ATM machines, ice cream, grocer and ice cream. We used a laundromat about 2 blocks away that was clean and easy to use. Pretty much the entire staff spoke fluent English. I would say that most guest there spoke English. The concierge was extremely helpful in getting metro directions to popular tourist sites. My only complaint is that the room internet was not WiFi, so not convenient for my iPad I travel with. I got an Apple Airport Express. You plug it in the wall, then plug their ethernet cable into it and it creates a WiFi hotspot immediately. You can get WiFi in the lobby, but certainly better to have it in the room. Our biggest concern going to Paris was pickpockets and the hotel staff warned us of this. We did have a few attempts, but we were prepared so it did not affect us. One was a younger girl, about 25, the other two attempts were older men. The best for me was wearing an ankle wallet we picked up at REI and leaving my pants pockets empty for stuff like maps, small amounts of euros for immediate things like buying metro tickets, water bottles, lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Just a bit out of the way for us ....”
Reviews.Author: DandMtraveling
Reviews.Content: Although the staff was terrific, the location was a bit too far away from any American's idea of the "romance of Paris". It's four block walk to the Metro. Next time it's back to the Saint Germain for us. The hotel is full of Erte' prints ... I guess to create an Art Deco mood. It looks as though the hotel was built in the 70's, and the prints added to the halls to try and create the mood., very strange. Two of the four elevators was not working during our five day stay. As always, the staff makes any hotel ... they responded to requests quickly and cheerfully. It is on a quiet street, always appreciated in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Absoulty Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: IM3MadisonWI
Reviews.Content: THe service and attention to detail were nothing short of outstanding. The concerige service assisted us in securing reservations at some very popular restaurants. Their suggestions as to using the Metro vs Taxi were always spot on. The executive floor is outstanding for business and pleasure. The assistance and food were top notch. One caution I would make is that most people smoke in Europe and our room had to be fumigated twice, despite it being a no smoking room. So make sure you emphasize that the room is not only non-smoking but has been fumigated. Also if you arrive early your room will not be ready but the staff was kind enough to allow us to use the spa to take a shower and clean up. Also the spa is an additional charge so if you like to run the conceirge has a great 10 K route through a nearby park. This was one of the best Hilton's I have ever stayed in and as a gold level member there are a lot of nights spent in Hilton's.

Reviews.Title: “A good reliable Hilton”
Reviews.Author: gmbklm
Reviews.Content: We spent an enjoyable 3 nights here in Jan 11. Our first stay at this hotel. It is located in a business district, not far from the Arc de T. Hence, a usefully quiet w/e location, but a good walk to the main museums / galleries. Booked a King Exec Plus, non-smoking, at a heavily reduced rate of Â£200 / night. At this price, it was very good value. Would feel very different at the much higher rack rate. We were also upgraded to a larger 2F suit, but which had clearly been used as a smoker room (which reception did not mention), but luckily the residual smell cleared quickly. It was very large room, particularly so for Paris, and well furnished. However, for my taste it was rather old fashioned. We had a very comfortable bed, which had very good linen. The room was also very quiet. The bathroom was reasonably modern, and a decent size. However, as another reviewer mentioned, shower pressure was very poor - we weren't sufficiently bothered to report it. Room service was good, but not great given the rack rate for such a room. One towel change per day, cleaning at odd late times, and not always replacing the tea / coffee already used. The staff were generally professional and friendly. We had access to a complimentary breakfast in the executive suite on the 6 floor. A useful source of a basic breakfast, with pastries, juices and fruit. Overall, a good stay in a well run Hilton. Would happily return. As a current UK TV advert puts it, "it does what it says on the can".

Reviews.Title: “It's a Hilton, exactly what you'd expect for a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: starmarie10
Reviews.Content: I am a Diamond member and this hotel treated me like royalty because of it. The room was very nice. The staff was helpful. This is everything you've come to expect from a Hilton with the addition of being in a very nice city. I was disappointed that I didn't get free internet...it was the typical Hilton daily rate.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay, it's home from home with all the Hilton refinement you would expect.”
Reviews.Author: Digger1066
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights at the end of May which clashed with the tennis tournament as many of the players stayed here. The staff realised that this was a special trip with my wife and upgraded us to a suite foc when they saw my loyalty to the Holton brand.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: Ikorel
Reviews.Content: convenient location, 10 mins to Arc de Triomph, very close to a Metro stop, room was fine we had a King, but the shower had poor pressure. Room service seemed a bit randome, 08:30 at the weekend! Concierge service was fantastic, they got us tickets for Moulin Rouge, and a good restuarant, overall satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near Arc de Triomphe”
Reviews.Author: iV0yager
Reviews.Content: beautiful hotel near Arc de Triomphe and great rooms. Food was good, especially break fast was great. But food was over priced though. Service could have been better, some days room service didn't change towel and bathroom accessories.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, but not so welcoming”
Reviews.Author: OsideJC
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here to finish our trip to Europe. After 2 weeks on the road we were a little road weary and were looking forward to winding down our trip. The property location is good, but since we rely on the metro in Prris the nearest line required multiple transfers any time we ant anywhere, our a long walk to a better connected line. We found the staff to be pretty cold, I felt strongly that being on the last legs of our clean clothes made less than welcomed (we were indeed underdressed relative to other guests). The executive lounge was adequate, but just so. My biggest complaint was the high speed internet was an absolute rip off, 22 euros / day, and it is bound to a single device instead of the room number so if like us you have a laptop, and a couple of ipads the cost would be astronomical, totally unacceptable in our connected world. All in all there are better values in Paris, but if you want to live (and spend) like a rock star, this is an excellent option.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Excellent Service No Matter Who You Are”
Reviews.Author: Pete962008
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently returned from this hotel, talk about an AMAZING EXPERIENCE! Rooms are in excellent shape, staff is extremely friendly and courteous, and almost everyone speaks English so there was no language barrier. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a wonderful pleasant stay with a close proximity to the city. First off, I had many questions before the trip, so I e-mailed their reservations office, Catrine e-mailed me back within 24 hours each time. She was fantastic. She was extremely helpful and gave me detailed answers about everything (no matter how small the question was she was never rude or short in her responses). Few notes: 1. We did use points for the hotel and had access to the lounge with free breakfast. If you are on a budget (like we were) and you donâ€™t have access to the lounge and youâ€™re looking for a cheaper breakfast/lunch option, there are 3 cafÃ©â€™s within 3 blocks of the hotel where you can get your coffee/breakfast/sandwhichs for a very affordable price. 2. You are 3 blocks away from a metro stop (Courcelles) and within walking distance to the Arc De Triomphe/Champs Elysees, your are very close to everything. My wife and I took the metro/train from the airport to Courcelles and walked to the hotel (with luggage). When we visited the Eiffel Tower and took a cab home, it was never more then 10 Euros. Finally, in the lounge we were blessed with Chloe. She was outstanding, not only was she extremely kind, she helped us out in every way and was very patient. She was friendly and assisted us with all of our needs. This hotel is perfect if you want to spend a lot or save a lot. I would highly recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “terrible hotel - service non existent - don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: sasha80
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 3 nights. cost nearly Â£500 per night. room average only. fan/air conditioning in building on all night - very noisy (our own air conditioning was switched off). this hotel is not central - we got the bus from the airport to the l'arc de triomphe and then had a 25 minute walk with heavy bags!! The room was not serviced properly for the duration of our stay and we had to ring the concierge every night for replacement cups, glasses, towels and toiletries. last night they had left us 1 towel!!!! do the staff pay for the tolietries out of their own pockets? last night, we wated an hour and a half for towels for this morning - as usual, inadequate toiletries were left. at 12.20am, a boy delivered the towels and tolitries, and said he would return in 2 minutes with cups (we had been waiting for a coffee all this time). he had not returned by 9am when we checked out!!!!! this hotel is WAY over priced and the service exceptionally poor. stay here if DESPERATE!!!!! also had a camera stolen out of my bag but couldnt prove this so didnt take it up with management. the only time my bag was unattended was in this room. never again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel especially for HHonors Gold & Diamonds!”
Reviews.Author: BlazerJH
Reviews.Content: This hotel probably has one of the nicest Executive Lounges in the world. It is open from 7 AM to 11 PM each day and is constantly stocked with fantastic foods and beverages. As Gold HHonors members we were given access to the Executive Lounge and used it every morning for breakfast and often in the evening for snacks or a small meal. The breakfast had eggs, bacon, fried potatoes, cold cereals, yogurt, cheeses, an assortment of breads and pastries, and about 5-6 different types of high quality juice (orange, apricot, apple, grapefruit, etc). This was an excellent way to start our day. In the afternoons, a selection of cheese, cookies, sodas, breads, etc was always on hand. In the evenings there was usually a soup such as tomato, carrot, or potato and various hot appetizer-style foods in addition to the breads and cheese. There were also chips, salsa, crackers, nuts, and a full selection of sodas and alcohols in the evening. From 9 PM to 11 PM fresh chocolates are put out and this is an excellent way to end the day. The lounge seating area is fantastic with an outdoor balcony that has about 6-8 tables and and spacious indoor seating area with many tables and bar areas as well. The room itself was comfortable with robes and slippers, a spacious bathroom with tub and shower and toiletry items from Crabtree & Evelyn. The bed was comfortable however not quite as comfortable as many Hilton beds I have experienced in the USA. Noise was not generally a problem however some noise from the hallway would occassionally come into our room. There is no wi-fi internet in the rooms but there is a wired internet terminal which is extremely fast. Internet access costs â‚¬22 per day unless you are HHonors Gold or Diamond member which makes the internet free. Prices for everything in this hotel were quite ridiculous (â‚¬7 for a soda or candy bar from the mini-bar, â‚¬6 for an orange juice on the room service menu, â‚¬36 for full room service breakfast, â‚¬3 connection fee to make a phone call, etc) however most travelers should know these types of prices are to be expected at luxury hotels in major cities.
