The location is within a 5-7 minute walk from a metro stop so that made getting around Paris relatively easy. There are also always taxis available outside the hotel. If needing to travel to a location during non-peak traffic times (early morning or later in evening), the taxis are actually fairly economical for a large city. We took one a couple times around 7 AM and went at least 4-5 km for only about â‚¬11. However it cost us about â‚¬9 and took about 15-20 minutes to go only about 1-2 km at 9:15 AM when traffic was heavy. We stayed at this hotel using HHonors rewards points and were treated very well by the staff, no differently than if we had paid cash for our stay. The concierge and guest relations team at this hotel are among the finest, always willing and able to answer our questions or make recommendations for the area. Check-out was a bit slow at 8:30 AM on a Saturday morning because at that time there were also a large number of Americans checking in (I am assuming they had just arrived from the airport on trans-Atlantic flights). The hotel could benefit from making separate lines for check-in and check out for peak times such as the mornings between 7:30 and 9:30 AM. Our taxi transfer to the airport on Saturday morning was only about â‚¬40 and took under 25 minutes because of light traffic. I would highly recommend using the taxi to transfer to and from the airport if you are arriving during a non-peak traffic time. Overall we would gladly stay at this hotel again using HHonors reward points however if paying the full price with cash there may be a better value out there for an equally nice hotel with a more central location in Paris. However we would definitely recommend it for anyone with HHonors Gold or Diamond status just because of the many amenities offered in the Executive Lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton standard in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Mac_Ll_41
Reviews.Content: We had a 5 night stay at this hotel in April with 2 young children (5 and 8) which was great. It's a Hilton standard, which if you've stayed in Hilton hotels before will understand as being a good standard, clean rooms, good restaurant/bar and good customer service, basically everything you pay the money for. It's about 10 minute walk from the Arc de Triomphe and about 5 minutes from the nearest Metro. The staff we're friendly and helpful, especially in the restaurant which does the standard Hilton deal of kids eat free with a paying adult, considering the kids menu was around 22 euros, that's a good saving. One big tip, as many previous reviewers we paid extra for an executive room which permitted access to the Executive Lounge. This is a nice room on the 6th floor (no views I'm afraid) and served breakfast in the morning then drinks and snacks all day long. If you conisder at a roadside cafe (and this was lierally roadside, nothing scenic!) we paid 30 euros for 1 tea, 1 coffee, 2 apple juice and 1 crepe, then a quick nip back to the hotel for the same for free covered the extra paid for the room and some more. From around 6pm they have champange, wine, spirits, beers and plenty of food all for free. You can also check-in and out at the lounge which means no hanging around in the lobby. On our last day (which ran into the first day of the Easter holiday) they set-up a room on the ground floor as the Family Executive Lounge and sent people with young kids to that room when they tried to enter the normal lounge. This room wasn't as nice as the usual lounge, it was much bigger (they set-up toddler toys in a corner) and had no atmosphere, if we'd have been forced down here the whole time I probably wouldn't have been as satisfied. I'd check what the poilcy is during the holidays. All-in-all it's a great hotel and worth paying that bit extra for the Hilton standard.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and location, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: TempAd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Arc de Triomphe for 5 nights and it was nothing short of fabulous. I used my Hilton points for 3 nights and we paid for 2 nights. We were on the Executive Level (6th floor) facing the inside courtyard. Location: A short 5-10 minute walk to the Metro at the Arc de Triomphe and numerous other metro stops on different lines. Grocery store close by, tons of restaurants in the area. Rooms: The room was beautifully decorated and had a window that opened up to a quiet view of the courtyard. It was large by European standards and had a big screen TV, desk, seating area and king size bed. The bathroom had a separate tub and shower, which was nice. The sink and vanity area was outside of the toilet/tub/shower area which is extremely convenient when youâ€™re sharing the room. Executive Lounge: Large with a nice patio with tables and chairs. The food was very yummy and the bar was well stocked. The staff were more than accommodating and welcoming. Hotel lobby: Very impressive. Check-in was wonderful and easy. Our room wasnâ€™t ready when we arrived around noon but they took our luggage and sent us up to the exec lounge immediately. The concierge suggested a local restaurant for dinner for us the first night, which turned out to be a bit fancier than we hoped for and more than a bit pricier than we hoped for, but good none-the-less. Staff: Incredibleâ€”very helpful. Everyone speaks English. Everyone smiles and greets you as you arrive and leave the hotel. Issues: We had an issue with the safe in our room (it stopped working) and they had to drill our passports out. They were prompt and overly apologetic and even sent up a plate of treats for us that night! Hints: (1) â€œWHEREâ€� magazine is in the room (they are in many European/USA/Canadian cities) and have an awesome selection of restaurant reviews in all price ranges that change with every issue. Iâ€™ve used these recommendations in plenty of cities and have always been happy. Also has a comprehensive list of local attractions, packages, shopping, spas, etc. (2) Book an executive roomâ€”the lounge is totally worth it, even if just for the 6-9pm drinks and appetizers. Overall: Fantastic hotel. Definitely would highly recommend and stay there again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Utterly Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: ExploringtheEarth
Reviews.Content: We had the most amazing stay at this hotel. The executive lounge, the rooms with balconies overlooking the Effiel Tower, the service, the staff, everything was impeccible!! The hotel is absolutely gorgeous inside!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff!”
Reviews.Author: khoregon
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with my young son for a week. Everyone on the staff from the front desk to the concierge to the executive lounge was most polite and helpful. Maxime, at the concierge, was especially gracious and helpful. The restaurant staff was equally gracious and accommodating. One evening, when I was just too exhausted to leave the hotel for dinner, I was looking at the restaurant menu, trying to find one of my old favorite French sandwiches. I could not find one and jokingly told the hostess that I couldn't leave Paris without eating one. She immediately went to the chef and requested one for me. A little while later, I was happily eating my croque monsieur in the bar lounge. The hotel is located in a quiet neighborhood, but only about a 2-3 minute walk to a metro stop and a 10-15 minute walk to the Arc de Triomphe. I very much appreciated the quiet location during a very, very busy Easter week in Paris. There are several bistros and cafes within easy walking distance. There is a small Monoprix (Monop) just down the street and a Banque National de Paris at the metro stop. The rooms were surprisingly spacious for Europe. I am always pleasantly surprised by the little extras that Hilton offers - slippers, water bottles, chocolates, and, in Paris, a little bottle of perfume with the toiletries! Overall, a very pleasant stay. Hilton was my oasis of calm in a bustling city.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, Fabulous Staff...And not Necessarily in that Order!”
Reviews.Author: Welovelove2travel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Arc de Triomphe with my wife, three young girls, their aunt and grandmother for four nights in April 2011. The staff was absolutely excellent from the bellhops to the executive lounge staff. First, the concierge staff is among the best I've ever experienced. We flew into CDG, purchased Carte Navago passes which provide unlimited public transport around Paris. The concierge at the Hilton told us exactly how to get from CDG to the Hotel. Then each day of our stay the concierge was able to tell us quickly and easily how to navigate the subway to get where we wanted to go. There are two stops within a block or two of the hotel. They cheerfully helped us with dinner reservations and a wealth of local knowledge for sightseeing. The front desk personnel were sharp and friendly. The manager contacted us during our stay and made sure our girls had received their welcoming gift (they had not) and which I suppose is tied to the rewards program. She invited them to visit her the next day and she presented them with gifts that will be long enjoyed and remembered. The executive lounge was excellent with service all day and well into the evening. They go above and beyond expectations. Eggs and bacon, croissants, rolls, cereals, jams and much more for breakfast, light lunch items, mid afternoon snacks, cocktail hour drinks and heavy hors devours, and late night nibbles. Great lounge. The rooms are large, new and very comfortable. From top to bottom this hotel and its staff made our trip to Paris one to remember. No negatives whatsover....except that you eventually have to leave. As a side note, we also purchased the unlimited museum passes in the airport and found it to be a good value. you can dip in and out of museums and not feel like you have to spend the entire day as all access is covered by the passes. Coupled with the unlimited transportation pass, an adult can really see alot for about $100 bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: sq7700
Reviews.Content: Arrival We arrived at the hotel just after 11 pm after a short (~10 minutes) walk from Arc de Triomphe (where the Air France Orly buses terminate). It was a safe walk, even during this hour, and not hard to find. We asked the staff at what time the executive lounge closes and we were a bit unlucky since they just closed. However, they didn't offer us any refreshments or anything during check in. Instead, we went up the our room on the 7th floor. Here, on the other hand, you could get something to drink - if you want to pay â‚¬8 (approx 12 USD) for small can of coke. All right, it's a minibar but there has to some sort of line. At least if the executive room, which we had reserved, is around 450 EUR (approx 670 USD) per night. Room I'd say that the room is of a quite normal size (at least in Europe). It has a nice flat screen TV, a minibar (ridiculously expensive, though), a few drawers, a desk - a little bit of everything that you may or may not need. Pretty much everything you could expect from a 4 star hotel. Umbrellas are even provided, however, not in your room, but in the lobby. The bathroom includes separate bath and shower which is, of corse, very smart. At least our room had a furnished balcony facing Rue de Courcells, however it seemed as if not all rooms did have a balcony. The room was cleaned once or even twice a day and was generally very clean. The carpet looked a bit tired, though. Location Paris is a huge city and therefore there is no real city center, it consists of many areas - the one different from the other. As a tourist you'll most likely want to stay somewhere around the river of Seine as that's where most of the main tourist attractions are located (such as the Eiffel Tower, the Arc of Triomphe itself, Champs-ElysÃ©es, the Louve and the Notre Dame). This Hilton complex is located, as said before, in a rather quiet business/residential area. It takes approximately ten minutes to either Arc de Triomphe (where you'll get access to the Paris metro, which is, per definition, access to every pocket of Paris) or Champs-ElysÃ©es/George V. So yes, the hotel is centrally located and you can easily walk to all of Paris' main attractions - if you enjoy walking that is. It may not be located in the most chic area of Paris, but I wasn't disappointed. Executive Lounge If you pay for an executive room you'll get access to the exectuive lounge located on 6th floor. Opening hours are from early morning (7 am) til late evening (11 pm) - however - don't plan on staying here all of that time. What's offered in the lounge depends on the time of the day. In the morning you'll find a rather small breakfast buffet, however, I'd say it contains just as what you need. The coffee and the freshly squeezed orange juice are extra nice. During lunch there are some (boring) sandwiches, vegetables etc. Sodas, beers and water plus snacks are provided all day. Wine is only available during lunch and early evening. For some reason, they'll take it away in the late afternoon and in the late evening (we couldn't get a glass of wine when returning after dinner, just after 10 pm). And for some reason, they'll only provide sparkling wine for a couple of hours in the early evening. A bit cheap, I'd say. Other There's a small spa, including a jacuzzi. As we had seen the pictures on the website we did bring swimwear. The ladies greeted us nicely and showed us to the jacuzzi which was very nice, but as we left for the room to go and change we were a bit shocked. There was an entrance fee. 30 EUR for the two of us - just to use a jacuzzi. To the management of this hotel: Did you forget that we - as your guests - are actually paying around 450 euro not per stay but per NIGHT? And we can't use the jacuzzi, unless we pay you even more money? Samething goes for the business center and inroom Wifi. The verdict Being at a good location (which is kind of vague when it comes to Paris) and being as clean as it obviously is, the hotel should definately earn its four stars. However, the room rates are way too high (even for Paris standards that is) compared to what you get. You'll need to remember that this is not pure luxury. Pure luxury, for me, is when a hotel can afford not to take away middle class wines for a couple of hours in the afternoon, just because they want save a little money - or when they won't ask their guests to pay a rather small - but symbolic sum of money to use a basic facility as a jacuzzi. Hilton Arc de Triomphe gets 3 points from me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but....”
Reviews.Author: darrender
Reviews.Content: OK...This is going to be a mixed review. First of all, the hotel was beautiful, the staff was especially friendly and the rooms were very nice. The bad...THE AIR CONDITIONING SUCKS IN THIS HOTEL!!! It was unusually hot for this time of year, and in our rooms that we had, the air conditioning never got cooler no matter where we set the thermostat. We switched rooms, and we still had the same problem. We were told that everything was working properly and were given 2 fans for our room to keep it cool. Not exactly what you would expect from a hotel like this. If you are booking a room with 2 beds, take caution. 2 queens is not 2 queens. it's 2 full size beds. Also, this hotel is totally into making you spend as much money as possible if you want anything to eat or drink. 24 euro's for a hamburger and 8 euros for a coke. that's about the equivalent of $30 and $12 respectively. Now I know you are going to say that you shouldn't be eating these things when you are in Europe. I didn't eat any american food while I was here, and cokes were available EVERYWHERE in the city for around the same price you would pay in America. Also, the hotel isn't necessarily super close to anything, but is very close to the metro. USE THE METRO OVER CABS!!! It's a great system, and if you have enough confidence in yourself to use it, you will save yourself a ton of money!! Cabs will cost you a minimum of 20 euros to wherever you go and the metro costs 3 euros. Overall I would stay again but I would make sure they had me in a room where the thermostat worked

Reviews.Title: “great rooms, pricey stay, far away from sights”
Reviews.Author: veggietravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Arc de Triomphe for 2 nights in April towards the end of our vacation in Paris. Check in was frustrating because someone was checking out at the HHonors check in desk and since the guests didn't speak any english, we were kept waiting for about 15 minutes while the other front desk folks were helping other guests. Once we did get to the check in desk, we were told that we would have to produce a reward certificate which we never received from Hilton, because we redeemed our points online. After some more minutes of the clueless front desk agent winking at us for everything and rambling on about various other things, she found our reservation and checked us in. Stay itself was fine, rooms are excellent. Please be aware that contrary to its name, this Hilton is actually a little away from Arc de Triomphe (0.6 miles or so). The nearest Metro is Courcelles, which is about 5-8 minutes walk. If you want to get to a hub, Charles de Gaualle-Etoile is the nearest station and thats about 10-15 minutes walk. This seems to be the business district and since we were there on a Sunday and Monday (Easter Monday), everything was closed and I mean everything. Not a single place to eat nearby and we ended up having to purchase the overpriced brunch at the hotel (they suspended the regular menu and replaced it with the brunch only at 70 Euros per person). Not happy about that. Probably not the hotel's fault, but it's worth knowing if you plan on visiting. Also be aware that there are inconsistencies in their final checkout bill - they tack on charges for snacks from minibar and hope you don't notice. Our bill had a charge from the DAY OF CHECKOUT for a Special K bar - how is that even possible? How can they charge us for a mini bar item that we didn't even use and that too on the day of checkout? Additional points to note - Wifi is not provided, you pay E8.50 for one hour or E21.00 for the day, Business Center is not free either. All I can say is, although Paris is overpriced in general, this place is way too overpriced. Go ahead and use your points like we did, but I do not recommend paying to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JennyWexford
Reviews.Content: Just back from a wonderful 3 night stay and was very impressed. The hotel has a lovely welcoming lobby area and the staff throughout the hotel are most helpful & courteous. Our room had a view of the Eiffel Tower, which was delightful. Hotel is in quiet area, about 10 mins walk from the hussle of shops/bars, etc. So it is a good idea to book the Executive level, which gives access to the executive lounge & to free drinks & all sorts of lovely snacks & good coffee throughout the day!! I found that after sightseeing all day with the kids, when we got back to the hotel in the evening we were not inclined to go back out again, so it was great for them to be able to enjoy unlimited bottles of coke, etc in the lounge!! The main bar downstairs is very pricey â‚¬8 for a bottle of coke & â‚¬13 for a pint of Heniken. The only negative is no free WiFi, which is a pity as most of the hotels give it. Would certainly return again

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Welcome with Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Beverleydc
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Hilton, Arc de Triomphe. We stayed for three nights in a lovely executive plus room with a large balcony. It is handy when you stay exec, as you can stop off either before or after a night out for a few drinks and this is all free. They also have morning, lunch and evening snacks but we didn't really take advantage of these but great if you are travelling on a budget. The only down side we could find is that it was not perhaps as central as we would have liked, so as well as lots of long walks, we also spent quite a bit on taxi's, but we liked the hotel and was made to feel very comfortable there. As we were celebrating our wedding anniversay the hotel sent us champagne and flowers to the room, which was a lovely touch and the flowers smelt sensational for the whole stay. So if you are celebrating a special occassion, it is worth letting them know.

Reviews.Title: “What a delight!”
Reviews.Author: SeattleFamily_2010
Reviews.Content: It was our 10th Anniversary with our 10-year old son. We studied Trip Advisor and other sites and finally chose Hilton Arc de Triomphe for a six night stay in Paris. Six nights at one hotel that we have never stayed at before means that there is a lot riding on our choice of a hotel...and the Hilton Arc de Triomphe delivered. It is a mature hotel but everything is kept up meticulously. The staff is very nice and very helpful. The rooms are very clean, modern, quiet and well appointed. They are reasonably sized and well laid out. It is not a busy street yet there are street sounds but not to worry...the high quality windows keep everything completely quiet in the room. The beds are comfortable and fresh. The hotel is close enough to walk almost anywhere...you can start at the Arc de Triomphe and walk the whole down the entire Champs Elysee from here, which is what we did on our first day. Or catch the Metro or take one of the taxis waiting right outside. It is very reasonably priced, too, making it an excellent value. We only have good things to say about Hilton and this hotel. Everything came together perfectly. Aaaaahhhh...what a delight. One caveat...using the telephone in the room will be unreasonably expensive. We used my Verizon global smartphone most of the time which worked fine. However, Verizon did try to rip us off with a $5,000 bill for usage when we got back back, even though we totally vetted things with them in advance...but that's a whole other story. The one thing I would do differently is to see if its possible to rent a smartphone in Paris if you are going to need one.

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: GlobalNomad62
Reviews.Content: Arrived early at the hotel and room was available so a good start. Rooms are largish for Paris. My room faced the internal courtyard which meant it was quiet, however the trade off is a lack of privacy as every hotel room across the courtyard look straight into your room, so you will need to keep the curtains closed if you value privacy or request an exterior facing room. The only significant downside was housekeeping and the general state of the corridors, the corridor carpets were not vacuumed in the 5 days I was at the hotel, and sundry rubbish (bits of paper, water bottle seals etc) that were there when I checked in were there when I checked out. Plus used wine glasses and coffee cups were not cleaned or replaced in my room. Overall a good hotel for Paris

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Silverbluebirds
Reviews.Content: Great location however not very close to CDG airport by tube so would recommend a taxi. Rooms were very clean and decorated lovely however size of room much smaller than you would get from a hilton hotel in the UK. Excellent customer service - staff very attentive, friendly and helpful. Overall, excellent hotel with excellent service but slightly on the pricey side. My husband and I stayed for 3 nights and cost us in excess of Â£600, but we thought it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: NiftyN0mad
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Hilton Arc de Triomphe twice and have been enchanted by the service we received both times. The facility is first rate, the location is marvelous (you can walk the Champs Elysee from the Arc to the Louvre from the hotel), but the best thing about the hotel is the superb service offered by the staff. They cannot do enough for you, From greeting you at the entrance to making restaurant reservations to providing almost-instant room service, the staff is solicitous and responsive. Our second stay was to celebrate our 50th wedding anniversary and the hotel could not do enough for us. It made our celebration quite special. One tip - if you can arrange it, stay on one of the concierge floors. The lounge is spectacular, serving a wide variety of delicious foods, wines and liquors throughout the day and night. if it were not for the wonderful restaurants, you could have all your meals there. Ask for one of the rooms with the balcony facing the Eiffel Tower. The view is to die for.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but more style than substance”
Reviews.Author: renfrewshire_boy
Reviews.Content: Got off to a bad start - arrived by car to be told that no parking available due to renovation - not mentioned when I booked! Mixed messages from staff meant I drove down and found a space, but was then told I had to leave. Eventually I got to stay after much debate. Then room was not ready and had to wait 30 minutes, but got an upgraded room. Very stylish and very comfortable with high quality fittings but no more practical or comfortable than the Courtyard we'd just left - at a fraction of the price. Shower pressure was poor. Hotel is actually quite a distance from Arc de Triomphe - despite its name! Like many reviewers I used points to stay here, and would certainly not pay the rates quoted. Overall I was a bit disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel helps to make a wonderful vacation”
Reviews.Author: IRCIA
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week's stay in Paris. We would like to extend our many thanks to everyone at the Hilton Arc de Triomphe who made our stay so special. The hotel is in a lovely quiet area of Paris within walking distance to the Arc de Triomphe, the Champs de Elysee, the Parc Monceau and of course to Paris's subway system, the Metro. The room we stayed in on the executive floor was well maintained, clean, spacious (for European hotels) with a very comfortable king size bed, a balcony overlooking the street and a lovely spacious washroom with both a bath and walk-in shower. Checking in and checking out of the hotel was easy. The concierges were excellent. and we'd highly recommend using their services for everything from restaurant suggestions to organizing day trips out of the city. The hotel's gym facilities were excellent, good equipment, clean and well maintained. As Hilton diamond members, we were fortunate to have access to the executive lounge which was attractive, comfortable and provided us with a good selection of food at breakfast and things to nibble on throughout the day. We would like to point out that our experience over the past few years with the Hilton Hotels has been excellent and that, in our opinion, they have one of the best managed "reward" programs out there. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Paris. Merci Hilton Arc de Triomphe.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hilton in Paris, problem at check-in”
Reviews.Author: pikapptcu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of March with my wife and 2 other extended family members. I had reserved a double queen room so we could all stay in the same room. The going rate for this room was 300 euros/night so I was able to redeem my hhonors points for 3 free nights. My one complaint with this hotel has to do with the check-in. We arrived at the hotel around 11am and was informed that our room was ready. So I showed my hhonors award letter and then they tried to charge me an extra 80 euros per night since there were 2 extra adults staying in the room (40/person). I complained and asked to speak with a manager and even showed my reservation confirmation and no where on the confirmation did it say there would be an extra charge for 2 extra adults in the room. The reception made a call to the manager and was quickly told they would waive the charge since I was a Diamond member. I just found this to be deceptive and I figure they try to take advantage of their guests in this manner. I have never had this happen at another Hilton property. I have also noticed this policy with some other hotel chains, but the extra charges were not noted on my reservation confirmation when I booked the room. Just keep an eye out for this at the Hilton in Paris and demand to speak with a manager if they try to charge you the extra fees. Everything else at this hotel was great. Please note it is about a 10 minute walk to the nearest Metro stop. Not very convenient to all the sites, but this is your best Hilton option in Paris to be close enough to the sites. Also note that many of the cafes close tot he hotel close early so your options for a close dinner are limited. It is also about a 15 minute walk to the nearest train station (St Lazare). One great thing I liked about this Hilton is the access to the hhonors lounge. Free drinks (beer, wine, cocktails, coffee) in the evenings along with light snacks (soup, appetizers, chips, cookies, etc). We did some damage in the lounge as it saved us some money on the drinks instead of buying them at the bar downstairs. Easily $100/day. Rooms were clean and spacious for 4 adults. I would stay here again, just keep an eye out for the extra room charges at check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service & Position Made our trip to Paris Perfect thank you”
Reviews.Author: ulladulla
Reviews.Content: We used points and paid extra on arrival for Exec lounge the two 9 year olds treated like royalty free pink Hilton Arc de Triomphe caps for the girls great safe location room service my daughter said 10/10 Concierge the best out there you must use these people to your full advantage in your stay night cruise on the seine everything recommended and booked first class Taxi form CDG easy great safe location we cannot recommend this hotel more highly the best Hotel 5 Weeks in europe

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: IronBird0
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days in September 2010 and had a wonderful stay. The location was convenient to the Arc de Triomphe - maybe a 15 minute walk or so. The rooms were adequate, of course on the small side, as are most European rooms, but the rooms are well appointed and modern. We had access to the Executive Lounge which was nice. Wine and drinks are free and so are light appetizers, which is a nice touch. All in all it was a good stay and I would most certainly go back to this same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best Hiltons”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveller2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 5 nights while visiting Paris on business. Glad I chose the Hilton. Did not get an upgrade to executive floor despite Gold membership, but I did get an upgraded room and was very happy with my stay. Very quiet room facing inner courtyard there are many rooms facing in like this and probably all quiet like mine. Having such a quiet room in Paris is really a lovely thing. Hilton breakfast is one of the better ones includes the usuals but also lovely croissants, crepes, many good fish, cheeses and meets and other fresh things. The main restaurant has a fantastic chef. I ate there my first night mainly because i was too jetlagged to go elsewhere - but the food was so good I kept on coming back on successive nights. One night a friend took me to what was supposed to be a very good trendy bistro in Paris and I found the food no better perhaps not as good as the Hilton chef. And the service was much better at the Hilton (and the atmosphere infinitely better due to space and quiet and ambiance). I found some of the negative reviews of this hotel overly critical. Yes it can be a bit dark but that is mostly due to its art deco decor - moreover the "dark" hallways have rather bright red carpet so I did not find them so dark. Some have mentioned a hard bed - the bed I would describe as "firm" rather than hard. Some prefer this - it is not as soft as the pillowtops found in my US hotels but still I found it quite comfortable and I do not like hard beds. In my opinion, the quietness of the room far outweighed the slight firmness of the mattress. The room came with a very large flat screen TV with working remote. There is a fully equipped and well-maintained fitness center in the basement. There is a large business center also fully equipped and staffed. I never called for room service and would honestly recommend going to the restaurant rather than ordering room service. The concierge and bell people are very helpful I always got a taxi immediately and help with my luggage if I wanted it. The front desk speaks both English and French. I spoke french about 60% of the time in the hotel and English about 40% - mainly when it was too complicated for me to understand well in French or when they greeted me in English. I really love the art deco style of this hotel it is special and distinguishes it from other basic Hilton chain hotels. I would be delighted to stay here again the next time I am in Paris, assuming I can fit it in my budget.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: ecpotash
Reviews.Content: My wife and I satyed there on a recent vacation. We had access to the Executive Lounge, which included free breakfast in the morning and snacks and cocktails in the evening. I casually mentionned that we were there for my wife's brithday and were surprised than the Guest Relations Manager knew exactly who we were when we went to the General Manager's reception. We were even more surprised when we returned to our room on my wife's birthday to find a bottle of champagne and a lovely rose bouquet waiting for us. The entire staff was great and all had a "can do" attitude. Rooms were good sized and immaculate. Loved the rainfall water shower. We will definitely be returning!! Thanks so much to the entire team there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: KAN50
Reviews.Content: This is hotel is outstanding for its service. The people at the registration desk, bell man at the door, concierge, wait staff at the restaurant and housekeeping staff are the main reason this hotel gets very high marks. They were consistently pleasant, friendly, efficient and took care of us well. I even observed while waiting in the lobby how they took care of other people. Even the smallest of request was accommodated with smiling and quick efficiency. The door men were very helpful in hailing taxis outside the hotel for guests and one of them even went far enough to convince a taxi driver who was not very open to taking 4 passengers. The rooms are well appointed and well maintained. The beds were super comfy. Breakfast was excellent with a range of choices including made to order egg omelets and waffles. Personalized attention made it even more pleasant experience when the waiter remembered our specific choices from prior visits. The location was convenient to Metro, several attractions and good restaurants all within short walk. Will definitely stay again and highly recommend to families.

Reviews.Title: “American Hotel that captures the essence of Paris”
Reviews.Author: DrChuck59
Reviews.Content: While I travel around the globe regularly, my wife had yet to visit outside the USA. As a graduation gift and to introduce her to Europe, we did a whirlwind tour of France, Amsterdam and Germany. This was our first stop on our journey. While I typically stay at local, small hotels, I booked Hiltons for the entire trip because (a) I wanted her to have a base she would find comfortable, (b) the online Hilton website is incredibly useful for flexible travel, and (c) as a HHonors member I have grown to trust the Hilton name worldwide. Hilton AdT was no exception. We arrived by bullet-train from Frankfurt. It was MUCH cheaper to fly there 1st class and take a 1st-class seat on the train than to go Heathrow or Charles de Gaul, plus the countryside by train is amazing. I intentionally took the Paris subway for the "atmosphere"; but be forewarned it's a long 3 blocks to the hotel if you miss your stop. <grin> And, of course, one must be aware of the current state of strikes. The hotel is breath-taking. Entering is akin to walking into a museum, except from the moment you arrive there is a lobby aide, bell hop, or service person ready and eager to see to your every need. Checkin took mere minutes. A quick stop at the concierge and we had maps and clear guidance for a walking tour of Paris from the generous and knowledgeble staff. Morning breakfast is, simply put, sumptuous. (And, as an HHonors gold member, it was free.) As in all Hiltons, internet access is readily available with a comprehensive business office and kiosk terminals. The rooms are not large, but well designed and laid out. In typical French fashion, rooms look into the gorgeous courtyard. Every hall and the lobby felt warm and inviting due to the artwork and deep, plush decor. Even the modern elevators had the feel of old Paris. Our bed was amazingly comfortable. Complimentary water is carbonated unless you specify otherwise (as is true for most of Europe). The hotel was immaculately clean despite its old-French feel. In fact, we initially tried to book the Hilton close to the Eiffel tower, but it was full -- we feel we found a much better value at Hilton AdT. Paris is a pedestrian city - driving is only for the locals and brave at heart. From this hotel, the Arc de Triomphe is just 14 minutes walk, and from there it is an easy stroll down the Champs ElysÃ©es to see the Eiffel tower (a must-see at night). Skip the touristy excursion up the Eiffel tower unless you booked dinner reservations a year in advance. Also a must-do is a boat tour on the river Seine. While a dinner boat tour is nice, we found many more romantic opportunities by frequenting the small cafes in the various arondissements and pausing to relax among the gorgeous sculptures of the parks. After visiting Paris, I truly understand why the French surrendered to the Germans... they were protecting their beautiful city! CAUTIONS: Do not, under any circumstances, touch items from the gypsies' displays, or you bought it. Do not give donations or encourage begging. There is a "scam" where the gypsies will drop a gold ring or bracelet for you to discover. If you pick it up, you just bought it at their price. LEAVE IT on the ground. In general, completely ignore the gypsies, even if they talk to you. Paris has about 20 districts, or quarters. Plan on visiting 1 or 2 per day and research the districts well ahead of time. Remember that the Louvre is closed on Tuesdays! HIDDEN GEM: Walk out of the main lobby doors, cross the street and go about 500 feet to your left. At this road, turn right and walk another 200 feet to find several local Parisian cafes with the best local breads, pastries and coffee that Paris has to offer! Dinner was just as fabulous without the expense, need for reservations or the congestion of tourists. Taxis are readily available to take you to any district, but I prefered the subway. Just remember to stay aware of rush hour and interruptions and you'll be fine. (Your hotel concierge will guide you in this regard.) In summary, when we return to Paris (as my wife has declared we will), we will return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a dark and depressing Paris business hotel”
Reviews.Author: foxbat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Arc de Triomphe on March 11. After a friendly greeting everything went downhill. The gloom of the bar was a shocker so I retreated to bed. Not much fun - my first floor room was a dark airless place, found off a never-ending tacky corridor. The big comfy bed was let down by rough sheets. There was a good flat screen TV . There is an in-bath shower with pathetic pressure. Every sound from the ground floor seemed to resonate in my room - bags being rolled, early morning cleaners all made for a sleepless night. Breakfast in the restaurant was good but done so cheaply (paper mats say everything) it had no style. Sorry - I will never return. Please get some white paint, decent furnishings and turn up the water pressure!

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: kalirick
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and staff Not the best location but only a couple blocks from the Metro and once there you get get to anywhere in the city. Staff is extremely polite and helpful and the concierge is among the best I've ever experienced. The Executive lounge is fantastic with plenty of snacks and drinks all day so if you are a Hilton Gold or Diamond member be sure to take advantage of this perk.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay, stunning gem in the hear of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Lisetteki
Reviews.Content: Stunning gem in the heart of Paris. My husband and i went here for our Anniversary. We had booked the presidential suite and it was Amazing! 2 dozen roses and champagne welcomed us to the room and the friedliness of the front desk staff was amazing. The exec. lounge has the most beautiful view from the balcony and is always stocked with my favourite Kir Royal. You truely feel special here. I have been to paris many times but this was one of my favourite places to stay. They recomend all these little local restaurants that I have never heard of. Little french bistros with amazing food and service. There is a really cool bar in the front lobby. Room service was open all night.! This is the place to stay if you are visiting Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: frankieglenda
Reviews.Content: Arrived like drowned rats at this beautiful hotel and greeted by a very helpful and sympathetic member of staff. Luggage was whisked away and sent to our room. Checkin was simple and the whole surrounding took my breath way. Room was beautiful however no tea or coffee making facilities, but maybe thats a Paris thing!! Got a complimentary bottle of champagne and dessert delivered to my room which was wonderful. Mini bar very expensive but it's not nesessary. Overall first class and will defenitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PeterOGStevenageUK
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms on the executive level for one night (Sunday 20th Feb 2011), and would summarise the whole experience as 'most impressive'. The staff were terrific at all levels, even remembering our name, which was a surprise for an international hotel chain. The complimentary drinks and snacks available in the executive lounge were top quality and included alcoholic beverages as well as tea, coffee and soft drinks. Breakfast was also good, with a good selection available. Our rooms on the 5th floor had a nice view of the hotel garden and looked like they had been refurbished recently or were just very well maintained. Everything was spotlessly clean and good attention to detail with complimentary bottled water available in the rooms. The location was ideal, only a few minutes walk from major attractions, or a short taxi ride away. I would definitely recommend this hotel as an outstanding establishment with superb staff and good value for money. I will be booking it again when next visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Tres Bon!”
Reviews.Author: Hellen65
Reviews.Content: Fantastic stay at the Hilton. Private transfer from CDG (Charles de Gauille) cost about Â£40 which didn't take long at all. Booked the executive level - well worth it. Private check-in and drinks including alcohol and snacks free! Tip - take breakfast in the downstairs restaurant rather than on the exec level - get a coupon/voucher from staff in the exec lounge. You have a better selection downstairs. Rooms small, but it is europe. Very comfortable. Couldn't fault it. Good location too, taxi's readily available. Great staff. Restaurant in the hotel is fantastic. Had a blues singer on the Friday night we were there and she was really good.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: printone
Reviews.Content: Burning my hard earned Hilton points in Paris. This is a nice hotel in a good location (nice neighborhood) and the service is very good. The Executive Lounge is excellent for breakfast and pre dinner drink. We just dont have that level of service in the US lounges. If you are Diamond member using points, they give you an "excecutive room" but not the larger ones on the executive floor. I still wonder why they treat their best customers like "second best customers" when they use rewards points. I like Manuel at the concierge desk for restaurant suggestions. He was helpful in sending us to nice places that were resonable priced, where the locals eat and not the overpriced tourist restaurants that kick back to the hotel concierges. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: yorkshirecouple50
Reviews.Content: Great hotel short walk to attractions, staff very helpful reception really good except the girl told us we had a really nice view but we stared straight into the office block opposite! breakfast in main restaurant really special try the smoked salmon and scrambled eggs yum! whenever you passed a member of the staff they all said hello which was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Service OK, needs some refurbishing”
Reviews.Author: missnyc16
Reviews.Content: Check-in went alright. The staff was not too friendly. Hallways had a strong perfume smell and carpeting was tired and needs replacement. Room was large for Paris standards, but Hilton is an american company. The owners lounge had a descent selection, but have seen better at other international Hilton's. Location is OK, located in more of the business district of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: wilhelmina
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed 3 nights in exec suite , room was spacious and clean .Great maxim chocolates for turndown , perfectly presented and staff were friendly and helpful , exec lounge was not the best due to being very busy but still was worth the extra.location was so so , a bit of a walk to the metro charles de Gaule ettoille but it was ok for us.

Reviews.Title: “Neat Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: LuvVacays
Reviews.Content: The area is desolate at night because it is located in the business district. The hotel has a nice bar, staff is very nice and they all spoke English (!) Strange thing is they have music playing in the hallway of my room in the middle of the night, can possibly get loud and disturbing. You must have their croque monsieur from Room Service, thought it was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and great location.”
Reviews.Author: piedmontcamom
Reviews.Content: Once again, not disappointed by Hilton in Europe. The Hilton Arc de Triomphe is in a great location near (well, yeah) the Arc de Triomphe and the Avenue des Champs-Ã‰lysÃ©es. The service was truly excellent. The staff was very kind and attentive to my two small children and had very good advice about what to see and where to eat. We booked a standard double-double plus a crib. It was a little tight but we made do, since the upgrade cost (EU150 per night) was more than we wanted to spend. The beds were excellent and extra pillows were delivered promptly. There was a nice large bathtub and plenty of fluffy towels and bathrobes. We were able to borrow big umbrellas to make our touring more comfortable. We chose not to eat in the hotel, especially not breakfast, due to the price. There is a very good cafe right across the street that serves ham, eggs, croissants, juice, and coffee for EU13. We were quite comfortable, and I will definitely continue to stay in Hiltons.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: rjp82
Reviews.Content: Great stay. Everything about the hotel was terrific. Would absolutely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: TheWags10
Reviews.Content: Just getting around to reviewing this hotel from our May 2010 stay. As the only hotel we stayed at while visiting Paris I am unable to compare it to anything else, but we found the rooms to be quite spacious and well appointed. After hearing from more than one person how small European hotel rooms are, we were pleasantly surprised and quite pleased with our Executive King Room. My only warning is to definitely bring an electric converter if you are coming from the US. I brought an adapter, but should have had a converter to change the actual voltage, my flat iron was a casualty of the French volts :) The location is fantastic - walking distance to the Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysees and very easy to access several metro stops.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Stay!!! Would recommend for everyone!”
Reviews.Author: cbletzacker
Reviews.Content: My family and I booked this hotel on points, and couldn't be happier. We arrived midday, and our room was not ready, but by the time we got to the executive level lounge, the attendant had our keys ready for us. Easiest metro stop to the hotel is the 1, at the arc de triomph stop, and take hooche? avenue until it ends. Excellent complimentary breakfast (for honors members) and service was second to none. Guest relations met us, and directed us to a superb concierge that got us reservations to Tour 58 restaurant and a local private tour guide. (Thank You Manuel). The staff at this hotel made our family feel like the royal family on holiday! We cannot wait to go back to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “VERY over-rated; huge disappointment”
Reviews.Author: gardengirlBoston
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for four nights after having spent 5 nights in London. We arrived late afternoon on a Friday. Were sent immediately to concierge level (husband is Diamond HH) and assigned a suite, an upgrade from the double double we requested to ensure a large room. We pulled our luggage to the room assigned, and 1st thing we noticed was a plate of dirty dishes in front of it, heaped high, not a good sign. Then we entered, or tried to enter, as the cigarette smoke was so intense that I had to cover my nose and try to breathe through my mouth. We backed out of the room, and headed back to the concierge. She suggested using an air purifier (REALLY????) to clear the air. This was supposed to be a non-smoking room- why didn't the maid notify the concierge that there was a problem??? Clean unoccupied rooms apparently were in short supply, so the concierge took us to a room on the 7th floor, room 766. When we checked it out (the concierge was with us), I only remember that it had clean air and a king bed. Being tired, we said okay. After spending a few hours in this room, we found it to be quite small. No storage in the bathroom, barely room to turn around in the bathroom. Teakettle was BEHIND the TV set, making it difficult to access. Half of the bureau was taken up by a small fridge. The next day we requested a room change to the original double double, not caring if we were on a concierge level. None were ready so they asked us to pack our suitcases and leave them in the room. Happily, on our THIRD try we got a decent room on the 3rd floor which had a view of the Eiffel Tower as a bonius. We had access to the EX. lounge. Breakfast was fine, but nothing special. The 3 hot dishes they served never changed, soft scrambled eggs (which I ate), fatty bacon, and overly cooked hash browns (which I didn't eat) Breads were all good. Wait staff and concierge personnel all seemed impersonal and perfunctory. Highlight of the lounge was a terrace where breakfast was enjoyable when the sun was rising. We tried the first night to have dinner at a nearby restaurant but NOTHING was open. As others have said, this hotel is in a business/residential district and there is none of the charm that exists in other parts of Paris. On the 3rd night of our stay as we were getting ready to go to dinner, I went into a sneezing fit- 10 sneezes in a row. Something was bothering my allergies. When we left the room, as we passed the air ducts in the hallway, I made a point of smelling what was coming out.....the odor of perfumed air freshener. When we got home ALL our clothing smelled like the Hilton, so everything had to be washed or dry cleaned. Other reviewers have mentioned mold, one other did mention the chemical smell (read that after the fact, unfortunately). So, I was ill with allergies for ten days after we got back home. Maybe this would not be a problem for some, but anyone with allergies or breathing problems should think twice about booking this hotel. Thank heaven we had the windows open at night which probably delayed my reaction to whatever was being blown into the hallways. BTW, we did not even use Hilton points to stay here. We actually had 4 FREE nights due to frequent stays at Hiltons within a certain time frame. So our bill was ZERO. BUT, I would NEVER stay here again, not even if it were free. .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: ghibb
Reviews.Content: From the welcome amenities to the very courteous staff, who speak fluent english given our lack of french language, this is one of the best hotels internationally we have experienced. The Hilton Molino-Stuckey in Venice is exceptional - but is much more comfortable with its size vs. the Stuckey. My wife and I appreciated the staff's acknowledgement of our attempt at the french language, which was really appreciated. The location is a 15 minute walk to the Arc de Triomphe - you cannot ask for better. Dinner recommendation by Gregory the concierge for New Years Eve couldn't have been any better (Flaubert ) - what a fantastic evening. Highly recommend this Hilton property as I spend over 120 nights a year with Hilton the past 12 years.

Reviews.Title: “Decent american hotel with french influence in the middle of Paris”
Reviews.Author: glamsmile
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Arc de Triomphe Paris is not a hotel that you need to avoid. It is the typical american style hotel in the middle of Paris with french influences. Hot spots are in walking distance (recommended for warm days as weÂ´ve been in december and freezed a little). The hotel and the rooms are in good taste equipped making the stay pleasant. The spa is old and totally out of fashion (i would appreciate that itÂ´s at least 20 years old) but the spa treatments are really good and can be recommended without any hesitation. The breakfast was not bad, but with some deficiencies, like no live preparation of fresh eggs (how it is almost a must in this category), or like the missing horseradish that must go along with the smoked salmon when offered. All in one a good hotel and a good choice!

Reviews.Title: “Happy New Year Paris!”
Reviews.Author: RochelleCarr
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for location and sight seeing opportunities. Beds are hard and extremely uncomfortable. We had to look for massage while there(massage therapists not experienced and definitely not deep tissue) - my arms were numb by mornings the mattress was so firm. Front desk staff amazing, restaurant Le Safran was substandard but referrals from concierge for restaurants were fantastic. Snow Bar at night a treat in the cold weather. Luxury and comfort it's not even close to how it's represented, but for location location location - it's perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great locale! Wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: kiwibird63
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a cold December morning to a beautifully decorated foyer and reception. Friendly reception and easy check-in. We were offered an upgrade which we took as we were travelling with our 20 yr old son. We were upgraded to a family room which ended up being two rooms at the end of a hallway with its own entry. Beautifully appointed rooms with nice art deco touches. Quiet rooms, one backed onto a garden view and the other faced the street. The beds were a little hard for our liking but that's the luck of the draw. The hotel is located perfectly for the Arc de Triomphe, Champs d'Elysses, the Louvre and if you like to walk, Notre Dame. The staff could not have been more friendly. We ate at the hotel restaurant, Le Safran a couple of the nights and the food and service was wonderful. A bit expensive but we were on vacation, so we really didn't care! I would absolutely recommend this hotel for your next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Best Executive Lounge and excellent service. For Paris, large room!”
Reviews.Author: AGrassini
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 6th floor where the executive lounge is located. Check in and check out were completed there though we had to stop at the front desk to get a card key to allow us access to the secure elevator. By far, this is the best executive lounge we have seen!! They set up different snacks and meals during the day--amazing! The room was sparkling clean with art deco style furnishings. Excellent size for Paris with all great amenities (and several plugs!). The staff was friendly and helpful everywhere. Turn down service at night was a bonus we had not expected! As for the location, it is about 10 minutes walk to the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysee. Not too bad if you love walking.. Great to have cabs outside and we were always able to find one when we needed it--even during snowing conditions when all of Paris was shut down! Overall, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TrailBoy
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel to stay at. They have done everything right. The rooms are very nice and clean. Everybody there is friendly, helpful, and knows how to speak English. The only US outlet in my room was by the hair dryer, so bring your own adapters. The hotel restaurant was excellent for both dinner and breakfast buffet. The concierge service is excellent. Their restaurant recommendations were excellent. They book the restaurant for you. All you have to do is show up. You won't be disappointed with their recommendations. I'll just mention a few other side things, which mainly have to do with the perceived disadvantage of the hotel's location. The Courcelles metro station is about a 7 minute walk from the hotel. It's slightly uphill but pretty easy to walk to. However, there is a bus stop (line 84) just outside of the hotel, which I found very handy. Get the subway/bus map from a Metro station. I don't know why the concierge doesn't have a map. It's easier to read the compact paper version than online. The machine reader to validate your Paris Visite ticket is just to your left and behind the bus driver. Or if you still don't know where to validate your ticket, ask the driver nicely in French. You can use your ticket to board through the back door when it's crowded, but you must board through the front if you're paying cash. The only bad thing is that the 84 line does not run on Sundays. The display in the bus and a computerized voice system will tell you when you've reached major destinations in French. Push the red button the tell the bus driver to stop. The bus stops also tell you when the next bus will arrive as well with a digital display. It will also notify you about service disruptions and delays in French. Using the bus in Paris isn't like the US where buses serve a different clientele. I don't really see other hotel guests or tourists using the bus, which is a real shame. Try it. You'll like it. There is a grocery store that is open late on R. de Lisbonne just around the corner from the hotel. I can't remember if they close at 10pm or 11pm but it was still later than the other places. You can also walk to the Arc de Triomphe for late night food, but most restaurants near the tourist spots are not that great and not cheap (watch for places with cheap food prices but outrageous non-alcoholic drink prices). Even the McDonalds there is not cheap. Let the hotel concierge book you at a good place instead. Cab fare from most other parts of Paris is about 10-15 euros at the most (I don't take the bus when going to a nice dinner - LOL). If your cab driver does not know the hotel and is using a GPS, use 57 rue de Courcelles (NOT 51 rue de Courelles). 51 does not take you to the right place. Cab fare is about 45 euros to CDG. 10 Euros from the Eurostar/Gare du Nord station. The hotel is not in the middle of the tourist area, but it is not that far from the metro, bus stops, late night food, late night grocery store, etc. And the hotel itself is very, very nice. Overall, I highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Though wish location were different”
Reviews.Author: DawgmanOH
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Arc d'Triomphe provided our family a fantastic stay for 10 days in late November. My wife and I stayed with our 10 year old daughter and couldn't have been more pleased with the hotel and the treatment from the employees of the hotel. The rooms were large for Paris standard, beds were very comfortable, and the setup of the desk made working at the laptop a breeze. We had access to the Executive Lounge and had fantastic treatment from all of the employees who worked up there. The lounge itself was well stocked and provided a great breakfast and evening meals. They were very polite and considerate to our daughter at all times. The only negative things about the room or the hotel itself would be: * Shower is a typical European shower head (meaning it hangs from a cord so you can take it off and rinse all over). However, it is attached to the side of the wall in the bathroom which can make it hard to actually get under the water for a shower. Nothing major, but an annoyance (my wife used a hair band to force it to stay upright that worked ok). * The location, though absolutely safe, shuts down around 19:00. Not many places immediately around for a bite to eat or anything else. The Champs is about a 15 minute walk away which isn't bad, but after a day of touring, it would be great to have something right close by that stayed open past 19:00 - 20:00. Again, not the hotel's fault, but should be noted. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel and look forward to staying there again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in midst of historic, quiet, upscale neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: nmalitz
Reviews.Content: No hotel can be all things for everyone. This hotel may not be geared for families with small children who want a tour bus out front and souvenir shops close by, but I loved its quiet elegance in a beautiful district of embassies and private dwellings -- you will love the sloping Mansard roofs that one associates instantly with this city. It is, in short, the essence of Paris as it is lived by Parisians of a somewhat upper economic class. The location is a ten-minute walk from the Arc de Triomphe -- at the top of the famous boulevard called the Champs Elysees -- for which this hotel is named. (If you learn this walk on the first day, you will not consider the distance to be a problem.) The hotel is also only two blocks from a good underground Metro stop, and just minutes from two fashionable shopping streets -- Hausmann Boulevard and the Rue du Faubourg Saint-HonorÃ©. The hotel neighborhood is dotted with non-touristy carryout shops, food stores, bakeries, bistros, wine shops and tiny store-front restaurants that allow you to live as the Parisians do. Most of the proprietors are friendly and speak enough English to be helpful. Do not hesitate to take your sandwich to the lovely nearby park, the Parc Monceau, which is surrounded with a running track and filled with sculptures and benches for leisurely contemplation and free Wi-Fi. Also in the immediate neighborhood, the exquisite Jacquemart-Andree Museum, inside an 1875 mansion, filled with the original owners' extraordinary personal collection of Renaissance art and furnishings, great for that first jet-lagged afternoon when you're not yet ready to take on the Louvre. The last Paris hotel that Hilton owned was the Hilton Eiffel Tower, and while it was close to the Eiffel Tower itself, it was also across the river from many of the attractions you will want to see, so I prefer this new location. If you're lucky enough to have lots of Hilton Honors points that qualify you for extras, the executive lounge and the complimentary breakfasts are wonderful perks. But you can also manage quite reasonably for meals in the neighborhood and mingle enjoyably with the locals.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Suites!”
Reviews.Author: TonyMnUK
Reviews.Content: Recently I was treated to a stay here for my 50th Birthday Celebration. The Executive Floor check in was a breeze and the attention to personal details is outstanding. The lounge is one of the best ever, cheerful and helpful staff and wonderful goodies throughout the day. The room/suite is VERY spacious for European hotels. Equipped with 2 baths and 2 closest with a separate sitting room that can be closed off if needed from the bedroom or sleeping area. Since this was a celebration the champagne and cake waiting for us our first night was very thoughtful and delicious! The Purple Bar in the lobby has a great selection of mixed drinks as well. The location is 2 blocks walk from the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elsyees, very convenient!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Great Service! Elegant Surroundings! Love It!”
Reviews.Author: joansue
Reviews.Content: Sisters and daughter arrived prior to our room being ready and they gave us a card for the Executive Lounge. Wow - what a nice surprise! Not only a very comfortable room to lounge in - it had our lunch for the day. Cheeses, Bread, Fruit, small sandwiches, drinks of all kind and sweets. Believe we were offered this as being a Hilton Honors Member. By the time we finished enjoying our lunch our room was ready. There were four of us and we had two very comfortable beds - a very nice room and a great view. Location was great! Very typical Paris and the Paris L Open Tour Bus (Hop-on Hop-off) was only a pleasant walking distance of five blocks - once you know the way it was a breeze. Thank you Hilton for a very pleasant stay. It was especially nice to go to the Executive Lounge after a day of sightseeing... have a few drinks, played some cards, and just enjoyed the atmosphere. Also, save a lot of money as the lounge was open from 7-11 and there was always something there to munch on as well as a hot breakfast. Hopefully, we will go back to Paris as one and a half day was not enough to see what we wanted to see -and the Hilton Arc de Triomphe will be at the top of our list for hotels to stay. Joan Sue

Reviews.Title: “Great location, classy hotel.”
Reviews.Author: FreddyQ
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located 5-10 minutes walk from the Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysees which is the best thing about it. Courcelles metro station is the same distance and the hotel itself is very nice albeit you can't tell from the outside! Excellent service, clean spacey rooms and the Spa is also very good! Nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service! Very happy with hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: IrfanK17
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at this hotel in August 2010. Used Hhonors points for the stay and recieved an upgraded room. The room itself was great, well decorated and a solid size for a European hotel. The best part of this hotel was the staff going out of their way to be helpful, especially the concierge who worked hard to help us rebook our train trips when bad weather canceled our plans to go to Switzerland. The Executive Lounge was nice and saved us a lot of money filling up on breakfast there each morning. The only small downside while we were able to walk to the Arc de Triomphe, Champs Elysees and Louvre, it took some time to walk to those places (especially the Louvre!). Overall I really enjoyed the stay

Reviews.Title: “FAR exceeded my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: bud0430
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many Hiltons and wasn't really sure what to expect about the quality of this hotel and it's convenience for sight-seeing based on other reviews, but the Hilton Arc de Triomphe definitely exceeded my expectations and made our trip to Paris truly fantastic! I have been to Paris 4 times before so I am now aware of how much a good hotel and great concierge service can add to the memorability and overall experience to one's stay in Paris. The Great: The Front Desk Staff - The man checking us in was very, very nice. When we checked in we asked for a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower and were apologetically told that they only had 7 rooms with that view and they weren't available. We booked entirely using our Hilton points so I didn't expect they would be able to accommodate that request. We checked in at 11am or so, and were told they were cleaning our room and to wait up in the Exec Lounge for a bit. After about 10 minutes they delivered our room key and much to our surprise, we had a room on the top (7th) floor with a view of the Eiffel Tour!! It was a wonderful treat to have that view, especially at night when the tower sparkles for a few minutes at the top of each hour. The Room - View aside, the room was great. It was very spacious (and coming from 2 Americans that says something given how small most European hotel rooms are), it was modern and comfortable. There was a big plasma (or LCD) tv, a writing desk by the window, enough room for 2 big suitcases, a large closet and great bathroom with both a bathtub and glass-enclosed shower. I really enjoyed taking a hot bath at the end of a long day of sight-seeing! The King bed was very comfortable (see note below), and I always got a great nights sleep. The housecleaning staff did a great job getting the room back to perfect every day (except there was an unexplainable wet spot on the carpet by the bathroom on our last day, who knows where that came from). The Concierges - We dealt with 3 concierges during our 4 nights stay, and each gave us dinner recommendations that made our dining experience in Paris the most memorable of any vacation I've taken. They told us to go to Pershing Hall, Le Cantine du Faubourg 105, and Barlotti. Each was truly outstanding and exactly what we were looking for in terms of menu and atmosphere. The concierges even made our dinner reservations and then called the restaurant before we arrived to let them know we were coming. This was the best concierge service I've ever had. The Executive Lounge - We have been to many and this is the best one yet - they were open all day through 11pm or so, and had alcohol, wine, beer, champagne, coffee, and snacks available. They had a different menu every 3 hours so it was worth checking the schedule to know what to expect before going up. I believe I read another review where someone complained that they only had 2 types of cheese to offer..... but most normal, reasonable people in the world will be more than happy with all you can eat and drink - again, including French wine and champagne!!! They even had an outdoor seating area where you could catch a breath of fresh air, smoke a cigar or what have you. We didn't use the hotel bar - we used the exec lounge and drank in our room, but it looked nice (if not a little pricey). We also did not use the spa. The one thing not everyone will like - the Location. My boyfriend and I are early 30s and in good shape and were looking forward to doing a lot of walking, so the less than 10 minute walk to the Arc de Triumphe was certainly reasonable. There were a few metro stations very close by that were on the same like as Montmarte and then South near the Eiffel Tour , and there were several cafes, bars and restaurants within easy walking distance. Granted, this hotel isn't exactly on the Champs Elysee, but it sure is close enough. It has the benefit of being on a quiet street so you can get a good nights sleep, and is much more spacious (and less expensive) than comparable hotels that are in slightly better sight-seeing locations. When we took cabs they were never more than 6-9 Euro or so, even when we were over by Notre Dame. Overall - stay here if you are looking for a nice, comfortable stay at a hotel with staff that treat you well and make your trip fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed on points, but....”
Reviews.Author: Dhavekost
Reviews.Content: I would have paid for this hotel either way. It's a nice hotel, very cosmo - great artwork and nice size rooms. My wife and i were only there for two nights, three days - and didn't spend to much time in the hotel....downtown Paris has too much to offer. Room was very nice - but our view was to the inside courtyard.... oh, well. Dinner the first night was at the hotel restaurant - very nice meal, and not too crowded. Dinner with wine was 180E - but well worth it. Very attentive servers. The staff at the hotel was fantastic - with recommendations throughout the stay as to where to have a coffee at different locations at tourist stops. Helped with cabs, luggage, etc. Concierge had great recommendations for dinner and lunches, etc. I would stay there again no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as I expected after reading all the reviews - dissappointed.”
Reviews.Author: jenm_10
Reviews.Content: I read very good rating about this hotel but was a little disappointed. The towels and bath robe were so yellow compared to the facecloths that they looked dirty. I didn't even use the robe. There was a long piece of caulking in the tub area hanging off and much of the hotel was in need of minor repairs. The red bench in the hall was so dusty, you could draw your name in the dust with your finger. The pillows were terrible and there were only 3 tiny ones on a huge bed. There was no top sheet or blankets, just the bottom sheet and duvet. The staff were very nice (except one young man at the concierge desk who couldn't be bothered to even look up at me) and all spoke excellent english. There was one waitress in paticular who made my trip that much more pleasant with her small talk and extra friendly personality. One woman at the concierge desk gave me tons of helpful info and was great. The breakfast buffet was excellent. My room service orders were disappointing, however, and sometimes not what I ordered. Pastries were not available during the evenings and when I ordered hot chocolate, I received a huge tea pot of plain luke warm milk. I had ordered a cesear salad with my meal in the restaurant and the lettuce was all brown so I did not touch it. The waitress asked me if there was a problem with it and I told her yes, it was obviously past prime and she still charged me for it. Food aside, the walk to the nearest metro and bus stop was not far and it was pleasant. I felt safe in this neighborhood. I would not stay there again at this price, however, would if it was cheaper. For all the Hilton's boast about extra special business touches, their hotel was nothing to brag about.

Reviews.Title: “You really need to stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Glick40
Reviews.Content: As an American making my first trip to Paris I have to say it was with a certain degree of anxiousness. I was continually advised before hand how the French would treat us and how rude it will be in Paris. URBAN MYTH!!!! It was gratifying to discover good people all over the world and not fall prey to the misguided apprehensions of others. This hotel is where every American making their first trip should stay. LOCATION GREAT. STAFF PHENOMENAL. ACCOMODATIONS SUPER . And above all the help that was essential for a great visit was understood by all the employees. Paris is a do over which I seldom entertain but what a City. See it on your own and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and quiet”
Reviews.Author: asabella
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful and clean, the location was quiet. A bit far from action. The quad room was big enough. The beds were quite hard though. Basic bathroom amenities. Nothing luxurious about the room, but clean and stylishly decorated.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: Radtrav
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, calm and classy lobby. Our room was large and comfortable. Two double beds, great sleep quality. Nice bath with Evelyn and Crabtree toiletries. Excellent well-stocked breakfast buffet. Restaurant price-y for what one gets. Not all that near to Arc de Triomphe. Not much in the vicinity. Very expensive high speed internet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: jecquest
Reviews.Content: Top of the line hotel, extremely friendly staff, clean, well-appointed rooms. And, they will actually change the towels and sheets daily. Nice sauna/steam room. Good location. Safran Bar is a little pricey for drinks, but we never had more than one.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: LoveWineandTravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights Pre- European Avalon River Cruise and was very satisfied with the quality of our room, the service as well as the cleanliness. Morning Breafast Buffet included and food was excellent with large selection. Front Desk staff very friendly and accomodating.Arrived to Hotel at 10:30A and room not ready, due to large amt of check -outs on Sunday morning. Staff knew we were tired from long overseas flight and tried to expedite getting our accomodations ready quickly. Finally got to our room by 11:30A. Easy walking distance to the Champs Eylsees and nearby Courcelles Metro Stop. Our room faced the interior courtyard. Restaurant and Bar pricey, was charged 8 Euro's for a Diet Coke, my biggest complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Strictly OK stay in Paris, no real complaints but won't be back”
Reviews.Author: BHM_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at other Hiltons in Europe (which were fabulous), this hotel was a let down. Very small rooms in need of renovation, and even though my parents' room was supposed to be a non-smoking room, it was clear there had been smokers there before. Overall, this is in a very good location for walking. Easy access to Metro, the Champs Elysee, Arc de Triomphe, etc. The staff was very nice and accomodating when we made requests (e.g., they brought us extra pillows and towels, they put a device in my parents' room that helped the smoke smell subside, etc). Also, the concierge staff were very friendly and helpful. There is a well-stocked little market and boulangerie a few blocks away on the Rue de Lisbonne, and a nice little cafe across the street, which is a good spot for a drink. Thankfully, we were staying here with Hilton points. Had we been paying, this would have been much more disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: ams507
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Arc de Triomphe in Paris is a wonderful Hilton Property. We stayed for 8 nights. Because of my Hilton Diamond Status, we were told to check in at the Executive Lounge. The lounge staff were quick and friendly. We were upgraded and given a beautifully decorated and spacious room. The room and bathroom were very clean. The executive lounge had wonderful snacks. The location is off the beaten path. For us we loved the location. We LOVE to walk. We walked everywhere, The Eiffel Tower, The Louvre etc. For the non walkers, the hotel is near the metro or you can take a taxi to wherever you want to go. The hotel is near plenty of restaurants. The neighborhood is quiet and peaceful. We would definitely recommend and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It was just fine -”
Reviews.Author: kgalli9544
Reviews.Content: Location was OK...walking distance to metro and restaurants. Our room wasn't anything special...it was very clean, but the beds weren't the most comfortable and the bathroom setup was awkward. Service was very good and we really enjoyed the end to our evenings at the Purple Bar. Can't really complain, I was in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: probativev
