Reviews.Content: For a Hilton hotel experience, this hotel is above average. Very pretty and nicely decorated although a bit old. Nice size bathroom (love that they offer Crabtree & Evelyn bath products in all their hotels everywhere). Very comfortable bed. Good amenities in the Executive lounge. Concierge REALLY helpful. A very cute courtyard. The lady at the business office is really nice and helpful too. The radio alarm clock with 5 buttons for automatic loop on specific music genre was a very nice touch. A bit far from metro but there are always taxis right outside of the hotel (this is important since I found it quite hard to get a taxi in Paris and other placces I've been in France during this trip).

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: klfield
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel from 2/27 through 3/6, and had a wonderful experience. We had two standard king rooms. The rooms were comfortable and very clean. Very nice bathrooms. It was my mother's 70th birthday trip and she was surprised our first night with flowers and a wonderful dessert in her room. The staff was extremely helpful and professional. We spoke very little French, but the staff was profficient in English. The restaurant and bar were nice and the food was quite good, although a little expensive. We had breakfast in the dining room twice and dinner once. Room service for breakfast good and a better deal than breakfast in the dining room. Excellent waiter for dinner in the dining room, and great desserts. The hotel location is pretty good. Although it is not a main throughfare, it is near the metro and short walk to restaurants, near the lovely Parc Monceau, The immediate neighborhood is not touristy, so the hotel is quite quiet and peaceful. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is at the top of world class”
Reviews.Author: Just_a_normal_person
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights with my wife and 3 year old in September 2010 using HHonors points and it was a fantastic experience. Due to being a Hilton Gold member we got the breakfast for free which would otherwise have been 33 euros per person, per day. It was the most amazing breakfast and amazing service I have experienced in the western world. If you live in Paris and want a treat for a weekend brunch, I recommend coming here. As for the rooms - the beds are so comfortable you won't want to leave. Here's my tips for the hotel: 1) Ask for a room that doesn't have a connecting door to the adjacent room. We stayed in one for the first night and it was very noisy so we changed rooms. 2) If you have kids and need them to take naps, discuss with housekeeping when your room will be cleaned. Thy started the cleanings at 9am and finished at 5pm. Our room was always scheduled around 4pm for cleaning. 3) Business Center is free for Hilton Gold members, otherwise it's pricey. 4) Internet is free for Hilton Gold members, otherwise it's pricey. 5) If you're staying here for 2 or more nights then it would be a wise decision to pay the annual fee for the American Express Hilton Card that gives you Gold membership before you go. 6) The bar and restaurant are expensive. **7**) If you usually use Hilton Status for an upgrade to the executive floor, just this one time, turn it down and opt for the complimentary breakfast vouchers instead - just trust me on this one!

Reviews.Title: “Made the difference in our visit”
Reviews.Author: ReneB
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough wonderful things about this hotel the staff was wonderful and very helpful with train reservations and dinner suggestions and reservations. The concierge was one of the best. The lounge was very nice, and the staff helpful. The only down point would be the eggs, they were undercooked. The bar should serve food later than 11 pm This hotel turned my view of Paris from negative to positive, I hope to get back soon and stay for a week.

Reviews.Title: “OK but expensive”
Reviews.Author: WinifredD
Reviews.Content: Paris is expensive and so is accommodation. The room was an executive double and was average size but this is normal in Paris. The breakfast we negotiated to be included in the overall price and boy was it worth it. It was fabulous - a buffet with fruit, cereals, salad, grill, pancakes and lots of yummy croissants and breads. Staff were lovely and the concierge was very helpful. They have a small Thalospa with a steamroom and jacuzzi. Not many people in it so even though its small, its fine. There is a gym also (small also but fine) and they have the usual massages etc. Connection to the internet is not free ... costs about 8.50 per hour or you can buy a 24 hour connection for approx. 24 Euro. Get a good map of Paris .. there are lots of tiny streets and you can get lost easily. The locals are not good at giving directions so you are on your own! Taxis are relatively cheap. The tour bus which you will see around the city, is a good way to introduce you to all the sites and stops outside the key attractions - its about 40 Euro per person and is 2 hours all in but you can hop on and off and the pass lasts for 2 days. The Louvre Art Gallery is spectacular ... the architecture (if you are in to it) is just amazing on the outside. It's huge inside ... get a map when you go in or you will be looking for 'Mona' all day. You can easily see Paris in 2 days. Restaurants are expensive and drink is also. You can find supermarkets that are reasonable. Beauvais airport is about 1 hour and 15 mins from Paris and you catch a bus outside the airport. Bring a very comfortable pair of shoes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in quiet area”
Reviews.Author: esh9953
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in April of 2009. My wife and I stayed for a total of eight (8) nights and we stayed for free with Hilton Honors points. The hotel location was great, kind of in the business district so it was relatively quite and easy going. There are a ton of places to eat within walking distance and the metro is only 5 minutes away. The concierge was awesome and spoke great English. He was always our go to guy for restaurant information and he seemed to know a great deal about all the places to eat in the area. We did not eat at the hotel as it was probably too expensive for us. Instead we just slipped off to a local cafe each morning for a quiet breakfast. We were first put on a room on the second floor right above the kitchen and it was very loud. We requested to be moved and were accommodated immediately. The new room was very quite. The rooms were a good size (especially for a European hotel) and kept clean. It was nice to be able to relax in a spacious room after a long day of tourism. I really liked this hotel and will definitely stay here again if ever in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Most frustrating hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: tommyp
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 â€œdouble doubleâ€� executive rooms with balconies, including breakfast and evening meal on the first night via the Hilton central reservations site by phone on the morning of our stay. We chose this hotel based on the mainly good reviews on Tripadvisor, an excellent stay at the Hilton Waldorf, London in Oct 2009, and the fact that the rooms both had two double beds in them. As a family of five we always have to book 2 rooms in Europe and even then our daughter usually has to sleep on a roll up bed. By booking double doubles we thought that we would enjoy a bit of luxury on the last two nights of a 3 week holiday that we had mainly spent staying in a mobile home in Italy. On arrival the doormen were friendly and helpful and reception found our reservation promptly and directed us to the dedicated executive level check-in on the 6th floor. It was all downhill from here! We stood in the lift pressing the 6th floor button but nothing happened so we got out and got in another lift but this one did not move either. A member of staff then got in and rather huffily showed us that we had to swipe our key in the lift after pressing the 6th floor button otherwise nothing happens, why was this not mentioned at reception? On the 6th floor my husband tried to check in and it then transpired that there were no double double rooms available even though we had booked these that morning! We were instead given a suite and a standard double on the 2nd floor â€“ not very convenient for the executive lounge and definitely not what we booked. The executive lounge manager described this as an upgrade, but while the suite probably was an upgrade, our double was definitely a down grade and neither room had a balcony. The suite had a bedroom, a sitting room and 2 bathrooms. However, this room was for the children and so, as usual, my daughter ended up sleeping on the sofa bed which was not put away by housekeeping for the duration of our stay. Our double room was a reasonable size (although not as big as a double double!) and was nicely decorated. However, it had numerous faults, there was a noise of constant dripping water from the toilet which we reported to maintenance. It was fixed quickly but the repair lasted about 10 minutes, in the end I repaired it myself! There were no tea & coffee making facilities in our room, we had to borrow them from the suite. No hairdryer â€“ again we had to borrow from the suite, the bathroom was very small so when the bathrobe was hanging up it was practically dangling in the toilet. The beds were not particularly comfortable and we did not get a turndown service on either night although the suite (immediately next door) did! No chocolate Eiffel towers for us! The housekeeping was probably the worst we have had in any hotel, it was difficult to tell if the room had been cleaned or not and tea, coffee and toiletries were not replaced. The TV lost the picture approx every 10 mins for about 30 seconds each time which was infuriating. We took the included dinner on the first night in the terrace restaurant, again the matter of some debate as the hotel did not have a record of this offer! We were provided with vouchers that entitled us to a varied and interesting menu, with further choices available for a few extra euros. The food was excellent as was the service. The next morning we went down to the main breakfast room to be interegated as to whether we wanted the buffet breakfast or the full breakfast, and if we had breakfast included had we brought our vouchers with us? What vouchers for goodness sake! This hotel is obsessed with vouchers! Surely a four star hotel can see who has booked what without resorting to a vouchers system that would only work if they gave their guests the relevant vouchers in the first place! We said that our vouchers were in our room and we would bring them down for inspection later (no chance!) and were allowed into the breakfast room where the buffet breakfast and the full breakfast appeared to be the same anyway! There was plenty of choice although a few of the items, particularly the pancakes, took a long time to be replaced. Cooked items such as bacon, mushrooms and rather perculiar chicken sausages were available on the buffet so the mystery of what constituted a full breakfast will never be solved! Around lunchtime we returned to the hotel for the lunch snacks served in the executive lounge. We had just helped ourselves to a few sandwiches, cruditÃ©s etc when we were informed by the lounge attendant that children under 12 were not allowed in the 6th floor executive lounge but were instead requested to use the â€œfamilyâ€� executive lounge! We were not told this when we booked (we had used the executive lounge at the Hilton Waldorf London for 4 days without any problems and assumed that the facility would be the same in Paris) or when we checked in at the executive lounge, and it was not mentioned in the printed executive lounge information sheet given to us on arrival detailing the opening hours of the lounge etc. In fact the only place this was mentioned was in small type on a notice by the door of the lounge. Our youngest child is 10 and the other two are 12 and 16, all they wanted to do was have something to eat and read the lounge newspapers, why were we embarrassed and told to use the family lounge in future? Later in the afternoon we decided to give the family lounge a go. This turned out to be a conference room with tables and chairs laid out a bit like a school dining hall. There was one sofa and a couple of easy chairs and a TV showing what appeared to be a horror film! In one area of the room were a few plastic slides, plastic toddler toys etc. It reminded me of going to play groups which I had not been too for at least 7 years and really did not want to be forced to go to when paying four star prices for supposedly executive lounge perks! The food was fairly mediocre, there was soup â€“ or rather a empty soup tureen which did not get refilled the whole time we were in the lounge, and pasta with a tomato based sauce. I helped myself to the pasta only to find there was no sauce, I waited at least 10 minutes for the sauce to be replenished, by which time my pasta was cold, I went to get some pasta and of course there was none left! My husband decided to voice his complaints to the guest relations manager. He listened politely, agreed that these things should not be happening in a four star hotel and said he would send a bottle of champagne and drinks for the children up to our room to try and make amends. While this was a nice gesture I would have rather had what I thought I had booked in the first place â€“ 2 double doubles, a balcony and a relaxing executive lounge. When the drinks arrived there were only 2 drinks and 2 glasses for 3 children! On Sunday morning my husband decided to go and settle the bill before breakfast to try and avoid the rush. He discovered that the hotel were trying to charge us for the full cost of the first nights meal as, yet again, they had no record of the meal inclusive rate. The clerk said that he needed to go and check all the restaurant receipts for that night and if he could find a signed receipt for the full amount we would have to pay! My husband said for him to go ahead as he was not in any rush and he wouldnâ€™t be able to find one!. After 5 minutes the clerk had to admit defeat. In conclusion, after the many good reviews on this site about this hotel, we were disappointed with everything apart from the restaurant and its staff and the doormen. There was nothing â€œexecutiveâ€� about our stay and we would certainly not recommend the â€œexecutiveâ€� level to families with children older than 5 because, apart from a bit of mediocre food, there is no advantage to paying â€œexecutiveâ€� rates to attend a childrenâ€™s playgroup. This really must be highlighted when booking. We certainly wonâ€™t be returning and we would hesitate to book another Hilton hotel. Sorry Hilton, we are off to New York and Washington in October and wonâ€™t be staying with you!

Reviews.Title: “A bit off the beaten path, but service makes up for it”
Reviews.Author: FlyStayEat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights using Hilton Points. We are gold members, but since an executive floor room was unavailable we were given free breakfast for 2 nights in its place. The breakfast, by the way, was great although I wouldn't pay for it if it wasn't free. When we arrived we were greeted by name with a handshake. Our room wasn't yet available, so we were given drink tickets to the bar while we waited. It was only a short wait. The room was quite nice, although I have been in rooms with more amenities (TVs, channels, toiletries, etc). We had a problem with our smoke detector in that the shower steam set it off, but someone came immediately to check it out and shut it off. The location is a bit off the beaten path, but the metro is just a couple minute walk and will take you literally anywhere you need to go. Why anyone would use a taxi, I don't know.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel, okay location”
Reviews.Author: certamenator
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this hotel. Our room was very comfortable and well-equipped, with a view of the courtyard garden. The staff was excellent and very friendly. We were given free maps, and a concierge helped us with all our sightseeing questions (e.g. where to see the Bastille Day fireworks from). When the staff found out we were there on our honeymoon, they brought us cake and champagne with a card. We didn't eat in the very expensive restaurant -- there are many cheaper options nearby. The business center is okay, but the internet price is steep. The hotel's location is a little remote. There is a metro stop nearby, and the hotel is two stops away from the Arc de Triomphe. Right near the hotel is a gorgeous park ("Parc Monceau") with a pond, landscaping, and statues. We ate a picnic dinner there several times. This hotel is a good choice for either business or pleasure excursions. Very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and grat staff!”
Reviews.Author: MariaLovesToTravel
Reviews.Content: I know the review is a little outdated as we stayed at this hotel last December (29/12-31/12) but better late than never! We arrived at the hotel after a 4 night stay at Disneyland, so my two girls as expected were very sad for leaving Disney and with a very bad mood. I have to say that before making the booking (3 months in advance) i joined the hilton honnors program and i booked a family room with two queen beds. I also had requested a high floor and non-smoking. As soon as we approached the check-in counter the girl who was behind (after giving her our reservation details and member card) smiled and said. Well he have two surprises for you today. First surprise was two very nice presents for my girls, appropriate for their age each, and wrapped in beautiful christmas papers. Before we had the time to thank her she said and now the second surprise is that because we were not able to honor your request for a high floor and a view we are upgrading you to a lovely two room suite with club access!! We were ecstatic, my husband kept asking if they're going to ask us to pay the difference, but no it was all complimentary. I am sorry i don't remember the name of that sweet girl at check in but i am very thankful to however took the decision to upgrade as, as this made the rest of our trip to Paris so special. The suite was on the first floor and had an inner courtyard view (beautifully decorated for Christmas) and it was stunning! Two separate rooms with a door in between, one was the main bedroom with huge and comfy king size bed and it's own private bathroom (bathtub and shower and every toiletry you could imagine, even bath salts) and the other room had a double sofa bed, with it's own bathroom too, two huge plasma tv's in each room, bathrobes and slippers of very high quality for the whole family, of course they offered turn down service with chocolate, i don't think i've stayed or will ever stay in a more plush or luxurious hotel room and i'm glad my girls had the chance to experience that too! Very good lounge with yummy offerings, they even invited us the other evening to a cocktail party held for the hilton honnors member. The breakfast buffet in the restaurant was of a very high quality (fresh orange juice of course served to your table) and cooked to order omelettes and waffles and french toast.. The lobby was stunning and the smell when entering the hotel was divine. To me that was certainly a five star hotel. The concierge was very helpful, giving us instructions to go to Notre Dame and recommending good restaurants. Also there was a very nice guy at the club lounge (sorry i don't remember his name, only that he was from african origin and very handsome, lol), and at an occasion when we asked him one night if we could see the eiffel tower blinking from the club lounge, as we wanted to show our girls, he said no i'm sorry the eiffel tower is not visible from here, but please could you follow me, he escorted us to the presidential suite which was empty at that moment, showed us the way to the balcony where the eiffel tower was clearly visible and said, you can sit here as long as you wish to see the eiffel tower blinking, i couldn't beleive his kindness and many thanks to him for his wonderful gesture! Yes the location was not the most central, but it was a nice 15min walk to Champs Elysees and the metro station was just 6-7 minutes away. Thank you Hilton for making our short Paris stay unforgettable (even if we were first time visitors and new members of the loyalty program)!

Reviews.Title: “Location a little out of the way but delightful hotel”
Reviews.Author: MichaelZLA
Reviews.Content: If you want someplace smack in the middle of all the Paris sights, this is not it. If you want a taste of Paris in your accomodations, also probably not it. Instead, this is a very comfortable American hotel with lots of amenities and extra room you wouldn't find in a typical Parisian hotel. However, while being a couple blocks from one Metro line and a few from another, it is not really close to many Paris tourist hot spots. The Arc is even a good 15 minute walk. But this is a business hotel in a business area so if you want a quiet, comfortable place to stay, this is it. Just don't be frightened when late in the evening and on Sunday, it's a ghost town. Used the business center(great service), same with the concierge, the bar being open late was a nice plus(especially when there's nothing in the neighborhood open), room service was very friendly and convenient but expensive(what in Paris isn't). Overall, very happy with the hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and holiday, but some points of improval”
Reviews.Author: Familiyguy4Fun
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel experience, but still some points of improval: On the upside: - Effective check in and out - Very friendly concierge - Nice breakfast On the downside: - Rooms smaller than expected - Just a bit to long to walk to the Champs Elysee and the Arc the Triomphe to justify the location name. - Strange service attitude of some of the staff Plus experience: The very nice local park, Parc Monceau, just three minutes from the hotel: Walks recommended on sunny days, a miniature Central Park, but with beautiful people and no robbers. The hotel should market this more to their guests. Odd experience: We checked in on a friday and saw that there were champane glasses (flutes) in the room. We bought a bottle of champane in the local shop to enjoy the day after. When the time came to enjoy it the glasses were gone (?!), the only thing left was one milk glass. When we went outside the room and asked the cleaing staff for new glasses they told us to go down to reception for this. Not very service minded to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: teddyrex
Reviews.Content: We spent ten nights (19 - 29 June 2010) at the Arc de Triomphe Hilton to celebrate our anniversary. I am Hilton HHonors Diamond and we used HH points for the stay. I advised the hotel ahead of time of the occasion and received a delightful response from the General Manager's Personal Assistant, Mira Kirov (whom we later met and she was as delightful in person). She arranged a beautiful room on the top floor with a terrace and view of the Eiffel Tower for us which was just great! The hotel, rather ugly outside and a little out of the way for the casual tourist, is absolutely stunning inside! It is beautifully decorated throughout in an Art Deco style (Erte prints decorate the rooms and hallways) with lots of red velvet, black laquered furniture, etc. The staff all spoke English and genuinely tried to be charming and helpful - quite a change from our last visit to Paris ten years ago! A terrific buffet breakfast was included and we could have eaten in the Executive Lounge which was very nice but usually crowded - it seemed to serve something to eat all day long. We ate dinner three nights in the hotel's Saffron restaurant - once inside and twice on the lovely terrace ( one night with a three piece band and a very good vocalist). All three dinners were delicious, beautifully served and (especially for Paris!) decently priced. The concierge desk was very helpful, the bellmen and doormen very pleasant and efficient and the whole hotel seemed to run like a well-oiled machine. The only thing about the hotel that is less than perfect is the location. The name is a bit of a misnomer as it is quite a walk to the Arc de Triomphe at the Place Charles De Gaulle and it is not an interesting walk - a number of short residential streets with really nothing to look at until reaching the Faubourg St. Honore or the Champs Elysees. The Parc Monceau is close by but really holds no attraction - sadly it seems to be populated with homeless people. We were told it was safe but it was not pleasant to walk, much less sit, in the park. We found no walking-distance restaurants for a nice lunch or dinner, but taxis are easily available from the hotel's doorman and are not as expensive as in other European cities. In summary, the Arc de Triomphe Hilton is a delight! We could not have been treated better and our stay there certainly made our anniversary celebration tres magnifique! Merci, Hilton!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Holnek
Reviews.Content: We had a layover in Paris and decided to stay here. My goodness what a pleasant surprise, and we are so glad we chose to stay at this hotel! Pros: Excellent service - they really went out of their way to make you feel special and welcomed at their hotel, regardless of how busy they are Hotel itself - very clean, grand, and nice looking hotel Location - super close to the Avenue des Champs and Arc de Triomphe Convenience - cabs are always waiting outside, convenient/fast access to the subway, easy walk to just about anywhere Food/lounge - if you stay at the club floor, take advantage of the 7 am to 11 pm lounge. They serve breakfast, lunch, snacks, dinner, drinks, and dessert there - all throughout the day for you to enjoy! What an excellent deal, and the quality of food/drinks is pretty surprisingly good. So why four stars? I would rate it 4 1/2 stars really, but there were just a few small things that turned me off sightly. Cons: Hotel corridors - the hallways and corridors to the rooms looked dark, and the carpet or color just made it look dirty. I wasn't too impressed when walking to my room Rooms - We got an upgraded club floor king room with a terrace - good sized room, and the terrace is great if you like to enjoy some fresh air. However, the ad on the Hilton website claims an Eiffel Tower view - my terrace only looked out to the adjacent office building...not exactly what I had in mind. Overall, this is an awesome hotel, and I'd definitely stay here again. There were just a few minor things that would've made this a perfect stay, but that's about it.

Reviews.Title: “Partial Perfect for Paris”
Reviews.Author: GD331
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel. 42E ride from CDG airport. The rooms are very nice and clean. The beds are the worst of any Hilton I have ever stayed. Hard as a rock. The executive louge is nice. Food is very expensive in the restaurant. 21E hamburger. It is a three block walk to metro. Lot of points for a Hilton of this caliber. Location is the only reason to use this hotel with points.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: lalawoman
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our three children. Rooms are spacious and updated. Beds are very comfortable. Breakfast is awesome! We ate dinner there too and the food was great, although pricey. Abdoulaye, our waiter, was wonderful, as was Sarah, the breakfast hostess. The concierge staff was helpful but not too knowledgeable -- they gave us the wrong information on concert tickets and weren't too helpful with restaurants. If you know where you're going, they can make the reservation for you but you can do that yourself. It is far from everything and we're not sure we'll stay there again but then again the rooms are so nice that it might be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “My 2nd stay at this hotel and would come...”
Reviews.Author: traveltweet
Reviews.Content: My 2nd stay at this hotel and would come back if I am around

Reviews.Title: “RESERVATION: MISSION IMPOSSIBLE”
Reviews.Author: pierre8453
Reviews.Content: saturday 3PM HONG KONG TIME - 9 AM PARIS TIME i call for a reservation: the service is closed and i am rerouted to a "CENTRAL" - a call center out of FRANCE : they first ask mee if a mean "paris in Egypt" ? they if i mean Hilton Roissy Airport it lasts 20 mn ( from hong kong!!) i call back the hotel , saying it 's unconceivable that ,at 9 AM, in a 5 stars hotel, it's impossible to get anybody to take a reservaytion.. and they reroute me again to this "CENTRA3" out of France, who does not seem to even belong to HILTON , since they offer me other chain.. where is Going "la France, where is going Hilton? 800 $ a room !!!! they can't pay somebody to take care of customers a saturday at 9 am ?????

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and a bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: Trotter41
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the staff and facilities, especially the executive lounge. The room was large and well furnished, and the bathroom had separate shower and bathtub. Employees were friendly and helpful. However, the location is in a quiet upscale residential neighbourhood, and in August everything was closed: restaurants, cafees, shops. It is possible to walk to the Arc de Triomphe, but you are basically dependant on metro or subway to get anywhere. On my next visit to Paris I will stay somewhere else, simply to avoid all the travelling.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable”
Reviews.Author: Dreamlifter
Reviews.Content: great location, good service thoughout the hotel, if staying in Paris this is the perfect hotel to stay in

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for trip to paris”
Reviews.Author: palmer85
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hilton for 5 nights. Although a little way from the centre, the Metro is only about 2 blocks down the street. The room was clean and spacious with elegantly styled furniture. We only ate breakfast there - but the food was of a high standard. The staff were professional and helpful. All in all, a fine hotel though not that cheap.

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: gskidsdoc
Reviews.Content: stayed early august for 1 night as a layover for another destination. very nice clean hotel with comfortable rooms. very comfortable beds and clean comfortable bathroom. hotel staff was very friendlty. concierge , on some level, helped avoid a disaster. impatient taxi driver sped off with my small bag still in car; bag held passports and many other vital items. aside from being sympathetic, concierge was very helpful in making phone calls to various taxi companies, and giving us advice and direction in a "panic" moment. eventually it was returned thanks to at least one honest taxi driver. not sure where the previous reviewer got hotel breakfast but this was something i couldn't find, other than the 26 Euro continental room service breakfast. not having a quick breakfast on location was going to be my only complaint. would highly recommend this very nice but somewhat pricey hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: playabum
Reviews.Content: We visited Paris and stayed at this hotel for three nights during a European trip, which was not nearly enough time to see all of the great sites of this city. The hotel staff was very friendly, as was everyone we encountered during our stay in Paris. We made an effort to use French when we could, but everyone usually responded to us in English - I guess our French is pretty bad. Since Paris is really spread out, the location of this hotel is not too bad - the Courcelles subway entrance is a two or three minute walk and we used the subway regularly to get around if we wanted to save some wear and tear on our feet. It is probably a 10 minute walk to Champs Elysees or the Arc de Triomphe. We booked a king room through Orbitz and prepaid to get a good discount, which included breakfast daily. We didn't know if including the breakfast would be worth it, but we saw that if charged separately, it was â‚¬33 per person for the breakfast, so if you can get the breakfast included, it's worth it. The food selection and quality was very good. The room was spacious, but we were on the first floor, so we didn't have any view. The bathroom amenities are what would be expected of a Hilton, however the bathroom magnification mirror was situated at the waist level, which was very awkward. Also, the bathroom did not have any plugs for using a hair dryer or other bathroom appliances. There was one plug outside the bathroom door, which was close enough to the mirrored closet door to use appliances, but that was also awkward. Closet and drawer space was ample. Room service and internet fees were expensive, as are most things in Europe, but I was able to connect to the Boingo service I subscribed to before leaving the US, so I did not incur their fees. All in all, we would stay at this hotel again if we visit Paris in the future.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: Akeastridge
Reviews.Content: The Hilton was very traveler-friendly. Extremly conveinent location right between 2 metro stops and very close to the Trocadero. Conceirge and front desk staff were fluent in 2-3 languages and were very helpful. Nice business center with internet access. Large rooms, for Europe that is.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Nice Facilities”
Reviews.Author: dsweet
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel was the best we have seen in Paris, including the Park Hyatt Vendome, a much more expensive hotel. Our requests were generally responded to within 5 minutes, often less. The facilities were good, with rooms on the executive floor large by Paris standards, comfortable by US standards. The bed was very comfortable, although the pillows a bullet hard, a Paris tradition. The club met our needs, offering a passable breakfast, although it was a bit crowded. The staff clearing tables, getting coffee etc. worked very hard and were very nice. The lounge concierges could have been a bit friendlier, but were knowledgeable. We found the walk to the Champs to be less than 10 minutes, and enjoyed the quiet of the hotel. While some find the hotel to be out of the way, even in the rain we found the quiet to be of greater benefit. We found during our stay that the Parc Monceau, a public park just two blocks from the hotel, has free wifi. We were therefore able to avoid the amazingly high internet charges that seem to be in place all over Europe. I would efinitely stay haere again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxe accomodations in the City Of Lights”
Reviews.Author: SOBE1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here to celebrate her birthday. As frequent visitors to Paris we were familiar with the hotel's location and it was fine. It is a large hotel. It is well maintained and updated. For those who mind the short 10 minute walk to the Champs I say Paris may not be the city for you anyway.To walk in Paris is to live. It is 3 blocks from the metro in a quiet affluent residential area of the 8arr. Parc Monceau is a delightful park basically across the street from the hotel. The public areas are impressive as is the purple bar . We had access to the executive lounge which provided breakfast, light snacks thoughout the day and light dinner. Also wine and later champagne is there to enjoy on the terrace outside. The rooms are large for Parisian standards with a nice marble bathroom and deep tub. All in all I could find no faults with our stay. Luxury room and bedding, luxury bathroom and nice bar and public areas. American luxury standards in Paris. If you are looking for a french hotel vibe, this is not the place, but the hotel is a very nice place to hang your hat while in Paris, my favorite world city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mawota
Reviews.Content: Would stay at this Hilton again - had a great stay in a Executive-Room with a furnished balcony and a view to Tour Eiffel - GREAT! Quiet location in a very good part of the City, here is the money. Staff is very helpful and friendly - not even found in other Hotels in Paris. Executive Lounge was one of the best we ever had - quiet, elegant, good food and a large balcony. Well worth extra money for executive rooms - especialy with an eiffel-view

Reviews.Title: “Everything You Could Have Asked For”
Reviews.Author: travelgeek222
Reviews.Content: You are welcomed to the wonderful hotel with a beautiful lobby and comforting front desk staff. We got Executive Lounge Access, which covers all your dinners and breakfasts. In addition, we got full spa access, and a room upgrade to the family suite, which is the second largest room in the hotel. Housekeeping provided complementary Parisian chocolates and water throughout the stay, with 2 cleanings everyday + a nightly turndown. The front desk staff was incredibly knowledgeable and continuously welcoming. The hotel was only a 5 minutes walk away from the Arc de Triomphe, as it is to Champes EllysÃ©. It also has a metro station pretty much right outside the door. = Anyhow, don't judge this hotel by it's website. Reality will surprise you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but location is a little out of the way for my taste”
Reviews.Author: MCCAD
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights the first of August using Honors points, I am Hilton Honors Diamond member. Although I received access to their Executive Lounge, my room was not upgraded and was thus very small for 2 adults and a teenager. Further complicating things is the fact that many Hiltons outside the U.S. will not allow you to book 3 people in a room when using points. As a result, the first night we had only 1 bed and I slept on the floor. The hotel redeemed itself by supplying a roll-away bed for the balance of the stay at no charge. Room was still small for 2 people with limited closet and drawer space for an extended stay. Our room was clean and appeared to have been recently upgraded with a flat-screen TV and good lighting. I would say that having access to the Executive Lounge saved this hotel for us. Having access to free breakfast, afternoon drinks and snacks, and evening cocktails saves an enormous amount of money in a city like Paris. That being said, charging 21 Euro for 24 hours of Internet service in the Executive Lounge is insulting. Personally, I didn't care for the location as it was a 10 minute walk to the nearest Metro station and 15 minutes to the Champs d'Elysees. For some lazy Los Angelenos that don't walk much, this wasn't very convenient. Furthermore, we couldn't find a lot of places to eat close by the hotel. On the plus side, we found the location and hotel in general to be very quiet which made for restful evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent if not very Parisian”
Reviews.Author: james_patching
Reviews.Content: Three features make this hotel stand out â€“ excellent food (not that they could get away with anything else in central Paris), friendly and helpful staff and a superb location. Of course, it being the Hilton, you sometimes forget youâ€™re even in France as it is a hotel with the international businessman / family in mind so it lacks the kind of character youâ€™re likely to get at smaller Parisian establishments. But if youâ€™re looking for the security of good food, comfortable rooms, central location then this is the place to come.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel and outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: mlove17
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had an incredible experience with this hotel. I'm not sure why so many people gave it bad reviews in terms of service, because we experienced the best in Paris. Perhaps it was because we didn't feel entitled to it, and came for our honeymoon "splurging" on one night here. When the staff found out it was our honeymoon (we are HHonors members as well), they surprised us by upgrading us from a standard room to the Presidential Suite. We felt like we were living in the lap of luxury! The executive suites receive complimentary breakfast in the lounge as well as drinks and food running all evening long. It was nice to take a break and eat privately with other guests in the lounge, and relax during our hectic Paris honeymoon. The staff charged our camera battery in their outlet behind the front desk, allowed us to check out very late, and held our bags all day the following day until we had to catch another train. My only disappointment was the overpriced internet (22 euros); however, directly across the street is a sandwich shop with free wifi which was okay. The entirety of the hotel was gorgeous, everyone was flexible, accommodating and friendly, and we felt very fortunate to spend a night in this hotel. It comes highly recommended from us.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: jayhawk209
Reviews.Content: We stayed here using our Hilton points and loved it. Wonderful location, great room, nice bar. The turndown service was nice...on our first night they left us a chocolate Eiffel Tower I think because we were Hilton Honors members.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SusieFx
Reviews.Content: Booked a King Terrace Suite for a weekend end of July. First impressions of the hotel lobby were great! The Terrace of one of their best suites overlooked a huge office block, the Suite was small and in the small bathroom the cold tap didn't work. Asked to be upgraded to the Presidential Suite which was double the price and the outlook and Suite was very nice with a very large bathroom. We had to constantly phone Reception for various problems.......... No toilet roll, only one bathrobe, no coffee/tea milk with the kettle, No radio, then we discovered the TV did'nt work properly, so they sent the engineer up about 3 or 4 times to try and fix it even when we were trying to have an evening meal in our Suite. Had to ask for complimentry water even and no turn down service, so every thing was left in the suite until the next day. This was an extremley expensive suite and the service was extremely poor.........would not recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: barbeeRx
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came here for Christmas. It snowed the day we arrived, and we enjoyed the morning in the executive lounge (Hilton point members allowed access) where we had an amazing FREE breakfast. . . the best I've every had at a hotel. Coffee, the best OJ, croissants, salami, cheese, etc. Come to find out, it was everyday. They also have an h'our dourves hour that is phenomenal as well. Very convenient to the sites and the train. Outstanding staff that is very helpful with directions, suggestions and reservations and speak English very well. They give very nice pocket maps. Not one single complaint. Our room was clean and quiet and very comfortable. I believe there was free wifi access as well. I was very happy and pleased here. Not over the top. . .not underdone. . .just right.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: guiguiny
Reviews.Content: Extremely stylish. great sps. Gym was too small though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joe451
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the hotel. The staff was extremely helpful. The lobby and restaurant were beautiful. As diamond VIP members we had full access to the executive lounge. The lounge had a great breakfast buffet and drinks, snacks, and food throughout the day. This is one of the few European hotels that is available with 2 queen size beds. It's very expensive to get 2 rooms all the time for 4 people. Our room was large by US standards. The bathroom was elegant. The air conditioning was a little under powered for the 90 degree heat we has in late June. The hotel location was good for site-seeing. The Metro is close by. Not a lot of restaurants in the immediate neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “a gem”
Reviews.Author: s2000imp
Reviews.Content: this hotel is as beautiful as many buildings in Paris. With Gold Status from Hilton you may save lots with all ofthe free food.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Art Deco Masterpiece”
Reviews.Author: Sedona-Joel
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is terrific except maybe its location. It is in a residential neighborhood about a 10 block walk to the Arc de Triomphe and about a 3 block walk to a metro station. The rooms and lobby and all common area are truly beautiful. The staff if helpful and friendly. The beds are wonderful, with high end linens. There are large flat panel TV's in the rooms with 99 cable channels, many in English. The hotel has an amazing fitness center which is free to hotel guests with the latest workout equipment. This was our third stay since the hotel opened about 5 years ago - and it has been beautifully maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent -- would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: AJD_CA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here six nights, my husband and myself along with two children (ages 7 and 10). We stayed on Hilton Honors points. The Hotel is lovely -- elegant and well maintained, with well appointed rooms. Reception gave us executive lounge keys because of my Hilton Gold status. There are actually two exec lounges, the main one on the 6th floor plus a "family executive lounge" on the ground floor. I was somewhat taken aback that the "main" executive lounge has a sign advising that it is limited to children over the age of 13 (including for breakfast). However, children were present and this seems not a problem. I did mention it to the staff at one point because my children were a little "old" for the family executive lounge and the staff person was very understanding. The breakfast buffet in the main restaurant (i.e., not the executive lounge) is amazing -- probably one of the top five breakfast buffets I have seen in any hotel anywhere (and I have been fortunate to do a lot of business travel in nice places). If you get passes to the "main" breakfast room, I recommend this over either of the executive lounges. On the other hand, the sixth floor exec lounge has a lovely terrace -- perfect for coffee and croissants while taking in the view. The hotel gym is also very nice, although they have posted sign they they open at 9:00 a.m. (a ridiculously late time for a gym to open, esp, in a hotel with a large business clientele). Notwithstanding the sign, the door is unlocked and you can get in there earlier. Do not miss Parc Monceau (walking distance from hotel) and, if you are female, take a peek in the art nouveau ladies' room on the lower level of the hotel. The walk to the Etoile (Arc de Triomphe) metro stop is a lovely way to start and end the day. In sum, great stay and highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service & Good Location”
Reviews.Author: hiltontribe
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed at the Hilton Arc de Triomphe for our summer vacation in Paris. I cannot say enough about the excellent customer service we received. The staff were friendly and accessible if we had a question or needed assistance. Location wise this property is super close to the metro and shopping as well as restaurants are a easy walk. I would rank this hotel at the top of the various Hilton Hotels that I have stayed at for business or pleasure simply due to the staff. The only negative was that the fitness center was closed during our stay, however we were offered a pass to a local health club nearby. This hotel has made customer service a priority and we were VERY impressed..

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with friendly staff; clean; close to sights / metro”
Reviews.Author: SteveKrep
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a week during our recent trip to Paris. The hotel is 2 blocks from the Courcelles metro station and a <10min walk to the Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysees. There are several cafes / restaurants nearby (plus the restaurant and separate bar in the hotel) and a very nice park about a block away (Parc de Monceau). The staff was great; the concierge desk was always helpful and friendly. They do charge for internet access: 5 Euro for 30min, up to 22 Euro for 24 hours - quite expensive! I am a rewards member and get access to the executive lounge. Breakfasts there suited us just fine: espresso machine, 5-6 kinds of juice, breads, croissants, fruit, cereal, eggs, bacon... The lunch snacks were very snack-like (not really a meal) and dinner was usually pasta, bread, etc. (in short: great for breakfast, eat out somewhere in Paris for lunch & dinner). Be forewarned: the lounge is FULL of Americans :) Our complaint about this hotel was really about the guests staying in the room directly above us. They were very loud - constantly rolling things around and dropping things on the floor for literally 24 hours a day. We actually thought it was a cleaning staff or maintenance room at first due to the noise. The fans / A/C unit in the room are typically (for Europe) very quite, so it didn't provide much white noise. We had to call the front desk every night. The responses ranged to no one answering (first night) to the manager saying he would personally go to the room (3rd night) to them saying they would have security go to the room (4th night). The last night was better, but it was disappointing that it took that long. Also on the last night somehow cigarette smoke got into the ventilation system and woke us both up at 3am - not sure what happened there. Overall the facilities and staff at the hotel were good and the location is close to shopping / some sights and, importantly, close to the Metro. Our fellow hotel guests caused most of our frustrations, but sometimes there's not much you can do about that.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat underwhelemed”
Reviews.Author: ChinaShrek
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews of this hotel before going and based on the many glowing recommendations I was a bit disappointed. First, there were many good aspects to the hotel. I am a Hilton Gold Member and they were able to give us the breakfast buffet each morning free. The buffet is excellent with many hot and cold choices. We also liked the made-to-order omelets, oatmeal, and waffles, which came as part of the buffet. Otherwise, you can help yourself from many types of fresh fruit, yogurt, breads, pastries, cereals, and other items. The room was great. This hotel has true queen-size beds in the rooms with two beds. In Europe, when you book a room with two beds you almost always get two twin beds, which I find rather small. Our room had two very comfortable queen beds. The mattresses were new and fairly firm. The AC worked great and it was not too loud. All staff members were friendly and spoke excellent English. So why am I underwhelmed? I had dinner one night in their restaurant and thought it was nothing special. I order the pasta of the day. It was supposed to come with shrimp (at least the server said so when I asked) yet when the dish was brought to my table there was no shrimp in it. I had to flag him down to get some shrimp (he was pretty busy and once the food was dropped off he had no intention of coming of back until we finished eating), which he told me was not his fault but would have some cooked right away for me. My friend ordered the club sandwich and the bacon came out burnt. This tells me that the restaurant is not really as good as it claims to be. Also, I really did not like the location. There is something of a running battle about whether this hotel has a good location or not in the reviews below. I like a hotel that is central to all of the sights or at least has lots of things to do around it. There weren't too many restaurants nearby and no bakeries, souvenir shops, or cheese shops. Yes, it is close to the metro but not so good if you just want to hang outside. At $300-$500 per night, I would stay elsewhere in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel. Great location”
Reviews.Author: mksharpe
Reviews.Content: Expensive, but nice hotel. The location was great. We were able to walk or catch the subway to all the famous sights. The service was excellent and friendly. Room was clean and the beds were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “"supurb"”
Reviews.Author: alitain
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel for 1 night with 7 girl friends!!! The hotel staff were brilliant the rooms were spacious even with 4 women sharing a room we booked onto the executive floor and had use of the lounge where there was lovely food and drinks available all day. we had also booked dinner at the hotel and the meal was gr8.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: perrystreet
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights and was disappointed but I think my review may be a bit isolated so obviously consider that. As a gold member I was given no upgrade to the executive floor or any special treatment which as I see was quite amazing from reading other reviews. My room was dated and smelled like a strong strong perfumed chemicals. It faced a courtyard and there were lawnmowers waking us up even on a Sunday at 8:30 am. The bathroom was oddly tiny and the back of the door had all these animal scratches...probably from some poor dog that had been locked up. Either way this sort of thing should be fixed. The service was decent. The doormen, bellman and concierge were great. The front desk was fine but not particularly helpful. Yes it is quite a distance from some things and it may have been nice to stay in a more convenient location, but that wouldn't deter me. We are big walkers (and live in NYC where we walk everywhere) but we had very sore feet. The neighborhood was very quiet so you do want to walk a bit to get to other areas to visit or eat. The breakfast was decent but not cheap (33 euro each) so I'd definitely recommend a cafe instead.

Reviews.Title: “"Anything is Possible"”
Reviews.Author: CaptainPlanIt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed eight nights in May, 2010 at the Paris ADT Hilton on a trip celebrating her birthday (one that ended in a zero). We used Hilton Hhonors points to book the room, and the purpose of our trip was leisure/sightseeing. Our experience was positive. The location of the hotel was perfectly satisfactory for us. It was not in a high tourist area, but we mastered both the bus and the metro in a day and found both accommodated us well. It was a two block walk to the blue 2 metro line that connected easily at Etoille to get to many tourist destinations, and the 30 bus had stops right there as well. The 84 bus stopped maybe 50 yards from the hotel and ran right past Madeline, Concorde, Bon Marche, St. Sulpice and to the Pantheon in the middle of the left bank. There were always taxis available outside the door. As for the location of the real ADT, ten, maybe fifteen minutes to walk. We went after dinner one night, just at sunset, turning left out of the hotel and taking the first left on Avenue Hoche. As soon as you make the turn you can see it, so it is not as if you wonder where it is. Hoche also leads you directly to the pedestrian underpass to go to the top. We never ate in the hotel restaurant, and there weren't a lot of restaurants nearby. Directly across the street was one called Le Pantheon, I believe, but we passed it without stopping. If you went left out of the hotel and in about twenty yards took your first right and walked down rue de Lisbonne half a block there was a small Monoprix express on the right where you could buy some groceries, premade sandwiches, wine and liquor. There was a pharmacie in the second building to the left of the hotel. We found all of the folks we encountered at the hotel worked hard to assist the guests in any way they could. Twice two different staff members used the phrase "anything is possible" when we made a request. We found there to be a terrific can-do attitude with everyone we encountered. We used the concierge on the main floor next to the reception desk several times. I was impressed with Julien Barral in particular; he made dinner reservations for us on Monday for Tuesday night as we were heading out, and on Tuesday when we asked him to do the same for Wednesday he remembered both my name and room number. While I was standing there he would pick up the phone, a flurry of French ensued, he would hang up and pronounce "voila," and our reservation was done. We were upgraded to the seventh (top) floor on our arrival. The room faced west and out and overlooked the 2nd floor rooftop garden of an adjoining building. We had a small balcony, but no chairs. The room was rather small by American standards, and the roof on the outer wall leaned in (there is an architectural term for this that I can't think of), making the total cubic feet (or meters) of the room smaller than if the wall went straight to the ceiling. We didn't spend a lot of time in the room so this wasn't an issue for us. It also gave the room a certain European feel that we wouldn't get here in the states. Everything worked in the room. Although the bathroom was rather small there was plenty of counter space for his and hers toiletries. The bed was firm and not as comfortable as the Suite Dreams mattress used here in the States (and in our home as we have purchased one we like it so much), but we had no issues sleeping. We left the door to the balcony open a few evenings and it was nice to sleep with fresh air and there was no noise to speak of to disturb us. We had three pillows when we arrived and got the "anything is possible" response the first time when we asked for a fourth. The room contained both a minibar with a small area for personal use, and a safe, both of which came in handy. There was a hairdryer in one of the dresser drawers. I had understood that there was an American style plug in the bathroom (but that it was at 220 volts), but ours had two European style outlets and no American style. I am a diamond level Hhonors member, and most of the rest of my comments will pertain to the Executive Level lounge. As either a diamond or because our room was on the Executive level (6th and 7th floors, need a key card to access), we were entitled to use the Executive lounge. This was great. We were able to have breakfast every day before setting out, and some evenings we circled back through the hotel and had a drink and some hors d'ouvres before going out to dinner. We were never in the hotel between 9 am and 5 pm so I have no idea what is available in the middle of the day. If I had any complaint it would be that the offerings were the same every single day; no 'if it's Tuesday we're having sausage instead of bacon.' There were three hot plates every morning, one with scrambled eggs, one with bacon and one with round potato patties. The eggs were generally runny (do they put cream in them? we wondered) but if you used the serving spoon to scrape the bottom of the dish or even better in the corner between the bottom and the wall they were firmer. If you wanted crispy bacon you had to dig, too. There were some plates with cheeses, meats and smoked salmon every morning, yogurt, a bowl of fresh fruit (but never bananas), and two tables with breads. There were some fluffy croissants, pain a chocolate, sandwich bread, baguettes, and peanut butter and nutella. Around the corner were pitchers with five different kinds of juice. You could either make your own coffee, espresso or cappuccino from the machine or one of the staff members working in the lounge would bring it out to you. Small jars of jams or honey were on each table. There were about seven tables (twos and fours) outside on the long, narrow balcony, lots of tables inside, and some stools along a bar around the edge of one end of the room. We only had an issue one morning finding a place to sit as we were later than normal, so we sat European style taking two seats at a table for four that had another couple sitting at it. We ended up having a nice conversation with them. There was a concierge desk in the lounge, and the gals who worked it were knowledgeable and helpful. When we told the one working the night before we left that it was our last night she said we could even check out there in the morning. The folks clearing the tables were courteous and helpful to a fault, and would stop everything they were doing if you let them know they had run out of plates or forks and go get them. In the evening the lounge had at least three different kinds of wine (red, white, Champagne) and an array of liquor and liquors. If the bottle of Johnnie Walker was empty a staff member would gladly go get another. There were hors d'ouvres every night, and like breakfast if I had a complaint it would be that they, too, were always the same as well. But who is complaining when you are having a couple of free drinks before going out to dinner? We never used the spa. I do not know if its use would have been still included under the executive floor upgrade or not, and never asked. There were two bathrobes in our room for wearing to the spa, however. We had a really great time staying at the Paris Hilton ADT. I thought it was an exceptional use of points; at one time I checked the rate and it would have cost us over $3,000 for the same stay. The location worked for us, the physical facilities were entirely satisfactory, and the staff, from the concierge to the maid who was coming down the hall to turn down our bed just as we arrived from a day of sight seeing, all seemed to understand they were working in the business of hospitality. As we left my wife asked when we could come back. Not soon enough, I thought. We had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: jmf3
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel based on the good reviews on Trip Advisor and I wasn't disappointed. My friend, her 18 year old daughter, my 18 year old daughter and I stayed here from June 8-14, 2010. We had spent the previous week in London and then two nights in Normandy before arriving here. We were very stressed upon arrival as we had just driven our rental car, through central Paris, back to the Gare du Nord train station and then caught a taxi to the hotel. We were exhausted. The staff, beginning with the gentleman who met our cab at the curb, were very courteous and helpful. Once inside, we were offered an upgrade to a suite for 100 Euros/night. As we were staying on points, I declined because we hadn't planned to spend any money. We were then offered the upgrade for 50 Euros a night. Marion, the very kind woman at the desk, explained that for a small amount, we would get a two room, two bath suite and access to the Executive Lounge throughout our entire 6 night stay. She wasn't pushy, but saw that we were stressed and very patiently made it clear what a good deal this was. So we accepted, and I'm very glad that we did. Our rooms were beautiful. One room was enormous and had a king sized bed. The connecting room was also large and had a queen sized pullout couch. Each room had a large marble bathroom and a 42" flat screen TV. We also faced south and had a wonderful view of the Eiffel Tower. We ended up saving a lot of money throughout the week by utilizing the Executive Lounge. It was a large beautiful room and had a balcony with tables where you could sit as well. The meals were the same each day; breakfast was scrambled eggs, bacon and hash browns along with all kinds of pastry, fruit, coffee and juices. Lunch was light sandwiches, but we were rarely there for that. Dinner each night was some kind of pasta with a choice of sauces plus soup. And there was always plenty of fruit, cheese, pastries and, my favorite...soda. Although the food was pretty much the same each day, it was still delicious and we appreciated the convenience and savings. I'd read in some of the reviews that the Lounge staff were unkind or unprofessional. We didn't experience that at all. Everyone was very friendly and the service was wonderful. We enjoyed conversations in both English and French with a number of the staff. The location of the hotel was excellent. It was a 5 minute walk from the Courcelles Metro station, but we rarely used it because we could walk to the Arc de Triomphe in about 15 minutes. We loved being near the Arc and the Champs Elysees. The neighborhood was beautiful and we felt very safe there. Our room faced another building which housed a daycare center. We could hear the children each morning, but it didn't bother us. And if you kept the window closed, you wouldn't hear it at all. We could hear a clock chime the hour somewhere nearby and we really liked that. I subscribed to Boingo Global internet service during our trip so I could stay connected to my family at home without paying exorbitant hotel internet fees. This hotel was a Boingo hotspot and I was able to connect without a problem. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hilton's”
Reviews.Author: zetalambda
Reviews.Content: My husband and I return to this Hilton every time we visit Paris. It's the nicest Hilton we've stayed in. The staff is fantastic and very helpful. The rooms can be on the small side as far as Hilton's go but this is Europe and the rooms are more beautiful than an average. So there is a bit of a trade off. The bar downstairs is plush and trendy with great service. I just really love this Hilton. The concierge staff is top notch. It's so nice to get American style customer service and value in the middle of Europe.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME HOTEL WITH PREMIUM SERVICE AND LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: atcSd
Reviews.Content: I do not normally take the time to write these advisor letters but I feel that Hilton and their excellent staff deserve this. First off, the service was fantastic by all staff. My special thanks and appreciation to the concierge team of Tony, Julien, Manuel, and Marie. You guys were premium and beyond helpful. We had a medical issue that they dealt with immediately and had a first rate doctor in our hotel room within 2 hours. Thank you for this unbelievable level of comfort and service you provided. The english of all staff was Hilton excellence which makes asking questions so much easier. As for the rooms, we had two teenage girls and we found the two full beds to be perfect and the space was fine. There was no issue with noise and taxi horns either as the location is residential with little traffic. The location is also perfect if you do not mind a little walking but if you are in Paris you should be thinking like that to begin with. The Arc and Champs was only 15 minutes walking and there were plenty of restaurants around the hotel, including Starbucks 10 minutes away, so this was all good. The bar was beautiful but you can see why this hotel is a bit pricey as the drinks were 35 dollars a piece, 25-40 euros, so we stayed away from that money pit but loved the ambience. We have stayed at Hilton around the world and this was the best one in Europe. What a perfect 5 days and the weather was also great except one day it rained but hey it's Paris!

Reviews.Title: “good location/mediocre experience”
Reviews.Author: Will206
Reviews.Content: Good location and the room was good sized for Paris, but a bit shabby - carpets, curtains, and furnishings are past their prime. The biggest problem with this hotel though is the service. I'm a diamond member, so have fairly high expectations, but overall the staff at this hotel are poor. Lots of problems with this stay (starting with being told my room would be ready within 30 minutes - arrived a bit after noon - only to wait until well after 3PM which is an hour after the published check in time). Hotel staff are good at making excuses, but don't seem to have learned how to apologize. Will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good but beds rough”
Reviews.Author: dm324100
Reviews.Content: Had great time and perfect location just down the street from the Eiffel Tower. Beds were absolutely horrible. Hard and uncomfortable and pillows were very old and tired. Staff was friendly and all spoke English. Great check in experience as well. Recommend purely for location!

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: Marcia7575
Reviews.Content: I took my mom to Paris for her 60th birthday using Hilton points, but since the Paris Hilton was sold out of two bed rooms, I decided to book here. While you cannot see any of the major sights, it is in the middle of a nice neighborhood with corner cafes and quaint restaurants. We felt immersed in the Parisian experience. The Arc du Triomphe was a short walk away and then the grand Champs Elysses! Beautiful. Cabs were plentiful and not terribly expensive (I've spent more going crosstown in Manhattan). We were greated warmly by the staff and the rooms were very comforable and spacious. The beds were so comfortable my mom asked the head of housekeeping what type of pillow the used! At the time, there was no restaurant to offer us the Hilton breakfast (but really, with all the croissant, cafe au lait and patisseries around why would you eat at the hotel?) we were given free internet. It was a great connection and worked well. Overall a great trip that yielded a ton of awesome memories.

Reviews.Title: “Wifi should be free and easy to access”
Reviews.Author: gclifton
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and well situated although outrageously expensive, but I guess that's the market for such a property. My profound dissappointment was that I couldn't get online. Our other hotels in France had free, easy to access Wifi. The Hilton used an expensive Wifi provider that I couldn't get to work from my iPad or iPhone. Although everything else was lovely, I feel gouging guests for a wifi service that doesn't work properly is not in line with the rest of the offering and it should be remedied in order for them to earn the ratings they have here.

Reviews.Title: “â‚¬8 for a sprite!”
Reviews.Author: roryhyppia
Reviews.Content: This is a poor hotel, unfriendly staff, air con not working and absolutely crazy prices in the bar! â‚¬21 for a pint of Heineken and a red wine and to cap it all â‚¬8 for a sprite!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hilton Experience”
Reviews.Author: CarolM4505
Reviews.Content: My friend, her daughter and I stayed at the Hilton Arc De Triomphe from April 15-April 23 for a girl's vacation. My husband and I are Elite members Hilton Grand Vacation Club and Gold HHonors members. We have stayed here 4 to 5 times previously with prior trip last August. I have never written a review but decided it was time. I traded my Hilton Grand Vacation points for an 8 nite stay. Upon arrival we were greeted warmly and I was welcomed back and thanked for my Hilton loyalty. I was advised we were being upgraded to the Exeuctive Floor. An Executive Room comes with access to the executive lounge which provides food and drinks on and off all day til 11pm. Breakfast in the lounge consists of fresh breads, eggs, bacon, potatoes, pastries, cheeses, fruits, cereals etc. There's a large cafe/expresso machine, teas, cold drinks and juices available. As soon as breakfast is over there are small tea sandwiches such as cucumber/ cream cheese or salmon, chips, nuts, veggie sticks and dips etc. Later there's afternoon tea, wine and snacks just enough to satisfy between meals. As we arrived 10AM our room was not ready so we headed out. When we returned around 4 pm we were checked into our room. Our room had 2 queen beds which were very comfortable. The bathroom is smaller but very nice and totally adequate for us. My only request would be an outlet for a curling iron. There is a mini bar, safe, large cupboard with shelves for storage with a flat screen tv on top, iron and ironing board. I had emailed the hotel prior to arrival requesting lots of extra hangers for 3 women and a coffee/tea maker. I received a very nice email next day telling me housekeeping would be happy to take care of my request. I also asked about my new alarm clock I had forgotten on my August trip. Would you believe they said it was located and would be in my room on arrival and it was. There are also 2 chairs, a small table and a nice desk and chair with internet/computer hookup. I know internet daily rates are terrible but the business center is great. It was 10 euro for a card with 30 or 45 minutes, can't remember. I checked my email several days on this. Our room looked out on the courtyard all in bloom with the most beautiful purple and pink flowers. The hotel is about a 15 minute walk to the Champs Elysee down Franklin Roosevelt to the Grand Palais/Petite Palais area. It is about a 15/20 minute walk to the Opera Garnier and Galeries Lafayette and Printemps department stores. Galeries Lafayette has a huge grocery and several places to grab a bite or drink as does Printemps. The hotel is located in a quiet residential area near Parc Monceau. There are few options for restaurants surrounding hotel but if you walk more toward Opera there are lots of places in the vacinity. There are always taxis waiting out front. Fares as far as the Louvre were about 8 Euro which included a tip. We did not use the metro but it was only a short 5 minute walk from the hotel. If you like to walk you can walk from the hotel to anywhere just wear good shoes. I'd say walking to the Louvre would be about 45 minutes or so. Paris is a beautiful walkable city with soooooo!! many sights. I cannot say enough about the wonderful staff. Everyone we encountered couldn't have been more pleasant and accomodating from the front desk staff to the bellmen, the concierge, wait staff and servers, housekeeping and business center. Everyone had a smile on their face when approached and were always willing to help. Wait staff in the executive lounge even remembered how one takes their coffee each morning before being asked. Just remember to always try and approach someone with Bonjour or Bonsoir Madame/Monsiuer before you start a conversation. 99% of the time you will always receive a smile and a warm greeting back. Remember you are in their country so try and learn a few words before you go. Some hotel staff do not speak Englsh such as our room housekeeper. It was just nice to speak a few words to her even if it was just Good Morning or Good Evening Madame. A smile does wonders. I've gone on enough-Great Hotel-Great Staff- We will definitely return to the Hilton Arc De Triomphe.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet relaxation with terrific Hilton service”
Reviews.Author: TanjungGuy
Reviews.Content: Picked the hotel mainly because they could guarantee a non smoking king size bed in a relatively large room and it was a Hilton. Hotel room prices are comparable to local competitors (Rack rate is 1500 euros and up) in the city center and not out of line with major North American centers. Restaurant is good but very pricey. Recommend getting the room & Breakfast package opton as there is only the breakfast buffet available (no alacarte) and it is hugely expensive at 33 euros/person for the full and 22 euros for the continental. Room service has alcarte but is again expensive and there is a 4 euro add on. We were upgraded to a courtyard room and this had to be the quetest hotel room I have ever stayed in and the hotel was busy! Beautiful art deco design. King bed in a 30 sq meter room with bath with tub and separate shower. Hotel is in a location that is about a 15 minute walk to the Arc de Triomphe and about 5 to 10 minutes to a lot of restaurants and brasseries. Restaurants do not usually open until 7:30 but the brasseries are open pretty well all day. ATM is right down the street but was broken and others are within a few minutes walk. You will probably need to walk a lot in Paris anyway so location is not an issue. Taxi stand at the front door always had cabs in attendance even in the early morning. All cabs require a minimum 6 euros per trip. Dinners in the hotel's Safran restaurant were OK but not outstanding as I sort of expected all good restaurants in Paris would provide. The night we arrived my wife had the pasta special of the day which was not to her liking at all. Little to much creativity in the kitchen I believe as it was heavily coriander flavoured. Wait staff was very apologetic and accomodating and offered free deserts as replacement. One three course dinner with wine cost ~ $400US. Purple Bar service a bit slow for my liking. That said I was not overly impressed with any meal I had in France except for lunch in a small brasserie in Arras. Staff were all excellent, friendly and couteous and all lobby, bar and restaurant personnel spoke english. Special praise for the Concierge desk staff as all were extremely knowlegeable and were able to help and answere all questions whether in person or on the phone. Great help when I needed assistance with a credit card issue requiring a call to North America. Charge for high speed internet access was very expensive. We had a great stay (six nights) and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Nice American-type hotel but average location”
Reviews.Author: TravelGnu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because I had points to use but I'm not sure I would have paid to stay here. It was a typical Hilton hotel, clean with larger than average rooms for Paris but the location was something left to be desired. It was an okay distance from a Metro station but if you just wanted to stroll home at night after dinner, it was a rather long hike back. I would recommend staying at a smaller boutique hotel that is closer to the center of the city unless you would like a large bedroom. Also do not order anything from the bar, the cokes are ~7 Euros!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Bodarony
Reviews.Content: Pros: Location! 10mins walking to Champs Elysees, easy walk to Metro, incredible staff, concierge was terrific. Cons: not cheap but it's Paris and this is top notch. Internet not included.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SelmaY
Reviews.Content: It was a great experience. Overlooking to Eiffel tower, executive floor

Reviews.Title: “Could'ent have been a nicer weekend away”
Reviews.Author: Gacie
Reviews.Content: Husband bought me here for a birthday treat, he's a diamond card holder with hilton so was upgraded to the exec floor and exec lounge. Nice room well stocked lounge excellent staff great breakfast nice location brill weather could'ent have been a nicer weekend.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL WELCOME”
Reviews.Author: TRANSATLANTIC GUY
Reviews.Content: The previous weekend we had been forced to cancel our visit because of medical problems and the hotel executive office was very kind to rearrange our stay, Our welcome from reception and guest services was fabulous. We had booked a suite but the room we were allocated surpassed all our expectations with one of the best views of the Eiffel Tower we could have asked for. The bathroom with a jacazzi and shower cubicle helped to make our stay memorable The service in the hotel is extremely friendly and the staff treat everyone with respect and consideration even those who speak no French at all. The hotel is in walking distance of the Metro but a fair walk from the Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysee. However taxis from the hotel are however readily available and Paris taxi prices seem reasonable to a Londoner. We ate twice in Le Safran restaurant for dinner and had very enjoyable meals. The deserts were outstanding, particularly the Creme Brulee and by Paris prices not outrageous. The waiters were knowledgable, very helpful, in particular Emilie. Breakfast was certainly the best we have had on the mainland of Europe.
