The pastries of course were wonderful, but to find a hotel that has quality French Toast, makes Ice Coffee, provide passable Silver Dollar pancakes and Sunny Side Eggs and much more to order is unusual . At 33 euros per person it can be expensive so I would suggest a breakfast inclusive rate.. The Executive Lounge is great and provides a buffet breakfast which is not as bountiful as Le Safran but perfectly adequate when it is complimentary to occupants of the Executive Floor. Snacks and beverages are provided most of the day. We particularly like afternoon tea on the terrace.. All in all with service we received after many visits to Paris this was our best hotel stay. We hope to be able to come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Absoloutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: omonija
Reviews.Content: This is by far one of the best hotels i've stayed in....considering the fact that as a consultant i travel for business every wk.Courteuos staff,clean room and an incredibly well stocked executive lounge.If you are heading to Paris ...look no further.

Reviews.Title: “One Of The Best In Paris.”
Reviews.Author: YEHYA_MAYA
Reviews.Content: one of the best hotel in paris , near from everything, metro, champs elysees,Bloulevard houssman and the very nice parc " parc de monceau " Service is Excellent , Crew are very friendly and helpfull, we stayed in the fourth floor, room has a nice balcony with nice view.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic friendly stay”
Reviews.Author: cousinal
Reviews.Content: we stayed 3 nights here with my 22 month old daughter. We travelled light and managed to catch the metro with bag and buggy and found the hotel easily from the directions on the website. The staff were all exceptionally polite and friendly to us all and in particularly to my young daughter. We were welcomed at check in with a gift for her, a teddy bear which remains a favourite ever since! Our room was lovely and comfortable and accomodated a childs cot easily. We had no problems enjoying the hotel or the city from this location - very easy to get around. Food and drink was expensive in the hotel, we expected this but I must say when we ate in the hotel restaurant it was amazing. Again our sometimes naughty nearly two year old was welcomed by staff and other guests in a very friendly manner and didnt distract from the dining experience. We certainly would recommend this hotel and stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Well turned out, but pricey !”
Reviews.Author: Alfanumeric
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night utilising club points ( 50,000 !! ). The general problem with this method of booking is the quality of room you receive as a result. Not the case here. Great sized room. Due to fatigue, we booked room service ; 1 starter, 2 mains and 2 drinks = Â£ 75 ! Great location, two blocks fom the Arc and the Metro is "at the foor of the road".

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: addict83
Reviews.Content: Like most previous reviews I must agree that this is a great hotel! In fact probably one of the best I have ever stayed at! My only complaint is that the rooms get a little stuffy at night. This is not a huge deal and can be solved by turning the fan to max in the room. Unfortunatley, this took us a few days to figure out.. Nonetheless, the hotel is situated in a nice quiet location, but in ample walking distance to all the major attractions. The staff is wonderful and extremely helpful. Tip: Try to upgrade to the executive area (top two floors) of the hotel. Here you get access to a private lounge with free snacks and drinks. If you are planning a trip to Paris - stay here!

Reviews.Title: “my favotite hotel in Paris...”
Reviews.Author: jpm-indy
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel in Paris by far. I have stayed here numerous times and am never disappointed. I've stayed at other Hilton's and Marriott's in Paris but this hotel is the nicest. It is a bit expensive and a little further away from the Metro but it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: cpdublin
Reviews.Content: A weekend in Paris is always a pleasure but even better when the hotel has friendly staff, a great breakfast and a great location near the lovely Parc Monceau and a few minutes walk to key sites. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in every way”
Reviews.Author: gemmaLondon_England
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic in every way. I stayed there with my boyfriend for the weekend and was very impressed with the cleanliness of the hotel. The rooms were spacious and beautifully decorated. The staff were extremely helpful and poilte and the concierge went out of their way to always give the best advice and recommendations of tourst attractions and directions. The hotel breakfast was also excellent and of a very high standard. Good variety of yogurts, fresh fruit, cereals, hot buffet, pastries, breads and cooked breakfasts including eggs, waffles and pancakes. It is approximately 25 minutes walk to the Eiffel Tower and 8 minutes to Arc De Triomphe. Coveniently located for doing all the touris sights and shopping on Champes Elyses

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: samiva
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with my wife for the weekend and were pleasantly surprised on the value the hotel provided. Booked on the executive level to get a little more special service for our "romantic getaway". We were given a room on the top floor of the hotel and the free use of the executive lounge on the floor below. Room was quite spacious and clean with a king bed and a tub. Breakfast was standard Hilton with a french twist. Having been in France previously we found the breakfast to be excellent to keep the hunger away until lunch - meaning that it's not just croissant and jelly which is quite often the case. We also tried Purple Bar saturday evening and both had a glass of wine before going to bed. To be honest, the drinks were quite upscale in pricing (â‚¬20+). All the public hotel areas were clean and in perfect condition and the staff very helpful with a good knowledge of english. The hotel is walking distance from the Lido cabaret, Lafayette Haussmann and Champs-ElyseÃ©s. We also walked to the Eiffel tower which is also not far away in good weather. As with the hotel name, the Arc de Triomphe is few hundred meters away from the hotel. All-in-all very good experience. Only small hinder was the fact that since being located on top floor, the sound of wind tearing the roof on the last night was quite dramatic. It almost felt like the roof is about to catch some air and be blown away during our sleep. It turned out that there was quite a big storm on sunday so this it not probably something that will happen every day. Would definitely come back when in Paris the next time!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good for a Hilton and great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Maast
Reviews.Content: Booked there expecting an average Hilton and was surprised by an actually very good hotel service and cozy rooms (was upgraded to suite thanks to Hilton status). Flawless service, very reasonable price for Paris. Don't hesitate if you're looking for a reasonably price accommodation in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelATL
Reviews.Content: Very nice, comfortable hotel and near metro. More space than normal European hotels with 2 double beds. Very good firm mattress, not the usual soft ones. Bathroom was excellent. Art deco style was interesting throughout. Purple bar had a good vibe although not too busy. Overall more of business environment than romantic. The area is upscale residential, so safe and nice, but little restaurants or nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton works....at a price”
Reviews.Author: Degas
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a business meeting for a few days - found it all worked with amazing organisation. Only ate there 'en masse' with the conference buffets etc - but it was of a good standard. Room was spacious and very well insulated from any noise either from other guests or traffic - internet was free (on our package) easily accessable and of moderate speed. Purple bar was fun and very plush but eye wateringly expensive- so beware if on a tight budget! It was great but suspect you could probably do better for the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but....”
Reviews.Author: DCG
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 Junior Suites for 2 nights over the weekend with access to the executive lounge. We were upgraded to suites which were down on the second floor which have an advertised room rate of â‚¬1800 per night. The suites were well appointed and spacious. However, if you look at the pictures I have posted, you will see the awful view from the window! We have visited Paris many times so it was not so important for us but our guests were on their first visit and must have been very disappointed. There were many guests from the USA and I can only imagine how they must feel if they are put into a room like this. In addition to this, the rooms were located directly above the kitchen service areas so most of our night was disturbed by bins of glass bottles being noisily emptied and general noise. We stayed at the old Hilton in Paris by the Eiffel Tower many times and the views from the rooms there were just breathtaking and everything which any visitor to the city would appreciate. On one morning we reported to the Executive Lounge for breakfast, only to find a long queue outside and a member of staff handing out vouchers for breakfast in the main restaurant to compensate. We accepted the vouchers but I can only describe the experience of breakfast as being similar to a Butlins holiday camp in the 1960's! The room was noisy, chaotic and over crowded. The pressure on the staff was such that, when we went to the buffet for our main items, we came back to the table to find that the staff had cleared away our juice, coffee and tea, breads and pastries which were clearly untouched! We had to stand about with plates in our hands until the table was completely reset. In some ways this was not bad as, on the first setting the waitress was in such a rush she did not bother to find a proper lid for the teapot and balanced an ill fitting saucer on top of it instead. I accept that the overall standards of this hotel, superficially, are much better than the old Hilton by the Eiffel Tower. However, once inside the Hilton Arc de Triomphe, you could be anywhere in the world. There is no feeling of being in Paris and this is sad, as it is one of the most beautiful cities in the world. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: robandjojo
Reviews.Content: Can only echo some of the previous views. The hotel was excellent and the staff very good + helpfull and keen to know anything they could do to improve our stay. Used some HHonors points for the stay and was upgraded to an executive room which had a balcony and a view of the eifel tower. The exec lounge is the nicest of any hilton I have stayed at. Food + drinks in the purple bar, as per the rest of Paris, very expensive .. so be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Boldizsar
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, 500 meters from Champs-Elysees but the area around the hotel is not very interesting. Lobby is elegant but rooms lack charm or anything worth remembering. If you are on a business trip that is good enough but I would not recommend it for romantic weekends. Reception was effective, breakfast was good but staff could not organize the waves of people coming at a time. All in all a high standard of quality but nothing more.

Reviews.Title: “What a place!! Amazing experience!”
Reviews.Author: irishmannyc
Reviews.Content: Used points to stay and upgraded to executive so it was quite a luxe experience! Staff amazing, location great and right by the Arc and Metro. Room was lovely and well appointed. The hotel itself is also beautiful with a central garden that is probably amazing during the warmer months. Lobby very chique and there is a bar and restaurant on site. Definitley want to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Hotel I've seen in Europe!”
Reviews.Author: bemywingman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights, using Hilton Points with status. Rooms were pricey but super nice and very clean, and large for Europe. Bathrooms were modern and tasteful. We had use of the Executive Club which was great as we could stop in for a snack before a late dinner, and for a drink before bed. Staff were very nice and helpful, and the stay was terrific. I would definitely stay here again, although probably only if I had sufficient points to reduce the cost somewhat.

Reviews.Title: “It is a Hilton, fantastic and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: justinchopper
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife for our Honeymoon in Paris. The hotel is not in the city centre but we walked every evening back since it is around 15 minutes away from arc de Triomphe. The rooms are nice, clean, spacious, however there are no views. our room was overlooking the internal garden with a small balcony outside. However, we did not like the Executive lounge breakfast becuse it was minimal so we decided to use the main restaurant. Breakfast is fantastic, fresh, vast and the staff are kind, trained and helpful throughout. Even room service is on time, perfect. I would definately return to the hotel if one day we go back to paris. The conciege is very helpful as well as reception staff and housekeeping. It's a hilton, we were happy and a memorable experience throughout

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I expected from Hilton”
Reviews.Author: EasyGoingMidwestGuy
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Hilton for 3 nights and were very pleased. I used my points for the room and as a Diamond member was upgraded to the Executive floor, which made a huge difference. The lounge there was very good, with full breakfasts, snacks and cookies during the day, food and drinks at night, all free - which helps in Paris obviously. Didn't eat at their restaurant or try room service. The staff was very friendly and almost all spoke English too. The concierge was good, and helped change a dinner reservation for us quickly and easily. The location is very close to the Courcelles Metro stop, a 5 min walk max. And it's not far from the Opera and Blvd Haussmann for shopping. Overall, the service was more than adequate, with only one small hiccup trying to get some extra pillows on the first night. The room was nice and a decent size for Paris standards, with both a shower and tub in the bathroom. Always had plenty of hot water and a good shower head (really important in my book). Given we spent the majority of our time not in the room, the hotel was exactly what we needed - a comfortable bed with food in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!!”
Reviews.Author: DavidC13
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I have stayed in worldwide!! The staff was great and as a diamond member I had access to the executive floor. The breakfast was great and the evening drinks and snacks were great. The rooms were comfortable and spotless. This place is worth the $ for a long weekend with your spouse. It is located an easy 1 block walk from Courcelles Metro station or an easy 10 minute walk to the Arc de Triomphe.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Patpaww
Reviews.Content: Though we did not get to experience the executive lounge, as a Hilton Honors Gold member we got breakfast vouchers for all 3 days we stayed. Breakfast was as expected, a good buffet French style. The Corcelles Metro station was only two short blocks away and is 2 stops away from the stop for the Arc de Triomphe. Although it was already dark we decided to walk to the Arc and take the Metro back. Having read a few reviews we were gearing up for a long walk. It turns out to be a short 10 minutes away literally. As the bellhop said turn left on rue de Hoche and walk straight. The room was neat and tidy, only issue was that the room thermostat maxed out at 21.5C (71F), coming from Jamaica that's not warm enough. We have only good things to say about the staff - friendly and helpful. We also found that, if you didn't want to take the Metro, most places were only a short taxi ride away. On average the taxi fare was 7â‚¬. Taxi rides in Paris run the gamut from pleasant to making a roller coaster ride feel like a walk in the park. If you are leaving via Charles de Gaulle, suggest you take a taxi to the Etoille to catch the Air France Shuttle. The Concierge can assist you with the departure times and the best time to leave the hotel to catch the shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: merosa
Reviews.Content: December 2009. Executive room for 2 adults and 2 children. + Nice and well maintained room, huge for the parisian standard. Stylish decoration. Great breakfast at the executive lounge. Good price (around 350 euros/night in a prepayed fare). Helpful and friendly staff. - A little bit far for the subway stations (15 minutes walking)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience-from quiet location, helpful staff, to wonderful food”
Reviews.Author: JC755
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days just after Christmas, and we couldn't have been more pleased. Wonderful, quiet location with a great walking/running park just steps from the front door. All the staff were incredibly helpful and cheerful, especially Tony at the Concierge desk (hot tip: buy your tickets for the museums from the hotel; they will cost about 1Euro more, but no waiting in lines at the museums, which saved us hours and much possible frustration). We had mentioned at check-in that we were celebrating our anniversary, so we were surprised with a bottle of wonderful champagne & dessert when we returned to our room that night. They had also delivered a beautiful flower arrangement with roses. The General Manager invited all Hilton Honors club members to a reception on our last night, which included unlimited champagne and drinks, an assortment of hot hors d'oeuvres, and dessert. The manger and staff mingled with guests and were genuinely interested in knowing what they could do better or to improve our experience. Breakfast was included with our room rate, and we were amazed by the assortment and quality of the food. This was NOT a continental breakfast --- you could custom-order any kind of eggs/omelets, or choose from the great variety of hot and cold foods. We didn't even bother to have lunch that day as we had such a satisfying breakfast. Fitness area is open 24hours -- you just request the key. Location was very nice - just 2 blocks to the Metro, 1 block to the Bus Stop. This was a quieter area - more residential, so we never heard traffic or the blaring of car horns. We will definitely return to this wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, a bit far from the action”
Reviews.Author: GuestTraveler5
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel with a very attentive staff who work hard to please the customer. All of the staff seemed to speak English and were respectful of our attempts to communicate in a "struggling" French. Concierge service was excellent, assisting us in dinner and Eiffel Tower reservations. We should have used their services for the Louvre reservations which would have prevented a 1 1/2 hour wait in line for tickets at the Louvre. The rooms are slightly larger than the average Paris hotel and very well appointed. We loved the small practical touches such as the bedside switches to control the room and hallway lights. The bathrooms are well decorated and well equipped. One slight caution, the hotel is in a residential neighborhood and a bit of a walk to the Metro and attractions. It is a 5 minute walk to the Metro (which I would advise all new travelers to learn to use), however the walk back is up a fairly steep hill. The Champs Elyse is at least a 15 minute walk and the Arc is really not that close to the hotel. Taxis are readily available at the hotel entrance and we found them quite useful especially on rainy days. We had 4 people in our party and the cost of a taxi ride (for 4) from the hotel to major attractions was only a few euros more than 4 Metro tickets. Overall I would recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for Christmas vacation, solid service”
Reviews.Author: Nellsh75
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent experience at the Hilton over Christmas--it's 2 blocks from the Metro and in walking distance of major attractions, but on a quieter block separate from the tourist rush. The rooms aren't large (big rooms are a rarity in Paris, either in homes or hotels), but ours was clean, well-decorated, and so comfortable (the beds are a luxury themselves). Breakfast was amazing--delicious with great service. The restaurant there is pricey, but not any more so than others in Paris, and the food is fantastic. Room service is excellent (especially for Paris), and though the menu is limited, everything we ordered was outstanding. The Concierge was knowledgable, and the front desk staff were friendly and efficient. Great stay, I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Even if a Little Out-of-the-Way.”
Reviews.Author: Brooks805
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed this hotel. The staff were very friendly (with the exception of one concierge) and would go out of their way to make your stay comfortable. We stayed on Hilton Honors Points and were upgraded to the executive level. The executive lounge was a great place to stop in an refresh almost anytime of the day before heading out to see the town. I do not recommend the restaurant. It left much to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Hip Hotel Off the Beaten Path Makes for Quiet Stay”
Reviews.Author: clayton82
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with well appointed rooms (kind of small / 5th floor standard room), but I used Hilton Honors Points, so my stay was free. We were able to use the Executive Lounge, which was very helpful since they offered small breakfasts, lunches (finger foods), and dinner (pasta w different sauces). Eating lightly there before heading out helped to save money! The downstairs bar is very hip, but was pricey. Overall the staff was very helpful and spoke good English. I will stay again when I go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Joracon
Reviews.Content: A good hotel in a nice area closed to the Arc de Triomphe. I found the international staff extremly friendly. The hotel is just 2 minutes away from the metro station and just a couple of minutes from the Avenue des Champs-Ã‰lysÃ©es.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, comfortable rooms...”
Reviews.Author: Bugs32
Reviews.Content: I was there at the end of November with some colleagues from my work as a part of a bussiness trip to Europe. It was my first time to France and I really believe that it was worth it.Clean rooms, impeccable service...not so personal....and the food in the restaurant was delicious... ...future visitors should also try the bar of the hotel... Choosing this hotel was a very good choice..we should all thank Mark and Joyce for their choice...:) I wish I can come back for vacations with my fiancee..Paris has so many staff to do and see...

Reviews.Title: “good but not the best”
Reviews.Author: monana66
Reviews.Content: when i stayed at this hotel, it was fully booked. reception area and breakfast restaurant were alwayes crowded. regarding the rooms they were small but trendy.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: OrnellaPiu
Reviews.Content: A good hotel in a beautiful place, all of us who travel know that Paris is not noted for its hotels, so preferably alojarque here. A very good option, I recommend. The restaurant is accessible and very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Snowcat99
Reviews.Content: The staff here spoke English and was quite helpful showing us around and helping us navigate the city. The free map here is more useful than the one you will find at the airport. The rooms were very well decorated and comfortable. It was a 5 minute to the metro and about 5-10 minute walk to cafes and restaurants. It was a 10 minute walk to the Arc de Triomphe and to the street with all the shops.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: MatthiasSmith
Reviews.Content: My husband treated me to Paris for a milestone birthday in early November and, with his honors points, we stayed on the Executive Level at the Hilton Arc de Triomphe for four glorious nights! Not only is the hotel conveniently located, but also it is grand and absolutely beautiful, with a very friendly, yet efficient staff. The Executive Level Lounge served an ever-changing variety of delicious, beautifully presented breakfast, lunch, dinner AND snack items, including liberal libations, daily -- with attentive service -- all beautifully appointed. Our lovely room was exceptionally clean, with the most pristine yet comfortable bed, and the Housekeeping staff did a great job of keeping things sparkling throughout our stay, complete with turn-down service. The concierge was very helpful and willing to answer our tourist questions, and the Manager personally called us the night before checkout to inquire about our stay. We would definitely stay at this Hilton again -- and, as much as we enjoyed Paris, we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, art deco style”
Reviews.Author: brunsky
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel - providing all the comforts of a big american chain in a unique art deco style. The beds are great, the service superb, the location is as good as you can get. Only minor issues were the fact the gym didn't open till 9am so I couldn't use it... and I thought the bathroom sink outside the bathroom was a bit odd. The internet service was quite pricey. Still, I had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: txsrc
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, luxurious hotel. Our room with 2 double beds was a comfortable size however our bathroom although marble was very small. Everything is luxurious with very comfortable beds. Beware though if they put you on the 5th floor that you are not under the executive lounge as it is quite noisy in the mornings with high heels tapping and chairs scraping. I didn't realize that we were until Sunday morning when we wanted to sleep a bit late and found it difficult with the noise. Otherwise we enjoyed out stay. Check out the ladies bathroom downstairs. Wow!

Reviews.Title: “Classy”
Reviews.Author: tranelle
Reviews.Content: In Paris, which can to some represent a cultural hurdle, the Hilton treated us like valued customers, like old friends or almost family. My fiance booked our week there on points but the staff could not have been kinder or more helpful. The restaurant and executive lounge staff were extremely gracious and accomodating. The concierge, especially "Bertrand", were extremely helpful when it came to planning our daily excursions about the city. The room was spacious and grand and always kept neat and clean by the hotel staff. As a hotel this one is impecable. Relax and enjoy the luxury, you payed for it.

Reviews.Title: “Better Places for $ - Great DÃ©cor/Location but Stinky Rooms/Snooty Staff”
Reviews.Author: 2inDenver
Reviews.Content: Nicely decorated and great location but rooms/floor had a funny water damage odor. While the concierge staff was friendly, the check-out/front desk staff was a bit snooty. On the morning of our departure we were running late and ordered CafÃ© au lait for room service but they delivered black so neither my husband or I drank any. At checkout they were aware we were already running late but had no consideration when we informed them of the error they made sure they took their time to call all around to confirm the error. Although Iâ€™m a diamond Hilton Diamond member we will certainly look for somewhere else next time we visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated Hotel for Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Angela_Kay_AZ
Reviews.Content: Neighborhood: We chose this hotel (over the other Hilton locations in Paris) for its proximity to the Arc de Triomphe. Its actually located further north of the Champs Elysee, in a blissfully calm and quiet neighborhood. This is great after a day of touring, but it does means you have to venture a few blocks to find food, as the surrounding buildings don't feature many restaurants or cafes. My husband and I love to walk, so we found the location to be no problem, and we walked to the Seine to use the Batobus to get around. A metro stop is also close by. We stayed for five nights and never found it necessary to call a taxi. To get to and from the airport, we took the Air France shuttle, and the walk from the shuttle stop (right off of L'Etiole) was easy, even with our luggage. Rooms and Decor: The hotel decor is art deco, with a cute courtyard and a trendy bar. Our room was very large (by European standards), with a separate shower and tub in the marble bathroom. We had a room on the top floor, and the balcony had a view of the Eiffel Tower, great for viewing its lights at night. Logistics and Staff: The hotel stay was a wedding gift from my parents (who have many, many Hilton points). Without these points, this hotel would be absolutely out of our budget, and I imagine this is the case for many travelers. Having traveled to many Hilton hotels in the US and Europe, I think this is probably one of the best value for points that I've experienced, and I highly recommend the hotel to anyone with Hilton Honors points considering a stay in Paris. There was some mix up on the reservation (we think because it was booked by my parents), which resulted in us being checked out before we even arrived! However, the staff was beyond accommodating, fixing the problem before we even realized what happened. We even found a bouquet of flowers in the room on our second day as an apology! Executive Floor Lounge: Since we stayed on points, we had access to the executive floor lounge, which serves breakfast, drinks, and snacks. We had breakfast there several mornings, and it was a great light meal to start the day with. We often stopped for drinks and snacks (think crudites and mini-croque monsieur sandwiches). The staff was professional if not friendly, and caught on to our drink preferences quickly. It was a comfortable place to relax, and my husband enjoyed reading the french papers while I enjoyed the view of the surrounding rooftops.

Reviews.Title: “like this hotel a lot”
Reviews.Author: bembridge
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hilton Arc De Triomphe twice in the last few year, and really like the hotel. It is an art deco style and inspired building with some nice touches and overall good decor. The lobby is quite impressive and striking, and the doormen and reception are friendly and helpful so from arrival you feel welcome. The location of the hotel is fairly good as walking distance to the Champs Elysee, but not slap bang in the busy area so I think is a good balance of being handy but quiet and out of the madhouse. The rooms are fairly large with big comfortable bed, good working space and then an unusual bathroom thing where the basin (an art deco inspired green basin) is in a small passageway which also has the cupboard. So it can be a bit clumsy. Then into the bathroom and toilet area. The water pressure is not great and the shower is okay buy not very strong. There is a very large TV with a good selection of channels, especially for English speakers - though there are actually more english channels if you flick through the channels than rely on those listed via the menu as english language (there are BBC1, BBC2, CBBC for example also available but not listed). The breakfast is a really good spread but costs 22 Euros if you not got it in your rate. But the service is fast and very friendly. In the evening the restaurant, which is very large, serves a good range of food with many very good fish dishes and nice wines. The staff again is attentive and helpful. There is a fairly well equipped fitness centre that seems quite busy, along with a spa. The hotel is very popular for meetings and during the day is full of business types. I like the hotel a great deal, though the rack rates can be quite high. But worth checking out as an option for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Everything about this hotel was fantastic”
Reviews.Author: joey56
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing, the rooms were extremely comfortable and the staff were wonderful. We stayed in an executive room and the executive lounge was so convenient. We had breakfast there each morning and I might add the breakfast was great, I don't know how anybody could want more than was on offer, there was a huge choose. The variety of beverages available throughout the day and evening was also extremely generous. The location was also very convenient for most things, we found lots of restaurants within easy walkng distance and the area felt very safe. Thanks Hilton Arc De Triomphe you made our stay in Paris very memorable

Reviews.Title: “overall pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: NagsHeadNcUsaJake
Reviews.Content: The staff were outstanding.,Serguei in particular. Room was great, on 7th foor with terrace, great views of the Effiel Tower. President of Chad also staying on the 7th floor which made things interesting. Executive Lounge was nice but tired, Needs a major overhaul with furnishings and more variety in food in daily servings. Subway lines are nearby to move around Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view onto their tranquil courtyard”
Reviews.Author: ondineontario
Reviews.Content: It's a little walk to the closest metro, nothing major. The courtyard has statues and is so peaceful to have your room open above it. The top floor lounge and balcony is really nice and the free food was FABULOUS...hey we're in france! I had a dispute and greatly disliked the attitude of one of the managing staff (typically french, ruffled my north american feathers) but in the end, they reimbursed me for the points for one of my nights of stay as I thought was fair so it was fine. The green/black marble bathroom is clean but super ugly. The rest of the room was standard good hilton, nothing spectacular but better than most places. Definitely very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: bcmcmahon
Reviews.Content: We were on the top floor and had a wonderful view of the Eiffel Tower from our terrace. The Executive Lounge had a wonderful buffet and snacks available all day and drinks/wine too.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, service and location.”
Reviews.Author: czap
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton for 4 nights in Aug. We had a terrific stay and great experience. The staff was wonderful and very helpful. The location is great, you can walk to several area attractions with no problem, and there is a tube stop close by the hotel. As platinum members we had access to the lounge area which was a big time and expense saver. It was hard to believe that they offered complimentary wine and champagne. However, I would stay away from the hotel restaurants, as they are pricey. We did get some great tips from the concierge on some local places to eat. I would absolutely stay at this hotel again at a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but don't touch the minibar!”
Reviews.Author: ACVIANA
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed being near Champs Elysees but the hotel is understaffed. Breakfast is great but you have to beg for coffee. Service needs improvement. Rooms aren't in the best conditions, mine need better cleaness and the internet service wasn't working. I had to use the businees center which had a dial-up experience. The internet speed was terrible and so the computers. Don't touch the minibar!!! It's sensitive and just looking at it you are being billed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in a great part of Paris”
Reviews.Author: ChrisBD
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed in the Hilton ADT for our Wedding Anniversary. I had booked us a deluxe king room using my Honors points, so were very pleasantly surprised when we were told at the front desk that we had been updated to a Deluxe Suit on the Executive floor. The suite was huge (2 adjoining Deluxe rooms, reconfigured as a Bedroom and Sitting room), with 2 bathrooms, 2 Giant Plasma TV screens. Also had access to the Executive Lounge, open until late with the usual freebies (bar, snacks and breakfast). The EL was full of attentive staff and the bar and snacks frequently replenished. Another very nice touch (especially as we werenâ€™t paying a bean for this stay, all on HH) was a complementary Bottle of Champagne and Chocolate left in our room, compliments of the Manager. Hilton are very clued up on making their guests feel comfortable, valued and welcome â€“ after this experience I will definitely put them at the top of my favorites list when making my next reservation. The location of the Hotel is good too. The Hotel is located in a very pleasant residential area of Paris just across the street from the Parc De Monceau. ADT, Champs Elysees are all within easy walking distance, we walked to Musee Dâ€™Orsay 20 Mins and the Lourve is about the same distance. Courcelle Metro station is just a few minutes walk, so no problem accessing other areas of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “You need to be in a Platinum level to get all the perks in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: boots67
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived in the morning, the front desk asked us to wait for 45 minutes. We waited patiently, and 2 hours later, we weren't called. We kept asking and they kept telling us to wait. Then another hour, they told us that the room had been vacated since 9am (and now at about noon time), but since we asked for no smoking and that we had mentioned our child had asthma, they were cleaning it well. Which was a lie because it couldn't have been that long to clean it. When we finally got our room, we didn't see anything special at all. It wasn't cleaned the way they told us they would've had. And after waiting, with 2 kids that were so tired from the trip, they gave us a room that overlooked a wall and was really an ugly view. We weren't very happy with the room but they didn't have another room until 2 days later if we changed rooms. The room's lamp didn't work, and the some of the lights were broken...A few days later, we got our room, which was not an upgrade but better view and at least the lights were working. The rooms are pretty good and if there are 4 of you, this is the only hotel that had 2 full size beds. For Paris hotels, I would say they are quite roomy, but in US standards, they are still of course small. Don't bother to ask for upgrade not unless you are a Platinum level. We were only silver but I would say Hilton points are the best in the world. We got the whole week on points. As silver level, we weren't even offered breakfast while waiting at the lobby with young kids and to think we were waiting for more than 3 hours!! A week before we arrived in Paris, I requested the guest services if they could do something for my husband who was going to celebrate his b-day in Paris. We have exchanged messages and had set up a plan to send us a cake and champagne. That was really nice and we got it in theafternoon. Also if you travelling with the kids, they do get gifts upon check in like hats and t-shirts that had the hotel's logo in it. We had dinner at the restaurant one night, The Saffran. The food was quite good and the service was excellent. A little expensive but it was convenient. In terms of restaurants around the hotel, there weren't too many but if you walked about 10-15 min towards Champs Ellysees, you will find a ton...There is a little market very close by, where you can get wines, cheeses, fruits, drinks, etc. It's the mini Prix. If you see a cafe across the hotel, go toward it and keep walking pass it. In about, a few min. you'll see the market. One night we bought a bottle of Bordeux, salami, cheese for my husband and I, and sandwiches and apples for the kids. The wines are cheap (about 2-3 euros).. Just ask the bellhops that hang around the front door for any directions and they will be happy to tell you. I used the concierge once but I didn't think they were that helpful. They didn't give me any recommendation on some good little bistros around or any cool restaurants to try...

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: californiagal1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days at the Hilton ADT in August and thoroughly enjoyed it. Since we were there with 2 young kids and celebrating our 10th wedding anniversary and coz my husband has Hilton Platinum status they upgraded us for a suite with 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms connected. We also got a complimentary bottle of champagne and a cake. Room was really nice and spacious and facilities topnotch. Having the Exec lounge for snacks and drinks throughout the day was a boon especially for those with young kids. FOr the 1st day we had breakfast at the Exec.Lounge but after that we got coupons for the breakfast downstairs and OMG.....that was Amazing!!!!! Huge choice and great quality. Staff at the hotel was very helpful with our plans and for making reservations but I especially loved the doormen....Incredible!!!!!! Location I thought was great. As a family with young kids we like to stay a little away from the action and this was an excellent choice for that. Dont get me wrong...it was not too far away. Its a 5 min walk to metro Courcelles and a 15-20 min walk to ADT which even my 7 & 5 year old did with no problems! My kids had a blast at the Parc Monceau which is just a few metres away from the hotel and a great place to observe parisian life!!!! Very interesting!!! They have a great playground and sandbox and green areas for those wanting to get some excercise and go for a run. I would definitely reccomend this hotel for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and relaxing hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: cpgolf2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our 25th wedding anniversary in Paris and London. We started the trip with a 5-night stay at the Hilton Arc de Triomphe. The hotel staff went above and beyond to make our trip a wonderful and memorable experience, starting with a bottle of champagne and dessert in our room on arrival. We were upgraded to the executive lounge floor (Hilton Honors Diamond upgrade); our room had a private balcony overlooking a quiet garden courtyard. The hotel's executive lounge is the best I have found in Europe and the USA. - Prior to traveling, we read several reviews about this hotel's remote, boring location. My response is (1) NOTHING in Paris is "boring" and (2) the hotel is an easy 5 minute walk from the Metro (or 10 minutes to the Arc de Triomphe Metro stop if you want to avoid one transfer); either way, this location is very easy to access day or night. We looked at other hotels while we explored Paris. While many are lovely, they are on very busy streets. We enjoy our sleep while traveling, so when we return to Paris, the only hotel we will consider is the Hilton Arc de Triomphe. The staff and facilities exceeded our expectations. By the way, I travel 5-days/week for business, and have top tier status at Starwood, Marriott, as well as Hilton. My hotel preferences are usually in that order, if convenient. To put the Hilton Arc de Triomphe first in this case should say something very positive about the hotel, the management and staff.

Reviews.Title: “tres belle”
Reviews.Author: JaneyfJaneyf
Reviews.Content: really enjoyed my stay here, a little noisy but that didn't affect my stay. Staff are really friendly and enjoyed it alot.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jw713
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Arc de Triomphe for 2 nights in September. The staff was absolutely amazing...very friendly and helpful. I have status with Hilton so we had access to the Executive lounge which was nice for free breakfast, snacks & a midnight chocolate treat. To get around Paris from this hotel you can access the metro from one of 2 stops. One stop is about 10 (maybe 15) minute walk right down the street from the hotel. If you take this train you'll always need to transfer at the next stop to another train. The other option is walk 15-20 minutes and walk right to the train where you'd transfer. Overall we didn't think it was a bad walk at all and the areas you walk through are just fine. We were upgraded to a suite which was huge...2 big rooms, 1.5 bathrooms, 2 nice sitting areas...very nice overall. The room was very clean, modern, nice furniture, comfortable bed, 2 huge LCD TVs. We really enjoyed our time at the Hilton ADT and were sad to leave. Our next hotel was in Venice where our room was less than 1/2 the size of our room at this hotel. I'd highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “With Hilton Reward Points - YES! Without - Maybe.”
Reviews.Author: Navyfan
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Arc de Triomphe, in my opinion, is a mixed bag. The service of the staff and condition of the rooms are outstanding. We arrived via taxi looking very haggard from an all-night flight. The doorman opened the taxi door and told my wife, "Madame, it is O.K. now - you are in Paris." She was so charmed by this greeting. Like other reviewers, we were not upgraded but did receive breakfast vouchers which were worth their weight in gold - the excellent breakfast is priced at a whopping 33 euros otherwise. Our room overlooked the gardens and was very quiet. It was not large by any stretch but beautifully appointed and the bathroom was quite luxurious. So here goes: Pros: (1) Staff was exceptionally cordial, without exception. The breakfast staff greeted us enthusiastically every morning. (2) The room, as mentioned, was plush and inviting with a very comfortable bed. (3) The neighborhood is quiet, especially after hours, and appeared totally safe. Cons: (1) EXPENSIVE!!! With this hotel's room rates, I think it's outrageous to charge a hefty fee for internet connectivity. Likewise, food and drink are exorbitant - unless you're on an expense account, you'll be eating and drinking elsewhere. (2) The location is not very convenient to the major attractions. On a future visit, I would try to stay in a more "happening" area. The walk back to the hotel at night was rather dreary. The nearest metro stop, Courcelles, only services one line so you'll find yourself trekking to the metro stop at the Arc de Triomphe (Charles de Gaulle, 15-20 minutes away) that connects with a number of lines. Overall, we enjoyed our stay, mainly because the price was right :) and the service was impeccable. However, since you spend so little time in your room while in Paris, if not using Hilton points I would recommend staying in less pricey accommodations more centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “It is all about the bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Eduardo54
Reviews.Content: I just read some of the reviews, and I have to agree. The location is fine and convenient, if you are interested in the touristy part of Paris, or you need to in near anything the 8 or 9 arrondissenments. The best thing about the hotel rooms are the bathrooms. Seems like when they remodeled it, they put all their money in making the roomâ€™s bathrooms great. I had the same experience that some of the other travelers: there were no upgrades available, no access to the executive lounge, free breakfast, which was very nice. The rooms are small. We got everyday complimentary water and cookies/candy everyday with a hand written note from the hotel guest coordinator, but no glasses for the room; we probably called 6 times to get glasses over the 4 days we were there and never got them. For a Hilton, I think it is a nice place, but it seems that the effort (people and money wise) has been placed in the wrong places. I also think the bar is way over priced considering that it is not a hip place or something that would be considered chic in the US, it is just a regular hotel bar with 20 euros champagne glasses.

Reviews.Title: “Parisienne Perfection”
Reviews.Author: BrianDiana
Reviews.Content: I collect Hilton's..well, sort of. I have been staying in Hilton hotels for the last twenty years or so and overall, I think they are a good brand/franchise. I don't provide reviews for all of them, only when they are good..or bad. Business finds me in Paris after a five year break from visiting this magnificent city and maybe it was the painless journey here by Eurostar (why on earth would anyone fly from London when that fantastic service is available?), or just the pleasant Autumn weather but I feel a warmth and joie de vivre which requires complimenting with a quick review. On arrival, a charming receptionist, who probably spoke eight or nine languages, greeted me. When I gave her my name, she gasped attractively "M'seiu Brian, 'ow wonderful to 'ave you as a Diamond member to visit our 'otel." After that welcome, I would have happily stayed in the laundry room but no, I was given a top floor room with a balcony. As I stepped out of the room, sipping a glass of the complimentary wine, what was the first sight to behold? Yes, the Eiffel Tower. Happily, I sat down in the sunshine and dozed contentedly listening to the chatter of Parisienne's at lunch. Later, I made my way to the executive lounge. Please, please, please Hilton USA, UK, Japan management, send your people here to learn. Gracious service, an open bar from 1pm to 3pm and then again 6pm to 9 and lovely food. No extra charges and no one rushing to rip the wine glass out of your hands as the clock strikes the hour. The food, wine and service is impeccable. Tres cher mon amis but I absolutely recommend this fine hotel if you have the wherewithal to spend the Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Stay There Again!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug070707
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hilton Arc de Triomphe for 7 nights in July. First of all, It is convienently located just a few blocks from the Arc de Triomphe and Champs-Elysees (about a 10 minute walk) and the Courcelles Metro stop (about a two minute walk). Getting there was so easy, we flew in to CDG took the RER to Gare du Nord, walked to the La Chapelle Metro Station (line 2) and took it to the Courcelles stop. I would travel this way again as it was easy and the most affordable way. This way could be hard if you have a lot of luggage though. Secondly, the hotel was amazing. It was beautifully decorated, from the lobby to our room. Everything was extremely clean and the staff was very helpful when we had questions. While we didn't spend too much time in the room (too much to do and see in Paris) it was nice to know that at night we had a great place to get a good nights sleep to be ready for the next day. Check-in was fast and easy and they made check-out work with our schedule. Their check-out time was noon, but weren't leaving the city until 8 pm that night, they held all of our luggage safely until we were ready to actually leave. This gave us the freedom to enjoy another beautiful day in Paris. The only disappointing thing was that there wasn't free internet access, which we were hoping for to communicate to our family and friends back home.

Reviews.Title: “Above our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: LisaJ626
Reviews.Content: Everything about this Hilton was above our expectations! It is beautiful in every way. The staff were incredibly accommodating and always pleasant. The staff spoke French (of course) but all spoke English so we had no difficulty making ourselves understood. We were upgraded to the executive level (as we are Gold members) and this is where we ate our breakfasts (scrambled eggs, croissants, french bread, meats, cheeses, yogurts, cereals, and sweets). There was light food available throughout the day which was much appreciated Champagne was available from noon onward. Our room and bath were so comfortable and beautiful. The hotel is decorated in an Art Deco style and the floors and baths are made of different colors of marble. The hotel is located in a quiet area very close to a beautiful park called Park Monceau. It is 2 blocks to the Metro and just about 5-4 to the Arc de Triomphe. We've stayed at many Hilton family hotels and this is by far our favorite. We will definitely stay here when we return to Paris. Can't wait to get back to this fabulous city! Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your sleeping-bag and sleep in the bathroom”
Reviews.Author: jo_cicco
Reviews.Content: I stayed only one night at the Hilton for business. I was given a suite on the 2d level (1800 euros a night, my most expensive stay ever). For that range of price, I was expecting something unique, chic and trendy. Actually, the suite was quite big (e.g., 2 bathrooms, no kidding!) but the Hilton should fire their designer: overall, furnitures, carpets, curtains, bed linen, everything seemed definitively old-fashioned and somewhat out-dated, not to mention the TV screens that seemed to have been found in a car boot sale in the early 90's. The most beautiful part of my room was the lavish and stunning bathroom (I even considered sleeping in the toilets as an alternative of my ugly bedroom). I don't know if my suite is representative of the other rooms, maybe I was just unlucky. Normally I don't really care about how the rooms are designed, but when rates reach the 2000 $ /night range, I do expect to get what I pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Our best stay in Europe!”
Reviews.Author: luvtobeonvaca
Reviews.Content: We are Hilton Gold members and used our points for our four nights stay in Paris. After a very long flight and early morning, our check-in was fantastic. We are a family of three and in order to be on the club floor, we would have to have a rollaway brought in. We opted to stay in a non-club floor and was provided with coupons for breakfast each day. Fortunately, we were able to get into our rooms very early and was able to sleep for a couple of hours. When we awoke, we were provided with bottled water and a chocolate Eiffel Tower. The service at this hotel was remarkable from the concierge service to guest services. I had trouble with my blackberry and the concierge assisted me with a phone call to our service provider. We also used the Internet due to no service with my blackberry and was able to purchase minutes for a reasonable cost in the business center. Our room was serviced twice daily and each night we were provided with a weather forecast for the next day. The breakfast was wonderful. We ordered french toast almost every day. With such a good breakfast, we often passed on lunch and just had dinner. The c oncierge was also very helpful in assisting us with traveling to Versailles on our own and provided us with several options to choose from, taxi, metro and train, and cab and train. The location was fantastic! What a wonderful stay we had at this hotel. We travel to Europe each year and this was by far, one of the nicest hotels we have ever stayed in with respect to the cleanliness and service provided by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “terrible terrible terrible”
Reviews.Author: jumpingJacq
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 6 night stay in Paris. Used my hilton points (gold vip) to book the stay. We were advised that there were no upgrades available and received complimentary bfast each day instead. This was unfortunate since we booked this hotel due to reviews of the exec lounge. Due to our long flight, I took a shower once I got in the room to find out that I was wearing a dirty robe! It had someone else' hair entangled all over it. I was so disgusted and called guest services to have it handled (sans apology)... come to find out later that housekeeping just came in and rehung the robe back in the bathroom. Needless to say, the service was appalling and the room very dirty (hairy robe, headboard had grease stains, and sheets were gritty). It took a follow up call to have the situation taken cared of with an apology (finally). I have stayed at Hilton hotels everywhere and this one was substandard in regards to cleanliness and service. The concierge almost ruined my vacation by failing one morning to follow up with my tour to Vernon. He noted that he received an automated voicemail and that I should just go to the train station. After waiting 1hr at the train station, I had to purchase an emergency phone card for 8euro to find that I was waiting in the wrong spot and that the train was leaving in 5 minutes. Luckily, we made a run for it and caught our tour group or else we would've lost out on the tour booking and 1 of the reasons for my trip - to bike in the countryside to Monet's garden (highly recommended - Fat Tire Tours). Very businesslike and not very relaxing here. Final 2 cents: I will not be returning and will be reconsidering my Hilton Honors membership after this.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Hotel does everything right!”
Reviews.Author: Rz72801
Reviews.Content: This hotel gets top ratings on priority items, and also has a lot of features we did not expect. We stayed 9 nights (late August-early September). Great service began at check in. We received free champagne in the bar's outdoor terrace while we waited 20 minutes for the room to be ready. Shortly after we arrived we received a chocolate Eiffel tower and a note from the guest relations staff to welcome us. The lobby is much more impressive in person than the hotel website's pictures. The housekeeping is great, the room was always immaculate after the staff visited. The bed was extremely comfortable, and the bath had good storage. Our room was quiet since it overlooked their pretty interior garden (deluxe king). We had a lounge chair and a desk, and we thought it was very ample. The art deco theme is very well done with great attention to detail. I almost felt like were in an old movie. We always had plenty of towels, thick plush robes and soaps/shampoos. The TV, flat screen, was big and worked well. About 6 channels in English. The layout of the room was very well designed. i really liked being able to open the window and get the latest weather without going downstairs. The staff spoke English, its air conditioned and there were ice machines on every floor which we appreciated as Americans. We had dinner one night in the hotel restaurant, and enjoyed it very much (3 courses with wine 100 euro for 2). Breakfast is a very lavish brunch like buffet for 33 euros (22 euros for deluxe continental). The location is in a residential/business area. A great plus is that the hotel is on rue de Courcelles, directly on the #84 bus a few steps outside the door. The bus goes directly to Madeleine, Concorde, or the left bank (St. Sulpice). The metro is a 5 minute walk (Courcelles) which goes directly to Montmartre, or Arc de Triomphe. Its a short walk (approx 10 minutes) on Ave. Hoche to the Arc de Triomphe and the restaurants of the Champs Elysses. The neighborhood is absolutely beautiful, its 19th century Paris. We appreciated the calm after a day of sightseeing. There is a ATM across the street a half block. Concierge desk was very helpful. They had good restaurant recommendations and printed out maps of how to walk there. Enjoyed the nightly turndown service with Laduree chocolates and the weather forecast. When we ordered a taxi for the airport, they looked up which terminal we needed to go to, a very nice touch. One tiny drawback is the waste basket in the bathroom is a little small by US hotel room standards. Also, we did not have a coffee maker in our room (probably that feature is not done in France), but the restaurant was happy to serve me a cup. When you have never been back to Paris for many years like us, you don't know if you're making a good choice. In Paris the standards of this hotel are so high I would easily choose it again! They've thought of everything, so we could just enjoy our Paris vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: 3rd_trip
Reviews.Content: I have stayed total 4 nights at this hotel in July and I must say that when I think about this hotel, it's the SERVICE! I don't know why but because it's in Paris, I had low expectation of service because what I read and heard about the hotels in Paris but I must say the service I got from there was one of the best in the World! Room is clean and size was okay but we had nice view of garden. Since I am a hilton diamond memeber, we used the lounge for free and breakfast and dinner drinks were very nice, if you are lucky, you can also get a seat from the terrace at the lounge and my wife and I, we enjoyed it very much. Hotel's name is Arc de triomphe but it's about 5~7 minutes walk to Arc de Triomphe but I didn't mind such walk, hotel was in nice neighborhood, felt safe to walk at nights. Overall, I would stay at this hotel again next time just because of their amazing service!!

Reviews.Title: “Paris”
Reviews.Author: Flit_Wing
Reviews.Content: stayed at the Hilton Arc De Triumph. This was a great hotel for me. I thought the location was easy walking to major sites and I am a big fan of Parc Monceau. The concierge was very helpful and tracked down our lost luggage, lent us a guide book, provided emergency toiletries, found some wonderful chocolate souvenirs and had ready suggestions. There are wonderful restaurants nearby. The room was very spacious for Paris and both clean and comfortable. I inadvertently left a pair of pearl and diamond earrings on the table one night and despite at least 3 people entering the room, they earrings were not taken. The lobby has a lot of plush chairs and it is a great place to sit and read the paper or recharge.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond expectations”
Reviews.Author: wahooalums
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Hilton Arc de Triomphe for four nights at the end of a ten day trip to France. We obtained a significantly discounted price for our stay thanks to a 50% off discount on the Hilton website. It is difficult to say how we would have felt were we paying full price for each night, but we were absolutely thrilled with every aspect of our stay. The lobby of the hotel is huge and lovely. The images on the website simply donâ€™t do it justice. It smells of fresh lilies all day long. But the best part of entering the Hilton was the incredibly warm welcome we received. We couldnâ€™t make a move without being offered assistance and guidance in flawless English. The concierge was particularly helpful. My husband visited the concierge desk several times during our stay, and each time he was helped by a new staff person, each of whom was courteous and knowledgeable. We expressed interest in taking a cruise on the Seine, and the gentleman helping us not only pointed out a company he knew of, but was able to sell us the tickets himself so we wouldnâ€™t have to wait in line. The hotel room was significantly larger than we expected in such a desirable location. The bathroom in particular was a relief, with a lovely deep tub and a roomy stall shower. Perhaps if we had paid the full $500 per night we wouldnâ€™t have been quite so surprised by the space, but as it was, the room felt every bit like a resort! Breakfast was included in our stay. We likely wouldnâ€™t have tried it otherwise, given the 33 euro per person price tag. Iâ€™m very glad we were able to experience the splendor of the Hilton breakfast. We were greeted by a sweet Parisian lady each morning, and she remembered our name after day one. Breakfast was a massive buffet of hot and cold dishes, with a full aisle of pastries and bread. A friendly waiter comes by with tea, coffee and the freshest most fragrant orange juice Iâ€™ve ever encountered. We lingered in the mornings, reading the complimentary copies of the International Herald Tribune, Financial Times, and The Economist. If I had stayed healthy, we would probably remember this hotel simply as a lovely hotel in a lovely city. But on the morning we planned to fly back to the US, I woke up viciously sick and unable to catch our plane. My husband rushed down to the concierge, who helped him make the necessary calls to change our flights. They put through the calls from the desk, without charging us for the long distance (which normally would have been outrageously priced through the hotel). We needed to stay an additional night, and the front desk let us extend our reservation at the discounted price we had obtained online, which they had absolutely no obligation to do. Finally, when my husband made it to breakfast after all of this, the friendly woman who greeted each morning noticed my husband was alone and asked after me. Upon hearing I was sick, she proceeded to find several Tupperware containers for him to use to bring me breakfast when I was recovered. We were both thankful for all the kind people who helped make the best out of a terrible day. I cannot say enough to adequately describe the friendly, intelligent, and helpful people who staff this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous decor, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: lindagaf
Reviews.Content: The photos do not do justice to this beautiful hotel. If you love art nouveau style, this will take your breath away. The staff were perfect, and treated us wonderfully, even though we were staying on points. ( A far cry from the Hilton Waikoloa Village on Big Island, Hawaii.) The rooms were standard Hilton rooms, not spacious, but hey, you are in Paris. Beds were comfy, bathrooms were clean. We changed rooms after the first night, as our room was under the executive lounge, and they were fine about it. The Executive Lounge was excellent, breakfast was amazing, with great service. This hotel caters to some very well-heeled Middle Eastern travellers, some of whom bring their (gold-plated ) cars with them. My kids got a kick out of seeing the Maserati's and Lamborghini's that were parked outside of the hotel every day. The only drawback of this hotel is that it could be a little more centrally located, but there are two Metro stations that are an easy walk nearby, so it's a minor quibble. I would stay here again with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Plush Parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: butterflybarbie
Reviews.Content: Used Hilton Honours Points so rate of the hotel was not relevant, although prices average 260 Euro per night. Location wise the hotel is a 15 minute walk to the Arc de triomphe and Champs Elysees, which is suprising because the name suggests you will be right there by it....this became a bit of a trek in the pouring rain! Check in was quick and speedy and we were able to check in very early at 12 noon, despite expecting not to see our room until 3pm. Rooms are decorated in art-deco style, very clean and well furnished as you'd expect from a 5 star hotel. Bar and restaurant extremely expensive, tea, coffee or soft drinks are 6-7 Euro each and even more for room service. Parking is 35 Euro per day in a secure underground car park. Lots of Ferraris and Porsches during our holiday due to Saudi Princes staying in the hotel. Did not use the restaurant or spa so am unable to comment on these. In conclusion, this is a great hotel, not the best Hilton I have stayed in, very expensive but afterall this is Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique”
Reviews.Author: Aspire_to_be_more
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went here for a long weekend to celebrate her 40th Birthday. Thankfully the hotel met and exceeded our expectations. We were lucky enough to get a balcony room on the executive level (half price deal) which meant access to complimentary drinks and nibbles in the executive lounge from Breakfast through until 11:00pm. I cannot say enough about the service and standard of the hotel. The hotel was located about 5 minutes from the nearest Metro station. There was a park about 3 minutes away that was very popular with joggers and it was about 10 minutes walk to the Arc du Triomphe and Champs Elysees. It was relatively expensive by our normal budget but this is Paris after all. The best hotel we have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: joannkel
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel because I was looking to accomadate my family of 4 in one room, which can be difficult in Paris. Our room was clean and a decent size. We had 2 queen beds which were very comfortable. The bathroom was large too. We had access to the Executive Lounge where we had complimentary breakfast every morning and cocktails at night. This was great in keeping the cost of our trip down. The hotei is in a quiet neighborhood within walking distance to the Metro, Arc de Triomphe, Champs Elyesss and the Hop on bus tour.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels of Paris !”
Reviews.Author: Maxiiie
Reviews.Content: I have been a few times to Paris and the Hilton is really the best hotel. The service is Superb ! The executive lounge is very good with a wide selection of drinks and snacks! But without free wifi . The breakfast in the lounge is also very good but mostly it is full so you can have breakfast in the restaurant . Their it is even better than in the lounge ! The staff is also very friendly and always ready for you ! The rooms are small but tat is normal in Paris !

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RNC8611
Reviews.Content: I have never posted a review on Trip Advisor before but we had such a great stay here that I felt I just had to post about our experience. We stayed at the hotel for several days. Upon check in, a very helpful staff member I think her name was Magilla, found us several rooms together. We were exhausted from the early arrival and lack of sleep on the plane. She found rooms that were available for check in at 10:30 a.m. She was kind, efficient, and fast. AFter a nap, we went up to the Executive Lounge for a quick cup of tea. The staff there were very efficient. Everything runs like clockwork. The location of this hotel was terrific. We could walk at night to many different neighborhoods and eat at local restaurants. Most of the time we were the only tourists there which is a feat in itself in August in Paris. The concierge had good recommendations and there was rarely a line. One day we rented bikes and went off on our own....the highlight of my 11 year olds visit. Everything about this hotel is great. I am back just 24 hours and miss it already. Treat yourself to this hotel. You won't be sorry!!!

Reviews.Title: “Reception staff not very friendly”
Reviews.Author: PSAVIO
Reviews.Content: We found a rate of 247,50 euro (+/- 355$) on the net and booked this weekend trip last minute with one of our teenage daughters (13) as she had not been to Paris yet. As we live in Brussels (Belgium), we went by car and advised the hotel that we would only check in late (9 pm). * Location : a 10' walk to l'Arc de triomphe, where one can catch the metro and/or hop on/hop off buses. * Check in : although we had booked an executive room (apparently all located on the 6th & 7th floor), we got a room on the 5th floor (room 507). When we asked the next day whether we could see an exec room (on one of the two other floors) to compare with ours, it seemed impossible to do. We did not insist but found this strange. Anyway, we did not want to waste our time and/or energy on the issue as we had a lot of visiting to do. * Room : Ok with very small bathroom. We had a loose tile on the bath/shower which was not fixed and which we did not report in order to verify whether they would notice it and repair it, did not happen... * Exec lounge (6th floor) : as mentioned in other reviews, get there early for breakfast because it gets rather crowded after 9 am. Seemed rather small considering the number of exec rooms. Service was very nice but selection was rather limited. * Parking : we knew up front that the day rate is 35 euro (+/- 50$) but all in all, should a hotel of this category not offer free parking ? * Conclusion : we spent a very nice weekend visiting Paris but will not return to this hotel the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property”
Reviews.Author: favargas
Reviews.Content: Great location, the hotel was very clean and the staff was very friendly (The manager actually came out to shake my hand when I was checking in but I think is because I' am a Diamond VIP with Hilton) The concierge lounge was very spacious and very well equiped; the room was very well decorated although the TV was rather old for a hotel of such stature. Really good hotel overall

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: NiceGuy6
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night, on a brief two-day add-on to our vacation in London (the trains that run thru the Chunnel make such things possible!). We had stayed at this hotel for one night a few years ago, on a brief stopover in Paris on the way back to the US from Nice and remembered it being wonderful, so we chose to stay here again. We were not disappointed. We arrived in Paris around 10.30am, very tired. We took the Metro to the hotel and our room was ready when we got there, around 11am. Perfect! We checked in and took a nap. The shower, and the entire bathroom setup, was wonderful and was very relaxing. The bed was very comfortable. The service we received from the staff was amazing and we felt very welcome during our brief stay. The next morning, we enjoyed the "Hilton Breakfast" (free due to our HHonors status level) that was, quite simply, awesome. The spread available for breakfast is very extensive and very delicious. Even if you need to pay for it, which looked to be pretty expensive, it's worth it. It's really that good. We checked out right around noon and left our luggage with the concierge for storage, with no issues. After picking it up later, the service was still wonderful and our experience at this hotel was a key component of the wonderful time we had in Paris. This hotel is highly recommended. It's one of the best we have ever stayed at. If you're in Paris, for one night or many, don't miss this place.

Reviews.Title: “Treated great the entire time”
Reviews.Author: GeauxSaints78
Reviews.Content: We used Hilton Honors points for this stay and honestly I was shocked at how nice the hotel turned out to be. The pictures of the exterior of the hotel don't do it justice. If you are a Hilton Honors member, do yourself a favor and do whatever it takes to gain access to the Executive lounge. It is unbelievable. Every morning a full breakfast that will meet any person's needs. I loved the eggs, salmon, yogurt, unlimited cappuccino, sparkling water, etc. All gratis with access to the lounge. But it doesn't end there. At lunchtime they will change the rotation to include small sandwiches, chips, cookies, cakes, cokes. At dinner the rotation changes to include alcohol (full liquor options, beer, wine). I never worked out whether or not we were supposed to tip - it didn't look like most people did. I'm traditionally a very generous tipper so I felt guilty about basically never doing it save for our room attendant. The room itself was very nice - we had a leak from our AC unit (I think) in the bathroom that was annoying and one night the guy had to come in at 11PM to drain it. Other than that everything was great. The 10 minute walk to the Arc/Etoile Metro station got to be a drag on the 6th and 7th days, but sometimes we could catch the Courcelles station (only 2 blocks away but only serviced 1 line). Overall I would rate this as a 4.5 star hotel. Definitely exceeded my expectations in every imaginable way. If you use iPass there is a wired hookup so I was able to use my work access to have hi speed internet the entire time. One final general note: I was shocked at how LATE everybody in Paris tends to start their day. No kidding, I'm no early bird but if you get into the breakfast room at 8:30AM you'll basically have the place to yourself and can get a great spot to eat on the outside terrace. Our room was across from a business park and it was hilarious for me as an American to see the first person in the office arrive at 9:10AM. Nobody was working past 4:30PM. Unreal. I could get used to that - Parisians know how to live for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service & Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nrf
Reviews.Content: This is a top-notch hotel. Although a bit further from many Paris attractions, we were just 2 blocks from the subway stop (Courcelles) and thus easy access to most places. Just a block away from Parc Monceau which is very pretty & filled with lots of people on the weekends. The hotel and rooms were very clean. There is a gym and spa (hot sauna & huge hot spa). Hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. We had the opportunity to eat at the restaurant and found it to be fantastic - excellent food and again - excellent service. Negatives: Ibahn internet connection is 30 euros per 24 hr period. There was free wireless (if it is supposed to be available - we hooked in anyway) and that service was spotty at best. We would stay here again and enjoyed the hotel very much.

Reviews.Title: “An american hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: manywhere
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite central, but you should know that 1/even if it is called "Arc de Triomphe", expect a 10-15 minute-walk to reach it and 2/ yes, it is central, but in a very quit neighbourhood; do not expect a lot of fun around the hotel. The hotel itself is very nice and very "exotic" for me as a French guy, because it is fitted to American standard. A stronger "French touch" would certainly be appreciated by guests.

Reviews.Title: “Ubelievable Service and Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: jestodc
Reviews.Content: Wow, I can not say enough about this hotel and the people that work there - thank you all so much for making the first night of our honeymoon one of the best of our lives. We arrived at the Hilton Arc de Triomphe early to find out that they upgraded us to a suite, and knowing we were tired and that the room was not ready, they allowed is into the lounge for some relaxation while the room was being prepared. First - the room - amazing, amazing, amazing - i've stayed at the Ritz in Paris and our room at the Hilton was much more comfortable and elegant (in a different style of course). Second - the staff - simply the best i've ever met in Paris or anywhere in europe - thank you for the surprise Champagne and dessert after a long day of sightseeing! Third - the concierge Tony - what an amazing, kind, and helpful concierge and crew - no request was too trivial, and the warmth and enthusiasm was amazing, tour of the city - no problem, last minute dinner reservations - no problem, advice and directions on a local breakfast cafe - done. Fourth - location - so easy to walk to the Champs Elysees and great access to all Paris has to offer. Finally - the most amazing part of the stay.... we used Hilton points, and the level of service, warmth, and attention was all essentially gratis. This is absolutely the ONLY place to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mika777
Reviews.Content: Location, room, service, and food where very good. I recomend this hotel to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Friendly staff and walkable to Arc De Triomphe!”
Reviews.Author: DesiTrvler
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 2 nights - in a Double Double room - thanks to Hilton Honors. The staff received us slightly earlier than regular check-in and got us to our room. Rooms are of reasonable size (for a 2 double bed room) and were well maintained. The property is in a good location - you can walk to Arc De Triomphe ( about 7 minute walk) and to the Metro (about 7 minutes to the Etoille Metro which is a bigger metro).
