The breakfast that they served was real good ( being honors gold helps - since breakfast is free) and it was a wide assortment. My kids were everywhere in this place and yet I felt completely safe when I was in the hotel. The front desk staff were always available to help answer questions and direct us to the right location/restaurant etc. Paris in general is not that kid friendly ( at least the impression I got) - but this place was certainly not the case.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place I stayed in Europe!”
Reviews.Author: manabout2wn
Reviews.Content: Keep in mind we stayed in a suite on the executive level so this may lean a bit, but...the staff was incredible and always helpful and smiling. The rooms were huge by European standards. The food there was wonderful, even though one night we waited a long time for a waiter. Staff in the lounge were always waiting for you at the door with a smile and "Bonjour!". You are about 6 or 7 blocks from the Arc de Triomphe. You are but a few blocks from an assortment of places serving great food. A tad pricy if you aren't staying here on points.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: parnellpanther
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located to most of Paris tourist attractions. Hotel staff were fantastic and went out of their way to make us feel welcome and assist with our needs. The concierge in particluar was fantastic and spent the best part of an hour on the phone, helping us successful locate a cellphone that had been left on a bus. This went well beyond the call of duty.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful visit!”
Reviews.Author: LoveEnglandLots
Reviews.Content: I just got back from staying 8 nights at the Hilton Arc de Triomphe hotel. Service was extraordinary- everyone was so friendly and helpful. The different concierges couldn't do enough for you. The servers in the restaurant had smiles on their faces and were so pleasant. Room was small but comfortable. Housekeeping comes in twice a day. The only negative comment was that the restaurant is pretty expensive for what you get. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: kdjte
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 7 nights (3 Hilton reward nights and 4 paid). It is conveniently located in a quiet, clean neighborhood with wide sidewalks. There is a park very close by where my daughter and I ran in the mornings. The metro is also nearby. The staff at the hotel was friendly and helpful. They remembered us from morning to morning at the breakfast buffet (free with Hilton Gold). One evening we ate at the hotel restaurant for supper. The food was enjoyed even by picky teenage girls and the staff went out of their way to compliment them on how nice they looked in their dresses. My wife had her fiftieth birthday during our stay. The hotel provided a welcome in our room with flowers, Champaign, and dessert. And to our surprise they repeated it again on the actual day of her birthday. Internet access is expensive (20 euro per day) but we managed to make do with 3 thirty minute sessions for the week (5 euro each). The room was clean with nice carpets and a marble bathroom. During our stay they replaced all the TVâ€™s on the floor with new 42 inch LCD flat screens.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: RA123
Reviews.Content: Paris. What can I say? Beautiful, wonderful! Visited with husband and children ages 9 yrs and 15 yrs., over the Valentine weekend. On checking in my children my presented with a Hilton t-shirt each - a nice touch (don't know if this is because I'm silver member or if they just ive to everyone). We had a family room - 2 rooms in the corner secured by a third main door. Lovely rooms. Bathroom a bit of a squeeze, but not bad, considering it was Paris! Breakfast was usual lavish Hilton spread. Had room service - food was excellent especially the onion soup. Ate at the bar. Prices are high (â‚¬ 15 for onion soup), but we found that the hotel prices were reasonable when compared with the prices in the restaurants on Champs Elysee. Food at the Hilton was very good though. Concierge recommended La Duree on Champs Elysee for afternoon tea - what a wonderful treat! The deserts were out of this world. My husband and I shared (watching the calories!) a violet concoction - made with real violet flowers, while my daughter had a rose concoction. Absolutely delicious. Their macaroons were one of the best that we'd tasted. Well worth a visit. As it was freezing cold that weekend we used taxis as mush as possible. The taxi drivers are very rude though and their charges seemed arbitrary. The Louvre was wonderful. Had downloaded the tour from their website, so we did only the masterpieces. There is a starbucks in the small shopping complex attached to the Louvre. Great stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BadHampton
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in July-09 for 3 nights. Used HH Points. Gold Member. 1st night not upgraded and then moved (upgraded) by my request to 6th Floor Executive Floor plus Lounge access. Should have free WiFi or at least a computer terminal in the Lounge. 9 Euros per Hour! Upgraded room very nice with double sinks. Executive Lounge nice but not as good as Hilton Hotels in London. Hotel is 10 minutes from Metro. If you are planning on visiting areas near Notre Dame, Marais etc, I found this hotel too far. Lived on the Metro. Wish I would of stayed closer to main sites. Overall, a good hotel with very polite personnel and excellent customer service. Do ask for Breakfast coupons for the Safron Restaurant...much better than offerings on the Executive Floor.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous”
Reviews.Author: JDsale
Reviews.Content: Stayed over the weekend 17/19 July for two nights and were lucky to have been upgraded to a beautiful junior suite. We had access to the executive lounge which was well stocked and a pleasant place to be; especially out on the balcony, before the pigeons started to wander! The staff were very helpful, both in the lounge and on the front desk. The location I found very good, in a quiet mostly residential area, about a fifteen minute stroll to the Champs Elysees, we walked on arrival from the Arc de Triomphe Etoile in a comfortable twenty minutes, and on our first night after taking advantage of the Louvre being open until 10pm, we walked back to our hotel from there in about 45 minutes. The Galleries Lafayette and the Rue Royale are about a 30 minute pleasant walk down past the Elysees Palace back to the Hilton. A great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KG-Colorado
Reviews.Content: After staying in 2 star hotels in a few previous cities, it was very nice to use reward points to have an excellent stay in this hotel. The lobby is beautiful, the staff was friendly, and the room was very large for a hotel room in Europe. Good location right off the Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysses. Out of the hustle and bustle of Paris, which was nice. We would stay here and use points again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TripleDeckers
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel - beautiful lobby with courtyard and our room was lovely with a huge window that swung open and you could hang out and look over the Parisian street below (we were at the front of the hotel). Staff were all very pleasant and helpful. We enjoyed the location - about a 10 minute walk to the Arc de Triomphe, 5 minute walk to the Metro, and about a block from the beautiful Parc Monceau. The Executive Lounge was great - full breakfast, afternoon tea, cocktails (even champagne!) and appetizers in the evening, and then later evening - chocolates and beverages. We also had a delicious room service dinner. We ate in their restaurant - it was adequate but quite pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a very good experience, with some minor exceptions”
Reviews.Author: Eryeal
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the ADT for 7 nights this past week, and here is a quick review .. As a Diamond, was upgraded to a 7th floor exec room (lounge on 6th floor). At the recommendation of others on here, I also requested a terrace room but was initially denied, then told I could move to a terrace room the 2nd night in, so I was happy with that. Even though it was a courtyard view room, it did have a very nice view with the Eiffel Tower in the background. All staff with the exception of one lounge person treated us exceptional. Every hotel employee greeted us no matter where we were in the hotel when we passed - very hospitable. As far as the one lounge person - it definitely was an exception and the manager said she was very new and apologized for the incident we had. In a long nutshell - my wife entered the lounge about 5 minutes before closing after a night out at the monuments and was denied a Ginger Ale soft drink because they were getting ready to close. Meanwhile - people left and right were getting wine and alcohol, and even leaving the lounge with it. It seemed my wife for some reason was singled out - but to me that didn't matter - it was the ridiculousness of denying a Ginger Ale 5 minutes before close simply because the attendant said she couldn't drink it in time and can't take it back to the room. Yes - it was that crazy. I immediately went down to the manager who was very gracious, got the drink, and even gave my wife a chocolate Arc de Triomphe. He seemed to genuinely understand that this was not appropriate behavior and would be addressed - he also mentioned this person was very new. The only minor downside to the hotel were facilities issues. On our first morning, the cold water was shut off (yes, the COLD water!) for about 15 minutes. Since this was our first time using the shower, we thought we were doing something wrong. It never happened again after that. Our TV every 15-20 minutes would go blank for about 5 seconds and then return to programming - was told this was a common problem they couldn't do anything about. Had water pressure issues every now and then where the shower would just drip and nothing else, but usually that lasted about a minute or so. Also had probably about half a dozen elevator malfunctions - door would not close, door would close but elevator would not move and then doors would open and process would repeat, etc. So the facilities part was the big downside during our stay. Room cleaning and turndown occured at about the same time every single day, and always occured. Turndown service was very much appreciated, and always included a gift of chocolate. The chocolates were always different, but it was always chocolates. As far as the lounge itself - very large and usually could get a table. Pretty much had the same food every day at the same times - no variety or changing things up there. For breakfast - hot eggs, bacon, and sausage, and a variety of fruits and vegetables and assorted drinks. Lunch was hot soup and the assorted items. Dinner was puff pastries, soup, and the assorted items. Mid-day snacks included cookies and chocolates, and nuts. While they did run out of things every now and then, it usually only lasted a short time and were replenished rather quickly. A few times they had quite a many uncleaned tables (50% of the lounge) - but again, being that it wasn't a normal occurrence it could be overlooked. Overall was pleased with what the lounge offered compared to others. Lounge also had a nice balcony, but with only about 6 tables. Check in and out was extremely fast - no waiting - and concierge was always helpful - usually a 5 minute wait or so for them. To and from - we took a taxi as we were 4 people and that was the cheapest, and fastest way. Cost was 40 Euros from CDG - so split that was 10 each, and about a 20 minute ride. Were greeted by doormen who offered to take our luggage, and they were generally always there for all guests arriving, and always greeted you as you came in or left the hotel. Taxi's were always available if you wanted to take them, and the metro stop was a short 5 minute walk. Be careful with the metro! Don't get overcharged for a one day unlimited pass for 9-12 Euros which is the first option you come to for unlimited use - deep in the menu is unlimited daily use for 5 Euros in Paris, and it's very hard to find yourself without the assistance first of a metro official. Just ask them for the Paris unlimited day pass that costs around 5 Euros and they will (in our case) be more than happy to come out and show you how to get to it - it's about 6 menus deep! I think they put the more expensive daily passes easy to get to just to make more money on people. Even the hotel concierge told us a daily pass is 9 Euros - so something to think about. Internet - 22 Euros a day! Tried to work some magic at the front desk but was no go. Ended up getting a $59 monthly subscription to Boingo, which you could use to access the wired, and wireless, internet at the hotel. MUCH cheaper than having to pay 22 Euros a day ($31/day) if you need access. On top of that, Boingo also worked at the second hotel we stayed at (Versailles Trianon Palace - Hilton), and also at the airport going home, so overall a very good deal considering. If you need internet - would defiitely recommend a subscription service like that. Easily canceled the subscription upon leaving. They also have about 6-8 other subscription services they support (T-Mobile, AT&T, among some) at the hotel so you don't have to pay the enormous daily rate. Also - MANY THANKS to those that mentioned the breakfast restaurant coupons at the lounge desk. Lounge person also had no problem giving us coupon each night for the next morning so we could enjoy breakfast in the hotel restaurant rather than the lounge - all you had to do was ask nicely. We ended up eating breakfast in the lounge only once - but since it wasn't as good, we got coupons for every other day. The restaurant breakfast included all of the same lounge options, but had more hot items (hash browns, crepes, pancakes, etc), and more bread and some other minor options. Definitely worth getting compared to the lounge. Again - the most important part was that the lounge person never once minded giving you the coupons if you asked. Great to be in Paris on Bastille Day! Parade wasn't as good as it was hyped to be - but the fireworks were AMAZING. Even though we had to go and sit for 4 hours prior to the fireworks - it was worth it. I've never seen such a great display coming from both the Eiffel Tower and behind it - all with great musical accompaniment and seemed to go on forever and had several different themes and light shows going along with it. It was PACKED - but again, well worth it. If you ever get the chance to be there on Bastille Day - don't pass up the fireworks .. but to be on the Champ de Mars - you'll probably have to get there 4-5 hours early ... You can safely get there 1 hour early and probably have an OK partially obstructed view somewhere in the park ... but expect a ton of people! That's it ... All in all 4 stars out of 5 for me .. Very close to 3 stars due to facilities and the one lounge person in such a respected hotel - but the other staff and hospitality brought it back up to 4.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: ANDC77
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for three nights on points and had a great, great experience. The front desk staff were helpful and welcoming upon arrival. The room was what we expected - it had an updated, American-style business/corporate feel and was of decent size. The bathroom, as the rest of the room, was very nice, although a bit small. While we didn't rely upon the concierge much, our one exchange was helpful. We had a restaurant in mind and asked for his guidance on location and the possibility of needing a reservation. He immediately called the restaurant to confirm its location to help us with a cab and addressed the resevartion issue. Again, very helpful. On food, my wife and I split one of the room service breakfasts and it was more than enough and very good. It included a 3-4 cups of coffee, a juice, 6-8 pieces of toast, three other baked good and cereal (again, a lot of food). We also had dessert at the main restuarant late one night and the wait staff was excellent. On location, the point has been made that the hotel is not on an especially tourist-friendly street. I agree. That said, it is an easy 5-7 minute walk to a metro stop and about a 15 minute walk (down hill) to the Champs Elysee (sp?) and to the Arc de Triomphe. We left here for the Westin Paris for the rest of our trip - I would have rather stayed here given our experience there.

Reviews.Title: “Really?”
Reviews.Author: anita-msp
Reviews.Content: Having read the great reviews on trip advisor, I was more than a little disappointed when my husband and I stayed there for our anniversary. We were there for two nights at the beginning of our trip and even though I booked with 80,000 Hilton Honors points, I really wish we'd gone somewhere else--anywhere else. For the rest of our trip, we stayed in 2-3 star hotels and what an improvement in location, character, and service! For starters, even the most basic rooms at the 2-3 stars had wi-fi included. This Hilton wanted about â‚¬20 per day for wi-fi (or â‚¬9 per hour)! This goes beyond the usual nickle and dime routines. Further, having gained all those points at Hilton family hotels that provide some continental or full breakfast, I was disappointed that this hotel, which was several blocks from any Parisian cafÃ©s, wanted another â‚¬20+ per person for breakfast. Even the 2-3 stars later in our trip included a petit dÃ©jeuner. On the other hand, if you're over 65 and you like sterile with no views and paying through the nose for things other places include, then you'll certainly love this remote Hilton Arc de Triomphe.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great service”
Reviews.Author: shoshosho
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 1 night. It was for our 10th anniversary. We reserved the cheapest room, but they upgraded us to a junior suite. The room was huge and clean. I never thought of staying at a suite room in the heart of Paris. The general manager greeted me in person when I checked in. They gave 2 special presents for my 2 kids. Since I am a Gold member, I had an access to the lounge, which was pretty nice. Great staff and great service. I would definately stay here again. Walking to the main attractions were not too bad. I had 2 small children, and it is a doable task.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel... a bit out of the way... worth $300 or so a night”
Reviews.Author: ChatoAguilar
Reviews.Content: Just returned from two nights in Paris. The Hilton was a beautiful property with spacious rooms and really nice beds. It's walking distance to the subway as well, which is great. Everyone speaks English there and is VERY helpful. We toured the Latin Quarter and thought that would be a bit more "parisian' experience. This feels more like a residential neighborhood. We paid $200 per night via Skyauction, which was an AMAZING value. We saw it for $900 a night on Expedia. If I'd paid that... I wouldn't have been pleased, but if you can get it for around $300 or so... great value and a beautiful property. P.S. Sorry, just too busy to respond to individual emails. I hope this review is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Location was poor”
Reviews.Author: brian_uk12000
Reviews.Content: We booked this Hotel as friends were staying there too, but we were definitely disappointed with the location. There was little nearbye of interest and few Restaurants that were open other than for drinks until 7.30 pm. The room was small but adequate and we had a separate shower and tub which was good. The choice at breafast was very good. The downside....We asked the concierge to look on his computer for a Company by name and he claimed it did not exist anywhere in Paris. I checked on my Blackberry and found it within 2 minutes. We asked him several other questions and although he found the information he did not check to see if it was either in the same location or even open on that day. It was of course closed and we wasted 15 euros on a taxi. Other info was also very vague and poor. The cost of a Coffee and a diet coke in the Bar was 16 euros which is just diabolical. Would we stay there again......a resounding NO.....there are so many better locations and more reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Pricy, but a great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: somanybooks
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern and quite lovely, with beautiful art deco styling, ebony woodwork, and extremely pleasant and helpful staff. The only downside was that all the food and drink was extremely expensive - my husband had two cups of coffee, and the breakfast buffet for $44 euros!! There are reasonable cafes in the immediate vicinity - just don't est at the hotel! We spent a week here, and although it is off the beaten path for tourists, we found it to be a great location in the 8th arrondissement. It was easy to get around via the Metro [3 blocks away] and it was a great and safe walking neighborhood. Perhaps the best surprise was the amazing Parc Monceau only a block away. it is a truly Parisian park - we saw no tourists at all and we were there 3 times. Beautiful gardens and statuary, and incredible people watrching, particularly on Wednesday afternoon when school is out.

Reviews.Title: “best hilton ever”
Reviews.Author: desslock
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 1 week this winter This Hilton hotel is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at. The staff at the front desk,the manager on duty,the cleaning service,the luggage and front door people were all exceptionally helpful and friendly.The staff at the executive lounge were extraordinarily helpful and friendly. Our family which included children were amazed ! The executive lounge offered an incredible array of drinks-both alcohol and non-alcohol as well as numerous food options as well as desserts. The food changed regularly and the staff provided things like hot chocolate on request. the lounge stayed open till 11pm which was very convenient. We were lucky enough to be upgraded to executive floor and to our surprise we could see the Eiffel Tower from our window twinkling each night--it was a wonderful experience. our room had two double beds which is very very rare in europe and this was great for our family. Breakfast was offered in both the lounge as well as downstairs in the restaraunt the breakfast downstairs had more options and was more than adequate. When we came to the hotel at night we would find little treats left by our cleaning service--these included bon bons and little chocolates--the kids went crazy over this The hotel is very clean and we consider this hotel elegant in style. It is in a sort of out of the way location but an easy walk to metro---maybe 8 minutes at most but was freezing in winter nonetheless we were able to get everywhere we needed to including disney paris we would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again--it was a great and memorable experience and helped make our time in paris extra special thank you Hilton Arc de Triomphe the Yamamoto family

Reviews.Title: “Would come back - but with better shoes!”
Reviews.Author: CvrGrl
Reviews.Content: When my husband and I arrived in Paris, we got dropped off via the Air France bus at the Arc de Triomphe stop. I figured since this hotel said "Hilton Arc de Triomphe" that it had to be close. I was pretty wrong. If you are walking to the hotel, it's easy to get turned around on a back street. The Arc is a good 10 or 15 minute walk from the hotel, which isn't horrible since we like to walk, but be sure to bring some good shoes when doing this. We arrived on a Sunday morning and were disappointed to find all restaurants in that area closed. Since it's in the business district, it strictly operates around those typical 9-5 or 6 hours. Luckily the hotel has a wonderful buffet breakfast (expensive though at 32 euros per person) that we took advantage of. I recommend snagging some food from the buffet for the walk around Paris during the day, as Supermarkets are not always nearby and when hunger pangs hit, it's hard to find something quick and easy. Our room was relatively big for European standards, and was very modern. I was impressed that the bathroom contained a large soaking tub and a decent sized shower. I was also excited that I could not hear foot traffic at night when we were going to sleep or waking up. These are not paper thin walls here. Overall, the hotel is very put together. The lobby is beautiful and clean. The staff were very helpful, although contrary to other reviews, I did not find the concierge to be one of my favorites. I didn't think he was that helpful and could not give me straight answers on certain questions.Unfortunately it was the same guy every day so I didn't have much exposure otherwise. We stayed here on hotel points and would stay again simply because we enjoyed walking around and discovering cafes that were a little more obscure/out of the way. I have to recommend a nearby Italian style restaurant right down the street by two blocks called Vinoteca. They are what I'd call midrange to expensive depending on the course - wonderful food and great wine. The atmosphere was so fun and romantic. This was probably one of the better dinners we had while staying near the Hilton. I would definitely recommend this hotel to couples that prefer a little more quiet, but still enjoy finding those "hidden gems" of restaurants or shops.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Mskellydoll
Reviews.Content: I stayed on Hilton points and was not dissapointed. The lobby/bar area when you first walk in is very Elegant, the staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was lovely with an en suite bathroom, full tub. It was spacious and clean, nicely decorated. It is not really very close to the Arc de Triomphe so wear your walking shoes. All in all, very nice hotel, would stay again and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: FatDucks
Reviews.Content: We obtained a very good online offer over the Easter Break so this stay was worth every cent. The staff at check-in managed to get us upgraded to a bigger room with a roll away bed (a late request), hence check in took us a little longer than expected. Room was comfortable and very clean. Breafast was included in the price but not fantastic. Dinning area did look like a large foodcourt. Easy access to famous landmarks and resturants and staff were pleasent and helpful. In short we would not hesitate to recommend this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Recommend Only If Using Hilton Points”
Reviews.Author: Jammop
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel only if you are looking to use Hilton points for a free stay and have Hilton status to give you access to the Executive Lounge. If not, I would suggest finding a hotel that is closer to the sights and action of Paris. The main drawback of the hotel is the location. It is a 10--15 minute walk to the Champs Elysee and about a 25-30 minute walk to the Seine and Left Bank. At night, the streets leading to the hotel are very quiet and dark and at times we felt slightly unsafe because it was so deserted. The hotel is a 7 minute walk to the Line 9 metro stop (Saint Phillipe du Roule). The walk to this metro is up and down a steep hill, so if you have kids or are older, this may present an issue. There are many nice cafes, shops, a supermarket and a Starbucks (if you are in withdrawal as we were!) along the route to the metro and the Champs Elysee. Another issue that we had was that our room was not ready until 3:30pm. This was disappointing as check in time is at 2pm. There was no sense of urgency to get our room ready, which was just awful after a long flight. The Executive Lounge was one of the best that I have seen and provided a full breakfast and snacks throughout the day (including free wine and champagne). The lounge is very large and there is also a terrace for outdoor seating. The Conceirge staff is amazing. They are very knowledgeable and very patient. There are also about 8 people working at the desk at one time, so you never have to wait long to speak with them. Overall, it was a lovely stay and the hotel is very clean and comfortable, but would only return if I was using Hilton points.

Reviews.Title: “Start of our Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Robbo44Melbourne
Reviews.Content: We were joining a river cruise with Avalon waterway and what a wonderful way to start. From the moment our taxi pulled up the treatment we received could only be described as magnificent. Porters, reception were great. The room and given a choice was excellent. Breakfast first class. This was a great start to what turned out to be the best holiday we have ever had

Reviews.Title: “Desapointing...”
Reviews.Author: Joao_Amorim
Reviews.Content: Small and old rooms and not so clean. Didn't feel the requirement of the Hilton Honors program. Great restaurant to compensate. The Arc de Triomphe is not so close as the name might look, but at a 10m walk.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Likequiettraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Paris for 9 days on vacation. We chose this hotel because of its location, a 10-15 minute walk to the Arc de Triomphe and Champs-Ã‰lysÃ©es. If you are not a walker, the Metro stop is very close - less than 3 city blocks. The area is quiet and beds are very comfortable. However, if you are warm-natured, you will need to request a sheet to cover yourself because the beds all have duvets which are very warm. We also requested pillows other than the down pillows provided because the down pillows are too soft for us. The hotel was quick to respond to any request, and the concierge service was very helpful. I especially liked the design of the hotel. It is modeled after a trans-atlantic ocean liner. I need to point out that if you looking for tons of things to do at night, this location is not for you. You will have to catch the Metro or a taxi out to do such activites. It was not really a problem for us since we only returned to the hotel to relax and sleep. We will definitely use this hotel again. We liked the quiet neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wireUsa
Reviews.Content: Beautifully decorated - all Art Deco. A few blocks walk from the Arch and Champs Eleseys, but worth hit. Concierge staff was the best I've ever seen. Stayed on points for a week (Gold Level) and was upgraded to a top floor large room with balcony, view of Eiffel Tower and access to the Exec Lounge which was the best I've ever seen - not stop food and drink from 7am to 11pm - great wine, beer and Champagne complementary all day. Would stay again in a minute. Management sent us champagne to the room and called us to see if we needed anything. Great Spa also.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay - pleasantly surprised with the excellent service!!”
Reviews.Author: soupandnoodles
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hilton using points in May for a one week family vacation. Although, I'm a HHonors member, I'm not a LOVER of my Hilton experiences, but I have to say this was the BEST experience we've ever had. We've stayed in hundreds of hotels around the world and many Hiltons all over the world, and we were so pleasantly surprised. We have a 2 year old daughter, and they treated her and us so well. The facilities were very clean, the location was pretty good and relatively close to the Champs Elysee and the Arc de Triomphe, but the one thing that really impressed us was the service from EVERYONE, everyday. The bell hop, the front desk, the concierge, the room service folks were all amazing. I've not always had great service at a Hilton, so this was a pleasant surprise. Just a fantastic all around stay and i would definitely stay here again, EVEN paying for the room with the existing high rates.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: UsaMaf
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a long weekend with my daughter who is studying abroad in France. Hotel is absolutely wonderful. The service is top rate, cleanliness of rooms is impeccable. The maid service is prompt and efficient plus they are very courteous. Everyone there goes above and beyond to assist in any way they can. Loved the decor of the rooms' design.My rate included the breakfast buffet and was well worth it. Have stayed in other hotels in Paris and this is a strong recommendation. Only drawback is that the location is a little distance of a walk from Arc, but very doable. The metro station is a short walk away, this will take you to Etoile and change there for other line. Don't hesitate to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful honeymoon stay!”
Reviews.Author: thatgirlsab
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Hilton Arc de Triomphe for six nights for our honeymoon. I redeemed Hilton HHonors points for the stay. We arrived at the hotel in the afternoon, probably between 3 and 4 p.m. The check-in process was not overly friendly but very courteous and professional. We were given the keys to our room and told that someone would bring our bags up shortly. The porter arrived with our bags much more quickly than I expected, and he was followed by another gentleman who came bearing gifts. He brought a small chocolate dessert plate, which at first we tried to turn away because we didn't order it. He told us it was from the hotel, and when we thanked him, he said, "Wait, there's more." He returned with a bottle of MoÃ«t & Chandon, and then he returned to the hall a few more times to bring us two champagne flutes, silverware and napkins, and a welcome note. We still don't know if the welcome gift is a standard amenity, or if it was a honeymoon gift (I did note that it was our honeymoon when making the reservation). Either way, it was a pleasant surprise and a nice way to begin our stay. The room was very nice. We had a king room which was spotless. I was very impressed with how clean everything was and how little wear and tear there was. For a European hotel room, it was a very comfortable size. I stayed in the Park Hyatt Place Vendome the last time I was in Paris, and I think that the Hilton's room was just as large if not larger, although the bathroom was smaller at the Hilton. I enjoyed the Crabtree & Evelyn La Source bath goodies like soap, shampoo, conditioner, and body wash. I also appreciated the "vanity kit" which included cotton pads I used to remove my makeup at night. Every evening, we also received chocolates at turndown. One evening, we received rose-flavored hard candy, which were lovely and amazing! We did have a problem with our AC unit, which a technician came to work on. We were comfortable after that. The location of the Hilton Arc de Triomphe is very convenient. It's a short walk to the MÃ©tro station (Courcelles), and not far at all to the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs-ElysÃ©es. I also appreciated the quietness of the neighborhood. It's not a very happening place at night, but it's very quiet and it felt safe when we returned to the hotel and walked back from the MÃ©tro stop late at night. Our favorite part of our stay was the wonderful service we received from the concierges. They were always very friendly and helpful. Whether it was calling a cabaret to move our reservation to another evening or simply making a dinner suggestion and reservation, the staff really made a difference in the quality of our trip. One day, we were walking from the hotel and trying to find a shortcut to LadurÃ©e, and one of the concierges -- who was in the area on his off day -- stopped and offered us perfect directions and said we would see him on his next day back at work. That was a really unexpected and much appreciated encounter that showed us that the staff actually cared about the guests...it wasn't just a job that they were clocking into and out of every day. We did not dine at the hotel, nor did we take advantage of any of the other services beyond the high-speed Internet access, which was very convenient but pricey. We loved the art deco style of the hotel, the courteous staff, and the convenient location. We felt very lucky to be able to use points for our stay, and we agreed we would be happy to return to the Hilton Arc de Triomphe someday. In fact, we hope to...Paris is a wonderful city and we can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Had a lovely stay -- would return in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: Seattle2007
Reviews.Content: Stayed on Hhonors points, but even though the room was "free" we were made to feel very welcome and wanted throughout our stay. Room was not ready when we arrived (a litte before official "check-in" time), but we were directed to the bar and given free champagne while we waited, and the room was ready within 15 minutes. Front desk & Concierge staff was excellent and helpful throughout our five night stay. There was a problem w/ the HVAC system in our room, but it was addressed quickly by maintenance, even though it was 11:00 at night. Restaurant staff was really wonderful. Which brings me to my single complaint... there is no where other than the hotel restaurant to get dinner... there are no other restaurants that serve dinner any where near the hotel. The food at the hotel restaurant is quite good -- but also extremely pricey, probably because they're the only game in town unless you want to take a cab or the Metro to find a restaurant. The location is otherwise very good -- close to a Metro stop and within easy walking distance of the Arc -- but the lack of convenient restaurants after a long day of sightseeing was a bit of an issue for us.

Reviews.Title: “Obnoxious Service”
Reviews.Author: 808stays
Reviews.Content: The front desk was rude and and dismissive at check-in. There was loud hammer pounding at 7 AM! I called the front desk after ten minutes of pounding, and they put me on hold 3 times then disconnected me. i called again, and was transferred once, put on hold once, then told "There is construction going on in THE ROOM NEXT DOOR, and we will contact them to stop." NO apology, just why-are-you-bothering-me attitude. Because of it's status, I had saved this hotel to be my final treat after 2 weeks in Europe. The rooms were gorgeous, but I will never stay at nor recommend this hotel again. The rudeness is not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “We wanted to stay longer...much longer....”
Reviews.Author: Wereldreizigster
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with HHonors points and we had a lovely room in Art Deco style and lounge access which was a real treat! Every evening Champagne and nice little snacks, in the morning breakfast there which was nice too. One morning the lounge was too full and we got vouchers for breakfast in the restaurant downstairs which was lovely. The Arc de Triomphe is at least a ten minutes walk and in the area of the hotel is nothing really special regarding restaurants or shops but the hotel has everything you need and more such as a spa and a lovely garden. The metro is not too far and taxis are always available and not so expensive. When we came home we had to adjust to normal life after being so spoiled there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, treated well, near the Arc!”
Reviews.Author: Marazzani
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I spent 4 days at this hotel. I am a gold hilton card member and we were lucky to get this stay with our points. From the looks of the place and theI rates I read prior to leaving we probably would not have afforded it this hotel. As we arrived we were greeted and welcomed by a pleasant hotel employee. I believe she was originally from Peru, but spoke French as well as English fluently. We ended up arriving quite early in the morning and as a result of this our room was not quite ready. They were kind to offer us their buffet breakfast. Although we just had a nice meal on the United Airlines flight we were pleased to accept the offer. Wow,...the buffet was impressive and from what I heard pretty expensive. Chocolate croissants, crepes, fruit platters and assorted meats is what we feasted on that morning. As we left we were happy to see that they had to go cups for coffee. The room took about 2 hours from the time of our initial check in to be available to us, but I didn't mind. The bell hop helped us with our bags and as he opened the door I was surprised that they had a bottle of champagne and fresh flowers waiting for us. I am not sure if this was offered because I had mentioned it was our anniversary or as a result of my gold member status, but was pleased that my Wife felt priviledged and happy at such a nice welcome to such a beautiful city. The service and the breakfast continued to be nice throughout our stay. The only thing I missed while there was a hot tub or pool to relax in. The hotel had a nice courtyard, but not too many places to sit and enjoy it. Keep in mind that when I say the Arc is near I mean it is about a 10 minute walk. Although I am Italian American and enjoy good Italian food I was sick of seeing it everywhere. I mean I went to France to eat, drink and see French. I was confident if I we walked up to the Champs Ellysee that we would be able to have a nice selection of French cuisine. We did ended up finding some french restaurants that charged about 100 euro per plate, but nothing more affordable. Recommendations that I would make are: -take the grand tour around the city with the tour buses that are available around town. This will give you good orientation and allow you to listen and learn a bit before you hit the road on foot. -Plan your restaurants and nightly activities in advance. This will save you from wondering around aimlessly trying to find a nice restaurant and will give you two something to look forward to each day. -Have a crepe, splurge on that tasty morsel at the local patisserie and use as much french as possible. I don't find the French to be so unhappy with those trying to learn and speak their beautiful language anymore. -Buy a baguette, some pate....YES some pate, some cheese and wine and sit in the grassy area underneath the Eiffel Tower and enjoy the day people watching and enjoying the view. Bon voyage!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Quaint Hotel in Decent Location”
Reviews.Author: niteflite
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel I stayed at for a few nights after I arrived in Paris. I walked after getting dropped off by the Air France coach near Etoile and it look roughly 10 min. The people working the front desk, concierge desk, and bellhops were great and very courteous and helpful. Room was a decent size... I am a hilton member so I may have gotten an upgraded room. The tv was small and a little outdated. Channels were limited compared to here in the states. Overall, a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option for Paris”
Reviews.Author: Manhattanites
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at the Hilton using Honors points. The art deco decor is modern and inviting, and the rooms although small are well equipped and comfortable. The first room we stayed in was too warm; the AC just did not seem to be working appropriately. The staff at the front desk were very accomodating and moved us into another room the next day, which was much cooler and more comfortable for us. I recommend just speaking up if you have a problem with the AC because there are cooler rooms available. The location near the Arc de Triomphe was ideal (short walk to the Metro),and we found several excellent restaurants in walking distance for dinners close to the hotel (Le Latin being one). Everyone spoke perfect English, and the staff at the concierge were so helpful with directions and making reservations for us. We would also like to thank the very nice Australian guest manager for her assistance during our stay! We would stay here again even without the points to cover our cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Hilton Arc de Triomphe”
Reviews.Author: daniela1336
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Hilton on a conference with 200 colleagues. We received great service from the staff from all aspects including; conference facilities, food and concierge. I agree with previous reviews that the rooms are small-ish, but there is enough room for two adults. The room was modern with a seperate walk-in shower and bath area. The TV channels are predominantly french, european and some arabic to cater for the guests visiting from those countries. My Husband ordered room service and payed 25euro for Hamburger and a softdrink. This hotel is in a convenient location, as it is a 10minute walk to the Champs Elysees. On foot you will find one or two sandwich/baguette deli's. Unfortunately it has no night-life in walking distance, However The Budha Bar as well as Cab ( Cabaret nightclub) is a 10euro taxi drive . Special mention to Maxime from Concierge as he helped me with area info as well as organising tgv train tickets. He was professional, courteous and remembered my name and birthday a few days after I had delt with him. He offered my husband and I celebratory drinks for my birthday.

Reviews.Title: “Not really worth paying for”
Reviews.Author: awilson21
Reviews.Content: I was staying here with a friend who had booked half of the stay on Hilton points - if she hadn't I really don't think I would stay here paying full price. The location is pretty good in terms of being close to the Champs Elysees etc, the nearest metro line is not a great one and there are not a lot of bistros or bars around and no shops that we could find close by. The room was fine, 2 big beds and plenty of storage space - pretty big by Paris standards now that I think about it but there was a combined bath-shower and the shower pressure was useless and the shower head was in the wierdest position - right in the corner of the walls and so awkward to use. The tv channels were useless too, mostly middle eastern (although we did enjoy watching Arabic telenovelas with the sound off, very amusing). We never found the fitness centre and think we might have imagined that there was one advertised on the website. The bar was nice but expensive. I didn't eat in the hotel apart from a basic room service meal which was just alright. The business centre I wanted to use on my last night just to print out my boarding pass but it was CRAZY money - something like â‚¬15 for a minimum hour on the computer. Madness. The decor was nice and the courtyard was beautiful. Overall though it just felt like you were paying mega bucks for nothing really special.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location for Paris”
Reviews.Author: dmc37
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our week in Paris. It had a convient location a few blocks to a Metro station, a bakery and a supermarket. There's also a park nearby. It's a little bit of a longer walk to the Arc and Champs Elysees. Rooms are typical Hilton hotel rooms. Not roomy but clean, well decorated. The staff was helpful even finding us a scale to weigh our baggage before we went home.

Reviews.Title: “Right on Hilton standards - not above or below”
Reviews.Author: TheRovingWeimaraners
Reviews.Content: Excellent service. The duty manager introduced himself to me at check in and gave me his card which I very much appreciated. The staff really charmed my pre teen daughter by giving her a series of small gifts - she will be a Hilton fan for life! The rooms were a little shopworn and the art deco furniture not entirely functional. Our room was very well sound insulated. We could not hear the screaming baby in the room next door, thankfully.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel; pure and utter luxury...”
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as a surprise birthday present for my partner. I decided to splash out on an executive room. After having told the hotel it was for a birthday, the hotel kindly ensured we had a lovely room with terrace on the 7th floor and champage and birthday cake waiting for us on arrival. The check-in experience was great, as we were offered a glass of wine whilst checking in. Our room was lovely, very spacious for a hotel room in Paris and the terrace was to die for. We had a great view of the Eiffel Tower. The staff all seemed very friendly. The service in the restaurant was a bit strange, as the waiter forgot to give us our bread when we sat down and therefore we didn't get our soup until our main course arrived, which wasn't too great. There were, however, a few little things that let the hotel down a bit. The air conditioning didn't work at all. We turned the temperature down to it's lowest point, and still the room didn't get any cooler. Also, we never had any tea/coffee mugs in our room at any time. So after calling for some mugs to be brought up, none ever arrived (which for an executive room, wasn't great). We had a late checkout booked and therefore after breakfast decided to use the spa (which is lovely). However, getting back to our room (about 12.30pm), we found our key cards didn't work. Not a surprise, as I stay in a lot of hotels beyond the normal checkout time and this happens frequently. However, when asking a maid to let us in (considering we were in our bath robes), she just shrugged and said no. It took a lot of persuading to get her to phone reception and send someone up. I advised, that this sort of thing shouldn't be happening to anyone, never mind someone staying in an Executive room. Overall, a fantastic hotel, spacious rooms, and a beautiful spa. This is a really good hotel to stay in and I would stay there again. However, this hotel has the oppertunity of being a great hotel, if only they were able to fix the small things that are easily fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: joeschmoeChicago
Reviews.Content: Spent our 25th anniversary in Paris. Hotel graciously updgraded our room. The service through out the hotel was excellent. Very nice spa. Location was very good for accessing the metro to get around town. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Kirkolam
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked us 3 nights in an executive room in the hotel as a 30th birthday present - it was such a lovely hotel. The foyer is very impressive, the staff cannot do enough to help and speak perfect English. Our room was gorgeous, with lovely La Source toiletries, and a balcony overlooking the Eiffel Tower on the top floor. One of the best bits was that we had free access to the executive lounge on the 6th floor - this is where we had breakfast (which was a nice continental style breakfast), but it also had nibbles and drinks throughout the day, then in the evening, free champagne which was a lovely pre-dinner treat! We had such a perfect time in the hotel, and would definitely return if we go back to Paris. I suspect the only down-side is the price, but if you can get a special deal, go for it. It was also fairly central for getting around Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Well up to standard”
Reviews.Author: smjak02
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights. Arrived by car so the underground Car Park was convenient albeit relatively expensive. Reasonable welcome and as Gold VIP upgraded only available for a double, we needed 2 beds. Was given free drink and breakfast vouchers by way of compensation. Especially reasonable as we were staying on points. Excellent location with choice of metro stops useful although walkable to some shops and plenty of bars and restaurants. Room of decent size as was bathroom and all clean and modern. Concierge indifferent with restaurant advice although he seemed more interested in talking to guests of the opposite sex, especially if they were attractive. This only applied to 1 individual.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Sidmouth4you
Reviews.Content: I was taken here by my fiancee as a special birthday treat, and we found the hotel amazing. The food could not be faulted and the service was impeccable. The hotel itself is in a good location just a five min walk from the Arc de Triomphe. I have no doubt the hotel is expensive (I dont know the actual cost as my fiancee paid), but you certainly get what you pay for.... I would certainly recommend this place for a romantic get-away.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Koevasi9
Reviews.Content: I didn't stay at this hotel for free using points unlike a lot of the reviewers here and bear in mind that this place isn't cheap. 480 euro a night without taxes or other charges for me. I don't know where the average price on TripAdvisor comes from. Having said that, the room was nicely appointed but the bathroom was a bit on the small side. The hotel is in a fantastic location and as you expect from most Hilton hotels around the world, very well maintained. The massage was excellent and the food at the ground floor restaurant was pretty good (the only place where everything felt inexpensive). But it was the courteous staff who really made this place shine and I look forward to seeing them again in a couple of months..

Reviews.Title: “Not my first choice”
Reviews.Author: plan2gosoon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we had points, so from a financial point it was great. They were very gracious to us and spoke English well. The room was very small, particularly the bathroom/shower area, but immaculate. They replaced the towels each day. Each night they gave us two bottles of water and some type of candy, which was cute. They had USA Today, Financial Times and Herald Tribune available on various days for free. They also had umbrellas for use if you needed it. It was only two long blocks to the metro - Courcelles - which was very convenient. It was close to the Arc d'Triomphe and easy to get to from CDG using the Air France bus. We did not use room service or eat in the hotel because of the extremely high prices. There was no wi-fi. There was a 21.99 e per day charge to use the internet and it was very slow. The fee in the Business Center was different but still a fee.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hilton Service I've experienced”
Reviews.Author: judyLongIslandusa
Reviews.Content: As a diamond level Hilton traveler, I must say this was the best service we have experienced at a Hilton. Oliver the concierge and Cindy at the front desk, couldn't do enough to make your trip comfortable and memorable.I have stayed in Paris before and the staff at this hotel did everything to be warm, welcoming and professional. The hotel is about a 15 minute walk to the Arc where you can easily pick up a "hop on bus" which is a great and cost effective way to see all of Paris on your timeframe. A small French grocery store and pastry shops are within a short walk. It's best to request a room on the "garden" if you like to open the window because Paris traffic can wake the lite sleeper. Many of the rooms in the back of the hotel have a beautiful view of the Eiffel Tower. Our rooms were kept pristine and comfortable. The average price for breakfast in Paris is E 30 ($40) and soda runs about E 5 ($6.50) so its best to take advantage of the local shops when travelling with a large family for much more affordable prices.The hop on bus "green line" will get you to all the must see places in Paris and a wonderful day dat trip (via Viator tours) is to see the Castles of the Loire Valley. Paris if definately a place you'll never forget.Enjoy!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: conelchilango
Reviews.Content: We stayed for our anniversary, and it was absolutely amazing! I have stayed at many hotels around the globe, and by far this was the warmest welcome I have ever received. The service was superb and the staff treated their guests with a warm professionalism. The room was spotless with every conceivable amenity offered. The location was also quite convenient - a quick walk to the Metro station yet the room was quiet and provided a good night's sleep. We hated to leave and would go back at the first opportunity!

Reviews.Title: “An American Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Mum4k9
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hilton Arc de Triomphe Hotel in December. We used points so I canâ€™t comment on the price of the room but if youâ€™re used to â€œAmerican hotelsâ€� and are looking for a central location, this might be the perfect fit for you. The rooms and bathrooms are large and well appointed. The service is what you expect for a hotel of this class and the staff was very gracious. The food is expensive at the hotel but there are plenty of places within walking distance (or a quick hop on the Metro to a more lively neighborhood). Our stay was very pleasant and we would definitely stay here again if the opportunity presents itself.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Mr-FawltyTorquay
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, but fairly average amenities, rooms and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great family stay”
Reviews.Author: alshin
Reviews.Content: I reserved this hotel since this is one of the few hotels which allows 2 adults and 2 children in one room. They have American style double-bedded rooms. This hotel is beautifully decorated, the rooms are bigger than any European hotel rooms that I have seen. The staff did everything they could to accommodate my request. A cold front came when I arrived in Paris on 12/26, and we felt the heater was inadequate. They sent maintenance person right away, and when it did not improve, they moved us to a suite in the middle of the night. The heater did not work up to American standard after all, but we appreciated the effort. Breakfast was awesome. Concierge' recommendation for restaurants were right on target. The location is about 10 minutes walk to Arc de Triomphe. I don't know about public transportation since we took taxis to everywhere. I would highly recommend this hotel to anybody who is looking for comfort and space which is standards at most American hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the action, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelinMoose
Reviews.Content: A quick walk to the Arc de Triomphe, this Hilton was the perfect choice for us. We were welcomed warmly by the customer relations agent who gave us her card and instructed us to call her if we had ANY issues. We stayed in a business room, which got us free breakfast and hors d'oeuvre's/open bar in the evening. Our room was immaculate, with our deck overlooking a garden. We also received free water, which is wonderful when you are walking a lot! The hotel is about a 7 minute walk to the metro, which is of course a benefit to the travelers!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a great service”
Reviews.Author: Msshinohara
Reviews.Content: As french prople do not like to speak english, Hilton is a good way out to avoid this kind of misfortune. I enjoyed my stay in Hilton, the breakfast is complete and with a French touch. The service is perfect and they treat you carefully. Location is good, nearby the subway and not so far from Champs Elysees. It worths, price is reasonable. About 15 minutes by walk from Arc de Triomphe actually. Around 10 minutes from Champs Elysees. A good tip for tourists is to buy a Tourist Ticket to get subway. Only 27 Euro for 5 day unlimited use.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - but very expensive!”
Reviews.Author: KindredNZUK
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at this hotel just after Christmas and over the New Year. It was a beautiful property with lovely rooms and great public spaces. The staff were absolutely outstanding - courteous, helpful and charming. However: the cost of food and drink was outrageous! Bearing in mind that this is a four star hotel, a continental breakfast should not cost more than 20 Euros, and nor should a round of three coffees and three Cokes in the hotel bar set the customer back nearly 50 Euros! Hilton are really having a laugh with these prices. 7 Euros for a Coke!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flyboy180
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel within a 7-10 minute walk to The Arc de Triomphe and only a 5 minute walk to the Metro......Rooms were lager than normal for a European hotel. The service was excellent and during my entire stay, every staff member gave me the impression they would do whatever it took to insure my stay was pleasant. I will certainly stay at this Hilton again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LuxTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hilton Paris using my Hilton points and found the hotel very nice and up to the normal Hilton very high standards in terms of service, staff etc.. We had access to the Executive Lounge which was very nice. It was quite busy in the morning at breakfast but otherwise it was excellent. The rooms in the hotel are lovely. The hotel is located about 10 mins from the Champs Elyesse and about 5 mins from the nearest metro station. Overall we had a very nice time in the hotel and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: DAL504
Reviews.Content: We stayed here using points. In most Hiltons you get access to the executive lounge as a Gold VIP, but that wasn't offered (I assumed it was because we were using points) although we did get bottles of water and some chocolate treats as a welcome gift. The hotel was very art deco in style and the rooms were very well apportioned, comfortable and luxurious. The beds were typical Hilton fare - very comfortable with lots of pillows and covers. The hotel is pretty conveniently located near the Arc de Triomphe. Lots of brasseries and boulangeries in the surrounding area and lots of other food choices within a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Treated us like royalty”
Reviews.Author: CaracasCorrespondent
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time trying to decide where my bride and I would stay during our honeymoon. I did a lot of research, torn between wanting it to be a once-in-a-lifetime experience and not depleting my savings account. In the end, I chose the Hilton and was able to use points for a free stay. I made the decision with a bit of trepidation, worrying that I was choosing savings over the memorable experience. I need not have worried. The hotel lobby was pretty, the room was nice and the sauna and jacuzzi downstairs were spectacular. Best of all, the staff treated us like kings. They put us on the executive floor, which gave us access to free breakfasts and free food and drink in the executive lounge. A couple of nights, after a big lunch, we simply stayed in, eating a snack in the lounge while drinking decent champagne. Not bad! Another night, we had a terrific meal in the cozy ground-floor bar/restaurant. The waiter treated us like stars, serving us dinner even though they had officially closed the kitchen 15 minutes earlier. During our stay, the concierge desk answered all of our questions authoritively and with good humor. To top it off, when my wife left behind clothes in the chest of drawers, they hadn't disappeared. Instead, the hotel (for a fee, which was fair), sent the clothes to her. In sum, the Paris Hilton and its wonderful staff left us with wonderful memories of our honeymon stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect From the Moment We Arrived!”
Reviews.Author: Kim1117
Reviews.Content: When you arrive at your hotel after travelling all night, struggling with luggage and finding your way in a new city, it is wonderful to arrive at a hotel that makes you feel welcome and comfortable the moment you step out of the taxi. This was our first trip to Paris (two adults; two teens) and the Hilton was the perfect choice for us. We like to experience as much of the local feel of cities we visit as possible -- experimenting with speaking the language, local cuisine, public transportation, neighborhood pubs, etc. However, having a safe place to land at the end of the day where English is spoken and the accomodations are superb makes the trip all the more special. When we arrived, we were offered a discounted upgrade to a suite, which we accepted. The hotel is beautiful and modern. The location is just a few blocks from the Arc de Triomphe, where you can hop on a bus or metro. The Executive Lounge was an added bonus, serving a delicious hot breakfast, drinks, wine and beer through the day and evening and snacks. Really first rate! One note of caution! If you do not speak French, be sure to take a card or something with the hotel name, address and telephone number with you when you venture out. Our French is extremely limited and we couldn't pronounce the hotel name and street well enough to be understood and got lost a few times. The Paris locals tried to help, but it was our fault for not having the address and name written down.

Reviews.Title: “No Upgrades for Diamond Members”
Reviews.Author: jenncole79
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is lovely, but do not expect any upgrades or preferential treatment if you are a Hilton diamond member. The manager greeted us which was nice, but then said there were no upgrades available. She proceeded to tell us that we could still use the executive lounge. Umm, this is always included with diamonod memberships, but she tried to pass it off as something extrra. All in all it's a nice hotel, but do not expect anything extra for being a loyal Hilton customer.

Reviews.Title: “great stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: jhoward45
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our last night in Paris and absolutely loved it. Great Location and Service. We used Honors points and hoped for Executive level upgrade in celebration of our anniversary. Unfortunately, that floor was booked but received a special surprise in our room upon returning from a shopping trip. Nothing like returning to a bottle of champagne, flowers and dessert. We were impressed and hope to return the favor by an extended stay the next time we are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: London3054
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel; very impressive lobby and great, well decorated (art deco) rooms (ours was lucky enough to have a slight view of the Eiffel Tower). Good location as well, about a 7-10 walk to Arc du Triomphe. I've stayed at other Hilton hotels in Paris and this is by far the best one.

Reviews.Title: “BEST ROMENTIC GET AWAY!”
Reviews.Author: ArthurSousa
Reviews.Content: I am very surprise seeing some poor reviews on this hotel from some guests - just maybe they were using points or very demanding without respect. We got in today, we explain very friendly that we were celebrating our 20th Aniversary and would be nice to have an upgrade. They already upgraded us to the executve floor of which we stated we already were on executive floor so they upgraded us to a full suite at no charge. After getting to the suite my wife found it too far from elevator and once again we ask for another room. No problems if we would not mind waiting 30-60 mins. We went to the Executive Lounge, smoking and having a great time with quality drinks/food...very recommend.. Our room was ready in 45 mins and near elevator and on top 7th floor - full suite! My wife loved it and therefor I was happy... It is a very GOOD HOTEL in a very nice area... even my friends were recommending it without knowing that we already booked it. When you are polite, nice to people and if they have the availability the staff at HILTON will go the extra mile to make you happy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Honeymoon at Hilton Arc de Triomphe Paris”
Reviews.Author: jrt0002
Reviews.Content: First off, let me say that I was quite neurotic about researching the hotels for my honeymoon. I knew that I was going to spend a lot of money so I wanted to make sure that I found three great places. We began our trip by staying six nights at the Hilton Arc De Triomphe. Then, we took the train to Monte Carlo and stayed for three nights at the Vista Palace Hotel in Rocquebrune-Cap Martin, FR. Then, we finished up by staying three nights at The Palais Mediteranee in Nice, FR. The Hilton far exceeded my already high expectations. The hotel- absolutely beatuful. Incredible location. The park nearby is beautiful and you can ideed get free internet. The hotel is designed to look like a 1930's steamliner inside and they did a great job. The lobby is beautfiul and the restaurant was very nice. Some people complained that the location was somewhat remote, but that is why I loved it. You are right in the middle of the city, but it is not in the touristy/busy part. You are about two blocks from the Metro. If you are going to Paris, take the Metro EVERYWHERE! It is so cheap, easy, and safe. We figured out how to get everywhere without having to take a cab once. The staff- very cordial. I felt at times like I was in an American Embassy. The conceirge recommended Galopin one evening for dinner... this was by far our favorite meal of the trip! I am a Hilton Gold Member and was hoping for a room upgrade. Unfortunately, the upgrades were all taken so they gave me two free breakfast vouchers for everyday that I was there and two free glasses of champagne. The breakfast- Wow... just awesome. Sure, it was expensive, but man it was a great way to start the day. If you have the free passes this is definitely a highlight of this hotel. Otherwise, I think that it's 40 Euro/person for this buffet. They have a person who makes omelettes and crepes. The buffet has a huge array of choices that are both European and American. My favorite part was that you could take bottles of Evian back to your seat with you. The honeymoon treat- Absolutely wonderful! The first night they bring you a surprise which is delicious. The room- spacious, neat. Beautfiul bathroom. Pros- Everything Cons- Our floor had a somewhat odd smell, but it was really no big deal. The cost is high, so we used points... I would definitely pay the fee though, this is an incredible hotel. In conclusion... if you are considering this hotel, I HIGHLY advise you book here. This is just a great hotel, period.

Reviews.Title: “Great, but not for Honeymoon.”
Reviews.Author: SMorgado
Reviews.Content: We had a good experience, but not a good place for our Honeymoon. We wanted something a little more romantic and with a better view. However, this is a great place to stay with family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Experiences”
Reviews.Author: EUtravelgal
Reviews.Content: Having now stayed on four seperate occasions, I'm pleased to report that the Hilton Arc de Triomphe is a well maintained, pleasant, and friendly hotel on the west end of Paris, and this assessment has been consistent throughout. Some of the benefits to staying at this property are the larger room sizes (one can very comfortably fit a family of 4 into their "Double Double" room--an unusual feature in Paris where normally you can only get 2 people in a room), the proximity to the Metro (stop: Courcilles), the prices are generally less than other comparable properties, the neighborhood (8th arrondisement), and the staff (very friendly and helpful at all times, especially Olivier the concierge). Negatives include being slightly further out from the center of Paris--there is no direct Metro to the center of town so you must change trains, very expensive dining and bar, and the fact that is is an American chain so you are not really getting a "real" taste of Paris like you would in a smaller type hotel. Overall, most Americans will find this American chain a very good value and will be pleased with the space. Be warned, though, the rooms at the front of the hotel which face the street suffer from an incredible amount of street noise IF the window is open. My room was incredibly warm during my last stay here, and I was forced to have the window open, causing sleepless nights. Next time I will insist on a courtyard room to avoid this issue.

Reviews.Title: “Very good top star hotel in the centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: apvac
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel 10 min walk from Champs Elysee and Arc de Triomphe. I had a room overlooking the small nice internal garden: very quiet accomodation in the centre of Paris. Elegant room in almost new conditions, although there is an obsolete 20" CRT TV and a few minor details to be fixed. Bathroom with shower in tub, no bidet. Very comfortable bed, double glazed window that really guarantees noise insulation, wired internet connectivity, wireless signal was weak in my room. The room is large enough, with sitting area. Underground parking with lift to lobby. The parking is limited in size and many places are reserved, so it may be difficult to park in busy hours. Good breakfast in the restaurant. Room service menu ethnically varied but somewhat limited. Official room rates are very high, but it's a Hilton in the centre of Paris ! If you can find a suitably discounted rate, it might be a good choice even for a short touristic stay, right in the centre of the french capital city (which will save a lot of time and possibly money).

Reviews.Title: “Executive Club Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: 01ofvisadventures
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hilton! We arrived around 8 p.m. and no executive floor rooms were available. We asked for the management and after discovering that we were Diamond VIP, we were told an executive level room would be available the next day. I would be very clear when making your reservation that you are requesting the Exec. Club. If you are not on that floor you are denied priviliges. I think this is totally unfair, and have heard rumors that Hilton has changed this since we got home, but I would still check. The rooms are nice and tastefully decorated. The windows actually open. Ours overlooked the courtyard, and you could just barely see the top of the Eiffel Tower in the evening from the room. NOT the best for the scenic view, but the rest of our experience made up for it! I believe we were put in an "emergency" exec room, because the first one was nicer than the exec floor room. We were in a service hall area just behind the club. Other travelers described nicer rooms on this floor. My only real gripe would be that if you have long hair, the hair dryer keeps cutting off before your hair is dry. You have to wait about 10 minutes for it to cool down before you can start again. Very close walking distance to Champs Elysees and Arc de Triomphe. Very easy to catch the red bus tour. There is a nice market a few blocks away for reasonable cheeses, fresh fruits, and wines. There were not many nice cafes nearby, unless you walk up to Champs Elysees. The immediate area appears to be a bit of a business district. The Executive Club was NOT skimpy with the "frou-frous". Very nice location on the rooftop, and smoking is allowed outside. Again, not much of a view, as it overlooks several groups of apartments, but the option to enjoy sunshine and fresh air made up for that. It was a nice place for my fiance to sit and work, as wireless was available there. This club is open from early in the morning until around 11 p.m. They served a nice hot breakfast with eggs, meats, cheeses, fruits, and several breads and pastries. There was ALWAYS something available, all day long. Lunch time they brought out a nice selection of sandwich and snack items, and cocktail hour had shrimps, chicken and various hot items throughout our stay. A full bar and unlimited wine and champagne was available all day. This includes mornings, in case you want a mimosa with breakfast. We enjoyed chatting with other travelers from around the world, and had a big party table going each evening. Fun FUN! The entire property is very clean and stylish. We were greeted with a friendly smile everywhere we went. Special requests were attended to promptly and cordially. Concierge was happy to mail our postcards as we were leaving. Definitely recommend this Hilton and cannot wait to go back. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, spotty service”
Reviews.Author: REF21
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights on Hilton points on the executive level on the 6th floor which gave us the ability to use the exec lounge for free (all day drinks, food, etc.) I would recommend if staying at the hotel to check into that option. We ate breakfast at the hotel as well as snacks throughout the day and saved a considerable amount doing so. I will agree that this hotel in the US is probably a 3.5 star hotel. The carpet in the room was dirty, and for 3 nights they didn't change the linens (I had a slight nose bleed the first night and even with a blood stain on the pillocase/sheet they still didn't change them). The location is decent. If you are in good physical shape, the Arc is about 10 minutes away (walking) and the tower about 20-25 minutes. Printemps and Galleries Lafayette are about 10-15 min. walk as well. The staff we found to be pretty helpful and all spoke English well. Would I stay here again? On points or with a great deal (under 400/night) I would, but otherwise, probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Decor”
Reviews.Author: cdn_traveljunkies
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights at this hotel. We did not have any problems with reception. They all spoke English very well. However, we had 4 large luggages with us and the porters were not easily available on our departure. The decor of the hotel was nice (art deco). Our standard room followed the decor of the rest of the hotel. We had a King size bed in the size of a 'North American' standard room size. It had plenty of room for all our luggage. It was clean and equip with a shower stall and a nice sized bathtub. Unfortunately, there was a fair bit of noise in the room above. I'm not sure if it was a service room as it sounded like people moving furniture around. I never called it in. This hotel was located in a quiet neighbourhood. The nearest metro stop was about a 10-15 minute walk away. There were many restaurants that were within walking distance of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “just so so”
Reviews.Author: grandma4Illiinois
Reviews.Content: My family of three stayed at the hotel for 7 days. I don`t think the room was cleaned throughly for 5 of those days. We would leave a piece of something on the floor at various spots and it would still be there when we returned.The first day we were given 2 free bottles of water for 3 people then none at all. We left a note and requested more water and 2 more pillows the note stayed on the pad for three days and the fourth day it was gone.Nothing was left. Would i stay again i don`t know.The staff was great but i agree with one poster they do make fun of the people staying there i saw it happen 3 times and one of the times it was at our party.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotels ever”
Reviews.Author: dergiss
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton for one night on 22 August 2008. We have booked a prepaid rate at 275 Euro for a King Size Bed. And the drama began. After receiving the credit card statement, we were surprised to find out that they have not only charged the credit card with the prepaid rate of 275 Euro, but also with an additional 1,600 Euro. To make a long story short, it took us more than a week to get Hilton to transfer the money back ! We have never received a word of apology !!! Upon arriving there, staff were friendly as hell. It took ages to check in and my wife had to participate in an urgent conference call. When answering the guy at the reception if there is a quite area in the hotel to take this call, he replied "No.". So he got us the keys to the room, my wife rushed upstairs and I have spoken to the Guest Relation Manager about the credit card charge. Finally someone apologiesed and promised us to send some champagne for the inconvience (unfortunately, it has never arrived). In the meantime, I got a phone call from my wife that the keys don't work.
