So she ran back downstairs and the receptionist thought he might have to give us a lessen in how to use the keys first before putting the code back on. Of course, he forgot it in the first time. While my wife was doing the phone call, I thought about buying some water in a supermarket. So I asked the porter outside the hotel and he simply returned: "I don't give directions". So I had to go back inside ask someone at the reception for a supermarket and was told, that they don't know whether there is a supermarket around the area. So I went back outside and it was pouring. So I thought I could take a Hilton umbrella. The porter refused to give me one. Coming to the room. It was very small, the sheets and the towels smelled as if someone has smoked with it (although it was a non-smoking room). The room was facing an office building and you were able to see the screens of the guys working there, which gives you really a nice feeling of privacy for your room. In addition, a church is somewhere close to the hotel and the church bell rings every hour. Furthermore, the air condition was making some burbing sound during our entire stay. The bathroom is as tiny as the room and you can see some stains and mould here and there. The shower is really uncomfortable. Anyhow, having experience in several hotels of this class in various cities around the world, this hotel is maximum a two star hotel and the employees should really get a training in how to deal with guests.

Reviews.Title: “very snooty”
Reviews.Author: traveladyUk
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here if you can get a room at the Eiffel Tower Hilton. The quality of staff here can in no way compare to the staff at the Eiffel Tower Hilton. And the room was dirty and small. The wait staff in the Executive Lounge would openly make fun of the guests with one another. I saw them pointing and laughing at one middle-aged woman because of the orthopedic shoes she had on and they did this right in front of her! And the doormen were only interested in helping the Sheik and his party. I guess this is how the French have gotten their reputation for snootiness. I won't stay here again if I can help it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, true Parisian experience!”
Reviews.Author: trngdir76
Reviews.Content: It's easy to see why this hotel is rated so well. The facilities are amazing, truly first rate. The staff were amazing, with a dedicated station for HHonors members. The room we got was a queen deluxe and it was great. Spacious (very large by Paris standards), luxurious, and very fashionable and spotless! It was great. If you can stay there using HHonors points I would do it. It seemed very pricey otherwise. We were offered a free breakfast buffet which was amazing. It had everything you could imagine and the staff again were very attentive. The only negatives were the carpets in the halls seemed like they were worn very badly in patches (I know a small thing, hardly worth mentioning), and you had to pay for internet in the business center. Two small things, but really the only negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: rseplin
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend Jason did a quick weekend in Paris, we combined our Hilton Honors points to stay here. Very nice hotel, especially for Europe standards. Room was comfortable. Service was good. Neighborhood had absolutely nothing in it but a metro station. But was very quiet. Overall not bad. Next time I would rather stay somewhere near something.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, location was not ideal for us”
Reviews.Author: TripMeAnytime
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay at this hotel while in Paris. We were a family group of 9 so we booked 2 family suites. The family suites are actually just 2 rooms with a common hallway. I was thinking it would be more like 2 bedrooms with a sitting room. Either way, it worked for us. The staff was VERY friendly, helpful & even managed to help us get our large group to the train station on time! Bed was comfortable, bathroom was a little on the small side but well appointed. The restaurant was fine - we ate there the first night because it was late & we were tired. Had room service one morning for breakfast & it was very good. There is a very nice bar - The Purple Bar - on the main floor with outdoor seating (watch out for the pigeons tho!). The downside is that the hotel is not as close to a main street as I thought. There was not something close by to go grab a soda or pastry. The walk to the Arc was a little long for my elderly parents. Again, the staff was very very nice & helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: SDTraveler007
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews on this site, I decided to experiment and spend one night at this Hilton during my trip last week. Overall, it's a relatively nice hotel and I can understand to a certain degree some of the enthusiasm here. But, as a frequent traveler and a guest of several hotels in the Paris area alone, I just don't feel that this hotel property merits the accolades people are writing here and certainly not in proportion to the prices that they charge. I ran into several problems in my short stay: 1) The biggest problem that I ran into was that the Air Conditioning unit in my room (located in the ceiling near the door) began to vibrate randomly around 2:30 in the morning. To get an idea of how this sounded, imagine a cell phone hidden in the ceiling that would vibrate loudly and randomly every couple of minutes (sometimes multiple times in a minute). I of course tried turning off the AC unit and wearing ear plugs, but the unit would still vibrate (and I could still here the vibrating with ear plugs), so I called the Front Desk (I speak French fluently) to tell them the problem. At first they wanted to send a technician to the room to start working on the unit in the ceiling. I said that this would be fine if I could move to another room (I needed to wake up early), but of course, the hotel was full. So, they said that they would have a technician try to shut off power to the unit from the central station. I was fine with this, but it ended up taking nearly 45 minutes to have the unit's power terminated. So, after being awoken by the faulty unit, I wasn't able to go back to sleep for at least an hour. I understand that technical problems happen and will give them credit for finding a way to stop the problem in a relatively timely manner. However, for any hotel that is charging prices at this level, there needs to be some sort of compensation to the customer in return for any inconvenience like this. This is where they fell short, simply saying that they couldn't offer reduced rates, breakfast at no charge, etc. They simply weren't willing to correct this wrong and so this is the biggest reason that I cannot recommend this hotel to any other potential guests. 1) The mattress is way too firm - one of the firmest that I have come across in a hotel. I tend to like mattresses on the firmer side, but this really was extreme. My back and neck were slightly sore the next morning. 2) There is a raised tile-covered ridge between the sink room and the toilet room in the bathroom that is unexpected and difficult to see in the dark. I slammed one of my toes on this pretty hard during the night. 4) The hallways had a slightly fishy odor. It wasn't strong by any means, but it still smelled a bit off when walking to my room. 5) This is more of a caveat and has been mentioned on here, but the hotel isn't located right by the Arc de Triomphe or Champs Elysees. Instead, it is a 10-15 minute walk away. With all the hotels that are available in Paris, I feel that there are other, better options in terms of comfort, price and service. In particular, the service element is what is lacking at this hotel. The staff weren't mean, snotty or anything of that nature. They just didn't seem to care and definitely didn't understand that in response to a problem that interrupts and prevents the client from sleeping, they need to find a way to compensate for this. Instead they acted indifferent about the issue and so I've chosen to come here and offer this as a potential warning to other travelers. Bon Voyage...

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Limabre
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location near the Arc de Triomphe. Is is however located in a quiet area, on walking distance from all the action, Champs, etc. Staff is very well trained and super great, the design of the interior is fabulous (see the bathrooms in the basement!) and breakfast was superb. Service is flawless. Triple A rating!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort at the Hilton in Paris”
Reviews.Author: zara06
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Arc de Triomphe for 5 days and found it to be very nice. The room was compfortable and very clean. The staff efficient, friendly and helpful. The location was convenient but was in a quieter residential type area....it was a new location for me and I really enjoyed the area which was good for walking and had some nice restaurants. I will go back. The only downside is the usual over priced breakfast buffet....skip it and go down the street for coffee and a croissant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andriyko
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel. Location is perfect (two minute walk to the metro station and five minuite walk to the Arc). The staff is amazing - everyone is welcoming and nice, speaks English. I really felt at home. I would say that staff is the best feature of this hotel. Rooms are spacious and clean and well appointed. Had dinner at the restaurant and the food was really good. Would definetely recommen this hotel and would retrun myself.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, good location, great executive club, great staff”
Reviews.Author: SamW_DC
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights at the Paris Arc du Triumphe in early July 2008, and had a wonderful time. Admittedly, the value was always going to be there as I (like many others) had used HHonors points to book. This is a great hotel to use your points on - the facilities were fantastic. Check-in was easy and painless and though our room wasn't ready, we were upgraded to the top floor with a view of the Eiffel Tower. The room was large by european standards and the decor was contemporary, yet had a warm feel to it. The beds were great, bathroom amenities just fine, but the real gem of this hotel is the free club lounge for members - champagne flowing (even at lunch), wine / spirits, soft drinks, some great food options (fresh prawn salads), hot English-style breakfasts in the morning. We definitely saved a ton of money by eating and drinking in the lounge every now and then - it's great for a pre-dinner drink and the staff are fun and helpful. All of the staff we dealt with spoke English. The location was just fine for us - close to a metro that will take you wherever you want to go and there was never a moment when there wasn't a taxi out the front waiting either. Would DEFINITELY stay here again - great hotel, one of the best Hilton's I've seen.

Reviews.Title: “Are you buying the sizzle or the steak?”
Reviews.Author: WineAuctioneer
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong, as the Hilton Arc de Triomphe Hotel was definitely better than most I have stayed in in France, but then again you would come expect this from a "Category Six" ranked Hilton Hotel. As such, you would come expect that your experience would be superb and with out worry or issues, but this was not the case I experienced. I checked into the hotel and initially I was offered only a standard room! French language difficulties were of no concern as almost all staff speak English fluently even if you try to converse in French. For the record, I am Hilton Honors Gold member and I booked this trip using my Hilton Honors points at a cost of 120,000 points or 40,000 points a day. I insisted that I be offered a room on the Executive level, and I was accommodated, but I felt that I should not have had to ask for what had already been reserved. Upon arriving at my room the air conditioner did not work. Once again I felt that this should have been checked out ahead of my arrival. Needless to say, I had visit the concierge on the executive floor to be relocated to yet another room. The Executive/Hilton Honors floor rooms are nicely decorated and quite comfortable, but the beds do have a single sheet, but a duvet instead. On hot days (July is humid), I had to request that a sheet be added below the duvet. Everything in Paris is quite expensive, so it was a real pleasant experience, unlike the US, to know that the Executive Lounge is stocked with snacks and food at certain times on the day. It is possible to actually eat a full breakfast, lunch and dinner in the Executive Lounge if you choose. Praise: 1. Definitely a better hotel that what is available elsewhere in Paris. For the price you pay you are left comparing actual value perceived versus high expense. 2. The staff in the Purple Bar is outstanding and fluent in English. Criticisms: 1. TIP: Housekeeping staff tend NOT to knock, but walk right in, unless your door is locked or you have the DO NOT DISTURB sign up. 2. The staff in the Executive Lounge demonstrate a bit of an arrogant attitude, and this just shouldn't be the case, especially since most of those hotel guests are Hilton Honors members. A. I found one Executive Lounge waiter joking about another guest which is entirely unprofessional. B. Another Executive Lounge waiter handed me a fork by fork end and not the handle. He looked upset when I asked him for a different fork. Then I informed him that I am a sommelier by profession, and he should have known better. 3. The hotel staff service is definitely better than most other hotels, but it certainly is not the best I experienced on my two week trip to France. Had I not booked this stay using my Hilton Honors points, I would have been very disappointed if I would have had to pay for hotel stay as it was not exceptional by any means.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Marvel”
Reviews.Author: klindsied
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem--being in Paris, it is safe to say that staying in an american hotel is your best bet because the french can be condescending to Anericans. The service at this hotel couldn't have been any better. We arrived and the terrace lunch restaurant was full, but Sarah, this woman that works at the hotel and helped to accomodate us during our entire stay, made us an extra table just so that we could eat in the gardens. When our room was finally ready, we were thankful to have an elevator to carry our luggage up without a hassel. Our room was gorgeous--very moden Paris--and the bathroom was like every other hilton in that it had a great bath/shower (a giant wonderful tub) and came equipt with bath robes. Breakfast comes with your stay and feel blessed that breakfast is as extensive as it is because in many other htoels you'll find that a toast and tea is all you are served. They had a chef making fresh crepes, pancakes, and omlettes that were delicious and had a variety of other delicious goodies. The concierge at the hotel was wonderfully helpful, and also, the hotel had a transport every hour to the other hilton hotel by the eiffel tower so you could be a short jaunt to the eiffel tower. Also, it is simply a short walk to the arch de triomph.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Staff - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: pcsanity
Reviews.Content: Hilton Paris â€“ Arc de Triomphe We stayed at the Hilton Paris â€“ Arc de Triomphe for six nights in Paris. This trip was part of a 15 night trip to Europe. The booking at this location was on a Hilton HHonors reward stay. We booked a King non-smoking room, and due to my HHonors Diamond status, were upgraded to a lovely King non-smoking suite on the fourth floor. (Upgrade was not available till the second day, but the first room was also very nicely sized King room, but had no lounge access or we would have stayed put there.) We arrived in Paris via high speed train from Amsterdam, and the taxi ride to the hotel was quick and easy (approximately 22 Euro). We did not want to take the Metro (and the associated stairs) with our luggage. The hotel has a beautiful lobby, restaurant, and bar. Check in was quick and easy. Quela the guest manager was phenomenal with accommodating us to the upgrade on our second and subsequent nights and really sought to make our stay wonderful. As part of my HHonors Diamond status we were given complimentary breakfast and drink coupons for the first night as the Executive level was sold out. Once we moved to the suite, we had Executive lounge access which was very critical to our wonderful stay. The first morning we went down and had the breakfast was wonderful, but if I was actually paying for it, the price would be excessive. (I think it was 30 Euros per person). The second morning we went to the executive lounge to have breakfast but it was packed with very limited seating availability. We asked the attendant for vouchers to go to the restaurant which they gladly provided, (which they also provided for the remainder of our stay on request.) The Executive Lounge has snacks all day, tea time with takes from 3-6pm, heavy appetizers and an entrÃ©e, from 6-9, and desserts till closing at 11pm. The evening offerings made meals for us most nights as the main entrÃ©e was varied and always had meat or fish. Additionally, the lounge has water, sodas, wine, beer, and cocktails. A nice touch in the lounge would be complimentary internet access. The hotel is approximately 10 minute walk to Champs-ElysÃ©es where dining options are available into the wee hours of the night, as well as lots of shopping). The River and Eiffel Tower are about a 30 minute walk if you choose to walk. The Metro needs 1-2 trains to get to many points but is very efficient and less than a five minute walk from the hotel. A taxi runs about 6 Euro to most of the tourist areas beyond a 15 minute walking distance if you choose not to take the metro. There are two convenient metro stops within a 5-7 minute walk. Other than Champs-ElysÃ©es this is rather an upscale residential area. (There is a Laundromat about 5 minutes away - great for those long trips where you donâ€™t want to pay 5 Euros to wash a shirt!) The location of the Hilton Paris (rather than Arc de Triomphe) could be a bit more centrally located, but the top notch service and great rooms (even the standard rooms) make this the best option. Both rooms were large, especially for Europe, with rooms overlooking a central atrium shared with an office complex. As with most European hotels, the beds were hard, but just fine. The bathroom had both a shower and separate tub. There was a lot of custom mosaic tile work. The bathrooms have frosted glass doors, which can be annoying if one person gets up to use the bathroom and needs to turn on the lights, it lights up the whole bedroom area. Housekeeping did an excellent job with keeping the room clean and well stocked with toiletries. They had bathrobes and slippers in the room for the guests to use. The hotel also had a nice cake, roses, and wine as this was an anniversary trip for us. Some nights they provided turn down service, other nights they did not, but there was no rhyme or reason to that. The room was spotlessly clean. They have a private access gym that is available to all guests. The "wet" areas (Sauna, hot tub, etc) are for a charge, but if you are a Diamond member they waive that fee. The spa is full service and we did use the hot tub. We never actually went down to the gym as we were doing enough walking to stay fit; however, we did use the hot tub one evening just before closing. (The gym and wet areas close rather early so we were rarely back before closing.) The concierge staff and bell staff was EXCELLENT and always went above and beyond in providing us with excellent service, advice, and assistance when needed. On arrival the bell services were rather slow so we went down and got our bags from the lobby but their service was otherwise great. All of the staff was multi lingual, I frequently heard French, English, Spanish, and German from the staff. The only suggestions I would have for this hotel is to get rid of the frosted glass windows on the bathroom door. It looks beautiful but can be annoying if someone gets up to use the bathroom in the night. Also, the air conditioning did not keep the room quite cool enough. Not uncomfortable, but a few degrees cooler would be appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, walking distance to Champs Elysees and Louvre”
Reviews.Author: ntravinsky
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton while my husband attended a conference on-site. I liked the hotel and found it to be within walking distance to the Louvre and the Champs Elysees. Although, the walk is about 15 minutes to the C.E. and about 35 minutes to the Louvre. I was ok with the walk as I had the time to do so. The hotel was equipped with all the amenities you would expect from a Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: movedsouth
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Paris, tired and hungry. Our room was not ready until noon, but we went to breakfast at the hotel while we waited. We were a family of four, two adults and two teens. We had a double double room. The room was decorated modern. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom modern. The hotel was nice. The staff was very helpful and everyone spoke english very well. The breakfast was excellent and was free because my husband is Hilton Gold. We did not get on the executive floor, but that was okay since we had a full breakfast downstairs each day. This saved us a lot of money. The room was small, but large enough for sleeping. We had air conditioning which does not go full blast, but cooled down enough. It was very hot outside. We had a view of the Eiffel tower from our room if you looked straight out. If you looked down, the view was large containers in a grass, weedy area. Not very pretty, but it was quiet and that is what I asked for. It is not right in the mix of things, but close enough to everything. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: TravelPlanner1029
Reviews.Content: My family and I just retuned from a 10 day trip to London, Paris and Normandy. We enjoyed our stay at the Hilton Waldorf before taking the Eurostar to Paris and staying at the Arc De Triomphe Paris; we can not say enough good things about this hotel! The hotel itself is onyl 5 years old...the lobby is very impresive with large crystal chandeliers and a beautiful sitting area! Upon checking in we were quickly given our rooms which included breakfast. The hotel's decor is inspired by the glamou of the Normandy ship andother grand transatlantic ships. The rooms, beds and amenities are all very comfortable with housekeeping twice a day. Breakfast each moring consisted of omlettes, panckaes and others eggs made to order in addition to pastries, fruit, lunch meats and other breakfast items. It was very plentiful each morning. One night after a long day of sight seeing we decided to take dinner in the adjoing patio restuatrant off the lobby. It was wondeful and the service was very top notch. The location of this hotel is within a 5 minute walk to the Arc de Triomphe...take a left and another left when leaving the hotel! Two blocks from the hotel (to the right) is a grocery store for regular items such as water and any forgotten toilteries. The hotel staf was great! We were always greeted with a hello Sir or Maam and everyone was kind. The concierge staff was very helpful with directions. During our stay we had rented a car at Budget...long story short the car caught fire only a few blocks from the rental place! We qucikly retunred the car to Budget to find out that was there last car of th day and that we wer eout of luck! We quickly contacted the hotel concierge and they arranged for a Mercedes Van to be delivered to the hotel within a half hour. They saved our weekend to Bayex and Omaha Beach! While we were gone they haeld our luggage! We had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelerFever
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying at this hotel for 6 days and then for 1 day. Staff were all delightful. They let us leave our luggage at the hotel for 2 days while we travelled to the south of France. . All staff spoke English, French, Spanish, Italian and other languages. We stayed on the executive floor and the food was exceptional. Some nights we only had to eat a light dinner, followed by great desserts. The conceirge staff on the executive floor were professional. She checked on the airline scheduled changes and then called our hotel in Los Angeles to notify them that we would be late. A self service laundry is close by on rue Berri, near the BMW dealership ( which is on the corner). It's only a five minute walk and very safe neighborhood. The Arc is a ten minute walk away and Parc Monceau is two minutes away. The park is great and typical of the French people. The metro is only two blocks away ( Corcelles) and directs with all other lines. Champs d'Elysee is also walking distance. Don't miss the opportunity to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice.”
Reviews.Author: JenniferPhoenix
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Arc de Triomphe for three nights in early June. The hotel was nice - and the size of the room was quite large - especially for European standards. The room was clean and well kept during the stay - with turn down service. We had a courtyard view - which was quiet for two nights, but were woken up early one morning by a business meeting. The neighborhood was close to Metro stops - which was convenient. However, on both Saturday and Sunday nights we had to really walk the neighborhood for long times to try to find any sort of restaurant open for business. Quite frustrating. Also, the AC unit wouldn't turn down too low - a bit warm in the room at times.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: bisbohemian
Reviews.Content: This place is EXCELLENT! Close to everything you come to Paris for... and the staff was phenomenal! c'est tres manifique! I have to rate this property along with the Hilton of the Americas in Houston as being the top Hilton properties I have stayed in (246 nights last year in Hilton family properties) worldwide. When we checked in, the bellmen were more than helpful in getting our baggage out of the car - and the hustle and bustle of Rue de Coucelles is a bit harried - at best. Once inside, the wonderful girl at the counter recognized our Diamond status and personally walked us to the executive lounge on the 6th floor where she turned us over to our personal checkin attendant. now THAT is service!!!! The room is EXTRA large by major city standards, with wonderful appointments. The lounge has a deck and chef prepared tidbits... now this is what ALL Hiltons should be!! This is our new home in Paris! ABSOLUTELY TOP NOTCH!

Reviews.Title: “Classy Art Deco Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AbbyTravelAgent
Reviews.Content: This Hilton is new in Paris. Art Deco 1930's hip decor. Clean and updated large rooms. Mini refridge, hairdryer, all standard amenities in the rooms. Staff is over the top. Upgrade to the executive level rooms, usually about $25-35e more. Nice because you have access to this lounge if you arrive at 9am and your room isnt ready, nice breakfast, newspapers and connected to an additional lounge with comfy couches and large flat screen T.V., outdoor deck overlooking quaint buildings. The concierge recommended great dining at Bound- a buddhabar.com restaurant and La Cantina- hip cool awsome food and experience. 20 minute walk to Champs Elessye where Bound Restaurant is and about the same to Arc de Triumph. Beautiful Neighborhood. It is less than $40 e taxi to/from the airport. about 20 minutes in good traffic. My advise is to hire a car from the airport into Paris. The taxi lane on the freeway into Paris is LONG and SLOW... not good after a long flight. Its about $50 e -$60 e one way. Worth every penny. Traffic to the airport on return is generally quick. I will stay here again- It was awsome.

Reviews.Title: “Just a Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: concher
Reviews.Content: We always refer to TripAdvisor when wanting accurate info on a particular hotel. Some of the things that we garnered from TripAdvisor for this hotel was modern, quiet and off the beaten path--but not to far. Everything mentioned above was absolutely true. You can now add that the staff was incredibly friendly, most helpful and everyone went out of their way to make your stay better. So, if you're looking for a spotless hotel, modern, quiet and with the comforts of air conditioning and so on, this is the perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: Bobzmcishl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Arc de Triomphe for eleven days, using our Hilton Honors points, and we were extremely satisfied with our stay to the point that I wrote thank you notes to many of the staff and sent a summary writeup to the customer service manager of this hotel. We were fortunate in getting a room upgrade that had a balcony, and access to the executive lounge. As many flights from the U.S. arrive early in the morning, it is important that the hotel expedite room availability upon arrival. The hotel let us check in at the lounge and then expedited our room for us, while we had breakfast in the lounge. A full breakfast is provided each day with a wide variety of food including an excellent machine that makes all forms of coffee ranging from espresso to cappucino's. You could also request a full pot of regular "American" style coffee. One nice thing about this hotel is that most of the key staff speak English and French and this is very handy, especially for those of us who have never been to France before. The concierge staff were really helpful in providing directions (very necessary in Paris), and restaurant recommendations. We also received help over and above the call of duty when I had my wallet stolen on the Paris Metro. The hotel customer service manager on duty called all of our credit card companies for us gratis, and arranged for an interpreter to accompany us to the local police station to report our loss. This helped to reduce our distress immensely. We also used the restaurant on two occasions and had excellent reasonably priced meals (by Paris standards) both times. Each night we had a different chocolate treat awaiting us, and we were able to use the executive lounge about 75% of our time at the hotel. This enabled us to get by with buying an average of one meal a day in Paris, which helped to minimize the horrendous $-Euro exchange rate. Our room was very nice, and very tastefully decorated, with a nice bathroom with excellent amenities, including luxurious towels. The room had a coffee/tea maker, a minibar, and iron and ironing board. The hotel is situated on the right bank in a business district, with two Metro stations nearby. We were able to get to almost any destination in Paris within 20-30 minutes maximum. If you are a Hilton Honors member there is no better way to maximize your points than staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but hey its expensive!”
Reviews.Author: Issyk-Kul
Reviews.Content: I Stayed in the Paris Hilton - sorry Hilton Paris - for one night on a business trip. The room was nice, well appointed and I had an excellent rest in the comfortable bed. One major disappointment: the Mosaic spa was closed - business as usual on Sunday, as it seems. Poor that you cannot access the sauna in a 5* hotel! Finally, none staff I met were French - sometimes it was hard to make you understand in the local language. But hey, the Hilton is an American chain....

Reviews.Title: “HHonors Redemption - Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Travels4workand4fun
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton HHonors Diamond VIP - booked online originally for six free nights as a C606 redemption into a Hilton King Deluxe Plus non-smoking room, then noticed about a week before my trip that the reservation had inexplicably changed to a King Deluxe smoking room. A quick e-mail to the hotel resulted in an explanation that the original booking was an error - the "Plus" room should not have been available for a reward redemption. The end result was a rebooking for 6 free nights as a GLONP2 (be sure to ask for this), which gave me the sixth night for "free" - which saved me about 75,000 points. At check-in, the hotel immediately recognized my Diamond status and upgraded us to a King Deluxe Plus Executive non-smoking room with access to the Executive lounge on the 6th floor. They also gave us coupons for free champagne in the hotel restaurant, and complimentary use of the "refreshing pool" in the hotel spa, Mosaic. I should note that check-in was available despite an early arrival around 10:30 a.m. From front desk staff, to bell staff, to the concierge and the waiters - everyone seemed delighted with our attempts to speak French, but ready to switch to English at any time to make things easier on us. We were strictly on vacation, though most folks staying at this hotel were on business. Having access to the Executive Lounge was a real treat - great full breakfast of traditional American and European foods in a stylish setting; afternoon tea with pastries and sweets; and evening cocktails with a lavish cold spread and a couple of hot specialties. We started every day there with breakfast and "refreshed" in the evenings with a complimentary glass of champagne or wine (a full complimentary self-serve bar is available). The room was nice, and the description of the King Deluxe Plus on the website is very accurate, so I won't go into detail here. We were given a quiet room on the back of the hotel, looking out into a courtyard. Turn-down service each night included a different local confection from area patisseries and chocolatiers. The first night we ate at Le Safran, the hotel's restaurant. The staff are very friendly and the menu featured French and international cuisine. There were several little surprises (a duck foie gras mousse with pomegranate seeds for an amuse') along the way that made this a nice experience. The complimentary champagne turned out to be one of the nicest selections on the wine list - about 20 euros a glass. We also made a couple of late night stops into the Purple Bar - a fun Art Deco lounge) for nightcaps while we were there. The Concierge staff are terrific. Marie-Leisse helped in advance via e-mail to arrange dinners for four nights at some very trendy places that had been suggested to us. The location of the hotel is walking distance to many top spots, including the 3-starred Guy Savoy. Alain and Olivier were also great in helping us to know what was open and what was closed, since our stay spanned the May 8 "Victory Day" national holiday, as well as stamping and mailing our regular postcard dispatches. All in all, this is one of the nicest Hilton properties I have ever stayed at - we really felt as if the all the staff were going the extra mile to make our vacation as pleasant and as memorable as possible. The residential neighborhood location was a great alternative to the more familiar Eiffel Tower/tourist zone location of the older Paris Hilton. Local info: Corcelles Metro (#2/Blue Line) is about 2 blocks from the hotel, providing easy access. There was almost always a line of taxis available in front of the hotel. Not to miss: about 2 blocks from the hotel, is the beautiful Second Empire-era Parc Monceau. Several Belle Epoque "follies" adorn the park, which is ringed with incredible mansions and a couple of small museums. There is free wi-fi in the park, as well. This is nice, since the hotel charges a steep 22 Euro charge for internet per day. You can pick up the signal from the park from the terrace of the 6th floor executive lounge - this was nice for checking e-mail and sending "e-postcards" to friends and family each day. To be avoided: the Corcelles Grill at the nearby Corcelles Metro stop (the most convenient stop near the hotel). It was the only neighborhood bistro open on the holiday, and we thought we would get a quick lunch there prior to afternoon sightseeing. While the host and hostess were quite gracious, the waiter was clearly not happy about working on the holiday, and treated us to a dreadfully surly experience, from our first "Bonjour, Monsieur" to the "l'addition sil vous plais." He spoke two words to us (in English) the entire meal: "cheese? dessert?" - our reply was a polite, "non, merci."

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: McSorley23
Reviews.Content: The beds were very hard, but you will find that in most of Europe. Other than that, great hotel. All of the staff speaks English and are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and exellent staff”
Reviews.Author: HeavyTravel
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at Hilton Arc de Triomphe was a really nice experience. We got an upgrade due to my HHonors Diamond status, and the executive lounge was absolutely one of the better we have visited. They served a lot of snacksy food all day, and the staff were friendly and serviceminded. We were very satisfied by the fact that they had turned on airconditioning. Otherwise it would have been dificult to get a good nights sleep. The beds were comfy and tha bathroom nice and clean. The hotel's bell boys and concierge were extremely nice and provided first class service.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It... Nice hotel, Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Dblues
Reviews.Content: The accommodations were very good and service was excellent. We were staying there with points, so I wasn't sure what to expect. Initially I was just happy we were able to find accommodations in Paris that could accommodate a family of 4. But both the room and the staff far exceeded my expectations. First the service. Coming from the US and arriving in the AM is an extremely draining experience. No matter how well (or not) you can sleep on the plane. But from the moment we got there I was just blown away by how accommodating they were. For one they let us check in at 9:30 AM. They also provided us complimentary drinks and passes to the Louve. But it wasn't just what they did but how they did it. They were just so friendly and helpful with everything. If I didn't know better I'd swear we were at Disney World instead of a hotel in the center of a major city. The manager greets you while your being checked in, introduces himself and requests you contact him if we need anything. The conciere's desk went out of their way to highlight areas of interest. And I'm not talking about the the tower and the arc. They advised us what parts of the town we would enjoy, where we could find historic churches, what days each of the attractions were open etc. Room wise, it was very clean and well kept. All we could ask Location was very good. Not right smack in the center of Paris but about a 12 min walk to the Arc. But the part I liked about it is it was right near one of their scenic parks. Personally I like spending time in those less tourist focused areas. And as a runner it was pretty cool as this particular park was well suited for running laps (about .5 mile) and a number of local runners were there as well.

Reviews.Title: “This Hilton topped the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: Abegweit1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Paris to celebrate her 40th birthday. Because I travel for work and belong to Hilton Honors we did the first half of our stay at the Hilton on points and the second half we splurged and stayed at The Ritz. The Hilton was everything The Ritz should have been. The Hilton staff was excellent - particulary the team in the Hilton Honors lounge and Marie, the Concierge. They were friendly, enthusiastic and knowledgeable. The concierge was even able to get us in to Jules Verne when all was booked. The Honors club was the perfect place to start the day with a quick breakfast and suggestions and good for a snack later on after walking the day away. The rooms at the Hilton are nice but on the small side. The shower and bathroom were well appointed. The location of the Hilton is in more of a residential neighborhood. The surroundings are beautiful and its an easy walk to the Arc or a metro station. All in all, the Hilton blew away expectations. It was upbeat, upscale and confident compared to The Ritz which was tired, full of itself and not terribly inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: shakergrandma
Reviews.Content: This was a typical Hilton--nice amenities, clean, upscale, well run--but the service wasnâ€™t as friendly as I would have expected. Since we are Hilton Honors members we were allowed to sit upstairs in the lounge while our room was still being prepared. We did not get our room until 3:30 in the afternoon. However when you spend the night flying over from the US, it would be nice to have a room sooner. Also, the hotel is not close enough to the Arc or the Champs for me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: slc123
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a wonderful 4 days in Paris, and highly recommend the Hilton Arc de Triomphe. The staff was impeccably polite and helpful; the room was clean and spacious. While this may be a standard "business" hotel, the location is good, the fact that one may not speak great french is not a problem, and the beautiful Art Deco decor lends a true Parisian flair. Parc Monceau is just a block or so away; the Arc de Thriomphe is an easy 5 minute walk. There are decent places to eat in the immediate neighborhoon and the Courcelles Metro station provides an easy connection to get anywhere. I may be influenced by the fact that three of my days were free via Points--I may not wax so lyrical if I paid $500 per night the whole time. But, this is Paris and the dollar is low, so all in all I still highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: SanMarco07
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very classy. The lobby is suited for, at least, 50 people to sit comfortably in comfy chairs or couches. We had to wait 2 1/2 hours for our room after flying in and the staff really tried to help any way they could. The family that was in our room got a late check out and stayed until the last possible minute! The hotel was crowded because of a wedding and our stay was close to New Year's so I wouldn't recommend staying during that time, especially if you have children! The breakfast buffet was near impossible but they will feed you as long as you are in the line, which was nice. The evening dining atmosphere is very elegant. Regardless of what you order, you are treated as if you ordered the special five-course meal! Very professional and knowledgeable staff. We did have room service one night and the presentation was top-notch. The bottom of the cart is filled with "boxes" that keep the food hot and the table setting was very elegant; for room service, this was presented very well. The only negative thing I can say for the rooms are that the hairdryers, literally, have a 12 in cord! Basically, they are pointless. Pack your own!! There is a pharmacy down the block for things you forgot but it is very expensive. Everything (famous landmarks) is within walking distance, at least, 20 minutes or more. But taxis and the metro are good alternatives. Unless you know French, I wouldn't recommend the charming restaurants on the side streets; stick to the more touristy areas. Just my opinion. Natives on the street and metro hardly ever smile; don't take it personally! I would stay at the Paris Hilton again and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet courtyard rooms”
Reviews.Author: Changes-In-Longitude
Reviews.Content: Like just about everybody we stayed here using Hilton Honors points. Whenever we do so we always seem to get upgraded and/or premium rooms. For this stay we requested a quiet room and received one overlooking the courtyard at the very end of the corridor. Despite checking in at 11 AM from an overseas flight we were led right away to our room. That came in handy to take a nap and freshen up. About half the rooms overlook the courtyard and are recommended if you don't want to listen to traffic noise. Due to the room being stuffy (even with the heat off) we slept with the windows open. It was so quiet it was hard to believe we were in Paris. The bed was comfy and the bathroom was gorgeous. The shower was probably the most powerful we have ever used. Normally I crank up the pressure but here I only had to put it half way. The area nearby is pretty quiet, mostly high end residential and offices but within a few blocks we found good restaurants. Also close to the Parc Monceau for a picnic. The hotel decor is designed to mimic the era of transatlantic liners such as the Normandie and is very pretty. Now that Paris is smokefree we even enjoyed a late night drink in the elegant bar. Overall it was a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Parisbound08
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 nights at the Hilton Arc de Triomphe and really enjoyed it. The lobby was beautiful, nice area to sit with beautiful chandeliers. The staircase leading to the lower level was very grand as well. Our check in was swift and staff was very helpful and efficient. Front desk and conceirge all spoke english. We were upgraded to a suite that had two bathrooms and a seperate sitting room which was wonderful. Our room overlooked the outdoor courtyard and was very quiet. Our kids had a room that faced out over the street and they didn't complain of any noise either. The executive lounge for Hilton Honors guests was very nice for breakfast, snacks, drinks etc. We also had complimentary breakfast in the restaurant. The rooms were clean, comfortable and had art deco style. Our bathroom had both a shower and a seperate tub. The location was fine for us, not in the heart of the sights but close enough. It was a nice 10 minute walk to the Arc de Triomphe. There were several nice place to eat within walking distance. The recommendations the conceirge made for dining were all very good, not touristy nor too expensive. We never had to wait for a taxi in front of the hotel and the doorman always made sure to tell the taxi driver exactly where we were going. Highlights of our trip were the segway tour and my husband and son went to the Normandy D Day tour. We are very glad we chose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Chuck&Jessica
Reviews.Content: This is your standard business hotel. It will not give you the true aura of Paris, but it's great for the business traveler or someone who wants a standardized hotel. It's a Hilton. Great Bed, Great Bathroom. Internet service. Great Lobby. It's not a great area but up the street is a very nice park, and it's by the Arc and it has some really nice restaurants around. Make no mistake this is a business area. The one great bonus is the concierge desk is excellent. They will find the perfect restaurant for you; of course you must be specific in your wants and needs. The one minus is the coffee; it's truly horrible. How can you make bad coffee in Paris. This hotel finds a way. This is not just me, but everyone at the conference. Stick with the cappuccino.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable!!”
Reviews.Author: NLoGalway
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights in February 2008. Arrival: we took the air france shuttle bus from the airport to the Arc de Triomphe. The hotel is about a 5 min walk from there but make sure to get the right directions! I think you must walk down avenue de hoche and then turn right onto rue de courcelles and you will see the hotel in front of you! On arrival the doormen whisked our way bags and were extremely friendly, even complementing my pathetic attempt at speaking french!! Our room was not ready when we arrived as it was early but we went to the bar for 30 mins until it was ready. Room: Very spacious with big comfy bed! Television had good selection of channels sky news etc... Lovely fluffy dressing gown and slippers also. Probably the best part of the room was the view from our large windows; onto the courtyard. We were only on the 2nd floor but it was beautiful! Staff: The staff were abolutely fantastic! They even remembered our name and preffered drinks in the bar! Consieierge quite good although perhaps not as friendly as the rest! Doormen excellent! Facilities: The Purple Bar was lovely. We drank here most evenings and although it is quite expensive the staff make up for it! They are so friendly! Also on the thursday evening of our stay, the bar seemed to be packed full of business people having a great time-really good atmosphere for paris!! We did not use the restaurant or have breakfast there so cannot comment. Also we didnt avail of spa as we did not have time! Location: As mentioned before, the hotel is situated very near the Arc de Triomphe/Champs Elysee! We even walked to the Eiffel Tower one evening (about 20 mins walk). For eveything else we used taxis and the metro. The metro stop of Courcelles is 3 min walk from hotel and very easy to use! Not alot of restaurants in immediate area around hotel but many within walking distance. There is a lovely little cafe across from the hotel for crossants etc... All in all we had a truely amazing time in Paris,and this hotel definitely had alot to do with it! I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone and anyone, it is one of the best hotels I have stayed in abroad! Hope this review was helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Impressive and "tres chic"”
Reviews.Author: pajanssen
Reviews.Content: One of the, if not the best Hilton I have ever stayed in. Fantastic location in heart of town, top class staff, great parking and all the other basic things which make a hotel great. On top of this however is the unique decoration and design of the hotel. No standard rooms, but unique designer rooms all in Egyptian theme. This theme you can find trhoughout the hotel. One of the nicest hotels I have ever been in, thanks to the original concept and beauty of it. Highly recommended!! Much better than the dreadfull other Hilton next to the Eiffeltower btw.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: chernd00
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and room was clean and bright. We brought a portable DVD player and were able to hook it up to their TV to watch movies. I got sick during the vacation and the concierge was very helpful in assisting with doctor, pharmacy, etc. The H Honors members got access to the lounge, which had a great breakfast and cocktail hour. It was very close to the Arc de Triomphe and subway stop - we never used a cab. Excellent use of points since the dollar is so low against the Euro.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Citizen_0f_the_W0rld
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute booking, literally we found ourselves in Paris without a hotel and needed to book a room for a week. Being Honors memebers really helped, they accomodated us, and even though we had to wait 6 hours for them to prepare our room, we were glad! We also got access to their lounge upstairs, which had fruit, and all the wine and champagne you want. It was really nice, because we had some friends in Paris come visit us, we took them to the lounge upstairs, and we enjoyed a drink there. Rooms are very comfortable, and clean, you can even call them "luxurious". The only thing is that the location is not central, so I would not recommend this hotel for newcomers to Paris. It is on a quiet corner, within walking distance of the Champs Elysee, but still not central. We knew Paris fairly well, so we didn't care about the location. In fact, the hotel is in the heart of a very upscale residential neighborhood, Parc Marceu is close by. I would definately stay there again, because Hilton makes it easy to use points, and rewards Honors (Diamond) members, and overall the hotel is very upscale. If you don't have points, and want a central location, you may find this hotel to be too expensive, and without access to the upstairs lounge, it wouldn't be as appealing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: c130andrew
Reviews.Content: Was upgraded to a family suite for my family of three with executive lounge access as a Hilton Gold HHonors member. It was indicated Gold/Diamond get access to the lounge, it's moments like this that keep me coming back to this hotel and the Hilton brand. The staff was great through out the our long weekend in Paris. It is a little walk to the Metro, front desk was nice enough to loan us umbrellas for the walk on a day when it was raining. Though some reviewers have different opinion, I felt the staff and management prided themselves on running a friendly and professional hotel. The concierge in the executive lounge was fantastic with assisting with reservations for dinner and we specifically wrote a note to the manager on her help. We are heading back this weekend for three nights and are very much looking forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: rgbplayer
Reviews.Content: After a week in London and two days in Brugge we stayed two nights at the Hilton Arc de Triomphe Paris. We accumalate a lot of Hilton points on business travel but usually prefer smaller, independent hotels when on vacation. But since we are Diamond Hiltonhhonors we booked the hotel using points. We were greeted at the taxi by name! For check in we were taken to the 7th floor executive lounge. The lounge is very comfortable with newspapers and TV. There is food from 7AM until 11PM. Breakfast till 1030, then snacks and sandwiches. Also a self service bar in the evening. We were only able to partake in the breakfast and late night drinks as we were on the go all day...it almost made us want to stop by the hotel several times during the day. The concierge was helpful in printing up our boarding pass for our flight home. The room was very nice. Large by European standards. Bath had an oversize tub and a separate stall shower. Nice quiet neigborhood near Parc de Monceau about 10 minute walk to the Arc De Triomphe. We would definitley stay there again and can't recommend it enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: WSG34
Reviews.Content: First time in Paris, only there for 2 nights and 3 days. I was looking for a nice place to stay that was convenient. I decided to use Hilton HHonors Points and book a reward stay and I was not dissapointed at all with this hotel. First, as far as getting to the hotel from CDG airport, the best thing to do is to take the Air France bus for 20euros round trip and take it to the Arc de Triomphe stop. From there it's about a 15 minute walk at most to the hotel. Very safe. As far as proximity to other things, it's about a 10 minute walk to the Champs Elysees, which wasn't bad at all. Grand and welcoming lobby. The hotel is very nicely decorated in a art deco style. The statt at the hotel was very friendly and eager to help (also spoke good English!). I checked it at 8am in the morning and was able to get my hotel room immediately. The room was very comfortable, nice size for Europe standards. Shower and tub in the bathroom in all nicely done in marble. Large towels. The bed and furniture were in good condition. Satelite t.v. with several stations in English. All and all, a very pleasant room. I'm not sure if it was because I was a Diamond Hilton HHonors member, but on the first night I received a nice note from the General Manager and a box of chocolates. On the second night I received a very nice bottle of wine again with a note from the manager thanking me for my stay and wishing me a happy new year. Wow, was I surprised. I was able to get the buffet breakfast included and was very surprised with how good the food was. A lot of choices, made to order eggs. Again, very nice spread for Europe standards. Again, can't say enough great things about this hotel. I would gladly stay hear again when I return to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Bubbles333
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel and location.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: poodlelover_7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I started our Honeymoon staying at the Hilton (stayed there 4 nights.) Because we were Hilton honors members they were able to upgrade our room to a suite with access to the Executive lounge -champagne and treats all day. The staff was WONDERFUL. The reception desk (especially Jean-Micheal) was so friendly and helpful and the staff spoke english (which was great because my french was pretty rusty.) Alain at the concierge desk was extremely helpful in helping us organize a weekend trip to Nice (he found a hotel and booked us train tickets at reasonable rates) The hotel rooms were very clean, spacious and the bed was comfortable with multiple feather pillows. The staff surprised us with champagne and dessert to our room for our Honeymoon on our first night there -it was extra special. The Purple Bar located within the hotel was comfortable and welcoming. In terms of location, there are not a lot of bakerys and cafes nearby but the hotel is within walking distance to the Arc De Triumph/Champs Elysee -maybe 15min? -which in the November cold, may seem longer but still possible. The metro was close by. The hotel itself is expensive but the hotel rooms and hospitality fit the price well. My husband and I would definitely return to Hilton Arc de Triomph.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SuzieQNewYork
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I were in Europe for a conference and decided to stay in Paris for a week of vacation following the conference. We had accumulated Hilton honors points and the hilton representative recommended we use our points here. SHE WAS RIGHT!!!! I wish I could thank her! The Hilton Arc de Triomphe is fabulous. I came in early, 7 am. Check in was not until later in the afternoon. They immediately took my bags and let me into their lounge which had a full breakfast buffet, magazines, and television. They told me to make myself comfortable and gave me a key card for a restroom down the hall should I need it. I was given my room in two hours. They were extraordinarily nice. The room was impeccably clean. We stayed for 7 days. They gave us access to the lounge, which included free breakfast, snacks and cocktails. We also had access to the gym. The spa was also included, it has a really great jacuzzi tub. The room was cleaned several times a day. The bathtub was sparkling! We got bathrobes and slippers to use while in the hotel. All of these amenities are included in the price. The bed was amazingly comfortable. The hotel is located in a very clean and safe area. Not to mention, very quiet. It is also very close to the metro and several shops and restaurants are within a 10 minute walk. The attention to detail and customer service at this hotel is SO WORTH IT!!!!! For a romantic parisian getaway... this is the place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: KJ39
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the associates at this property. I would especially like to commend Carlo at Reception and the exceedingly amusing young male Irish bartender. My son and I had an outstanding time and will continue to stay at the International Hiltons. This property did not disappoint. It is about a 10 minute walk from the Arc de Triomphe and you can walk straight down from the Arc de Triomphe to the Louvre. It is also close to the Courcelles Metro station and you can get anywhere from there. Treats by our bedside, very clean rooms and rooms much larger then a typical Parisien hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Solid Hilton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Escadabelle
Reviews.Content: For our anniversary, my husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in November 2007. We were deciding between this hotel and the Eiffel Tower Hilton but decided to try this one because of the Art Deco theme and a few better reviews. We were very happy with our choice and will probably return in the future. Just like many other reviewers, my husband is a HHonors Diamond Card Member so we were upgraded to the Executive lounge. Our room was on the 6th floor and faced the inner courtyard. We used 160k Hilton Honors points and it's hard to say whether it was a good value because I don't know how many points others have used. Unlike some other reviewers here, we were very happy with the location of the hotel which was just down the street from the famous Royal Monceau Hotel on Hoche Ave. and a mere 2-3 minutes walking distance from the Metro Courcelle and about 10 minutes walking distance from the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysee. The transit strike was in full swing for the duration of our trip but we were still able to get around the city (but not to Versailles, unfortunately) because of our proximity to Metro line 2 which ran a few times every hour. Anyhow, we spent most of our days walking and standing so we were glad we had access to the lounge drinks and snacks in the evenings when we'd come back to the hotel. Plus, it was nice to have the lounge buffet breakfast which gave a wider range of choice than we had at our last hotel in Paris. One nice surprise is that we were provided with small Evian water bottles each day. These seemingly small perks added a lot of pleasure and time-saving to our crammed days. We had zero problems with noise. We were courteously greeted with "Bonjour" and "Bonsoir" at every turn and the hotel manager called us on our last night to inquire about our experience. Everyone was attentive and polite. Also, the hotel has a good gym and sauna that we would've used if we had come prepared. Bottom line: great experience, no complaints, solid Hilton hotel

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch!”
Reviews.Author: crazyzete
Reviews.Content: Well, maybe not the 4 Seasons, but if you don't want to spend $700-1k per night, this hotel is great. My wife and I just got back from the second leg of our honeymoon in Paris. Our first leg was in Florence, and you can read my review of the Hotel Porta Faenza there. I'll start by saying that I used Hilton HHonors points for a free 6-night stay at the Hilton Arc de Triomphe. I am HHonors Gold and was upgraded to an executive room on arrival. The room was large for european rooms and was very comfortable. The bed was fantastic. The bathroom had a tub and shower stall, and marble floors. The Hilton provided 2 bottles of water daily, slippers, and bathrobes. Upon arrival, there was a box of chocolates waiting for us in the room. One word of caution - if you get them, eat them. We left half the box on the table and it was removed by housekeeping when they cleaned. I didn't bother complaining about this (though we would have liked more). Anyway, the second night when we arrived back, we found a second welcome gift awaiting us. The hotel had a plate of desserts/snacks and a half-bottle of chilled champagne waiting for us. The best part of this hotel was the executive lounge. You need to have a room on the executive floor, or an exec room to get access. The lounge is open from 7:30am - 11pm, and serves food and drink all day long (all for free). There is an ample breakfast served from 7:30-10:30am. There is a coffee machine that brews cafe, espresso, cappucino all-day long. The coffee was great (even though it was machine-brewed). The lounge served free snacks all day long, including cheeses, some sort of beef stew, cookies, candy. There was free wine, champagne, liquor, bottled water, coke, etc. all day. One night we were too stuffed to go out and eat dinner. We ended several evenings with a few glasses of wine and chocolates in the lounge. The hotel is also in a good area. A very nice residential neighborhood. Not too far of a walk from the Arc or the Champes Ellysees. I debated between this hotel and the Hilton Paris by the Eiffel. We walked by the other and agreed this one is in a much nicer area in the city. We walked to the Eiffel twice...Not too far, but not too close. Unfortunately, the transit workers were on strike and so metro service was sporadic or packed while we were there. Also, they are renovating the metro stop closest to the Eiffel until next March, so walking is a nicer option. If you find yourself in Paris, there are plenty of nice hotels as I hear. I loved the service at the hilton arc. The staff was friendly, the location was nice. The hotel decor was great, and the hotel was newer and clean. The exec lounge helped a lot too. I think you can book an executive room, and the extra costs may be worthwhile if you consider the free breakfast, snacks, and booze.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: pasadena_mouse
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not a good choice for anyone who is visiting Paris as a tourist. Considering the price, the guest rooms are incredibly noisy and the beds are not overly comfortable. The location is also somewhat inconvenient as a base for sightseeing and the immediate neighborhood is devoid of shops and restaurants. If you aren't strictly a jaded business traveler, this hotel is a waste of perfectly good money. There are too many other non-corporate, less expensive, more comfortable hotels to choose from in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if you are deaf”
Reviews.Author: Sophie_In_Taipei
Reviews.Content: Recently restored hotel. Very nice decorated room, bed is comfortable and bathroom is convenient. The major problem of this hotel is the thin wall between each room. My husband and I heard all the conversation of our neighbor... Also do ask for a room facing the interior yard... since traffic is terrible in Paris. Also, do not trust the Concierge when booking an early taxi for the airport... Even with 1 day advance booking, our 'booked taxi' (a taxi booked through hotel in the early morning for the airport is usually a friend of one of the concierge staff...) never arrived. After 15 min, we took another one.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance”
Reviews.Author: ArabellaLOndon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Paris during the Rugby World Cup. As H Honours Gold Card Members we were upgraded to the Executive lounge. I have nothing but praise for the quality of service and the quality of the food. The free-flowing champagne was also very welcome. Our suite, though small was well appointed and quite luxurious. We travel the world, especially the Middle and Far east. This was better than some of the more expensive hotels in Dubai. We loved the Art Deco theme. We will definately be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lifeinj2004
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at the Hilton Paris Arc De Triomphe for 7 nights from Wed May 23 â€“ Wed May 30, 2007. The lobby and a joining courtyard are quite impressive. The bellmen, concierge, and front desk staff were cordial. After checking in the quest services manager greeted us as well. Most high-rise buildings in Paris are limited to the La Defense business area. The Hilton Paris Arc De Triomphe is not in that area and as such is only 7 stories tall. Executive suits are on floors 6 & 7, we were given a room on the 5th floor with a view of the lovely courtyard. The room was modern and impressive. The concierge and other staff spoke English. There was only a mini-bar in the room, and they did not have spare refrigerators, so I had them clear it so that we could use it as a refrigerator. They did so without complaint. The area around the hotel is upscale. There are many embassies nearby. There are several brasserie in walking distance. The Arc de Triumphe actually is not that close â€“ about a 15 â€“ 20 minute walk. No convenience stores close, however. There is subway transportation at about a 15 minute walk, though we used the taxis that were readily available out front. We had drinks at the lobby bar after returning from seeing the Eiffel Tower one evening. The service and drinks were great. All-in-all the hotel definitely deserves its 4 star rating if not more. I would definitely stay there again if visiting Paris in the future.

Reviews.Title: “central location, great family room”
Reviews.Author: loulouSurrey
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a lovely family suite (2 rooms & 2 bathrooms) for 3 nights in May 1/2 term. Breakfast great although busy as tennis players staying for French Open. Room great. Conceirge very helpful booking us dinner reservations outside the hotel and helping with maps & tips for sightseeing. Would come again & recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelWiz43
Reviews.Content: All in all, very good experience. Hotel is relatively close to all attraction. Metro is a walking distance away. Excellent breakfast. Nice bar in the evening. Rooms are relatively spacious. NO POOL.. that was not appreciated by my kids!! Service was very good. Friendly staff. Would certainly consider staying there next time we go to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service...”
Reviews.Author: eurochic
Reviews.Content: Below is an abstract of the complaint I have sent to the management of this hotel. I think it explains everything. However if you don't have these problems the hotel is beautiful and well located. "I would like to bring to your attention my highly unsatisfactory stay at your hotel earlier this week. Checking into the Hilton Arc de Triomphe on July XXX at around 12h15 in the afternoon I was promptly checked-in to room XXX. Spending only a few minutes in the room to drop off my luggage I found the room satisfactory and left at once for my office located down the street on Rue Monceau. Arriving back at the hotel around 20h00 in the evening to quickly change for a business dinner I noticed an odd smell in the hotel room. Approaching the window I realized that the entire carpet and wall below the window sill were soaked with water carrying the distinct grey hue of mold. Obviously there had a been a problem for quite sometime. Having little time before my next engagement I stopped by the reception on way out to inform them of the problem. The staff were perfectly pleasant apologizing for the inconvenience and promising to send someone up to see what could be done to fix the problem and, if no problem could be found, to change my hotel room. Had this occurred I would not be writing to you at this time as I would have been perfectly satisfied with how the situation was handled. Hotels make mistakes and should surely be given the chance to rectify them. Unfortunately when returning to my room at 23h15 in the evening I found that not only had nothing been done but that the stench by this time was intolerable. It would have been impossible to sleep in this room. Calling the reception not one person on duty was aware of my earlier complaint. However after verifying the room number they were not surprised by the problem as I was informed that my room was 'closed' and was not to be assigned due to the leak. At this point they promised to send some up to look at the situation immediately. After waiting, in the hall (because of the odor), for 25 minutes, I was forced to call the reception a second time. It was only then that they sent someone to help me transfer to a comparable room on the same floor. The whole ordeal of transferring rooms meant that instead of going to bed at 23h15 I was not able to get to bed until well after midnight. Having woken up at 4h30 in the morning to catch a red eye flight to Paris and working for twelve hours straight this was certainly a less than ideal way to end my evening. The next morning when checking out no mention to the prior evening's events were made until I brought up the issue. At this point I was clumsily offered a discount on the my room. In all honesty this represents little compensation for me, spending over 100 days a year in hotel rooms neither me nor my employer could care less about saving a few euros on a hotel room. Spending over a third of my time in hotels for work I value a customer service and more importantly a good night's sleep. This is much more important to me than the actual cost of a hotel room and I would venture to say that this is the case for many of the business travelers you wish to attract.''

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: VonMannheim
Reviews.Content: As mentioned in other reviews; it is the staff that makes staying here so memorable. From chambermaids to Executive Floor Manager, all are most pleasant and eager to please. The only problem noted was the somewhat outdated television programing that the hotel subscribes to. But you don't come to Paris to watch TV...do you?

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel but lacks wow factor”
Reviews.Author: edleo13
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 3 night stay at the Hilton Paris Arc de Triomphe. Our stay was strictly for fun â€“ my wifeâ€™s 2nd trip to Paris; my 3rd. We picked this hotel because of the good Trip Advisor ratings and the fact we generally prefer American style hotel rooms when traveling in Europe. Overall, we thought this was a good hotel that could have been great if it had any wow factor whatsoever. Rooms: As I am a Hilton Honors member with Diamond status, we were upgraded to an Executive Room facing Rue de Courcelles (we didnâ€™t have one but if you have the opportunity, ask for one of the of the ones with a balcony and table/chairs â€“ those look like fun on a pretty night!). Furnishings in the room were as advertised â€“ Art Deco. The room was standard Hilton â€“ pretty nice based on European hotel room standards; average for a typical full service American hotel. Things we liked: wash cloths, complimentary slippers, complimentary USA Today each day, high powered A/C, and very plush king bed. Things we didnâ€™t like: the in-room hair dryer was a joke. The cord that attached it to the wall was no more than 12 inches. It was virtually useless given the location where it was mounted (approx. 12 inches from the edge of the sink). Secondly, no one goes to Paris to watch TV however the size of the 19â€� flat screen TV was a little disappointing for the size of the room and caliber of the hotel. Other: Turn down service was provided all 3 nights. Both the room and the bathroom were EXCEPTIONALLY clean â€“ kudos to housekeeping. Executive Lounge: On a whole â€“ disappointing. The staff was very friendly, the lounge itself was comfy (enjoyed the balcony), and the bus staff was impeccable (empty plates and glasses were removed promptly). However, the snack selection catered a little too much to Americans in my opinion (i.e. chips & salsa everyday, chicken wings one day, and then freezer-section chicken nuggets the next). Secondly, too much of the clientele confused the lounge for a restaurant. Iâ€™m sorry but itâ€™s just classless when the lounge is packed and you load your plate up with 15+ chicken wings! The lounge isnâ€™t a Las Vegas buffett. On the upside, we liked the department store macaroons that showed up one afternoon (check out the price on these babies the next time your in Galeries Lafayette â€“ youâ€™ll appreciate â€˜em even more!) Transportation: The Courcelles metro stop (line 2) is a 5 minute walk (roughly 3/10 of a mile) from the hotel. Itâ€™s 2 stops from the Charles DeGaulle/Etoile stop (access to the RER and a handful of other metro lines) and about 5-6 from the Montmarte/Sacre Coeur area. Iâ€™ve been on metros all over Europe and the States and there isnâ€™t a single one that I find as efficient and useful as this one. My wife and I probably took 15-18 trips over 3 days (buy the 10 ticket carnet â€“ lowers your cost to roughly 1.10 Euros per ticket) to just about every site Paris has to offer. To get to/from the airport, take line 2 to Charles DeGaulle, transfer to RER A towards Disneyland, then transfer at Chatelet to RER B towards CDG or Orly (depending on what you need). Trips to the airport are 8 Euros per person (more because you cross all 5 zones). General Area: Other reviews are pretty accurate. The Rue de Courcelles is basically a colorless Parisian street made up of business and residences. There arenâ€™t any charming cafes or trendy shops that most people associate with Paris and frankly, this place isnâ€™t that close to the Arc â€“ itâ€™s about a 10-15 minute walk up Ave Hoche to get there. You basically have to hop on the metro and go somewhere anytime you want to shop/eat/see something. Knocks: 2. Realistically, this hotel caters to the business crowd. Prices are high (geared to people with expense reports) and thereâ€™s a virtual fortress of meeting rooms. Secondly, the hotel wonâ€™t win any awards for its proximity to the main sights. As noted above, you really canâ€™t walk anywhere â€“ even the Arc is 10-15 minutes. Iâ€™d imagine the Louvre and other central sites could take anywhere from 45 to 60 minutes. Hilton vs. Hilton: Weâ€™ve stayed at both Hiltons in Paris â€“ the Arc and the Eiffel Tower. Personally, we prefer the Eiffel Tower location. It may not be quite as new but we found the rooms to be of comparable quality and the views (wow factor) of the Tower and Right Bank are unbeatable. The Eiffel Tower may also have slightly better transporation options as it has access to both a metro and RER stop within a 5 minute walk. Overall, this is a very nice hotel. We enjoyed our stay. The rooms are nice and the service is acceptable (i.e. no one really goes out of their way to do anything for you). Unfortunately I wouldnâ€™t classify this place as exceptional (what you expect for the prices they charge). We would return, but only if we got a pretty good deal (i.e. I wouldnâ€™t pay 275 euros a night) Furthermore, if you are considering using your points (40k per night), Iâ€™d recommend using them elsewhere (i.e. Hilton Barcelona Diagonal Mar).

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Alexcat
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Hilton Arc de Triomphe for 4 nights in July. I used 125k Hilton points for the stay and have to say we were very pleased with the hotel. We were upgraded to the Executive floor (I am a Diamond member). The rooms are comfortable but not overly large. We received complementary waters every day. The Executive Lounge had a great breakfast but was marginal the rest of the time. The location of the hotel is a bit away from most sights but if you are willing to use the Metro, the location is great. There is a metro station very close by & the arc de triomphe is less than a 10 minute walk away. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to use Hilton points for the stay or if you prefer American chain hotels. If I were paying for it I would stay elsewhere...there are plenty of cute cheaper hotels in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NicBournemouth
Reviews.Content: We went to the Hilton Arc de Triumph in April 2007 and thought what a lovely place it was. All the staff were very friendly and polite and very helpful as well. Our room was lovely, we were on the 3rd floor facing towards the garden, and you can open your big double window and have a lovely view. We had breakfast in our room twice and they bring it on a big trolley and put it on your table for you. We always made sure that our windows were open and the table facing out towards the view as we ate our breakfast, it starts your day off beautifully. We had dinner there for one evening and ate outside as the weather was great in April,the food and the service was very good indeed.The Arc de Triumph was only 7 or 8 minutes away which is not far at all.
