We will be staying there again when we go next time(hopefully this year again!)

Reviews.Title: “A superb stay!”
Reviews.Author: michiganstategogreen
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here 6 nights in May 2007. I booked a reward stay with Hilton Hhonors (Diamond member) and everything was great! The executive lounge always had complimentary food and drinks (including wine, beer, liquor, and champaign) available, and the room was excellent. Hotel is about a 3 minute walk from the Metro - very convenient - and is located in a relatively quiet area of Paris. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for accommodations in a non-touristy area. Would stay here again in a second!

Reviews.Title: “Simply amazing!”
Reviews.Author: HonorsKing
Reviews.Content: The hotel is absolutely beautiful. Somewhat of an Asian theme in the rooms we had and the lobby. I had 1 king room and a family room. The family room is two rooms that share a secured entry hallway. Rooms were very spacious. We had been expecting tiny cramped hotels in Europe after speaking with friends and family that had traveled before. The entire hotel appeared quite new. Everything was clean and seemingly only a few months old at best. We spent 5 days here and absolutely loved this hotel. We got 3 night through Hotwire for $216 a night and 2 nights with Hilton points.

Reviews.Title: “Tip Top”
Reviews.Author: Marais1969
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel located approximately 10 minutes from the Arc de Triomphe (walking) and ave. Champs-Elysees. If you are booking a rewards stay through Hilton you may be looking for an economical way to get to the hotel (as was I). Thus, you can take the Air France bus, line 2, from CDG to the Arc de Triomphe stop for about 13 Euro per person (as long as you have quality rolling luggage to make the 10 minute treck from the bus-stop). The ride takes about 1/2 hour. There is a cafe (Le Cristal) located one block from the bus-stop (corner of rue de Tilsitt and ave Grande Armee) that has the best coffee and Croque Madame that I have found in Paris. Arriving by plane in the morning and hitting Le Cristal is a ritual that I would not give up. The lobby and dining facilities at the hotel were appropriately upscale and, despite being a large corporate hotel geared to business travelers, quite romantic. The staff were extremely nice and knowledgeable. Evelyne, a front desk clerk, possesses an outstanding knowledge of the city. I was provided with a Deluxe King room which was, by Paris standards, huge. Although coffee/tea facilities were not provided, the room was otherwise perfect: comfortable bed, quality furnishings, bathrobes and slippers. The view from the window was nothing spectacular, but not shabby either (A view of an upscale street in Paris is pretty nice). When the drain in my bathtub did not work, a technician was sent up to fix it immediately, at 11:30 pm. He had sufficient class not to mention that I had closed the drain by mistake and that there was actually nothing wrong with it (well, that is what I figure since it took him all of 2 seconds to fix it and I believe he hung out there another 10 or 20 seconds so it would not be so obvious to my date that I was a fool...maybe he was just making sure the water drained). I have stayed in numerous other hotels in Paris (some of which were highly rated). This hotel was the absolute best. Note about the food/beverage prices at the hotel: they are steep...very steep. While the prices are comparable to other hotels of this level, you may want to venture out for meals (it is Paris, anyway, so there really is no excuse to eat in the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “A favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: DC_Traveler
Reviews.Content: We love this Hilton. It is very clean and modern. We had access to the Executive lounge. It is fabulous!! The staff are very nice. The food and beverages are non-stop all day long. We loved it!! The breakfast had great smoked salmon, pastries, etc.. It is very close to the metro, approx. a two minute walk. It is a good 10-15 minute walk from main shopping streets. However, with the metro so close it doesn't matter. This hotel is well worth the extra 2 minutes on the metro. If you are able to stay in a room with a terrace, the view of the Eiffel tower is priceless. Go get some wine and cheese and sit and watch the tower at night.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: mntravellers3
Reviews.Content: Even though I booked this hotel with my Hilton Honors points, we were lucky enough to be upgraded to the Executive floor. (I'm HH Diamond). We had access to the Exec Lounge and free access to the whirlpool at the Spa. Completely relaxing! This was our fourth visit to Paris in the last 4 years, and this was by far, our best stay. We've stayed at the Westin and at the Le Grand Intercontinental for comparison's sake. The service here was the best - everyone was so friendly and helpful - no attitude at all! The hotel was in fairly good condition. Our room was nice - only issue was some staining on the carpets. Our room overlooked the rue de Courcelles, and I didn't find it too noisy at all. In our bathroom, we had a separate shower and tub. No mold in the bathroom.The room was pretty big - probably because it was on the exec floor. It's about a 3 minute walk to the Courcelles Metro stop. The immediate neighborhood around the hotel is comprised of businesses/residences, so it didn't feel too busy or touristy. We took the Air France bus from CDG to the Arc de Triomphe stop - it was about a 10-15 minute walk to the hotel. I would definitely stay here again, even without using honors points!

Reviews.Title: “Poor experience - very noisy”
Reviews.Author: Troy32830
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HAdT during the last week of May 2007 for 5 nights on Floor 1 facing the inner courtyard. We were on vacation on our first visit to Paris. Our primary concern was the amount of noise emanating from the courtyard between 00:00 and 06:00 each night. Hotel workers were cleaning and moving the courtyard furniture around, making an awful amount of noise. Imagine heavy tables and chairs being pulled across a stone pavement (screeeeech...). We confirmed the noises with other members of our traveling party in other rooms. We placed calls to the front desk and asked for a new room which was not available due to the hotel being sold out. Their reply was that they would send security to check on the noises. There was not any follow-up by the hotel staff. The HAdT is a business hotel and it is located in a business section of Paris. I would strongly recommend vacation travelers to look elsewhere. The nearest metro is Courcelles (#2 Port Dauphine / Nation Line) which is a 5 minute walk away on Rue de Courcelles at the intersection of Boulevard de Courcelles. The Charles de Gaulle Etoille metro station is two stops away on the #2 Line. There is a cash/money machine and a pharmacy located nearby on Rue de Courcelles (walk towards Avenue Hoche). The breakfast buffet has a wide selection of pastries, fruits, meats, and juices. On Mondays to Fridays it is very busy as business travelers start their workday. Complimentary newspapers are available near the elevators. The elevators are slow to appear during busy times. We primarily used the stairwell since we were on a lower floor. The concierge seemed very friendly and helpful. They printed out copies of train schedules and gave us directions. Housekeeping was inconsistent as our room was not cleaned everyday. The evening turndown service was also inconsistent. This wasn't a big deal to us but it seemed unusual. Overall, we would not stay at this hotel again. If you are a tourist on vacation, find a hotel closer to the action.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with a touch of snootiness.”
Reviews.Author: JimmyJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few days during the first week of May (I also stayed at the Hilton Eiffel Tower as well if you want a comparison). The hotel is very nice and the staff were exceptional. I was hoping for a room upgrade, being a Gold member, but there were no upgrades to be had for all 5 days I was there. They did compensate me with free breakfast coupons for their breakfast buffet. That turns out to be quite a deal as they charge 30 Euros for breakfast! I don't know who pays that kind of money for breakfast, but it was always packed. The rooms are small, as expected in Europe, but very neat and mostly clean. There was some normal wear and tear, but in the bathroom there was a good bit of mold in the shower and ceiling. Otherwise, the bathroom was nice with a seperate tub and shower. The only other complaint I had is the airconditioning was turned off. I still find it hard to believe that a hotel like this would still decide when their customers would like airconditioning. It was still a bit cool in May, but being in a small room with stagnant air can become very uncomfortable and warm. Opening a window was just ok, but the noise level outside made it impractical for me. The hotel is very popular with business people and upscale travelers, so I didn't exactly fit in around there. The patrons seemed to have a bit of snob appeal but the staff were very pleasant. The location is a bit out of the way except for the Arc de Triomphe. Making use of the excellent subway system in Paris is recommended and effortless, otherwise you will be spending a good bit of money to get to the rest of Paris from this location. I would stay here again if the price were right, otherwise you will find me at Hilton's Eiffel Tower location.

Reviews.Title: “New Year in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Flintshiresightseer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over New Year with friends having booked a flight and hotel package through Opodo. The name of the hotel can be a bit misleading as it is a good 10 minute walk to the Arc de Triomphe, but wasn't a major problem. The concierge was excellent, having booked and changed a dinner reservation for us at the Altitude 95 via e-mail prior to our arrival. He also left a note in our room confirming the reservation. The interior of the hotel is quite impressive, especially the reception area and grand hall downstairs. The service was good as one would expect from the Hilton group, but drinks were a little expensive as seems to be the case in most hotels of this standard in Paris. Rooms were small, but well laid out and equipped. A special thanks to the front desk who allowed us a late checkout without charge at short notice. While we will go to Paris again and would consider this hotel, we ceratinly wouldn't travel for New Year.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Lovely Staff....”
Reviews.Author: NomadPrincess
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hilton Arc de Triomphe for a long weekend in April 2007. The hotel is beautifully decorated and the rooms modern and comfortable. I loved the Art Deco styling. The staff were amazingly friendly and helpful from Reception to Waiters to Bar Staff. They really couldn't do enough for you and they all spoke excellent English. We ate in the restaurant on one night and it was quite expensive but in line with the rest of Paris. The food was well prepared and tasty. Although the hotel is not bang in the centre of Paris it was an easy walk to the Arc de Triomphe and the Metro system (which is a very efficient service). When the weather is beautiful, as it was when we were there, it would have been a crime not to walk around and see the wonderful architecture of such a lovely city however taxis from outside the hotel are always available if you prefer to take the weight off your feet!

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mattrLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights during Jan 2007. The hotel is of a high standard as you would expect for a Hilton in a major city - but it has the price tag goes with this (it is pricey, even for Paris). The hotel is not especially close to any major tourist spots (the ADT would be a 10 minute walk), but I find that this is not a problem in a city like Paris where it can be too crowded if the hotel is right by a tourist attraction. There is a metro station very close by. The rooms are interesting and clean - the property is well maintained. The entrance lobby seemed to be filled with smokers every time we went through, but that is Paris. The prices of food/drinks in the hotel are totally over the top - even for Paris. Overall, this is a good (but for the price, not great) hotel. There is nothing wrong with it, but it does not go the extra mile. I would recommend it and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Find”
Reviews.Author: Casa4602
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I were spending our last two nights in Paris after traveling France, and because we had HiltonHonors Points Hilton recommended this hotel to us. I'm glad they did. It's beautiful. The area is a bit off the beaten track but a nice walk through the sidestreets of Paris take you where you want to go. The decors Art Deco and fun, the lobby large and the airy courtyard gives all the rooms great light. The service was friendly and helpful and I'd love to get back and spend more time here. If you're thinking about it ... do it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, takes care of their honors members”
Reviews.Author: wineglobelovers
Reviews.Content: If you have Hilton points and want to redeem them, this is the hotel. We were upgraded to the executive floor and their VIP lounge was second to none. Full breakfasts, snacks throughout the day, and an open bar (think high quality Champagne and top shelf spirits not box wine and well drinks). Made for a great start to the day or warm up before heading out on long walks through Paris. There were some hiccups in the service, but nothing major. Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel in the middle of nowhere”
Reviews.Author: traveller55555
Reviews.Content: IÂ´ve stayed in this hotel twice - in June 2006 and now, in January for business matter and it is definately not for tourists. It is a large business hotel with lot of people and always very crowded. But the rooms have nice art deco feeling and are really big (what is rare in Paris) and the staff in concierge and reception desk is friendly and nice. The service at the breakfast was horrible - slow and unpolite. Breakfast itself was quite generous with lots of juices, hot and cold dishes, fish, cheese, pancakes - you name it! I also liked the Purple bar which is also popular among locals. Bathroom was very small and has Crabtree&Evelyn amenities. When I first time stayed in Hilton Arc de Triomphe, I also had some problems with the room service - they didÂ´nt clean the room and they "forgot" turndown service. Overall - if You donÂ´t mind to move around by taxi (it costs 7-8 euros to Louvre area for example and 47 euros to airport) and You donÂ´t mind, that the hotel is overcrowded and noisy, then go for it! But if You prefer more personal touch and intimate feeling and historical atmosphere and to be close to the lively city center, then it is definately not for You.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: SilverSpringer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here January 13-16 on an "award" stay and as Hilton diamonds, we were upgraded to the executive floor. This is a lovely hotel, only 4 years old, decorated in the 1920's art deco style. While some of my review reflects the executive floor service, I found all staff very pleasant and service oriented, and happy to see and talk to us. Our room was on the seventh floor and while compact was very nicely appointed. The breakfast, snacks and champagne served in the executive lounge were great and the service was very personalized. We also used the "hamam" steam room in the spa and the whirlpool/spa in the basement--very nice. We told them when we reserved we were celebrating our anniversary and received a bottle of champagne and cake in our room the first night. The executive floor staff noted our anniversary and as we checked out, they called for glasses of champagne (delicious Nicholas Feuillatte champagne by the way) to send us off. January was also a good time for Paris as it was a slow time, good airfares, and Xmas decorations still up. We were walking distance to Taillevent, a three star Michelin restaurant where we had a fantastic lunch. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service on the top floors”
Reviews.Author: HoneymoonPlanning
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend at the Hilton Arc de Triomphe in February 2006 - and we'd only wish we could have stayed for longer...My fiancÃ© used HHonors bonus points for the stay. We arrived from Gare du Nord with a taxi outside the hotel - and before I'd even stepped out of the car, our luggage was brought inside. We walked up to the reception, and when my fiancÃ© brought out the Diamond VIP card, as the reservation was on this card, we were simply given a key card and asked to use the elevator up to the 6th floor. On the 6th floor we were greeted by an extremely serviceminded personell, and taken into an office where they processed our reservation. Unfortunately, the room was not ready (it was about 2 pm) - but I think this is because the reservation was originally for a standard room, but they upgraded us because of the Diamond VIP (funny thing the computersystem hadn't registered that, but oh well). We were given the option of going for a walk, and they would call us when the room was ready, or we could simply hang out in the lounge - which we ended up doing. We watched sports on the giant flat screen, had snacks and drinks - all for free. The lounge is open all day, and all who stay on the 5th and 6th floor are told to "think of it as their livingroom". Great livingroom with access to champagne, beer, cappuccino and fruit (and what not!) all day long!! The room was wonderful - the largest bed I have ever slept in. The bathroom wasn't brand new, but still very luxurious and spacious. An hour after we got our room a bell boy stopped by and rang our door bell (yes, an actual door bell... no knocking!) - and gave us a platter of sweets and a dessert wine. All in all, the service could not have been better. There's a spa at the hotel, that we were planning on using before our departure on Sunday - however, the only day during the week that the spa is closed happened to be on Sundays... That was a disappoinment, as I only learnt this Saturday night...and we had to make new plans for Sunday (and travel days are always so stressful anyway...). As for location it is not "shmack in the middle of things", and there are few restaurants and bars immediately around the hotel. However, it is only a 10 minute walk to Champs-ElysÃ©es, where you obviously can find whatever suits you. All in all, a great luxury hotel - however - I have no idea what it is like in the rest of the hotel, as you live a very "secluded" life on the 5th and 6th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and great staff”
Reviews.Author: irishrover
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night at this hotel so it was just a flying visit. The most positive feature of the hotel is the fantastic staff. They all seemed actually geniunely delighted to see and speak to us. Not a hint of haughtiness or boredom. The cleanliness of the hotel and room was very high and, very important to me, the room (on the 5th floor) was quiet, both from internal and street noise. The one drawback was that the room was incredibly overheated. Even though I turned everything off, I still could not sleep for the heat and the heavy duvet did not help the situation. The other strange thing about the room is that the curtains are not made to close so the street lights shone all night through the net curtains. These two points were a big let down to an otherwise very comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A hilton, but not as I know them!”
Reviews.Author: ksm100
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton adt for 3 days at the beginning of December. The location is a little out of the way, but is a 5 -6 minute walk from Les Courcelles metro and is within walking distance of the Champs Elysees. I am not generally a fan of big chain hotels, but this was very stylish and had a bit of character, despite its size. The service was excellent, from the front desk, concierge and bar staff. The breakfast (included in the price) was good in terms of variety (pretty much anything you could want!) and quality, but the hot food was rather lukewarm. The bar had a good ambience; prices were expensive, but then so is the rest of Paris. The room was an adequate size (a standard, on the 5th floor), with plenty of wardrobe space for two. The art deco decor was very nice, and everything was clean and well-maintained. Overall, I enjoyed my stay, and would consider staying at another Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a great experience”
Reviews.Author: grad82
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night and used Hilton points. We had the best service - free breakfast, late checkout, friendly staff. The lobby was beautiful. Our room was on the fifth floor. Loved the bathroom and the robe. My only complaint was that the tub was too long for me. The breakfast buffet was amazing. I would definitely recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: tkeegan
Reviews.Content: Excellent experience at this hotel. The staff are friendly,helpful and polite. Avoid Restaurant Eugene-bad food and poor service.The executive lounge has excellent food and drink.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, But May Not Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: liinny
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautifully kept but lacks charm and a welcome feeling. It is within a 10-15 minute walking distance to the Arc de Triomphe and within 5 minute walking distance to a metro station. The staff was not overly helpful and even gave us bad information at one point which cost us a precious day of sightseeing. (We learned an important lesson on that trip - always check to make sure that you are not traveling during a local holiday when 90% of monuments and museums are closed.) However, manager Gregoire made it up to us for the concierge's faux pas. The food was excellent and the bartender friendly! 2 for 1 cocktails (normally 18 euros for one martini) are offered in the later evening. Breakfast is 19 euros for continental and about 30 euros for the full breakfast. The continental breakfast was entirely satisfying with fruit, granola, yogurt, croissants, cheese, cappuccino, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Airy Art Deco”
Reviews.Author: C.Elder
Reviews.Content: Stayed during a busy October period.The hotel is lovely,with spacious,nicely decorated rooms.The A/C works very well.The bathrooms are equipped with wonderful toileteries(crabtree&evelyn).The layout is a bit odd,with long,long corridors(poorly signposted to elevators).Check-in/out was fast and simple.Staff smiled(a rarity in Paris!),and spoke English easily and with no hang-ups(also a rarity in France).There are shops for every possible forgotten item 100 yards to the left on exiting the hotel(obviously a previous reviewer never turned left during his stay!).The room TV was uneven-some channels reception was on/off;the remote was poor.The separate shower stall had a poor shower head that flopped around and could not be fixed in any direction.But these were small quibbles.Did not try the food,but frankly with all the fine eating establishments available in Paris,you should NEVER stay in a hotel to eat .

Reviews.Title: “Very Very overrated”
Reviews.Author: traveler4k
Reviews.Content: OK, I TRULY do not understand the rave reviews at this site. As a diamond HH member we had to fight to get an obstructed view room on the executive level but that is not a big deal. This hotel is really very odd. It used to be an old police station that was transformed into a hotel. Yes, the rooms are larger than most of Paris' hotels but the rooms are odd at best. The food in the executive lounge (if you decide to stay there and pay more) is mediocre at best as well. The scrambled eggs are runny and the food is not good. It is also the same boring food every day. Again, for the money that you would spend at the executive lounge (if paying) just eat meals you want to eat out. I cannot understand for the life of me how this place has a 4 star rating! I stayed at the Le Grand Intercontinental last time and it was MUCH MUCH MUCH nicer and less expensive, better location, etc. While it is near the Arc de Triomphe, there are barely any other attractions nearby and extremely difficult to get directions from people as they are unaware of its bizarre location. This is a shabby-chic hotel and that is it! Nothing outrageous and extremely disappointing. While the staff is extremely "nice" for Paris' standards, we still had to wait about 5 hours for the room to be ready. The rooms are not as big as we expected and the bathroom was OK but again, nothing to write home about. I really cannot understand, for the life of me, the rave reviews of this place at all. Sorry to be a downer, and believe me, I am not a complainer but this was not a great hotel by any stretch of the imagination.

Reviews.Title: “How many ways can you say Fantastic?”
Reviews.Author: ColoLdr
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this hotel and will without a doubt stay here again on my next trip to Paris. This was my first ever trip to Paris and I was a little worried that the handful of French I spoke wasn't going to get me by. The desk and concierge staff were very kind and helpful in English and didn't make me feel out of place. I ate dinner at the restaurant the first night and was fortunate to get a fantastic waitress who not only helped me order but offered lots of advice on places to go and things to do. In fact she was so nice and so helpful, I'm actually going to write Hilton about her. Will also praise the hotel as a whole. The room was a standard room, as I haven't built up that many Hilton Honors points. But it was actually pretty large, very clean and had a window in the back that faced the Eiffel Tower. Each night, because of the weather I was able to open that window and enjoy the fresh cool air and the fabulous view of the Eiffel tower in all it's twinkly glory. The bed was amazing. If you like to and are able to, Paris is a great city to walk. The location of this hotel, while not optimal, is pretty close to the Arc( 5-10 minutes) and to the Eiffel Tower( another 30 ). I was able to walk to the Louvre and d'Orsay and highly recommend both. Checkout was a snap and the desk staff corrected one small billing issue without fuss. The concierge was especially helpful in getting me to the airport. Great stay, great hotel, great city!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: BermudaTraveler1
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a wonderful one-week trip to Paris. We used Hilton points for a 6-night stay. We liked the hotel a lot. When we arrived from the airport early in the morning after an overnight flight, we were able to check in right away and get some sleep/shower. That was great and unexpected. Room was a bit small but nicely done. We had a courtyard view. Bath had a tub and a separate shower. As Gold members, we were given coupons to use for the buffet breakfast downstairs. Very good - although service there was slow to get a coffee. The area around the hotel was very residential. However, it was easy to get to the metro stop. We walked to the Arc de Tri. area a few times too. All in all, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at this Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: SJhulawahine
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights (on points) and it was fabulous. Our room had 2 double beds and a great view of the top half of the Eiffel Tower. It was great to watch it all lit up at night as we were falling asleep. The hotel is located about 5 mins from the Arc D'Triomphe. The first night we didn't get back until around midnight and had no problems walking around the area at that hour. It is located in a quiet neighborhood and we felt safe at all times. There is an ATM, pharmacy & cafe right down the street. The closest metro is Couchelles (not sure if I'm spelling that right!) and it is an easy walk to the hotel from there. If you're an adventurous walker, you can hike it down to Notre Dame and hit the Louvre at the same time. It takes a while but we managed to do it. Our room was big, clean and comfortable. Actually one of the best hotels we stayed in during our 2 weeks in Europe! Everyone who worked there was very helpful & friendly. I would go back to this hotel. Just be aware of the taxi drivers. Fares vary with each taxi. Verify first how much it would cost for 4 people or if you have any luggage with you.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay with wife and kid”
Reviews.Author: uniter
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights (award stay) last week at the Hilton Arc de Triumphe with my wife and 4-year-old son. Overall, the hotel was beautiful and the service was great. Upon check-in in the lobby, I was given a card for the elevator and told Iâ€™d been upgraded (HHonors Diamond) and needed to check in at the Executive Lounge on the 6th floor. Going upstairs, we helped ourselves to early afternoon snacks (mostly smoked salmon and veggie sandwiches with a wide selection of drinks) and saw our room. My son's reaction: "This room is very small." Sadly, he was right. Our room, although on the executive floor, was tiny. Just barely enough room to walk between the beds and the dresser. There were two queen beds, though. And since we spent as little time as possible in the room, it didnâ€™t really matter too much. The executive Lounge was amazing, though. They had a great breakfast spread of breads, pastries, meat, cheese, fruit, eggs, potatoes, eggs, bacon, yogurt, fresh squeezed juice and coffee served to table (plus you could use the cappucino machine). Snacks were available throughout the day consisting of various nuts, chips, salsa, and assorted other savory snacks, along with sodas, beer, wine, and bottled water. Around 3 pm (afternoon tea time) they put out finger sandwiches â€“ smoked salmon, chicken, and cucumber usually. The dinner snack was more sandwiches and a hot item (it differed on the night, but there were chicken wings, fried pasta, small ribs, etc), plus the nuts and chips. (After a long day of touring, we usually came back and made a meal of the stuff). Later in the evening, they put out chocolates that were quite excellent. Wine, liquor, champagne, and other drinks were available all day. We made such great use of the lounge (which was a few feet from our room) that we didnâ€™t mind the small room. They had lots of magazines, newspapers, and a TV with BBC playing most of the day as well. The concierge service in the lounge was excellent as well. Arriving in Paris, our luggage was lost by BMI. I mentioned it at check-in and they asked for the contact info and said theyâ€™d follow up for us. Lo and behold, our bags arrived the next morning at the hotel. In fact, the service at the hotel was quite good. Upon arrival, they sent up a complementary puzzle for my son to try (it had a picture of the hotel on it). It was too tough for him, but a nice gesture. Each night, turndown service left us a special treat. One night, chocolates, another a small incense kit, another a potpourri kitâ€¦. it was fun to see what weâ€™d get each night. Location wise, we were on a quiet street, not far from a nice park (Monceau -- good playgound), which is also where the nearest Metro was located. The walk to the Arc was a bit long, but certainly manageable. Overall, it was a bit out of the way, but quiet and nice and near a number of good restaurants. While I did not go, my wife spent one morning at the spa (free for Diamonds and perhaps Golds) downstairs. She went on and on about how amazing it was! Just the thing she needed. Beautiful tiles everywhere and a â€œhyrdo roomâ€� â€“ a very large room with a large whirlpool tub (4 feet deep). The tub had places to stand, sit and lie down with four different kids of jets and sprays. There was also a steam room and sauna. They had free mineral waster and hot tea available. Though I didn't go, evidently this is one of the best parts of this hotel! The service alone makes this place worth a stay .. though I'd ask for a bigger room next time.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel, OK Location”
Reviews.Author: St._Louie
Reviews.Content: Used Hilton points for a two-night hotel stay. Asked for an upper-level garden view room. Best shower ever, but bathroom was a bit small and lacked counter space. Bed covers and linens were clean, but the carpet definitely needs to be replaced in the rooms and the halls. Lobby was impressive. Staff was very attentive and helpful. Asked about using a pre-paid calling card from the room but was informed we'd be charged twice -- once with the card and once by the hotel. Not sure if that would have been true or not. Did not eat at the hotel. Instead found a very nice outdoor cafe if you walk left out of the hotel and further up the block, pastry, wine and cheese shops. Take the train from CDG to Gard du Nord to avoid traffic, but then take a taxi to the hotel -- too trying to do that with luggage.

Reviews.Title: “It's not a cheap hotel - so your bed has a mattress.”
Reviews.Author: skurczysyn
Reviews.Content: After we fled the 2-star nightmare hotel we'd booked we came here. It was plenty more expensive - but then you get a good hotel. Art-deco style. The standard room we had was rendered smallish by the crib we needed. Clean and bright. Very comfortable bed. Great water pressure. AIR CONDITIONING which you won't find in a lot of hotels. The mini-bar was outrageously priced at 6 Euro for a small water, so BYOW. The location is okay - not my personal preference as I like the Marais district - but it's a short walk to the upscale shopping on the Champs Elysses and the traffic extravaganza they call Arc de Triomph. They want 26 Euro for a bare-bones breakfast, so plan on eating elsewhere unless you're Spendy McSpenderson.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: Mortgagee
Reviews.Content: We noticed a strong odor on the floor and my wife couldn't understand why she was suffering from breathing difficulty each night when we returned to the hotel. We later found out that the smell was mold (we suspected but it was later confirmed) due to a problem they had on the floor above with the sprinkler. It is hard to believe that a hotel placed guests on a floor knowing that there was a mold problem. The breakfast, which is 40 Euros (about $55 USD) is ok but I never rec'd the omelette I requested despite numerous requests. Bottom line, for the price there are far more reputable places to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: harperharper
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the French Open and were pleasantly surprised to see many of the players choosing to stay here as well. We had a room on the 6th floor which gives you access to the executive lounge, so we enjoyed the complimentary breakfast and snacks/drinks that were available throughout the day. We found the concierge to be very helpful. Never felt that it was snobbish at all. The hotel is located in a quiet, safe area and there are two convenient Metro stops: one with a 8-10 minute walk, the other a 10-12 minute walk. There is not much to do around the hotel, but the Metro is so easy to use, that we spent our days out and about and then returned to the quiet of the hotel and relaxed in the executive lounge. The room was very nicely done and a good size for European hotel. Ours overlooked the courtyard, so it was very peaceful as well. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: PrincessJennyJen
Reviews.Content: Just got back from spending 3 nights at this hotel. Yes the food was quite expensive but in Paris everything is expensive. We had terrific service from all the staff we found them extremely helpful and polite. Our room was quite large for Paris standards and quiet and clean. The location was also fantastic - it was a 10 minute walk to the Champs Elysee. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly 25th Wedding Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: rudz
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here as part of our anniversary and had a wonderful time. The facilities are new and well maintained. Great bed, top notch shower and bathtub, absolutely outstanding concierge desk and hotel staff - we literally had a laughing crowd load our baggage into our rental car as we left. The bar and restaurant were excellent, and Carlos the bartender is helpful and friendly (tell him that you heard about him on the Internet). The hotel exterior is rather dull, but the interior and your room are clean, new, and luxurious. As far as the comments on its location, LOOK at a map! We found the hotel as a great base of operations; it's a short walk to the Arc de Triomphe, metro, Champs d'Elysee, buses, great restaurants, and shopping. It is in a very safe and quiet financial/diplomatic district. It is not at the Seine or the Eiffel Tower, but a brief cab ride will get you there quickly, or better yet enjoy a pleasant and romantic walk. Do take the Air France bus from Charles DeGaulle to the Arc de Triomphe, and walk a few blocks to the hotel. Do consider paying for the upgrade to executive class for the lounge, which has great food and drink available - we had a great breakfast daily, and occasionally used the available snacks as a meal replacement. Do ask the concierge/staff for help and suggestions - buy your Louvre and other museum tickets here to avoid lines - we took their advice and explored the newly opened Musee de l'Orangerie of Impressionist art, and went to a nearby bistro as recommended. Most importantly, do explore the wonders of Paris. We also spent time at the Paris Hilton for a different base of operations and experience and would also recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Sterile, snooty, outrageously expensive.”
Reviews.Author: cpmgrp
Reviews.Content: Sterile, snooty, outrageously expensive. Rooms ok, the usual Hilton experience only with a French attitude. Which is why I still have to give it above average. The kids in the business center were terrific. No view to speak of. $30 for continental, $45 for full breakfast. $9 for a half cup of cafÃ© au lait. Why it was only a half cup -- ?? Iâ€˜m a bit of a cheapskate, but that seemed way out of line. There is a small bistro across the street with a very nice $12 breakfast including coffee to your liking. The hotel is quite a walk from anything of interest, use the busses and subway. NOTE TO RYAN AIR passengers. The RyanAir facility is at Beauvais a 45 minute taxi drive. I found a private car shuttle for $47, just Google it a day in advance and make a reservation. The Ryan Air folks let me slide on my luggage weight coming out of Lubeck, but nailed me good out of France. An observation about TripAdvisor (if youâ€™ve seen this in other of my posts, feel free to skip): I used it extensively when planning a last-minute 3-week trip to Europe, was very happy to have the service and felt I should pay back with my comments. I think you have to read between the lines and determine the type of traveler writing the review compared to your own type. Iâ€™ve stayed in places that were highly recommended and turned out to be terrible; and the reverse. Try to judge whether the contributor is complaining about a one-time, bad experience as a result of an inattentive employee as opposed to a basic fault with the property itself. If a restaurant manager was rude, so what. If the place floods, and smells -- thatâ€™s a different story.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were at the Hilton Arc de Triomphe from May 10-17th 2006. We are in in our early 30's and were celebrating our anniversary, my birthday and valentines all in one! We had not had a chance to get away by ourselves since the birth of our two children 3 years ago, so this was very special, being just the two of us. We used our Hilton points and hold the silver VIP membership. We checked in late around 8pm and orginally given a room on the 5th floor. The room was nice with the sink on the outside of the bathroom and a big king size bed. I had asked before I left the US what the availabilty was at the hotel and they has said full for the time I was staying there. I thought since it was a special trip I would go back down and see what I could do to get an upgrade. I just asked and explained by situation and viola! They upgraded us to the 7th floor, balcony room with the executive lounge priviledges! We moved all of our things to the new room and unpacked and checked out the fabulous view of the Eiffel tower from our balcony! We were in the last room on the 7th floor, however, I discovered that the shower head was broken. I called downstairs and after a promise to send someone up in a few minutes to fix it, we went to the executive lounge to check that out. After a couple of drinks, we went back to our room to find that the shower head was not fixed as of yet. Again I called downstairs and they informed me that the part has been ordered for quite sometime and still has not come in. They don't know when it will come in, probably at some point during our stay, but not in the next day or so. So again we were moved to another room, this time closer to the elevators. The room was exactally the same, except the further room had a much bigger safe. So again we packed and unpacked and moved. Finally we showered and changed and played under the sheets and then we went to bed by 2am! After all it was our first night in the city of love! How could we not?? The room was bigger than the one on the 5th floor and had a flat screen tv. Which did stop working one night, but was fixed the next morning. There are only 2 channels you get in English and alot in French and Arabic. I think we saw about 15 minutes of tv if that during our whole stay. There are games you can play on the tv as well, which my husband discovered one night and had a blast playing them while I had a nice long soak in the tub. The bathroom had the sink and standing shower along with a large bathtub all in one room, not separate like the one on the 5th floor. Maid service was good, though they did not speak any English. We had turn down service each night with two liitle boxes of chocolates on the pillows! Yummy! The shampoo and shower gel, is not too good, so you may want to bring your own. They do give you a wash clothes, shower cap, embry board, q-tips, shoe shine, and of course soap. You also get two large and fluffy bathrobes and slippers! The bed was comfortable with goose down comforter and 3 large fluffy pillows. The weather was in the low 70's and over-cast to sunny all of our days there and one if it were any hotter, I don't think the a/c would of been sufficent. I don't know if there was something wrong with our a/c but we had it on the whole time we were there and it barley felt cool. The weather was perfect and it only rained one day for 15 minutes while we were standing in line to the Saint Chappell. Of course the only day we left our umbrellas in our hotel room as well! Figures right? The hotel is very nice in the Art Deco theme and very clean. The closest metro Courcelles is 1 3-5 minute walk. You will need to change to any place you go, not a big deal unless you are under time restrains. The metro by the Arc de Triomphe Charles de Gaulle Etoile is more central and that one is a good 15 minute walk. We took the Air France bus from the airport (pay on the bus, via euros). You can save 16E by buying a roundtrip ticket. It took about 45 minutes to get to our stop by the Arc and then we had only two roll-on bags and a back pack so we walked to the hotel. Not to hard to find at all. Be sure to have a map with you at this time. It comes in handy to find the hotel. If you take the taxi it will cost a min. of 6E, plus if you have bags, not worth it. The bus begins the trips to the airport at 5:45am bythe Arc and runs every 15 minutes or so. We took it back to the airport as well. Very easy and cost effective. We found the staff at the hotel to be just okay. Not really going out of their way, but doing their jobs. We had no problems aside from the broken shower head and the tv. The concerige were always willing to help and most helpful. There are taxis at all times outside of the hotel so that's never a problem either. We did not eat at the hotel restraunts, but did look at the menus and they were very pricey! The bar was pretty busy a couple of nights. There were lots of business as well as leisure travelers the time we were there. But the hotel never felt crowed. There is a very high fee to use the internet at the hotel. We saw many internet cafes that were a lot cheaper around the city. There are two phone booths right outside the hotel which we used nightly to call home to check on the kids. Very handy as it is insainly expensive to use the hotel room phones! We were gone all day everyday from early in the morning to late at night except our last two days there. On those two days, we went to the Executive lounge in the early evenings and found it to be quite full. They did have the same food out for breakfast each day, but plenty of food to get you started. Dinnertime they did have different food the two nights we were there and for late night snacks, they had different things almost each night. Of course there was not a lot of choices, but a few finger sandwiches and the such. Not too bad. One night they had really good food and alot of it and I could of made that my dinner, had I not just eaten two hours before! They always had coke, orange juice, beer, water, champagne, wine, gin, vodka, rum and brandy availabe each day. Apples and bananas each day along with a nice fruit salad each morning. If you can get an upgrade, by all means do try! I heard if you can't get the upgrade, try to get the free breakfast, they usually give you that which is around 20E or so. The street across the metro station Courcelles, has many little shops and places to eat. We found a couple of fun places, Indiana a tex-mex restraunt that was always busy in the evenings and good food at good prices on Hoche street, about a 8 minute walk going towards the Arc. One of the best Cholcalatiers in also nearby, called La Maison du Chocolat on 225 rue du Faubourg St Honore, again only a 8 minute walk away. Nicholas is a grocery store and good deals on wines and beers which is across the street from the Courcelles metro stop. There is no shuttle that goes between this hotel and the Eiffel tower as some have indicated. Perhaps they only run it in the summer? I asked several employees there and none knew anything about this. Since we used the executive lounge for breakfast, after dinner snacks, we really saved a lot of money. We usually ate on the run, simply because of all the sites we wanted to take in, so we did not go to many of the recommended restraunts, but there are tons of places to eat so that shouldn't be a problem. Another benefit being the on 7th floor is that you get to use the spa whirlpool for free, otherwise there is a 25E charge. There is a sauna and a steam room. We only found time to use it on our very last day there, but enjoyed it emmensely as we were the only two in there! The water however in the jaccuzzi was barley warm, but we didn't let that stop us from having fun! You do not need to know much French at all to enjoy the city. I knew probably 30 phrases and I barely got to use them...85% people speak enough to answer your questions no matter where you are. Even those who do not speak any English, we found we could communicate with them without much effort as well. The metro are very easy to use, realiable, fast and cost effective. By the un carnate (10 tickets) or carte orange if you will be using the metro 3-4 times a day. We had a wonderful and romantic time while we were in Paris! If and when we go back someday I don't think I would stay here again, only becasue of the location. Yes, it is quite, but too much walking to get to the center of the city and all the major sites. We did enjoy our time at the hotel in our larger upgraded room and the executive lounge privileges made our stay just that much better!

Reviews.Title: “A Really Top Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yochi
Reviews.Content: We had the most fabulous time in Paris staying at this hotel. The decor was very beautiful throughout, especially the downstairs toilets, they were out of this world. The rooms were a little small but the luxury of the sheets and quilts made up for it. The marble bathroom was beautiful and everything felt very plush. The bathrobes even came on cream satin hangers. We tried the spa and that also was a luxury experience. If you can manage to stay on the 6th or 7th floor do. We had a balcolny and had brilliant views of the Effile Tower at night all lit up. The staff were fantastic at this hotel. We have to say we have never met people who seemed so kind and happy in their work they really made you feel like wanted guests. A great stay and a memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “what a great stay............”
Reviews.Author: dfwbob
Reviews.Content: Well we just returned from our Paris trip and can't say enough about how well everything went. The Hilton was a pleasure. We had a room on the 7th floor with a balcony the size of my first apartment and arrived to find champagne from the Hilton in our room (I am only gold level). The bed and linens were very comfortable and the room was quiet! Each night at turndown the were different chocolates and the executive lounge on the 6th floor stayed open till 11pm. They offered breakfast each morning and wine ,drinks and snacks all day. The Coucelles metro stop is two blocks away and the Camps Elysee is a mere 10 minute walk the other direction. We purchased a Carte Orange for the metro which is good for unlimited use from Monday- Sunday (bring a small photo). The Hotel staff was very helpful with directions and restaurant reservations. A great place nearby was Le Bistro de Sommalier on Haussman. It was one of our best dining adventures of the week. We went with the "Chefs Menu" which consisted of 5 courses paired with wonderfull wines for 70 euros each. Another hotel suggestion was "Boeuf Sur La Troit" just a ten minute walk south. A great Paris bistro and open on Sundays when most other places were closed.

Reviews.Title: “A little taste of luxury!”
Reviews.Author: KayWhiteley
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for two nights, Sat 6th and Sun 7th May. From the moment we walked in we knew we would enjoy our stay. The decor throughout the entire hotel is beautiful - very grand. We used the separate HHonors check in desk, and as my boyfriend is a Hilton Diamond member, we were requested to go up to the Executive Lounge to check in. The Lounge staff are wonderful - nothing is too much trouble. We had been upgraded to a Executive room which was wonderful - bathrobes, slippers, complimentary water and chocolates each night. Again, the rooms, whilst on the dark side, are beautifully decorated, with nice toiletries. Massive, comfortable bed, large bath, small balcony overlooking a courtyard and a radio/CD player which was tuned in to a classical station and playing when we walked in! Nice touches. The Lounge provided us with a place to relax in the evening drinking complimentray champagne, and snacking on chips, pralines, nuts, olives, fruit, and hot snacks. I believe they had sandwiches and hot snacks throughout the day but we were exploring Paris and missed most of those! The Lounge is a nice place to meet and talk to others. We ate breakfast there the first morning, great service and nice food, but we thought the selection was smaller than the previous Hilton we stayed in. Still, cereals, pastries, coffee tea, hot items, fruits meats, cheeses and rolls, etc etc etc. The second morning we asked to eat downstairs in the main hotel restaurant, where the food selection is SO much better!! Try the lounge and the restaurant if you can. The staff happily stored our luggage on the last day, and again, they were all so polite and courteous. The Hotel is not in the centre of Paris, but Metro stop "Courceles" is a few minutes walk, or a ten minute walk to the Arc de Triomphe where the regional express trains (RER) stop. All in all, a fantastic stay, obviously made better by the upgrade to the Exec Floors. Hopefully we'll be going back!! Contact me with any questions!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Hicke
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in the middle of the city. One of the newer hotels in town. Rooms are medium-sized but well proportioned. Good service and great balconies on the executive floor. It has a slight corporate feel to it and is not the most intimate of Paris hotels.

Reviews.Title: “well worth the extra”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: have just spent 4 nights in the hilton arc de triompohe and loved it we payed extra to upgrade to the executive floor and its well worth it you get to use the executive lounge and are able to have snacks and drinks all day and evening including champagne and have acess to the spa facilities we would definatley stay here again also a good tip to get around the attractions use the batobus its a boat service on the seine and it stops at all the tourist spots without getting stuck in the traffic and its really cheap too but we also found the taxis very good value go soon!

Reviews.Title: “great property”
Reviews.Author: JanetDeluca
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed here for six nights in Feb. We were upgraded to the executive level. The hotel is fabulous. Staff is excellent, concierge service was great. The rooms are beautiful and clean, marble bathrooms, windows that open so you can see the Eifel Tower. We have a teen-aged son so the exec level was a real $$ saver. Free breakfast and snacks all day. Just for the price of soda and wine it would've been worth paying for. As you'll read in other posts, the location isn't exciting but it's safe and it's only about a 7 minute walk to the Metro stop. This is a top, 4 star hotel and we'd return in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Hilton Arc de Triomphe”
Reviews.Author: name_screen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Arc de Triomphe for one week on business. The beds are very comfortable with down pillows. The rooms are large for Paris, and include an in-room safe, hair dryer, mini-bar, high-speed internet (fee). Concierge is very helpful finding restaurants if you would like recommendations. Breakfast is available as continental (19EUR) or full (30EUR), make sure you mention which breakfast you want. Hotel lobby is very art-deco and tends to be a bit smoke-filled. Purple Bar is fine for cocktails. Nearest metro is Courcelles, about 2 blocks away; a taxi to CDG airport is about 35-40EUR. Overall, this hotel is good for business travelers or tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly -- Nice location”
Reviews.Author: JHMPLS
Reviews.Content: This was our third time in Paris and the best hotel of the 3. Rooms were nice with Art Deco throughout. Small by American standards but above average in size for Paris. The breakfast buffet was very good with a nice variety. What really stood out was the concierge -- very helpful, very friendly, very good service.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous! We loved Hilton in the fall.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hello Paris-lovers, This is a hotel for you! My husband and I took a weekend get-away in a quite rainy and cold Paris, in October. And yet, it is one of the best weekend-experiences we've ever had. Hilton Arc de Triomphe is a splendid hotel and the atmosphere is outstanding. Paris is even better in the fall, than in the summer. We took a lazy stroll down a calm Champes Elysee, and walked down all the way, to the Louvre. We got there at 7 o'clock at night and wandered the place almost alone. Extraodinaire feeling, almost out of this world. It was us and the great artists, a friendly and completely stress-less experience. We were alone with Mona Lisa and couldn't help thinking about the Da Vinci Code... Afterwards, we took a taxi to a restaurant called Spice. A nice and cozy restaurant with a 100% Paris-feel to it. Quite cheap and very romantic. Enough about that and more about the hotel. We actually got a cheaper rate from their own website, so check it out. The hotel itself is more expensive than most hotels, but it's SO WORTH IT! The decor is suductive and very romantic, and the service is excellent. The lobby is like I would imagine Titanic's decor was. This is a hotel experience to remember, and we loved it. Breakfast is quite expensive, as they say, but very parisian and we recommend taking a long lunch beside the windows. Sip a cup of coffee, read a news paper and relax. The rooms are so very nice and actually quite ..sexy. I loved the dressing/bathroom. :)) Don't forget to have a drink in the bar, when you feel for it. We had a late night-cap, and strongly recommend it. We will absolutely return again, for a nice get away. The hotel is located perfectly. Just off the beaten tourist track, and yet so very close to everything! We have been to quite some hotels and restaurants over the years, in Paris, including the most luxurious ones you can find, all the way down to the middle priced ones. Mark my words - this hotel is different from others, and it gives you a very nice experience. We hold it very high on our personal "around the world-hotel list". Enjoy your stay, you will not regret checking in here.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Hilton Was Excellent”
Reviews.Author: cincyred1
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed here for 3 nights at 179 Euro per night. It was an excellent hotel located close to the action. We found nice restaurants within walking distance and the train station was just up the street. The staff was especially nice and made us feel welcome to France. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: georgeinn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hilton for 7 nights including valentines. We have stayed in so many Hiltons in our time that we have become accostomed to thier excellent service however, this trip was out of this world. We had a couple of hiccups ie credit card problems that took a few days to sort but the staff at the Hilton were wonderfull Tatiana the guest relations manager could not do enough to help. We even got Champagne and chocolates in our room on Valentines night. Carlos in the bar is a great laugh if you are lonely or fancy a drink on your own. The rooms are clean, comfortable and excellently decorated/furnished Art deco. If you are a first time visitor the concierge will get you to anywhere and provided us with the most excellent resturant booking on our first night, we loved it so much we booked again for our last night. You will not be disapointed by the Hilton Arc de Triumph.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Arc de Triomphe: Helpful Staff and a Great Hotel Choice”
Reviews.Author: Standby4321
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Arc de Triomphe is a relatively new property, but it has been designed to fit well into its Paris neighborhood. It is about a 10 minute walk to the Arc de Triomphe and even a bit shorter to the Champs-Elysees. The common areas and rooms are tastefully furnished with a high level of finish. We especially like the deep bathtub and separate shower stall in the bathroom, with the sink area separated for easy use of facilities by more than one person. The bed was firm and comfortable. The windows can be opened wide for fresh air and the rooms facing the courtyard are especially quiet with a nice view. The hotel staff from check-in to concierge and the breakfast room were very friendly and accommodating. (We give special acknowledgement to Clarisse, who is a real gem!) The daily internet fee of 22 Euros is a bit steep, but typical of Paris hotels and we were pleased to have the service available in our room. The desk staff provided us with a converter so that our U.S.-type laptop could be recharged during our stay. The immediate neighborhood is not a terribly active one, although there are some brasseries, etc. within several blocks' walk. In summary, we found the Hilton Arc de Triomphe to be an excellent choice for what is very much a higher end property at comparatively realistic rates in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel With Perfect Staff”
Reviews.Author: mparel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 3 night stay in this hotel. We rely on trip advisor for hotel reviews, so we thought we should add ours. From check-in to departure, everything was perfect. We were escorted to the executive level for an expresso while registering then escorted to the room. As in the brochure and on the hotel web site, the room had a balcony and a picture perfect view of the Eiffel Tower. It was ready for our 9:30 AM arrival, even though I had requested an early 10 AM check-in. As others have noted, this is a newer hotel (almost 2 years old, I think)and everything is still in excellent condition from the bedding to the baths. The rooms and baths really are like the pictures. Our plasma TV did indeed work just fine. The executive lounge is wonderful: Madame Catherine will even make dinner reservations for you. Refreshments and snacks (including beer, excellent wines and champagnes - complimentary) were served throughout the day starting with breakfast and constantly replenished. Dinner in the hotel restaurant was a very pleasant experience. The wait staff, especially Mademoiselle Cira, was excellent and the food was far superior to many of the restaurants having one of the coveted stars. My husband says I am too picky when it comes to hotels, and we have stayed in some of the best in the world (e.g., Lord Byron - Rome, Mauna Kea Resort- Hawaii, Peninsula - Hong Kong) but in all honesty, I have absolutly nothing but good things to say about this Hilton. We paid a discounted rate for our room (#777 on the top floor) yet experienced first class service. As long as the hotel maintains the service and ambiance that we experienced this time, we intend to stay here whenever we are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Witing this review from my room ..”
Reviews.Author: sunstonetours
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute weekend in Paris. I read the review of this hotel and it was a mix bag, I hesitantly booked a room. From the minute of walking into the lobby, I love the Art Deco style through out every nook and crany. The hallway, doors, carpet, even the number font on each door is consistant detail to Art Deco. I honor what a good job this hotel has done and love how it is carried out in the rooms and bathroom as well. Location is a good 5 minute walk to the main blvd. Everything is clean and in perfect condition. Tony the front desk speaks perfect english and knew my name the second time I came down to the lobby. I give this place a thumbs up

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the point when we arrived to our departure we were treated as though everyone was pleased to see us at their hotel. We were met by the bell boy from the taxi. he discreetly checked the labels on my luggage and then checked inside his hat. "Welcome Mr and Mrs Chambers" he said "Please go to floor 6 for your Ã‹xecutive Floor checkin. We felt welcome already and we were not inside the hotel yet!!!! The room was perfect and had a balcony which overlooked the inner garden and in the distance the Eiffel Tower. Within walking distance of the Champs Ellysse the hotel and staff were as good as your other previous guests had said. Finally the concierge reccomended a wonderful restaraunt Le Cuisine which is a short taxi ride away, try it and we are sure you will not be dissapointed

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic...”
Reviews.Author: Jem89
Reviews.Content: It is a brand new hotel in a really nice place in Paris. Just in a walking distance to champs elysey (spelled wrong) and offers really high standards with a great hospitality...

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dpb
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in September 2005. Pleasant room, very comfortable. This is a very good business class hotel. Modern, not quaint. The "art deco" blandishments are not in the best of taste (particularly in the hallways) and unnecessary. Not a sterile hotel though. Staff helpful and very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “You could do better, you could do worse...”
Reviews.Author: TMM
Reviews.Content: I feel a bit guilty about the review I have to give as the stay was a freebie after entering a competition on the UK Conde Nast Traveller website last December. The reception desk was great and very helpful and we were allowed to check into our room very early. This was a bonus as we did want a nap before going out. We were upgraded to a King deluxe suite which consisted on two bathrooms (only one with a bath), living room and a separate bedroom. The dÃ©cor of the suite and hotel is nice. Besides reception, service was virtually none existent. We called three times to have the plasma TV in our bedroom repaired as there was no reception. When the technician did show up he said very little except the TV was broken which we already knew. He offered us nothing and then my husband asked if the regular TV set in the living room could be moved to the bedroom. He swapped the TVs and we suspect whoever stays in the room next (room 424) will have to make a few calls if they wish to watch TV in the lounge area. The hallway leading to our room was constantly littered and quite a few stains on the carpets. When we arrived there were dirty drinking glasses in front of our door and when we left (two days later) the same glass was there. Kid you not. It wasnâ€™t like they were concealed. Room service was appalling and way overpriced even by Paris standards. We ordered a cheese plate that came with two small pieces of cheese (mold and all) and a small bistro salad, a croque monsieur that was cold and bottle of Evian for 50 euros. Had the food been good food, no problem, but it wasnâ€™t so we canâ€™t give room service a good review. We also had access to the Executive Lounge. The food offerings were slim. It was okay for a drink before going out, but the EL was not worth the upgrade price. Again the service was non-existent and the lounge is pretty much self service. We have stayed in many hotels in Paris and this is not one we would rush back to. There are too many choices in Paris at the same rate level to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Isky
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for three nights in September and loved it. The king size bed was incredibly comfortable and the dark drapes and heavy lining under them kept the sun out....we woke up one day to a dark room and it was 1pm! Very romantic hotel with marble bathroom, great toilitries and four large towels, the size of beach towels. Breakfast was just okey...but very expensive - about 30 euros per person. I never made it to the spa because we were so close to the tourist sites and there was so much to do. The Arc de Triomph was a five minute walk, as was the metro station. The Hilton staff was wonderful at speaking English and very informative in helping us with a show at the "Lido" and providing huge hotel umbrellas for the days it rained. I would highly recommend this hotel and would stay their again. During our walks near the Arc de Triomph, we did not see any hotels that would compare to this Hilton.
